If [I]694-i had only just a moment to think .... Good , [I]694-i 've got it . [I]694-i 'm all right . ”[694-i] [You]694-i see , it was the eclipse . It came into [my]0-i mind in the nick of time , how [Columbus]152-columbus , or [Cortez]153-cortez , or [one of those people]695-one of those people , played an eclipse as a saving trump once , on [some savages]696-some savages , and [I]0-i saw [my]0-i chance . [I]0-i could play it [myself]0-i , now , and it would n't be any plagiarism , either , because [I]0-i should get it in nearly a thousand years ahead of [those parties]697-those parties . [Clarence]131-clarence came in , subdued , distressed , and said : “ [I]131-clarence hasted the message to [[our]4548-our liege]4549-our liege [the king]4445-the king , and straightway [he]4445-the king had [me]131-clarence to [his]4445-the king presence . [He]4445-the king was frighted even to the marrow , and was minded to give order for [your]4551-you instant enlargement , and that [you]4551-you be clothed in fine raiment and lodged as befitted one so great ; but then came [Merlin]134-merlin and spoiled all ; for [he]134-merlin persuaded [the king]4445-the king that [you]4551-you are mad , and know not whereof [you]4551-you speak ; and said [your]4551-you threat is but foolishness and idle vaporing . [They]4553-they disputed long , but in the end , [Merlin]134-merlin , scoffing , said , ' Wherefore hath [he]4445-the king not _ named _ [his]4445-the king brave calamity ? Verily it is because [he]4445-the king can not . ' This thrust did in a most sudden sort close [the king]4445-the king 's mouth , and [he]4445-the king could offer naught to turn the argument ; and so , reluctant , and full loth to do [you]4551-you the discourtesy , [he]4445-the king yet prayeth [you]4551-you to consider [his]4445-the king perplexed case , as noting how the matter stands , and name the calamity -- if so be [you]4551-you have determined the nature of it and the time of its coming . Oh , prithee delay not ; to delay at such a time were to double and treble the perils that already compass [thee]4551-you about . Oh , be [thou]4551-you wise -- name the calamity ! ”[131-clarence] [I]0-i allowed silence to accumulate while [I]0-i got [my]0-i impressiveness together , and then said : “ How long have [I]0-i been shut up in this hole ? ”[0-i] “ [Ye]0-i were shut up when yesterday was well spent . It is 9 of the morning now . ”[131-clarence] “ No ! Then [I]0-i have slept well , sure enough . Nine in the morning now ! And yet it is the very complexion of midnight , to a shade . This is the 20th , then ? ”[0-i] “ The 20th -- yes . ”[131-clarence] “ And [I]506-the boy am to be burned alive to - morrow . ”[506-the boy] [The boy]506-the boy shuddered . “ At what hour ? ”[506-the boy] “ At high noon . ”[131-clarence] “ Now then , [I]0-i will tell [you]506-the boy what to say . ”[0-i] [I]0-i paused , and stood over [that cowering lad]699-that cowering lad a whole minute in awful silence ; then , in a voice deep , measured , charged with doom , [I]0-i began , and rose by dramatically graded stages to [my]0-i colossal climax , which [I]0-i delivered in as sublime and noble a way as ever [I]0-i did such a thing in [my]0-i life : “ Go back and tell [the king]4445-the king that at that hour [I]0-i will smother [the whole world]4556-the whole world in the dead blackness of midnight ; [I]0-i will blot out the sun , and [he]4445-the king shall never shine again ; the fruits of [the earth]399-the earth shall rot for lack of light and warmth , and [the peoples of [the earth]399-the earth]4558-the peoples of the earth shall famish and die , to [the last man]4560-the last man ! ”[0-i] [I]0-i had to carry [the boy]506-the boy out [myself]0-i , [he]506-the boy sunk into such a collapse . [I]0-i handed [him]506-the boy over to [the soldiers]701-the soldiers , and went back . CHAPTER VI THE ECLIPSE In the stillness and the darkness , realization soon began to supplement knowledge . The mere knowledge of a fact is pale ; but when [you]702-you come to _ realize _ [your]702-you fact , it takes on color . It is all the difference between hearing of [a man being stabbed to the heart]703-a man being stabbed to the heart , and seeing it done . In the stillness and the darkness , the knowledge that [I]0-i was in deadly danger took to itself deeper and deeper meaning all the time ; a something which was realization crept inch by inch through [my]0-i veins and turned [me]0-i cold . But it is a blessed provision of nature that at times like these , as soon as [a man]518-a man 's mercury has got down to a certain point there comes a revulsion , and [he]518-a man rallies . [Hope]154-hope springs up , and cheerfulness along with it , and then [he]518-a man is in good shape to do something for [himself]518-a man , if anything can be done . When [my]0-i rally came , it came with a bound . [I]0-i said to [myself]0-i that [my]0-i eclipse would be sure to save [me]0-i , and make [me]0-i [the greatest man in [the kingdom]517-the kingdom besides]705-the greatest man in the kingdom besides ; and straightway [my]0-i mercury went up to the top of the tube , and [my]0-i solicitudes all vanished . [I]0-i was as happy [a man]518-a man as there was in [the world]374-the world . [I]0-i was even impatient for to - morrow to come , [I]0-i so wanted to gather in that great triumph and be the center of all [the nation]709-the nation 's wonder and reverence . Besides , in a business way it would be the making of [me]0-i ; [I]0-i knew that . Meantime there was one thing which had got pushed into the background of [my]0-i mind . That was the half - conviction that when the nature of [my]0-i proposed calamity should be reported to [those superstitious people]710-those superstitious people , it would have such an effect that [they]710-those superstitious people would want to compromise . So , by and by when [I]0-i heard footsteps coming , that thought was recalled to [me]0-i , and [I]0-i said to [myself]0-i , “ As sure as anything , it 's the compromise . Well , if it is good , all right , [I]0-i will accept ; but if it is n't , [I]0-i mean to stand [my]0-i ground and play [my]0-i hand for all it is worth . ”[0-i] The door opened , and [some men - at - arms]711-some men - at - arms appeared . [The leader]712-the leader said : “ The stake is ready . Come ! ”[712-the leader] The stake ! The strength went out of [me]0-i , and [I]0-i almost fell down . It is hard to get [one]434-one 's breath at such a time , such lumps come into one 's throat , and such gaspings ; but as soon as [I]0-i could speak , [I]0-i said : “ But this is a mistake -- the execution is to - morrow . ”[0-i] “ Order changed ; been set forward a day . Haste [thee]701-the soldiers ! ”[0-i] [I]0-i was lost . There was no help for [me]0-i . [I]0-i was dazed , stupefied ; [I]0-i had no command over [myself]0-i , [I]0-i only wandered purposely about , like one out of [his]714-his mind ; so [the soldiers]701-the soldiers took hold of [me]0-i , and pulled [me]0-i along with [them]701-the soldiers , out of [the cell]716-the cell and along the maze of [underground corridors]717-underground corridors , and finally into the fierce glare of daylight and [the upper world]718-the upper world . As [we]719-we stepped into [the vast enclosed court of [the castle]721-the castle]720-the vast enclosed court of the castle [I]0-i got a shock ; for the first thing [I]0-i saw was the stake , standing in the center , and near it the piled fagots and [a monk]722-a monk . On all four sides of [the court]550-the court [the seated multitudes]724-the seated multitudes rose rank above rank , forming sloping terraces that were rich with color . [The king]4445-the king and [the queen]579-the queen sat in [their]727-their thrones , the most conspicuous figures there , of course . To note all this , occupied but a second . The next second [Clarence]131-clarence had slipped from some place of concealment and was pouring news into [my]0-i ear , [his]131-clarence eyes beaming with triumph and gladness . [He]131-clarence said : “ ’ Tis through _ [me]131-clarence _ the change was wrought ! And main hard have [I]131-clarence worked to do it , too . But when [I]131-clarence revealed to [them]4561-them the calamity in store , and saw how mighty was the terror it did engender , then saw [I]131-clarence also that this was the time to strike ! Wherefore [I]131-clarence diligently pretended , unto this and that and the other one , that [your]4562-you power against the sun could not reach its full until the morrow ; and so if any would save the sun and [the world]374-the world , [you]4562-you must be slain to - day , while [your]4562-you enchantments are but in the weaving and lack potency . Odsbodikins , it was but a dull lie , a most indifferent invention , but [you]4562-you should have seen [them]4561-them seize it and swallow it , in the frenzy of [their]4561-them fright , as it were salvation sent from [heaven]4564-heaven ; and all the while was [I]131-clarence laughing in [my]131-clarence sleeve the one moment , to see [them]4561-them so cheaply deceived , and glorifying [God]121-god the next , that [He]121-god was content to let the meanest of [[His]121-god creatures]4565-his creatures be [His]121-god instrument to the saving of [thy]4562-you life . Ah how happy has the matter sped ! [You]4562-you will not need to do the sun a _ real _ hurt -- ah , forget not that , on [your]4562-you soul forget it not ! Only make a little darkness -- only the littlest little darkness , mind , and cease with that . It will be sufficient . [They]4561-them will see that [I]131-clarence spoke falsely,--being ignorant , as [they]4561-them will fancy --and with the falling of the first shadow of that darkness [you]4562-you shall see [them]4561-them go mad with fear ; and [they]4561-them will set [you]4562-you free and make [you]4562-you great ! Go to [thy]4561-them triumph , now ! But remember -- ah , [good friend]4460-good friend , [I]131-clarence implore [thee]4460-good friend remember [my]131-clarence supplication , and do the blessed sun no hurt . For _ [my]131-clarence _ sake , [[thy]4460-good friend true friend]4567-thy true friend . ”[131-clarence] [I]0-i choked out some words through [my]0-i grief and misery ; as much as to say [I]0-i would spare the sun ; for which [the lad]613-the lad 's eyes paid [me]0-i back with such deep and loving gratitude that [I]0-i had not the heart to tell [him]613-the lad [his]613-the lad good - hearted foolishness had ruined [me]0-i and sent [me]0-i to [my]0-i death . As [the soldiers]701-the soldiers assisted [me]0-i across [the court]550-the court the stillness was so profound that if [I]0-i had been blindfold [I]0-i should have supposed [I]0-i was in a solitude instead of walled in by [four thousand people]731-four thousand people . There was not a movement perceptible in [those masses of humanity]732-those masses of humanity ; [they]732-those masses of humanity were as rigid as stone images , and as pale ; and dread sat upon every countenance . This hush continued while [I]0-i was being chained to the stake ; it still continued while the fagots were carefully and tediously piled about [my]0-i ankles , [my]0-i knees , [my]0-i thighs , [my]0-i body . Then there was a pause , and a deeper hush , if possible , and [a man]518-a man knelt down at [my]0-i feet with a blazing torch ; [the multitude]734-the multitude strained forward , gazing , and parting slightly from [their]734-the multitude seats without knowing it ; [the monk]735-the monk raised [his]735-the monk hands above [my]0-i head , and [his]735-the monk eyes toward the blue sky , and began some words in Latin ; in this attitude [he]735-the monk droned on and on , a little while , and then stopped . [I]0-i waited two or three moments ; then looked up ; [he]735-the monk was standing there petrified . With a common impulse [the multitude]734-the multitude rose slowly up and stared into the sky . [I]0-i followed [their]734-the multitude eyes , as sure as guns , there was [my]0-i eclipse beginning ! The life went boiling through [my]0-i veins ; [I]0-i was [a new man]737-a new man ! The rim of black spread slowly into the sun 's disk , [my]0-i heart beat higher and higher , and still [the assemblage]738-the assemblage and [the priest]739-the priest stared into the sky , motionless . [I]0-i knew that this gaze would be turned upon [me]0-i , next . When it was , [I]0-i was ready . [I]0-i was in one of the most grand attitudes [I]0-i ever struck , with [my]0-i arm stretched up pointing to the sun . It was a noble effect . [You]740-you could _ see _ the shudder sweep the mass like a wave . Two shouts rang out , [one close upon the heels of the other]741-one close upon the heels of the other : “ Apply the torch ! ”[741-one close upon the heels of the other] “ [I]742-the one forbid it ! ”[742-the one] [The one]742-the one was from [Merlin]134-merlin , the other from [the king]4445-the king . [Merlin]134-merlin started from [his]134-merlin place -- to apply the torch [himself]134-merlin , [I]0-i judged . [I]0-i said : “ Stay where [you]134-merlin are . If [any man]4568-any man moves -- even [the king]4445-the king -- before [I]0-i give [him]4445-the king leave , [I]0-i will blast [him]4445-the king with thunder , [I]0-i will consume [him]4445-the king with lightnings ! ”[0-i] [The multitude]734-the multitude sank meekly into [their]734-the multitude seats , and [I]0-i was just expecting [they]734-the multitude would . [Merlin]134-merlin hesitated a moment or two , and [I]0-i was on pins and needles during that little while . Then [he]134-merlin sat down , and [I]0-i took a good breath ; for [I]0-i knew [I]0-i was master of the situation now . [The king]4445-the king said : “ Be merciful , [fair sir]4423-fair sir , and essay no further in this perilous matter , lest disaster follow . It was reported to [us]4571-us that [your]0-i powers could not attain unto [their]734-the multitude full strength until the morrow ; but-- ”[4445-the king] “ [[Your]4445-the king Majesty]4572-your majesty thinks the report may have been a lie ? It _ was _ a lie . ”[4445-the king] That made an immense effect ; up went appealing hands everywhere , and [the king]4445-the king was assailed with a storm of supplications that [I]0-i might be bought off at any price , and the calamity stayed . [The king]4445-the king was eager to comply . [He]4445-the king said : “ Name any terms , [reverend sir]4573-reverend sir , even to the halving of [[my]4445-the king kingdom]4574-my kingdom ; but banish this calamity , spare the sun ! ”[4445-the king] [My]0-i fortune was made . [I]0-i would have taken [him]134-merlin up in a minute , but [I]0-i could n't stop an eclipse ; the thing was out of the question . So [I]0-i asked time to consider . [The king]4445-the king said : “ How long -- ah , how long , [good sir]4575-good sir ? Be merciful ; look , it groweth darker , moment by moment . [Prithee]129-prithee how long ? ”[4445-the king] “ Not long . Half an hour -- maybe an hour . ”[4445-the king] There were a thousand pathetic protests , but [I]0-i could n't shorten up any , for [I]0-i could n't remember how long a total eclipse lasts . [I]0-i was in a puzzled condition , anyway , and wanted to think . Something was wrong about that eclipse , and the fact was very unsettling . If this was n't the one [I]0-i was after , how was [I]0-i to tell whether this was the sixth century , or nothing but a dream ? Dear [me]0-i , if [I]0-i could only prove it was the latter ! Here was a glad new hope . If [the boy]506-the boy was right about the date , and this was surely the 20th , it _ was n't _ the sixth century . [I]0-i reached for [the monk]735-the monk 's sleeve , in considerable excitement , and asked [him]735-the monk what day of the month it was . Hang [him]735-the monk , [he]735-the monk said it was the _ twenty - first _ ! It made [me]0-i turn cold to hear [him]735-the monk . [I]0-i begged [him]735-the monk not to make any mistake about it ; but [he]735-the monk was sure ; [he]735-the monk knew it was the 21st . So , [that feather - headed boy]751-that feather - headed boy had botched things again ! The time of the day was right for the eclipse ; [I]0-i had seen that for [myself]0-i , in the beginning , by the dial that was near by . Yes , [I]0-i was in [[King Arthur]116-arthur 's court]752-king arthur 's court , and [I]0-i might as well make the most out of it [I]0-i could . The darkness was steadily growing , [the people]753-the people becoming more and more distressed . [I]0-i now said : “ [I]0-i have reflected , [Sir King]137-arthur . For a lesson , [I]0-i will let this darkness proceed , and spread night in [the world]374-the world ; but whether [I]0-i blot out the sun for good , or restore it , shall rest with [you]137-arthur . These are the terms , to wit : [You]137-arthur shall remain king over all [[your]137-arthur dominions]4577-your dominions , and receive all the glories and honors that belong to the kingship ; but [you]137-arthur shall appoint [me]0-i [[your]137-arthur perpetual minister]4578-your perpetual minister and executive , and give [me]0-i for [my]0-i services one per cent of such actual increase of revenue over and above its present amount as [I]0-i may succeed in creating for [the state]4579-the state . If [I]0-i ca n't live on that , [I]0-i sha'n't ask [anybody]553-anybody to give [me]0-i a lift . Is it satisfactory ? ”[0-i] There was a prodigious roar of applause , and out of the midst of it [the king]4445-the king 's voice rose , saying : “ Away with [his]4445-the king bonds , and set [him]4445-the king free ! and do [him]4445-the king homage , high and low , rich and poor , for [he]4445-the king is become [the king]4445-the king 's right hand , is clothed with power and authority , and [his]4445-the king seat is upon the highest step of the throne ! Now sweep away this creeping night , and bring the light and cheer again , that all [the world]374-the world may bless [thee]137-arthur . ”[4445-the king] But [I]0-i said : “ That [a common man]4583-a common man should be shamed before [the world]374-the world , is nothing ; but it were dishonor to [the _ king]4585-the _ king _ if any that saw [[his]4585-the _ king minister]4586-his minister naked should not also see [him]4585-the _ king delivered from [his]4585-the _ king shame . If [I]0-i might ask that [my]0-i clothes be brought again-- ”[0-i] “ They are not meet , ”[4445-the king] [the king]4445-the king broke in . “ Fetch raiment of another sort ; clothe [him]4585-the _ king like [a prince]4587-a prince ! ”[4445-the king] [My]0-i idea worked . [I]0-i wanted to keep things as they were till the eclipse was total , otherwise [they]756-they would be trying again to get [me]0-i to dismiss the darkness , and of course [I]0-i could n't do it . Sending for the clothes gained some delay , but not enough . So [I]0-i had to make another excuse . [I]0-i said it would be but natural if [the king]4445-the king should change [his]4445-the king mind and repent to some extent of what [he]4445-the king had done under excitement ; therefore [I]0-i would let the darkness grow a while , and if at the end of a reasonable time [the king]4445-the king had kept [his]4445-the king mind the same , the darkness should be dismissed . Neither [the king]4445-the king nor [anybody else]555-anybody else was satisfied with that arrangement , but [I]0-i had to stick to [my]0-i point . It grew darker and darker and blacker and blacker , while [I]0-i struggled with those awkward sixth - century clothes . It got to be pitch dark , at last , and [the multitude]734-the multitude groaned with horror to feel the cold uncanny night breezes fan through [the place]448-the place and see the stars come out and twinkle in the sky . At last the eclipse was total , and [I]0-i was very glad of it , but [everybody else]631-everybody else was in misery ; which was quite natural . [I]0-i said : “ [The king]4445-the king , by [his]4445-the king silence , still stands to the terms . ”[0-i] Then [I]0-i lifted up [my]0-i hands -- stood just so a moment -- then [I]0-i said , with the most awful solemnity : “ Let the enchantment dissolve and pass harmless away ! ”[0-i] There was no response , for a moment , in that deep darkness and that graveyard hush . But when the silver rim of the sun pushed itself out , a moment or two later , [the assemblage]738-the assemblage broke loose with a vast shout and came pouring down like a deluge to smother [me]0-i with blessings and gratitude ; and [Clarence]131-clarence was not [the last of the wash]765-the last of the wash , to be sure . CHAPTER VII [MERLIN 'S TOWER]155-merlin 's tower Inasmuch as [I]0-i was now [the second personage in [the Kingdom]517-the kingdom]766-the second personage in the kingdom , as far as political power and authority were concerned , much was made of [me]0-i . [My]0-i raiment was of silks and velvets and cloth of gold , and by consequence was very showy , also uncomfortable . But habit would soon reconcile [me]0-i to [my]0-i clothes ; [I]0-i was aware of that . [I]0-i was given [the choicest suite of apartments in [the castle]721-the castle]768-the choicest suite of apartments in the castle , after [[the king]4445-the king 's]771-the king 's . [They]772-they were aglow with loud - colored silken hangings , but the stone floors had nothing but rushes on them for a carpet , and they were misfit rushes at that , being not all of one breed . As for conveniences , properly speaking , there were n't any . [I]0-i mean _ little _ conveniences ; it is the little conveniences that make the real comfort of life . The big oaken chairs , graced with rude carvings , were well enough , but that was the stopping place . There was no soap , no matches , no looking - glass -- except a metal one , about as powerful as a pail of water . And not a chromo . [I]0-i had been used to chromos for years , and [I]0-i saw now that without [my]0-i suspecting it a passion for art had got worked into the fabric of [my]0-i being , and was become a part of [me]0-i . It made [me]0-i homesick to look around over this proud and gaudy but heartless barrenness and remember that in [[our]773-our house in [East Hartford]13-east hartford]774-our house in east hartford , all unpretending as it was , [you]775-you could n't go into [a room]776-a room but [you]775-you would find an insurance - chromo , or at least a three - color God - Bless - [Our]773-our - Home over the door ; and in [the parlor]777-the parlor [we]773-our had nine . But here , even in [[my]0-i grand room of state]778-my grand room of state , there was n't anything in the nature of a picture except a thing the size of a bedquilt , which was either woven or knitted ( it had darned places in it ) , and nothing in it was the right color or the right shape ; and as for proportions , even [Raphael]156-raphael [himself]156-raphael could n't have botched them more formidably , after all [his]156-raphael practice on those nightmares [they]779-they call [his]156-raphael “ celebrated Hampton Court cartoons . ”[156-raphael] [Raphael]156-raphael was a bird . [We]773-our had several of [his]156-raphael chromos ; one was [his]156-raphael “ Miraculous Draught of Fishes , ”[156-raphael] where [he]156-raphael puts in a miracle of [his]156-raphael own -- puts [three men]780-three men into [a canoe]781-a canoe which would n't have held a dog without upsetting . [I]0-i always admired to study [R.]157-r. 's art , it was so fresh and unconventional . There was n't even a bell or a speaking - tube in [the castle]721-the castle . [I]0-i had [a great many servants]783-a great many servants , and [those that were on duty]784-those that were on duty lolled in the anteroom ; and when [I]0-i wanted one of [them]783-a great many servants [I]0-i had to go and call for [him]157-r. . There was no gas , there were no candles ; a bronze dish half full of boarding - house butter with a blazing rag floating in it was the thing that produced what was regarded as light . A lot of these hung along the walls and modified the dark , just toned it down enough to make it dismal . If [you]785-you went out at night , [[your]785-you servants]786-your servants carried torches . There were no books , pens , paper or ink , and no glass in the openings [they]786-your servants believed to be windows . It is a little thing -- glass is -- until it is absent , then it becomes a big thing . But perhaps the worst of all was , that there was n't any sugar , coffee , tea , or tobacco . [I]0-i saw that [I]0-i was just another [Robinson Crusoe]148-robinson cast away on [an uninhabited island]787-an uninhabited island , with [no society]788-no society but some more or less tame animals , and if [I]0-i wanted to make life bearable [I]0-i must do as [he]157-r. did -- invent , contrive , create , reorganize things ; set brain and hand to work , and keep them busy . Well , that was in [my]0-i line . One thing troubled [me]0-i along at first -- the immense interest which [people]357-people took in [me]0-i . Apparently [the whole nation]790-the whole nation wanted a look at [me]0-i . It soon transpired that the eclipse had scared [the British world]791-the british world almost to death ; that while it lasted [the whole country]515-the whole country , from one end to the other , was in a pitiable state of panic , and [the churches]793-the churches , [hermitages]794-hermitages , and [monkeries]795-monkeries overflowed with praying and weeping poor creatures who thought the end of [the world]374-the world was come . Then had followed the news that [the producer of this awful event]797-the producer of this awful event was [a stranger]798-a stranger , [a mighty magician at [[Arthur]137-arthur 's court]595-arthur 's court]799-a mighty magician at arthur 's court ; that [he]797-the producer of this awful event could have blown out the sun like a candle , and was just going to do it when [his]797-the producer of this awful event mercy was purchased , and [he]797-the producer of this awful event then dissolved [his]797-the producer of this awful event enchantments , and was now recognized and honored as [the man who had by [his]797-the producer of this awful event unaided might saved the globe from destruction and [its peoples]802-its peoples from extinction]801-the man who had by his unaided might saved the globe from destruction and its peoples from extinction . Now if [you]803-you consider that [everybody]600-everybody believed that , and not only believed it , but never even dreamed of doubting it , [you]803-you will easily understand that there was [not a person in [all Britain]806-all britain that would not have walked fifty miles to get a sight of [me]0-i]805-not a person in all britain that would not have walked fifty miles to get a sight of me . Of course [I]0-i was all the talk -- [all other subjects]807-all other subjects were dropped ; even [the king]4445-the king became suddenly [a person of minor interest and notoriety]809-a person of minor interest and notoriety . Within twenty - four hours [the delegations]810-the delegations began to arrive , and from that time onward for a fortnight [they]810-the delegations kept coming . [The village]811-the village was crowded , and all [the countryside]812-the countryside . [I]0-i had to go out a dozen times a day and show [myself]0-i to [these reverent and awe - stricken multitudes]813-these reverent and awe - stricken multitudes . It came to be a great burden , as to time and trouble , but of course it was at the same time compensatingly agreeable to be so celebrated and such a center of homage . It turned [Brer Merlin]134-merlin green with envy and spite , which was a great satisfaction to [me]0-i . But there was one thing [I]0-i could n't understand -- [nobody]476-nobody had asked for an autograph . [I]0-i spoke to [Clarence]131-clarence about it . By [George]158-george ! [I]0-i had to explain to [him]131-clarence what it was . Then [he]131-clarence said nobody in [the country]420-the country could read or write but [a few dozen priests]816-a few dozen priests . [Land]14-land ! think of that . There was another thing that troubled [me]0-i a little . [Those multitudes]817-those multitudes presently began to agitate for another miracle . That was natural . To be able to carry back to [[their]817-those multitudes far homes]818-their far homes the boast that [they]817-those multitudes had seen [the man who could command the sun , riding in the heavens , and be obeyed]819-the man who could command the sun , riding in the heavens , and be obeyed , would make [them]817-those multitudes great in the eyes of [[their]817-those multitudes neighbors]820-their neighbors , and envied by [them]817-those multitudes all ; but to be able to also say [they]817-those multitudes had seen [him]819-the man who could command the sun , riding in the heavens , and be obeyed work a miracle [themselves]817-those multitudes -- why , [people]357-people would come a distance to see _ [them]817-those multitudes _ . The pressure got to be pretty strong . There was going to be an eclipse of the moon , and [I]0-i knew the date and hour , but it was too far away . Two years . [I]0-i would have given a good deal for license to hurry it up and use it now when there was a big market for it . It seemed a great pity to have it wasted so , and come lagging along at a time when [a body]427-a body would n't have any use for it , as like as not . If it had been booked for only a month away , [I]0-i could have sold it short ; but , as matters stood , [I]0-i could n't seem to cipher out any way to make it do [me]0-i any good , so [I]0-i gave up trying . Next , [Clarence]131-clarence found that [old Merlin]134-merlin was making [himself]134-merlin busy on the sly among [those people]823-those people . [He]131-clarence was spreading a report that [I]0-i was [a humbug]676-a humbug , and that the reason [I]0-i did n't accommodate [the people]753-the people with a miracle was because [I]0-i could n't . [I]0-i saw that [I]0-i must do something . [I]0-i presently thought out a plan . By [my]0-i authority as executive [I]0-i threw [Merlin]134-merlin into [prison]377-prison -- [the same cell [I]0-i had occupied [myself]0-i]827-the same cell i had occupied myself . Then [I]0-i gave public notice by herald and trumpet that [I]0-i should be busy with affairs of state for a fortnight , but about the end of that time [I]0-i would take a moment 's leisure and blow up [[Merlin]134-merlin 's stone tower]828-merlin 's stone tower by fires from [heaven]4564-heaven ; in the meantime , whoso listened to evil reports about [me]0-i , let [him]134-merlin beware . Furthermore , [I]0-i would perform but this one miracle at this time , and no more ; if it failed to satisfy and any murmured , [I]0-i would turn [the murmurers]830-the murmurers into horses , and make [them]830-the murmurers useful . Quiet ensued . [I]0-i took [Clarence]131-clarence into [my]0-i confidence , to a certain degree , and [we]831-we went to work privately . [I]0-i told [him]131-clarence that this was a sort of miracle that required a trifle of preparation , and that it would be sudden death to ever talk about these preparations to [anybody]553-anybody . That made [his]131-clarence mouth safe enough . Clandestinely [we]831-we made a few bushels of first - rate blasting powder , and [I]0-i superintended [[my]0-i armorers]833-my armorers while [they]833-my armorers constructed a lightning - rod and some wires . [This old stone tower]834-this old stone tower was very massive -- and rather ruinous , too , for [it]834-this old stone tower was [Roman]15-roman , and four hundred years old . Yes , and handsome , after a rude fashion , and clothed with ivy from base to summit , as with a shirt of scale mail . [It]834-this old stone tower stood on a lonely eminence , in good view from [the castle]721-the castle , and about half a mile away . Working by night , [we]831-we stowed the powder in [the tower]836-the tower -- dug stones out , on the inside , and buried the powder in the walls themselves , which were fifteen feet thick at the base . [We]831-we put in a peck at a time , in a dozen places . [We]831-we could have blown up [the Tower of [London]16-london]837-the tower of london with these charges . When the thirteenth night was come [we]831-we put up [our]831-we lightning - rod , bedded it in one of the batches of powder , and ran wires from it to the other batches . [Everybody]600-everybody had shunned that locality from the day of [my]0-i proclamation , but on the morning of the fourteenth [I]0-i thought best to warn [the people]753-the people , through [the heralds]840-the heralds , to keep clear away -- a quarter of a mile away . Then added , by command , that at some time during the twenty - four hours [I]0-i would consummate the miracle , but would first give a brief notice ; by flags on [the castle towers]841-the castle towers if in the daytime , by torch - baskets in the same places if at night . Thunder - showers had been tolerably frequent of late , and [I]0-i was not much afraid of a failure ; still , [I]0-i should n't have cared for a delay of a day or two ; [I]0-i should have explained that [I]0-i was busy with affairs of state yet , and [the people]753-the people must wait . Of course , [we]831-we had a blazing sunny day -- almost the first one without a cloud for three weeks ; things always happen so . [I]0-i kept secluded , and watched the weather . [Clarence]131-clarence dropped in from time to time and said the public excitement was growing and growing all the time , and [the whole country]515-the whole country filling up with [human masses]844-human masses as far as [one]434-one could see from the battlements . At last the wind sprang up and a cloud appeared -- in [the right quarter]846-the right quarter , too , and just at nightfall . For a little while [I]0-i watched that distant cloud spread and blacken , then [I]0-i judged it was time for [me]0-i to appear . [I]0-i ordered the torch - baskets to be lit , and [Merlin]134-merlin liberated and sent to [me]0-i . A quarter of an hour later [I]0-i ascended [the parapet]847-the parapet and there found [the king]4445-the king and [the court]550-the court assembled and gazing off in the darkness toward [[Merlin]134-merlin 's Tower]850-merlin 's tower . Already the darkness was so heavy that [one]434-one could not see far ; [these people]551-these people and [the old turrets]853-the old turrets , being partly in deep shadow and partly in the red glow from the great torch - baskets overhead , made a good deal of a picture . [Merlin]134-merlin arrived in a gloomy mood . [I]0-i said : “ [You]134-merlin wanted to burn [me]0-i alive when [I]0-i had not done [you]134-merlin any harm , and latterly [you]134-merlin have been trying to injure [my]0-i professional reputation . Therefore [I]0-i am going to call down fire and blow up [[your]134-merlin tower]4589-your tower , but it is only fair to give [you]134-merlin a chance ; now if [you]134-merlin think [you]134-merlin can break [my]0-i enchantments and ward off the fires , step to the bat , it 's [your]134-merlin innings . ”[0-i] “ [I]134-merlin can , [fair sir]4423-fair sir , and [I]134-merlin will . Doubt it not . ”[134-merlin] [He]134-merlin drew an imaginary circle on the stones of the roof , and burnt a pinch of powder in it , which sent up a small cloud of aromatic smoke , whereat [everybody]600-everybody fell back and began to cross [themselves]600-everybody and get uncomfortable . Then [he]134-merlin began to mutter and make passes in the air with [his]134-merlin hands . [He]134-merlin worked [himself]134-merlin up slowly and gradually into a sort of frenzy , and got to thrashing around with [his]134-merlin arms like the sails of a windmill . By this time the storm had about reached [us]855-us ; the gusts of wind were flaring the torches and making the shadows swash about , the first heavy drops of rain were falling , [the world]374-the world abroad was black as pitch , the lightning began to wink fitfully . Of course , [my]0-i rod would be loading itself now . In fact , things were imminent . So [I]0-i said : “ [You]134-merlin have had time enough . [I]0-i have given [you]134-merlin every advantage , and not interfered . It is plain [your]134-merlin magic is weak . It is only fair that [I]0-i begin now . ”[0-i] [I]0-i made about three passes in the air , and then there was an awful crash and [that old tower]857-that old tower leaped into the sky in chunks , along with a vast volcanic fountain of fire that turned night to noonday , and showed a thousand acres of [human beings]858-human beings groveling on the ground in a general collapse of consternation . Well , it rained mortar and masonry the rest of the week . This was the report ; but probably the facts would have modified it . It was an effective miracle . [The great bothersome temporary population]859-the great bothersome temporary population vanished . There were a good many thousand tracks in the mud the next morning , but [they]860-they were all outward bound . If [I]0-i had advertised another miracle [I]0-i could n't have raised an audience with [a sheriff]861-a sheriff . [Merlin]134-merlin 's stock was flat . [The king]4445-the king wanted to stop [his]134-merlin wages ; [he]4445-the king even wanted to banish [him]134-merlin , but [I]0-i interfered . [I]0-i said [he]134-merlin would be useful to work the weather , and attend to small matters like that , and [I]0-i would give [him]134-merlin a lift now and then when [his]134-merlin poor little parlor - magic soured on [him]134-merlin . There was n't a rag of [[his]134-merlin tower]863-his tower left , but [I]0-i had [the government]864-the government rebuild [it]863-his tower for [him]134-merlin , and advised [him]134-merlin to take [boarders]865-boarders ; but [he]134-merlin was too high - toned for that . And as for being grateful , [he]134-merlin never even said thank [you]866-you . [He]134-merlin was [a rather hard lot]867-a rather hard lot , take [him]134-merlin how [you]866-you might ; but then [you]866-you could n't fairly expect [a man]518-a man to be sweet that had been set back so . CHAPTER VIII THE BOSS To be vested with enormous authority is a fine thing ; but to have [the on - looking world]869-the on - looking world consent to it is a finer . [The tower]836-the tower episode solidified [my]0-i power , and made it impregnable . If [any were perchance disposed to be jealous and critical before that]871-any were perchance disposed to be jealous and critical before that , [they]871-any were perchance disposed to be jealous and critical before that experienced a change of heart , now . There was not [any one in [the kingdom]517-the kingdom who would have considered it good judgment to meddle with [my]0-i matters]872-any one in the kingdom who would have considered it good judgment to meddle with my matters . [I]0-i was fast getting adjusted to [my]0-i situation and circumstances . For a time , [I]0-i used to wake up , mornings , and smile at [my]0-i “ dream , ”[159-colt] and listen for the [[Colt]159-colt 's factory]874-colt 's factory whistle ; but that sort of thing played itself out , gradually , and at last [I]0-i was fully able to realize that [I]0-i was actually living in the sixth century , and in [[Arthur]137-arthur 's court]595-arthur 's court , not [a lunatic asylum]876-a lunatic asylum . After that , [I]0-i was just as much at [home]619-home in that century as [I]0-i could have been in any other ; and as for preference , [I]0-i would n't have traded it for the twentieth . Look at the opportunities here for [a man of knowledge , brains , pluck , and enterprise]878-a man of knowledge , brains , pluck , and enterprise to sail in and grow up with [the country]420-the country . The grandest field that ever was ; and all [my]0-i own ; not [a competitor]880-a competitor ; not [a man who was n't a baby to [me]0-i in acquirements and capacities]881-a man who was n't a baby to me in acquirements and capacities ; whereas , what would [I]0-i amount to in the twentieth century ? [I]0-i should be [foreman of [a factory]883-a factory]882-foreman of a factory , that is about all ; and could drag a seine down [street]884-street any day and catch [a hundred better men]885-a hundred better men than [myself]0-i . What a jump [I]0-i had made ! [I]0-i could n't keep from thinking about it , and contemplating it , just as [one]434-one does who has struck oil . There was nothing back of [me]0-i that could approach it , unless it might be [Joseph]160-joseph 's case ; and [Joseph]160-joseph 's only approached it , it did n't equal it , quite . For it stands to reason that as [Joseph]160-joseph 's splendid financial ingenuities advantaged [nobody]476-nobody but [the king]4445-the king , [the general public]889-the general public must have regarded [him]160-joseph with a good deal of disfavor , whereas [I]0-i had done [[my]0-i entire public]890-my entire public a kindness in sparing the sun , and was popular by reason of it . [I]0-i was no shadow of [a king]891-a king ; [I]0-i was the substance ; [the king]4445-the king [himself]4445-the king was the shadow . [My]0-i power was colossal ; and it was not a mere name , as such things have generally been , it was the genuine article . [I]0-i stood here , at the very spring and source of the second great period of [the world]374-the world 's history ; and could see the trickling stream of that history gather and deepen and broaden , and roll its mighty tides down the far centuries ; and [I]0-i could note the upspringing of adventurers like [myself]0-i in the shelter of [its]894-its long array of thrones : [De Montforts]161-de montforts , [Gavestons]162-gavestons , [Mortimers]163-mortimers , [Villierses]164-villierses ; the war - making , campaign - directing wantons of [France]17-france , and [[Charles the Second]165-charles the second 's scepter - wielding drabs]895-charles the second 's scepter - wielding drabs ; but nowhere in the procession was [[my]0-i full - sized fellow]896-my full - sized fellow visible . [I]0-i was [a Unique]897-a unique ; and glad to know that that fact could not be dislodged or challenged for thirteen centuries and a half , for sure . Yes , in power [I]0-i was equal to [the king]4445-the king . At the same time there was another power that was a trifle stronger than both of [us]899-us put together . That was [the Church]900-the church . [I]0-i do not wish to disguise that fact . [I]0-i could n't , if [I]0-i wanted to . But never mind about that , now ; it will show up , in its proper place , later on . It did n't cause [me]0-i any trouble in the beginning --at least any of consequence . Well , [it]901-it was [a curious country]902-a curious country , and full of interest . And [the people]753-the people ! [They]753-the people were [the quaintest and simplest and trustingest race]904-the quaintest and simplest and trustingest race ; why , [they]753-the people were [nothing but rabbits]905-nothing but rabbits . It was pitiful for [a person born in a wholesome free atmosphere]906-a person born in a wholesome free atmosphere to listen to [their]753-the people humble and hearty outpourings of loyalty toward [[their]753-the people king]907-their king and Church and [nobility]908-nobility ; as if [they]753-the people had any more occasion to love and honor [king and Church and noble]909-king and church and noble than [a slave]910-a slave has to love and honor [the lash]911-the lash , or a dog has to love and honor [the stranger that kicks [him]910-a slave]912-the stranger that kicks him ! Why , dear [me]0-i , _ [any _ kind of royalty]913-any _ kind of royalty , howsoever modified , _ any _ kind of aristocracy , howsoever pruned , is rightly an insult ; but if [you]914-you are born and brought up under that sort of arrangement [you]914-you probably never find it out for [yourself]914-you , and do n't believe it when [somebody else]915-somebody else tells [you]914-you . It is enough to make [a body ashamed of [his]916-a body ashamed of his race race]916-a body ashamed of his race to think of the sort of froth that has always occupied [its]917-its thrones without shadow of right or reason , and [the seventh - rate people that have always figured as [its]917-its aristocracies]918-the seventh - rate people that have always figured as its aristocracies -- [a company of [monarchs]920-monarchs and [nobles who , as a rule]921-nobles who , as a rule , would have achieved only poverty and obscurity if left , like [[their]921-nobles who , as a rule betters]922-their betters , to [their]921-nobles who , as a rule own exertions . [The most of [King Arthur]116-arthur 's British nation]923-the most of king arthur 's british nation]919-a company of monarchs and nobles who , as a rule , would have achieved only poverty and obscurity if left , like their betters , to their own exertions . the most of king arthur 's british nation were [slaves]924-slaves , pure and simple , and bore that name , and wore the iron collar on [their]923-the most of king arthur 's british nation necks ; and [the rest]598-the rest were [slaves]924-slaves in fact , but without the name ; [they]598-the rest imagined [themselves]598-the rest [men]508-men and [freemen]928-freemen , and called [themselves]598-the rest so . The truth was , [the nation]709-the nation as a body was in [the world]374-the world for one object , and one only : to grovel before [king and Church and noble]909-king and church and noble ; to slave for [them]909-king and church and noble , sweat blood for [them]909-king and church and noble , starve that [they]909-king and church and noble might be fed , work that [they]909-king and church and noble might play , drink misery to the dregs that [they]909-king and church and noble might be happy , go naked that [they]909-king and church and noble might wear silks and jewels , pay taxes that [they]909-king and church and noble might be spared from paying [them]909-king and church and noble , be familiar all [their]909-king and church and noble lives with the degrading language and postures of adulation that [they]909-king and church and noble might walk in pride and think [themselves]909-king and church and noble [the gods of [this world]352-this world]932-the gods of this world . And for all this , the thanks [they]909-king and church and noble got were cuffs and contempt ; and so poor - spirited were [they]909-king and church and noble that [they]909-king and church and noble took even this sort of attention as an honor . Inherited ideas are a curious thing , and interesting to observe and examine . [I]0-i had [mine]0-i , [the king]4445-the king and [[his]4445-the king people]935-his people had [theirs]936-theirs . In both cases they flowed in ruts worn deep by time and habit , and [the man who should have proposed to divert them by reason and argument]937-the man who should have proposed to divert them by reason and argument would have had a long contract on [his]937-the man who should have proposed to divert them by reason and argument hands . For instance , [those people]823-those people had inherited the idea that [all men without title and a long pedigree]939-all men without title and a long pedigree , whether [they]939-all men without title and a long pedigree had great natural gifts and acquirements or had n't , were creatures of no more consideration than so many animals , bugs , insects ; whereas [I]0-i had inherited the idea that [human daws who can consent to masquerade in the peacock - shams of inherited dignities and unearned titles]940-human daws who can consent to masquerade in the peacock - shams of inherited dignities and unearned titles , are of no good but to be laughed at . The way [I]0-i was looked upon was odd , but it was natural . [You]941-you know how [the keeper]942-the keeper and [the public]943-the public regard the elephant in the menagerie : well , that is the idea . [They]909-king and church and noble are full of admiration of [his]4445-the king vast bulk and [his]4445-the king prodigious strength ; [they]909-king and church and noble speak with pride of the fact that [he]4445-the king can do a hundred marvels which are far and away beyond [their]909-king and church and noble own powers ; and [they]909-king and church and noble speak with the same pride of the fact that in [his]4445-the king wrath [he]4445-the king is able to drive [a thousand men]944-a thousand men before [him]4445-the king . But does that make [him]4445-the king one of [_ [them]944-a thousand men _]945-_ them _ ? No ; [the raggedest tramp in [the pit]947-the pit]946-the raggedest tramp in the pit would smile at the idea . [He]4445-the king could n't comprehend it ; could n't take it in ; could n't in any remote way conceive of it . Well , to [the king]4445-the king , [the nobles]949-the nobles , and all [the nation]709-the nation , down to [the very slaves and tramps]951-the very slaves and tramps , [I]0-i was just that kind of an elephant , and nothing more . [I]0-i was admired , also feared ; but it was as an animal is admired and feared . The animal is not reverenced , neither was [I]0-i ; [I]0-i was not even respected . [I]0-i had no pedigree , no inherited title ; so in [the king]4445-the king 's and [nobles]953-nobles ' eyes [I]0-i was [mere dirt]954-mere dirt ; [the people]753-the people regarded [me]0-i with wonder and awe , but there was no reverence mixed with it ; through the force of inherited ideas [they]753-the people were not able to conceive of anything being entitled to that except pedigree and lordship . There [you]956-you see the hand of that awful power , [the Roman Catholic Church]957-the roman catholic church . In two or three little centuries it had converted [a nation of [men]508-men]958-a nation of men to [a nation of worms]960-a nation of worms . Before the day of [the Church]900-the church 's supremacy in [the world]374-the world , [men]508-men were [men]508-men , and held [their]508-men heads up , and had [a man]518-a man 's pride and spirit and independence ; and what of greatness and position [a person]966-a person got , [he]966-a person got mainly by achievement , not by birth . But then [the Church]18-the church came to the front , with an axe to grind ; and [she]967-she was wise , subtle , and knew more than one way to skin a cat -- or [a nation]341-a nation ; [she]967-she invented “ divine right of [kings]339-kings , ”[967-she] and propped it all around , brick by brick , with the Beatitudes --wrenching [them]753-the people from [their]753-the people good purpose to make [them]753-the people fortify an evil one ; [she]967-she preached ( to [the commoner]969-the commoner ) humility , obedience to [superiors]970-superiors , the beauty of self - sacrifice ; [she]967-she preached ( to [the commoner]969-the commoner ) meekness under insult ; preached ( still to [the commoner]969-the commoner , always to [the commoner]969-the commoner ) patience , meanness of spirit , non - resistance under oppression ; and [she]967-she introduced heritable ranks and aristocracies , and taught [all the Christian populations of [the earth]399-the earth]974-all the christian populations of the earth to bow down to [them]974-all the christian populations of the earth and worship [them]974-all the christian populations of the earth . Even down to [my]0-i birth - century that poison was still in the blood of [Christendom]45-christendom , and [the best of [English commoners]977-english commoners]976-the best of english commoners was still content to see [[his]976-the best of english commoners inferiors]978-his inferiors impudently continuing to hold a number of positions , such as [lordships]979-lordships and the throne , to which the grotesque laws of [[his]976-the best of english commoners country]980-his country did not allow [him]976-the best of english commoners to aspire ; in fact , [he]976-the best of english commoners was not merely contented with this strange condition of things , [he]976-the best of english commoners was even able to persuade [himself]976-the best of english commoners that [he]976-the best of english commoners was proud of it . It seems to show that there is n't anything [you]981-you ca n't stand , if [you]981-you are only born and bred to it . Of course that taint , that reverence for rank and title , had been in [our]982-our American blood , too -- [I]0-i know that ; but when [I]0-i left [America]19-america it had disappeared -- at least to all intents and purposes . The remnant of it was restricted to [the dudes and dudesses]983-the dudes and dudesses . When a disease has worked its way down to that level , it may fairly be said to be out of the system . But to return to [my]0-i anomalous position in [[King Arthur]116-arthur 's kingdom]984-king arthur 's kingdom . Here [I]0-i was , [a giant among pigmies]985-a giant among pigmies , [a man among children]986-a man among children , [a master intelligence among [intellectual moles]988-intellectual moles]987-a master intelligence among intellectual moles : by all rational measurement [the one and only actually great man in [that whole British world]990-that whole british world]989-the one and only actually great man in that whole british world ; and yet there and then , just as in [the remote [England]1-england of [my]0-i birth]991-the remote england of my birth - time , [the sheep - witted earl who could claim long descent from [[a king]891-a king 's leman]994-a king 's leman , acquired at second - hand from [the slums of [London]16-london]995-the slums of london]992-the sheep - witted earl who could claim long descent from a king 's leman , acquired at second - hand from the slums of london , was [a better man]996-a better man than [I]0-i was . [Such a personage]997-such a personage was fawned upon in [[Arthur]116-arthur 's realm]998-arthur 's realm and reverently looked up to by [everybody]600-everybody , even though [his]997-such a personage dispositions were as mean as [his]997-such a personage intelligence , and [his]997-such a personage morals as base as [his]997-such a personage lineage . There were times when _ [he]997-such a personage _ could sit down in [the king]4445-the king 's presence , but [I]0-i could n't . [I]0-i could have got a title easily enough , and that would have raised [me]0-i a large step in [everybody]600-everybody 's eyes ; even in [the king]4445-the king 's , [the giver of it]1003-the giver of it . But [I]0-i did n't ask for it ; and [I]0-i declined it when it was offered . [I]0-i could n't have enjoyed such a thing with [my]0-i notions ; and it would n't have been fair , anyway , because as far back as [I]0-i could go , [[our]1004-our tribe]1005-our tribe had always been short of the bar sinister . [I]0-i could n't have felt really and satisfactorily fine and proud and set - up over any title except one that should come from [the nation]709-the nation itself , the only legitimate source ; and such an one [I]0-i hoped to win ; and in the course of years of honest and honorable endeavor , [I]0-i did win it and did wear it with a high and clean pride . This title fell casually from the lips of [a blacksmith]423-a blacksmith , one day , in [a village]1008-a village , was caught up as a happy thought and tossed from mouth to mouth with a laugh and an affirmative vote ; in ten days it had swept [the kingdom]517-the kingdom , and was become as familiar as [the king]4445-the king 's name . [I]0-i was never known by any other designation afterward , whether in [the nation]709-the nation 's talk or in grave debate upon matters of state at [the council - board of [the sovereign]1013-the sovereign]1012-the council - board of the sovereign . This title , translated into modern speech , would be [THE BOSS]1014-the boss . Elected by [the nation]709-the nation . That suited [me]0-i . And it was a pretty high title . There were [very few THE 'S]1016-very few the 's , and [I]0-i was one of [them]1016-very few the 's . If [you]1017-you spoke of [the duke]1018-the duke , or [the earl]1019-the earl , or [the bishop]1020-the bishop , how could [anybody]553-anybody tell which one [you]1017-you meant ? But if [you]1017-you spoke of [The King]4445-the king or [The Queen]579-the queen or [The Boss]1014-the boss , it was different . Well , [I]0-i liked [the king]4445-the king , and as [king]1026-king [I]0-i respected [him]4445-the king -- respected the office ; at least respected it as much as [I]0-i was capable of respecting any unearned supremacy ; but as [MEN]508-men [I]0-i looked down upon [him]4445-the king and [[his]4445-the king nobles]1028-his nobles -- privately . And [he]4445-the king and [they]508-men liked [me]0-i , and respected [[my]0-i office]1029-my office ; but as an animal , without birth or sham title , [they]508-men looked down upon [me]0-i -- and were not particularly private about it , either . [I]0-i did n't charge for [my]0-i opinion about [them]508-men , and [they]508-men did n't charge for [their]508-men opinion about [me]0-i : the account was square , the books balanced , [everybody]600-everybody was satisfied . CHAPTER IX THE TOURNAMENT [They]508-men were always having grand tournaments there at [Camelot]7-camelot ; and very stirring and picturesque and ridiculous human bull - fights they were , too , but just a little wearisome to the practical mind . However , [I]0-i was generally on hand -- for two reasons : [a man]518-a man must not hold [himself]518-a man aloof from the things which [[his]518-a man friends]1032-his friends and [[his]518-a man community]1033-his community have at heart if [he]518-a man would be liked -- especially as [a statesman]1034-a statesman ; and both as [business man]1035-business man and [statesman]1036-statesman [I]0-i wanted to study the tournament and see if [I]0-i could n't invent an improvement on it . That reminds [me]0-i to remark , in passing , that the very first official thing [I]0-i did , in [my]0-i administration -- and it was on the very first day of it , too -- was to start [a patent office]1037-a patent office ; for [I]0-i knew that [a country without]1038-a country without [a patent office and good patent laws]1039-a patent office and good patent laws was just a crab , and could n't travel any way but sideways or backways . Things ran along , a tournament nearly every week ; and now and then [the boys]1040-the boys used to want [me]0-i to take a hand -- [I]0-i mean [Sir Launcelot]122-sir launcelot and [the rest]598-the rest -- but [I]0-i said [I]0-i would by and by ; no hurry yet , and too much government machinery to oil up and set to rights and start a - going . [We]1042-we had one tournament which was continued from day to day during more than a week , and as many as [five hundred knights]1043-five hundred knights took part in it , from first to last . [They]1044-they were weeks gathering . [They]1044-they came on horseback from everywhere ; from [the very ends of [the country]420-the country]1045-the very ends of the country , and even from beyond [the sea]1047-the sea ; and [many]473-many brought [ladies]1049-ladies , and all brought [squires]1050-squires and [troops of servants]1051-troops of servants . It was [a most gaudy and gorgeous crowd , as to costumery]1052-a most gaudy and gorgeous crowd , as to costumery , and very characteristic of [the country]420-the country and the time , in the way of high animal spirits , innocent indecencies of language , and happy - hearted indifference to morals . It was fight or look on , all day and every day ; and sing , gamble , dance , carouse half the night every night . [They]1044-they had a most noble good time . [You]1054-you never saw [such people]1055-such people . [Those banks of beautiful ladies , shining in [their]1056-those banks of beautiful ladies , shining in their barbaric splendors barbaric splendors]1056-those banks of beautiful ladies , shining in their barbaric splendors , would see [a knight]1057-a knight sprawl from [his]1057-a knight horse in the lists with a lanceshaft the thickness of [your]1054-you ankle clean through [him]1057-a knight and the blood spouting , and instead of fainting [they]1044-they would clap [their]1044-they hands and crowd [each other]1058-each other for a better view ; only sometimes [one]434-one would dive into [her]434-one handkerchief , and look ostentatiously broken - hearted , and then [you]1054-you could lay two to one that there was a scandal there somewhere and [she]434-one was afraid [the public]943-the public had n't found it out . The noise at night would have been annoying to [me]0-i ordinarily , but [I]0-i did n't mind it in the present circumstances , because it kept [me]0-i from hearing the quacks detaching legs and arms from the day 's cripples . [They]1044-they ruined an uncommon good old cross - cut saw for [me]0-i , and broke the saw - buck , too , but [I]0-i let it pass . And as for [my]0-i axe -- well , [I]0-i made up [my]0-i mind that the next time [I]0-i lent an axe to [a surgeon]1061-a surgeon [I]0-i would pick [my]0-i century . [I]0-i not only watched this tournament from day to day , but detailed [an intelligent priest from [[my]0-i Department]20-my department of Public Morals and Agriculture]1062-an intelligent priest from my department of public morals and agriculture , and ordered [him]1062-an intelligent priest from my department of public morals and agriculture to report it ; for it was [my]0-i purpose by and by , when [I]0-i should have gotten [the people]753-the people along far enough , to start a newspaper . The first thing [you]1064-you want in [a new country]1065-a new country , is [a patent office]1037-a patent office ; then work up [[your]1064-you school system]1067-your school system ; and after that , out with [your]1064-you paper . A newspaper has its faults , and plenty of them , but no matter , it 's hark from the tomb for [a dead nation]1068-a dead nation , and do n't [you]1064-you forget it . [You]1064-you ca n't resurrect [a dead nation]1068-a dead nation without it ; there is n't any way . So [I]0-i wanted to sample things , and be finding out what sort of reporter - material [I]0-i might be able to rake together out of the sixth century when [I]0-i should come to need it . Well , [the priest]739-the priest did very well , considering . [He]739-the priest got in all the details , and that is a good thing in a local item : [you]1064-you see , [he]739-the priest had kept books for [the undertaker - department of [[his]739-the priest church]1072-his church]1071-the undertaker - department of his church when [he]739-the priest was younger , and there , [you]1064-you know , the money 's in the details ; the more details , the more swag : [bearers]1073-bearers , [mutes]1074-mutes , candles , prayers --everything counts ; and if [the bereaved]1075-the bereaved do n't buy prayers enough [you]1064-you mark up [your]1064-you candles with a forked pencil , and [your]1064-you bill shows up all right . And [he]739-the priest had a good knack at getting in the complimentary thing here and there about [a knight that was likely to advertise]1076-a knight that was likely to advertise -- no , [I]0-i mean [a knight that had influence]1077-a knight that had influence ; and [he]739-the priest also had a neat gift of exaggeration , for in [his]739-the priest time [he]739-the priest had kept door for [a pious hermit who lived in [a sty]1079-a sty and worked miracles]1078-a pious hermit who lived in a sty and worked miracles . Of course [this novice]1080-this novice 's report lacked whoop and crash and lurid description , and therefore wanted the true ring ; but its antique wording was quaint and sweet and simple , and full of the fragrances and flavors of the time , and these little merits made up in a measure for its more important lacks . Here is an extract from it : Then [Sir Brian de les Isles]167-sir brian de les isles and Grummore Grummorsum , [knights of the castle]1081-knights of the castle , encountered with [Sir Aglovale]168-sir aglovale and [Sir Tor]169-sir tor , and [Sir Tor]169-sir tor smote down Sir Grummore Grummorsum to [the earth]399-the earth . And [Sir Arnold]174-sir arnold , and [Sir Gauter]175-sir gauter , [knights of [the castle]721-the castle]1081-knights of the castle , encountered with [Sir Brandiles]176-sir brandiles and [Sir Kay]123-sir kay , and [these four knights]1092-these four knights encountered mightily , and brake [their]1092-these four knights spears to [their]1092-these four knights hands . Then came [Sir Pertolope]177-sir pertolope from [the castle]721-the castle , and there encountered with [him]177-sir pertolope [Sir Lionel]178-sir lionel , and there [Sir Pertolope]177-sir pertolope [the green knight]1094-the green knight smote down [Sir Lionel]178-sir lionel , brother to [Sir Launcelot]122-sir launcelot . When [King Aswisance of [Ireland]21-ireland]1100-king aswisance of ireland saw [Sir Gareth]180-sir gareth fare so [he]1100-king aswisance of ireland marvelled what [he]180-sir gareth might be , that one time seemed green , and another time , at [his]180-sir gareth again coming , [he]180-sir gareth seemed blue . And thus at every course that [he]180-sir gareth rode to and fro [he]180-sir gareth changed [his]180-sir gareth color , so that there might [neither king]1101-neither king nor [knight]372-knight have ready cognizance of [him]180-sir gareth . Truly , said [King Arthur]116-arthur , [that knight with the many colors]1116-that knight with the many colors is [a good knight]1117-a good knight .
