[Sir]367-sir , said [Launcelot]122-sir launcelot , [I]0-i may as well find in [my]0-i heart for to forbear [him]394-that knight at this time , for [he]394-that knight hath had travail enough this day , and when [a good knight]1117-a good knight doth so well upon some day , it is [no good knight]1122-no good knight 's part to let [him]1117-a good knight of [his]1117-a good knight worship , and , namely , when [he]1117-a good knight seeth [a knight]1057-a knight hath done so great labour ; for peradventure , said [Sir Launcelot]122-sir launcelot , [his]394-that knight quarrel is here this day , and peradventure [he]394-that knight is best beloved with [this lady of all that be here]1124-this lady of all that be here , for [I]0-i see well [he]394-that knight paineth [himself]394-that knight and enforceth [him]394-that knight to do great deeds , and therefore , said [Sir Launcelot]122-sir launcelot , as for [me]0-i , this day [he]394-that knight shall have the honour ; though it lay in [my]0-i power to put [him]394-that knight from it , [I]0-i would not . There was an unpleasant little episode that day , which for reasons of state [I]0-i struck out of [[my]0-i priest]1125-my priest 's report . [You]1126-you will have noticed that [Garry]192-garry was doing some great fighting in the engagement . When [I]0-i say [Garry]192-garry [I]0-i mean [Sir Gareth]180-sir gareth . [Garry]192-garry was [my]0-i private pet name for [him]394-that knight ; it suggests that [I]0-i had a deep affection for [him]394-that knight , and that was the case . But it was a private pet name only , and never spoken aloud to [any one]1127-any one , much less to [him]394-that knight ; being [a noble]1128-a noble , [he]394-that knight would not have endured a familiarity like that from [me]0-i . Well , to proceed : [I]0-i sat in the private box set apart for [me]0-i as [[the king]4445-the king 's minister]1130-the king 's minister . While [Sir Dinadan]140-sir dinadan was waiting for [his]140-sir dinadan turn to enter the lists , [he]140-sir dinadan came in [there]4491-there and sat down and began to talk ; for [he]140-sir dinadan was always making up to [me]0-i , because [I]0-i was [a stranger]798-a stranger and [he]140-sir dinadan liked to have a fresh market for [his]140-sir dinadan jokes , the most of them having reached that stage of wear where [the teller]1133-the teller has to do the laughing [himself]1133-the teller while [the other person]1134-the other person looks sick . [I]0-i had always responded to [his]140-sir dinadan efforts as well as [I]0-i could , and felt a very deep and real kindness for [him]140-sir dinadan , too , for the reason that if by malice of fate [he]140-sir dinadan knew the one particular anecdote which [I]0-i had heard oftenest and had most hated and most loathed all [my]0-i life , [he]140-sir dinadan had at least spared it [me]0-i . It was one which [I]0-i had heard attributed to [every humorous person who had ever stood on [American soil]1136-american soil , from [Columbus]152-columbus down to [Artemus Ward]25-artemus ward]1135-every humorous person who had ever stood on american soil , from columbus down to artemus ward . It was about [a humorous lecturer who flooded [an ignorant audience]1138-an ignorant audience with the killingest jokes for an hour and never got a laugh]1137-a humorous lecturer who flooded an ignorant audience with the killingest jokes for an hour and never got a laugh ; and then when [he]1137-a humorous lecturer who flooded an ignorant audience with the killingest jokes for an hour and never got a laugh was leaving , [some gray simpletons]1139-some gray simpletons wrung [him]1137-a humorous lecturer who flooded an ignorant audience with the killingest jokes for an hour and never got a laugh gratefully by the hand and said it had been the funniest thing [they]1139-some gray simpletons had ever heard , and “ it was all [they]1139-some gray simpletons could do to keep from laughin ' right out in meetin ' . ”[1139-some gray simpletons] That anecdote never saw the day that it was worth the telling ; and yet [I]0-i had sat under the telling of it hundreds and thousands and millions and billions of times , and cried and cursed all the way through . Then who can hope to know what [my]0-i feelings were , to hear [this armor - plated ass]1140-this armor - plated ass start in on it again , in the murky twilight of tradition , before the dawn of history , while even [Lactantius]193-lactantius might be referred to as “ [the late Lactantius]193-lactantius , ”[193-lactantius] and [the Crusades]1141-the crusades would n't be born for five hundred years yet ? Just as [he]140-sir dinadan finished , [the call - boy]1142-the call - boy came ; so , haw - hawing like a demon , [he]1142-the call - boy went rattling and clanking out like a crate of loose castings , and [I]0-i knew nothing more . It was some minutes before [I]0-i came to , and then [I]0-i opened [my]0-i eyes just in time to see [Sir Gareth]180-sir gareth fetch [him]1137-a humorous lecturer who flooded an ignorant audience with the killingest jokes for an hour and never got a laugh an awful welt , and [I]0-i unconsciously out with the prayer , “ [I]0-i hope to gracious [he]1137-a humorous lecturer who flooded an ignorant audience with the killingest jokes for an hour and never got a laugh 's killed ! ”[0-i] But by ill - luck , before [I]0-i had got half through with the words , [Sir Gareth]180-sir gareth crashed into [Sir Sagramor le Desirous]117-sir sagramor and sent [him]1137-a humorous lecturer who flooded an ignorant audience with the killingest jokes for an hour and never got a laugh thundering over [his]1137-a humorous lecturer who flooded an ignorant audience with the killingest jokes for an hour and never got a laugh horse 's crupper , and [Sir Sagramor]117-sir sagramor caught [my]0-i remark and thought [I]0-i meant it for _ [him]117-sir sagramor _ . Well , whenever [one of [those people]823-those people]695-one of those people got a thing into [his]695-one of those people head , there was no getting it out again . [I]0-i knew that , so [I]0-i saved [my]0-i breath , and offered no explanations . As soon as [Sir Sagramor]117-sir sagramor got well , [he]117-sir sagramor notified [me]0-i that there was a little account to settle between [us]1145-us , and [he]117-sir sagramor named a day three or four years in the future ; place of settlement , the lists where the offense had been given . [I]0-i said [I]0-i would be ready when [he]117-sir sagramor got back . [You]1146-you see , [he]117-sir sagramor was going for [the Holy Grail]26-the holy grail . [The boys]1040-the boys all took a flier at [the Holy Grail]26-the holy grail now and then . It was a several years ' cruise . [They]1040-the boys always put in the long absence snooping around , in the most conscientious way , though [none of [them]1040-the boys]1148-none of them had any idea where [the Holy Grail]26-the holy grail really was , and [I]0-i do n't think any of [them]1040-the boys actually expected to find it , or would have known what to do with it if [he]117-sir sagramor _ had _ run across it . [You]1146-you see , it was just the Northwest Passage of that day , as [you]1146-you may say ; that was all . Every year expeditions went out holy grailing , and next year relief expeditions went out to hunt for _ [them]1040-the boys _ . There was worlds of reputation in it , but no money . Why , [they]1040-the boys actually wanted _ [me]0-i _ to put in ! Well , [I]0-i should smile . CHAPTER X BEGINNINGS OF CIVILIZATION The Round Table soon heard of the challenge , and of course it was a good deal discussed , for such things interested [the boys]1040-the boys . [The king]4445-the king thought [I]0-i ought now to set forth in quest of adventures , so that [I]0-i might gain renown and be the more worthy to meet [Sir Sagramor]117-sir sagramor when the several years should have rolled away . [I]0-i excused [myself]0-i for the present ; [I]0-i said it would take [me]0-i three or four years yet to get things well fixed up and going smoothly ; then [I]0-i should be ready ; all the chances were that at the end of that time [Sir Sagramor]117-sir sagramor would still be out grailing , so no valuable time would be lost by the postponement ; [I]0-i should then have been in office six or seven years , and [I]0-i believed [my]0-i system and machinery would be so well developed that [I]0-i could take a holiday without its working any harm . [I]0-i was pretty well satisfied with what [I]0-i had already accomplished . In various quiet nooks and corners [I]0-i had the beginnings of all sorts of industries under way -- nuclei of [future vast factories]1151-future vast factories , the iron and steel missionaries of [[my]0-i future civilization]1152-my future civilization . In these were gathered together [the brightest young minds [I]0-i could find]1153-the brightest young minds i could find , and [I]0-i kept [agents]1154-agents out raking [the country]420-the country for more , all the time . [I]0-i was training [a crowd of [ignorant folk]1157-ignorant folk]1156-a crowd of ignorant folk into [experts]1158-experts -- [experts in every sort of handiwork and scientific calling]1159-experts in every sort of handiwork and scientific calling . [These nurseries of [mine]0-i went smoothly and privately along undisturbed in [[their]1160-these nurseries of mine went smoothly and privately along undisturbed in their obscure country retreats obscure country retreats]1161-their obscure country retreats]1160-these nurseries of mine went smoothly and privately along undisturbed in their obscure country retreats , for [nobody]476-nobody was allowed to come into [[their]1160-these nurseries of mine went smoothly and privately along undisturbed in their obscure country retreats precincts]1163-their precincts without a special permit -- for [I]0-i was afraid of [the Church]18-the church . [I]0-i had started [[a teacher]1164-a teacher - factory and a lot of [Sunday - schools]1166-sunday - schools]1165-a teacher - factory and a lot of sunday - schools the first thing ; as a result , [I]0-i now had an admirable system of graded schools in full blast in [those places]1167-those places , and also a complete variety of [Protestant congregations]1168-protestant congregations all in a prosperous and growing condition . [Everybody]600-everybody could be any kind of [a Christian [he]600-everybody wanted to]1170-a christian he wanted to ; there was perfect freedom in that matter . But [I]0-i confined public religious teaching to [the churches]793-the churches and [the Sunday - schools]1172-the sunday - schools , permitting nothing of it in [[my]0-i other educational buildings]1173-my other educational buildings . [I]0-i could have given [[my]0-i own sect]1174-my own sect the preference and made [everybody a Presbyterian]1175-everybody a presbyterian without any trouble , but that would have been to affront a law of human nature : spiritual wants and instincts are as various in [the human family]1176-the human family as are physical appetites , complexions , and features , and [a man]518-a man is only at [his]518-a man best , morally , when [he]518-a man is equipped with the religious garment whose color and shape and size most nicely accommodate themselves to the spiritual complexion , angularities , and stature of [the individual who wears it]1178-the individual who wears it ; and , besides , [I]0-i was afraid of [a united Church]1179-a united church ; it makes a mighty power , the mightiest conceivable , and then when it by and by gets into selfish hands , as it is always bound to do , it means death to human liberty and paralysis to human thought . [All mines]1180-all mines were royal property , and there were a good many of [them]1180-all mines . [They]1180-all mines had formerly been worked as [savages]1181-savages always work [mines]1182-mines -- holes grubbed in [the earth]399-the earth and the mineral brought up in sacks of hide by hand , at the rate of a ton a day ; but [I]0-i had begun to put the mining on a scientific basis as early as [I]0-i could . Yes , [I]0-i had made pretty handsome progress when [Sir Sagramor]117-sir sagramor 's challenge struck [me]0-i . Four years rolled by -- and then ! Well , [you]1184-you would never imagine it in [the world]374-the world . Unlimited power is the ideal thing when it is in safe hands . The despotism of [heaven]4564-heaven is the one absolutely perfect government . An earthly despotism would be the absolutely perfect earthly government , if the conditions were the same , namely , [the despot the perfectest individual of [the human race]1188-the human race]1187-the despot the perfectest individual of the human race , and [his]1187-the despot the perfectest individual of the human race lease of life perpetual . But as [a perishable perfect man]1189-a perishable perfect man must die , and leave [his]1189-a perishable perfect man despotism in the hands of [an imperfect successor]1190-an imperfect successor , an earthly despotism is not merely a bad form of government , it is the worst form that is possible . [My]0-i works showed what [a despot]1191-a despot could do with the resources of [a kingdom]1192-a kingdom at [his]1191-a despot command . Unsuspected by [this dark land]1193-this dark land , [I]0-i had the civilization of the nineteenth century booming under its very nose ! [It]1193-this dark land was fenced away from the public view , but there it was , a gigantic and unassailable fact -- and to be heard from , yet , if [I]0-i lived and had luck . There it was , as sure a fact and as substantial a fact as any serene volcano , standing innocent with [its]1193-this dark land smokeless summit in the blue sky and giving no sign of the rising hell in [its]1193-this dark land bowels . [[My]0-i schools]1194-my schools and [churches]1195-churches were [children]533-children four years before ; [they]533-children were grown - up now ; [[my]0-i shops]1197-my shops of that day were [vast factories]1198-vast factories now ; where [I]0-i had [a dozen trained men]1199-a dozen trained men then , [I]0-i had [a thousand now]1200-a thousand now ; where [I]0-i had [one brilliant expert]1201-one brilliant expert then , [I]0-i had fifty now . [I]0-i stood with [my]0-i hand on the cock , so to speak , ready to turn it on and flood [the midnight world]1202-the midnight world with light at any moment . But [I]0-i was not going to do the thing in that sudden way . It was not [my]0-i policy . [The people]753-the people could not have stood it ; and , moreover , [I]0-i should have had [the Established Roman Catholic Church]1204-the established roman catholic church on [my]0-i back in a minute . No , [I]0-i had been going cautiously all the while . [I]0-i had had [confidential agents trickling through [the country]420-the country]1205-confidential agents trickling through the country some time , whose office was to undermine knighthood by imperceptible degrees , and to gnaw a little at this and that and the other superstition , and so prepare the way gradually for a better order of things . [I]0-i was turning on [my]0-i light one - candle - power at a time , and meant to continue to do so . [I]0-i had scattered [some branch schools secretly about [the kingdom]517-the kingdom]1207-some branch schools secretly about the kingdom , and [they]1207-some branch schools secretly about the kingdom were doing very well . [I]0-i meant to work this racket more and more , as time wore on , if nothing occurred to frighten [me]0-i . One of [my]0-i deepest secrets was [my]0-i [West Point]27-west point -- [[my]0-i military academy]1209-my military academy . [I]0-i kept that most jealously out of sight ; and [I]0-i did the same with [[my]0-i naval academy]1210-my naval academy which [I]0-i had established at [a remote seaport]1211-a remote seaport . [Both]1212-both were prospering to [my]0-i satisfaction . [Clarence]131-clarence was twenty - two now , and was [[my]0-i head executive]1213-my head executive , [my]0-i right hand . [He]131-clarence was [a darling]1214-a darling ; [he]131-clarence was equal to anything ; there was n't anything [he]131-clarence could n't turn [his]131-clarence hand to . Of late [I]0-i had been training [him]131-clarence for journalism , for the time seemed about right for a start in the newspaper line ; nothing big , but just a small weekly for experimental circulation in [my]0-i civilization - nurseries . [He]131-clarence took to it like a duck ; there was [an editor]1215-an editor concealed in [him]131-clarence , sure . Already [he]131-clarence had doubled [himself]131-clarence in one way ; [he]131-clarence talked sixth century and wrote nineteenth . [His]131-clarence journalistic style was climbing , steadily ; it was already up to the back settlement Alabama mark , and could n't be told from the editorial output of [that region]1216-that region either by matter or flavor . [We]1217-we had another large departure on hand , too . This was a telegraph and a telephone ; [our]1217-we first venture in this line . These wires were for private service only , as yet , and must be kept private until a riper day should come . [We]1217-we had [a gang of men on [the road]460-the road]1218-a gang of men on the road , working mainly by night . [They]1218-a gang of men on the road were stringing ground wires ; [we]1217-we were afraid to put up poles , for they would attract too much inquiry . Ground wires were good enough , in both instances , for [my]0-i wires were protected by an insulation of [my]0-i own invention which was perfect . [[My]0-i men]1220-my men had orders to strike across [country]1221-country , avoiding [roads]1222-roads , and establishing connection with [any considerable towns whose lights betrayed [their]1220-my men presence , and leaving [experts]1158-experts in charge]1223-any considerable towns whose lights betrayed their presence , and leaving experts in charge . [Nobody]476-nobody could tell [you]1226-you how to find [any place in [the kingdom]517-the kingdom]1227-any place in the kingdom , for [nobody]476-nobody ever went intentionally to [any place]1230-any place , but only struck [it]1230-any place by accident in [his]476-nobody wanderings , and then generally left [it]1230-any place without thinking to inquire what its name was . At one time and another [we]1217-we had sent out topographical expeditions to survey and map [the kingdom]517-the kingdom , but [the priests]1232-the priests had always interfered and raised trouble . So [we]1217-we had given the thing up , for the present ; it would be poor wisdom to antagonize [the Church]900-the church . As for the general condition of [the country]420-the country , it was as it had been when [I]0-i arrived in [it]420-the country , to all intents and purposes . [I]0-i had made changes , but they were necessarily slight , and they were not noticeable . Thus far , [I]0-i had not even meddled with taxation , outside of the taxes which provided the royal revenues . [I]0-i had systematized those , and put the service on an effective and righteous basis . As a result , these revenues were already quadrupled , and yet the burden was so much more equably distributed than before , that all [the kingdom]517-the kingdom felt a sense of relief , and the praises of [my]0-i administration were hearty and general . Personally , [I]0-i struck an interruption , now , but [I]0-i did not mind it , it could not have happened at a better time . Earlier it could have annoyed [me]0-i , but now everything was in good hands and swimming right along . [The king]4445-the king had reminded [me]0-i several times , of late , that the postponement [I]0-i had asked for , four years before , had about run out now . It was a hint that [I]0-i ought to be starting out to seek adventures and get up a reputation of a size to make [me]0-i worthy of the honor of breaking a lance with [Sir Sagramor]117-sir sagramor , who was still out grailing , but was being hunted for by various relief expeditions , and might be found any year , now . So [you]1237-you see [I]0-i was expecting this interruption ; it did not take [me]0-i by surprise . CHAPTER XI THE YANKEE IN SEARCH OF ADVENTURES There never was such [a country]1238-a country for [wandering liars]1239-wandering liars ; and [they]1239-wandering liars were of both sexes . Hardly a month went by without [one of [these tramps]1241-these tramps]1240-one of these tramps arriving ; and generally loaded with a tale about some princess or other wanting help to get [her]1242-her out of [some far - away castle]1243-some far - away castle where [she]1242-her was held in captivity by [a lawless scoundrel]1244-a lawless scoundrel , usually [a giant]1245-a giant . Now [you]1237-you would think that the first thing [the king]4445-the king would do after listening to such a novelette from [an entire stranger]1247-an entire stranger , would be to ask for credentials -- yes , and a pointer or two as to locality of [castle]1248-castle , best route to it , and so on . But [nobody]476-nobody ever thought of so simple and common - sense a thing at that . No , [everybody]600-everybody swallowed [these people]551-these people 's lies whole , and never asked a question of any sort or about anything . Well , one day when [I]0-i was not around , [one of [these people]551-these people]1252-one of these people came along -- it was a [she]1254-she one , this time -- and told a tale of the usual pattern . [[Her]1254-she mistress]1255-her mistress was [a captive in [a vast and gloomy castle]1257-a vast and gloomy castle , along with [forty - four other young and beautiful girls]1258-forty - four other young and beautiful girls , pretty much [all of [them]1258-forty - four other young and beautiful girls princesses]1259-all of them princesses]1256-a captive in a vast and gloomy castle , along with forty - four other young and beautiful girls , pretty much all of them princesses ; [they]1258-forty - four other young and beautiful girls had been languishing in that cruel captivity for twenty - six years ; [the masters of [the castle]721-the castle]1260-the masters of the castle were [three stupendous brothers , each with four arms and one eye]1262-three stupendous brothers , each with four arms and one eye -- the eye in the center of the forehead , and as big as a fruit . Sort of fruit not mentioned ; [their]1258-forty - four other young and beautiful girls usual slovenliness in statistics . Would [you]1263-you believe it ? [The king]4445-the king and [the whole Round Table]1265-the whole round table were in raptures over this preposterous opportunity for adventure . [Every knight of the Table]1266-every knight of the table jumped for the chance , and begged for it ; but to [their]1266-every knight of the table vexation and chagrin [the king]4445-the king conferred it upon [me]0-i , who had not asked for it at all . By an effort , [I]0-i contained [my]0-i joy when [Clarence]131-clarence brought [me]0-i the news . But [he]131-clarence -- [he]131-clarence could not contain [his]131-clarence . [His]131-clarence mouth gushed delight and gratitude in a steady discharge -- delight in [my]0-i good fortune , gratitude to [the king]4445-the king for this splendid mark of [his]131-clarence favor for [me]0-i . [He]131-clarence could keep neither [his]131-clarence legs nor [his]131-clarence body still , but pirouetted about [the place]448-the place in an airy ecstasy of happiness . On [my]0-i side , [I]0-i could have cursed the kindness that conferred upon [me]0-i this benefaction , but [I]0-i kept [my]0-i vexation under the surface for policy 's sake , and did what [I]0-i could to let on to be glad . Indeed , [I]0-i _ said _ [I]0-i was glad . And in a way it was true ; [I]0-i was as glad as [a person]966-a person is when [he]966-a person is scalped . Well , [one]434-one must make the best of things , and not waste time with useless fretting , but get down to business and see what can be done . In all lies there is wheat among the chaff ; [I]0-i must get at the wheat in this case : so [I]0-i sent for [the girl]1272-the girl and [she]1272-the girl came . [My]0-i expedition was all the talk that day and that night , and [the boys]1040-the boys were very good to [me]0-i , and made much of [me]0-i , and seemed to have forgotten [their]1040-the boys vexation and disappointment , and come to be as anxious for [me]0-i to hive [those ogres]1298-those ogres and set [those ripe old virgins]1299-those ripe old virgins loose as if it were [themselves]1040-the boys that had the contract . [I]0-i was to have an early breakfast , and start at dawn , for that was the usual way ; but [I]0-i had [the demon]1308-the demon 's own time with [my]0-i armor , and this delayed [me]0-i a little . It is troublesome to get into , and there is so much detail . First [you]1309-your wrap a layer or two of blanket around [your]1309-your body , for a sort of cushion and to keep off the cold iron ; then [you]1309-your put on [your]1309-your sleeves and shirt of chain mail -- these are made of small steel links woven together , and they form a fabric so flexible that if [you]1309-your toss [your]1309-your shirt onto the floor , it slumps into a pile like a peck of wet fish - net ; it is very heavy and is nearly the uncomfortablest material in [the world]374-the world for a night shirt , yet plenty used it for that -- [tax collectors]1311-tax collectors , and [reformers]1312-reformers , and [one - horse kings with a defective title]1313-one - horse kings with a defective title , and those sorts of [people]357-people ; then [you]1309-your put on [your]1309-your shoes -- flat - boats roofed over with interleaving bands of steel -- and screw [your]1309-your clumsy spurs into the heels . Next [you]1309-your buckle [your]1309-your greaves on [your]1309-your legs , and [your]1309-your cuisses on [your]1309-your thighs ; then come [your]1309-your backplate and [your]1309-your breastplate , and [you]1309-your begin to feel crowded ; then [you]1309-your hitch onto the breastplate the half - petticoat of broad overlapping bands of steel which hangs down in front but is scolloped out behind so [you]1309-your can sit down , and is n't any real improvement on an inverted coal scuttle , either for looks or for wear , or to wipe [your]1309-your hands on ; next [you]1309-your belt on [your]1309-your sword ; then [you]1309-your put [your]1309-your stove - pipe joints onto [your]1309-your arms , [your]1309-your iron gauntlets onto [your]1309-your hands , [your]1309-your iron rat - trap onto [your]1309-your head , with a rag of steel web hitched onto it to hang over the back of [your]1309-your neck -- and there [you]1309-your are , snug as a candle in a candle - mould . This is no time to dance . Well , [a man that is packed away like that]1315-a man that is packed away like that is a nut that is n't worth the cracking , there is so little of the meat , when [you]1309-your get down to it , by comparison with the shell . [The boys]1040-the boys helped [me]0-i , or [I]0-i never could have got in . Just as [we]1317-we finished , [Sir Bedivere]112-sir bedivere happened in , and [I]0-i saw that as like as not [I]0-i had n't chosen the most convenient outfit for a long trip . How stately [he]112-sir bedivere looked ; and tall and broad and grand . [He]112-sir bedivere had on [his]112-sir bedivere head a conical steel casque that only came down to [his]112-sir bedivere ears , and for visor had only a narrow steel bar that extended down to [his]112-sir bedivere upper lip and protected [his]112-sir bedivere nose ; and all the rest of [him]112-sir bedivere , from neck to heel , was flexible chain mail , trousers and all . But pretty much all of [him]112-sir bedivere was hidden under [his]112-sir bedivere outside garment , which of course was of chain mail , as [I]0-i said , and hung straight from [his]112-sir bedivere shoulders to [his]112-sir bedivere ankles ; and from [his]112-sir bedivere middle to the bottom , both before and behind , was divided , so that [he]112-sir bedivere could ride and let the skirts hang down on each side . [He]112-sir bedivere was going grailing , and it was just the outfit for it , too . [I]0-i would have given a good deal for that ulster , but it was too late now to be fooling around . The sun was just up , [the king]4445-the king and [the court]550-the court were all on hand to see [me]0-i off and wish [me]0-i luck ; so it would n't be etiquette for [me]0-i to tarry . [You]1320-you do n't get on [your]1320-you horse [yourself]1320-you ; no , if [you]1320-you tried it [you]1320-you would get disappointed . [They]1321-they carry [you]1320-you out , just as [they]1321-they carry [a sun - struck man]1322-a sun - struck man to [the drug store]1323-the drug store , and put [you]1320-you on , and help get [you]1320-you to rights , and fix [your]1320-you feet in the stirrups ; and all the while [you]1320-you do feel so strange and stuffy and like [somebody else]915-somebody else -- like [somebody that has been married on a sudden , or struck by lightning , or something like that , and has n't quite fetched around yet , and is sort of numb]1325-somebody that has been married on a sudden , or struck by lightning , or something like that , and has n't quite fetched around yet , and is sort of numb , and ca n't just get [his]915-somebody else bearings . Then [they]1321-they stood up the mast [they]1321-they called a spear , in its socket by [my]0-i left foot , and [I]0-i gripped it with [my]0-i hand ; lastly [they]1321-they hung [my]0-i shield around [my]0-i neck , and [I]0-i was all complete and ready to up anchor and get to [sea]1326-sea . [Everybody]600-everybody was as good to [me]0-i as [they]600-everybody could be , and [a maid of honor]1328-a maid of honor gave [me]0-i the stirrup - cup [her]1328-a maid of honor own self . [They]1338-boys say “ Go up , baldhead ”[1338-boys] to [the prophet]1340-the prophet going [his]1340-the prophet unoffending way in the gray of antiquity ; [they]1338-boys sass [me]0-i in the holy gloom of [the Middle Ages]1341-the middle ages ; and [I]0-i had seen [them]1338-boys act the same way in [[Buchanan]198-buchanan 's administration]1342-buchanan 's administration ; [I]0-i remember , because [I]0-i was there and helped . [The prophet]1340-the prophet had [his]1340-the prophet bears and settled with [[his]1340-the prophet boys]1344-his boys ; and [I]0-i wanted to get down and settle with [mine]0-i , but it would n't answer , because [I]0-i could n't have got up again . [I]0-i hate [a country without a derrick]1345-a country without a derrick . CHAPTER XII SLOW TORTURE Straight off , [we]1346-we were in [the country]420-the country . It was most lovely and pleasant in those sylvan solitudes in the early cool morning in the first freshness of autumn . From [hilltops]1348-hilltops [we]1346-we saw [fair green valleys lying spread out below , with streams winding through [them]1349-fair green valleys lying spread out below , with streams winding through them]1349-fair green valleys lying spread out below , with streams winding through them , and island groves of trees here and there , and huge lonely oaks scattered about and casting black blots of shade ; and beyond [the valleys]1350-the valleys [we]1346-we saw [the ranges of hills]1351-the ranges of hills , blue with haze , stretching away in billowy perspective to the horizon , with at wide intervals a dim fleck of white or gray on a wave - summit , which [we]1346-we knew was [a castle]4622-a castle . [We]1346-we crossed [broad natural lawns]1353-broad natural lawns sparkling with dew , and [we]1346-we moved like spirits , the cushioned turf giving out no sound of footfall ; [we]1346-we dreamed along through glades in a mist of green light that got its tint from the sun - drenched roof of leaves overhead , and by [our]1346-we feet the clearest and coldest of runlets went frisking and gossiping over its reefs and making a sort of whispering music , comfortable to hear ; and at times [we]1346-we left [the world]374-the world behind and entered into the solemn great deeps and rich gloom of [the forest]1355-the forest , where furtive wild things whisked and scurried by and were gone before [you]1356-you could even get [your]1356-you eye on [the place where the noise was]1357-the place where the noise was ; and where only the earliest birds were turning out and getting to business with a song here and a quarrel yonder and a mysterious far - off hammering and drumming for worms on a tree trunk away somewhere in [the impenetrable remotenesses of [the woods]4638-the woods]1358-the impenetrable remotenesses of the woods . And by and by out [we]1346-we would swing again into the glare . About the third or fourth or fifth time that [we]1346-we swung out into the glare -- it was along there somewhere , a couple of hours or so after sun - up -- it was n't as pleasant as it had been . It was beginning to get hot . This was quite noticeable . [We]1346-we had a very long pull , after that , without any shade . Now it is curious how progressively little frets grow and multiply after they once get a start . Things which [I]0-i did n't mind at all , at first , [I]0-i began to mind now -- and more and more , too , all the time . The first ten or fifteen times [I]0-i wanted [my]0-i handkerchief [I]0-i did n't seem to care ; [I]0-i got along , and said never mind , it is n't any matter , and dropped it out of [my]0-i mind . But now it was different ; [I]0-i wanted it all the time ; it was nag , nag , nag , right along , and no rest ; [I]0-i could n't get it out of [my]0-i mind ; and so at last [I]0-i lost [my]0-i temper and said hang [a man that would make a suit of armor without any pockets in it]1360-a man that would make a suit of armor without any pockets in it . [You]1356-you see [I]0-i had [my]0-i handkerchief in [my]0-i helmet ; and some other things ; but it was that kind of a helmet that [you]1356-you ca n't take off by [yourself]1356-you . That had n't occurred to [me]0-i when [I]0-i put it there ; and in fact [I]0-i did n't know it . [I]0-i supposed it would be particularly convenient there . And so now , the thought of its being there , so handy and close by , and yet not get - at - able , made it all the worse and the harder to bear . Yes , the thing that [you]1356-you ca n't get is the thing that [you]1356-you want , mainly ; [every one]1361-every one has noticed that . Well , it took [my]0-i mind off from everything else ; took it clear off , and centered it in [my]0-i helmet ; and mile after mile , there it stayed , imagining the handkerchief , picturing the handkerchief ; and it was bitter and aggravating to have the salt sweat keep trickling down into [my]0-i eyes , and [I]0-i could n't get at it . It seems like a little thing , on paper , but it was not a little thing at all ; it was the most real kind of misery . [I]0-i would not say it if it was not so . [I]0-i made up [my]0-i mind that [I]0-i would carry along a reticule next time , let it look how it might , and [people]357-people say what [they]357-people would . Of course [these iron dudes of the Round Table]1363-these iron dudes of the round table would think it was scandalous , and maybe raise Sheol about it , but as for [me]0-i , give [me]0-i comfort first , and style afterwards . So [we]1364-we jogged along , and now and then [we]1364-we struck a stretch of dust , and it would tumble up in clouds and get into [my]0-i nose and make [me]0-i sneeze and cry ; and of course [I]0-i said things [I]0-i ought n't to have said , [I]0-i do n't deny that . [I]0-i am not better than [others]1365-others . [We]1364-we could n't seem to meet [anybody]553-anybody in [this lonesome Britain]1367-this lonesome britain , not even [an ogre]1368-an ogre ; and , in the mood [I]0-i was in then , it was well for [the ogre]1369-the ogre ; that is , [an ogre with a handkerchief]1370-an ogre with a handkerchief . [Most knights]1371-most knights would have thought of nothing but getting [his]1371-most knights armor ; but so [I]0-i got [his]1371-most knights bandanna , [he]1371-most knights could keep [his]1371-most knights hardware , for all of [me]0-i . Meantime , it was getting hotter and hotter in there . [You]1372-you see , the sun was beating down and warming up the iron more and more all the time . Well , when [you]1372-you are hot , that way , every little thing irritates [you]1372-you . When [I]0-i trotted , [I]0-i rattled like a crate of dishes , and that annoyed [me]0-i ; and moreover [I]0-i could n't seem to stand that shield slatting and banging , now about [my]0-i breast , now around [my]0-i back ; and if [I]0-i dropped into a walk [my]0-i joints creaked and screeched in that wearisome way that a wheelbarrow does , and as [we]1373-we did n't create any breeze at that gait , [I]0-i was like to get fried in that stove ; and besides , the quieter [you]1372-you went the heavier the iron settled down on [you]1372-you and the more and more tons [you]1372-you seemed to weigh every minute . And [you]1372-you had to be always changing hands , and passing [your]1372-you spear over to the other foot , it got so irksome for one hand to hold it long at a time . Well , [you]1372-you know , when [you]1372-you perspire that way , in [rivers]1374-rivers , there comes a time when [you]1372-you -- when [you]1372-you -- well , when [you]1372-you itch . [You]1372-you are inside , [your]1372-you hands are outside ; so there [you]1372-you are ; nothing but iron between . It is not a light thing , let it sound as it may . First it is one place ; then another ; then some more ; and it goes on spreading and spreading , and at last [the territory]1375-the territory is all occupied , and [nobody]476-nobody can imagine what [you]1372-you feel like , nor how unpleasant it is . And when it had got to the worst , and it seemed to [me]0-i that [I]0-i could not stand anything more , a fly got in through the bars and settled on [my]0-i nose , and the bars were stuck and would n't work , and [I]0-i could n't get the visor up ; and [I]0-i could only shake [my]0-i head , which was baking hot by this time , and the fly -- well , [you]1372-you know how [a fly]1377-a fly acts when [he]1377-a fly has got a certainty -- [he]1377-a fly only minded the shaking enough to change from nose to lip , and lip to ear , and buzz and buzz all around in there , and keep on lighting and biting , in a way that [a person]966-a person , already so distressed as [I]0-i was , simply could not stand . So [I]0-i gave in , and got [Alisande]195-alisande to unship the helmet and relieve [me]0-i of it . Then [she]195-alisande emptied the conveniences out of it and fetched it full of water , and [I]0-i drank and then stood up , and [she]195-alisande poured the rest down inside the armor . [One]434-one can not think how refreshing it was . [She]195-alisande continued to fetch and pour until [I]0-i was well soaked and thoroughly comfortable . It was good to have a rest -- and peace . But nothing is quite perfect in this life , at any time . [I]0-i had made a pipe a while back , and also some pretty fair tobacco ; not the real thing , but what [some of the Indians]1380-some of the indians use : the inside bark of the willow , dried . These comforts had been in the helmet , and now [I]0-i had them again , but no matches . Gradually , as the time wore along , one annoying fact was borne in upon [my]0-i understanding -- that [we]1381-we were weather - bound . [An armed novice]1382-an armed novice can not mount [his]1382-an armed novice horse without help and plenty of it . [Sandy]199-sandy was not enough ; not enough for [me]0-i , anyway . [We]1381-we had to wait until [somebody]1383-somebody should come along . Waiting , in silence , would have been agreeable enough , for [I]0-i was full of matter for reflection , and wanted to give it a chance to work . [I]0-i wanted to try and think out how it was that [rational or even half - rational men]1384-rational or even half - rational men could ever have learned to wear armor , considering its inconveniences ; and how [they]1384-rational or even half - rational men had managed to keep up such a fashion for generations when it was plain that what [I]0-i had suffered to - day [they]1384-rational or even half - rational men had had to suffer all the days of [their]1384-rational or even half - rational men lives . [I]0-i wanted to think that out ; and moreover [I]0-i wanted to think out some way to reform this evil and persuade [the people]753-the people to let the foolish fashion die out ; but thinking was out of the question in the circumstances . [You]1386-you could n't think , where [Sandy]199-sandy was . [She]199-sandy was [a quite biddable creature and good - hearted]1387-a quite biddable creature and good - hearted , but [she]199-sandy had a flow of talk that was as steady as [a mill]1388-a mill , and made [your]1386-you head sore like the drays and wagons in [a city]1389-a city . If [she]199-sandy had had a cork [she]199-sandy would have been a comfort . But [you]1386-you ca n't cork that kind ; [they]1390-they would die . [Her]199-sandy clack was going all day , and [you]1386-you would think something would surely happen to [her]199-sandy works , by and by ; but no , they never got out of order ; and [she]199-sandy never had to slack up for words . [She]199-sandy could grind , and pump , and churn , and buzz by the week , and never stop to oil up or blow out . And yet the result was just nothing but wind . [She]199-sandy never had any ideas , any more than a fog has . [She]199-sandy was [a perfect blatherskite]1391-a perfect blatherskite ; [I]0-i mean for jaw , jaw , jaw , talk , talk , talk , jabber , jabber , jabber ; but just as good as [she]199-sandy could be . [I]0-i had n't minded [[her]199-sandy mill]1392-her mill that morning , on account of having that hornets ' nest of other troubles ; but more than once in the afternoon [I]0-i had to say : “ Take a rest , [child]4640-child ; the way [you]4640-child are using up all the domestic air , [the kingdom]517-the kingdom will have to go to importing it by to - morrow , and it 's a low enough treasury without that . ”[0-i] CHAPTER XIII FREEMEN Yes , it is strange how little a while at a time [a person]966-a person can be contented . Only a little while back , when [I]0-i was riding and suffering , what a heaven this peace , this rest , this sweet serenity in [this secluded shady nook]1394-this secluded shady nook by [this purling stream]1395-this purling stream would have seemed , where [I]0-i could keep perfectly comfortable all the time by pouring a dipper of water into [my]0-i armor now and then ; yet already [I]0-i was getting dissatisfied ; partly because [I]0-i could not light [my]0-i pipe -- for , although [I]0-i had long ago started a match factory , [I]0-i had forgotten to bring matches with [me]0-i -- and partly because [we]1396-we had nothing to eat . Here was another illustration of the childlike improvidence of this age and [people]357-people . [A man in armor]1398-a man in armor always trusted to chance for [his]1398-a man in armor food on a journey , and would have been scandalized at the idea of hanging a basket of sandwiches on [his]1398-a man in armor spear . There was probably not [a knight of all the Round Table combination who would not rather have died than been caught carrying such a thing as that on [his]1398-a man in armor flagstaff]1399-a knight of all the round table combination who would not rather have died than been caught carrying such a thing as that on his flagstaff . And yet there could not be anything more sensible . It had been [my]0-i intention to smuggle a couple of sandwiches into [my]0-i helmet , but [I]0-i was interrupted in the act , and had to make an excuse and lay them aside , and a dog got them . Night approached , and with it a storm . The darkness came on fast . [We]1396-we must camp , of course . [I]0-i found a good shelter for [the demoiselle]1400-the demoiselle under a rock , and went off and found another for [myself]0-i . But [I]0-i was obliged to remain in [my]0-i armor , because [I]0-i could not get it off by [myself]0-i and yet could not allow [Alisande]195-alisande to help , because it would have seemed so like undressing before [folk]1401-folk . It would not have amounted to that in reality , because [I]0-i had clothes on underneath ; but the prejudices of one 's breeding are not gotten rid of just at a jump , and [I]0-i knew that when it came to stripping off that bob - tailed iron petticoat [I]0-i should be embarrassed . With the storm came a change of weather ; and the stronger the wind blew , and the wilder the rain lashed around , the colder and colder it got . Pretty soon , various kinds of bugs and ants and worms and things began to flock in out of the wet and crawl down inside [my]0-i armor to get warm ; and while some of [them]1402-them behaved well enough , and snuggled up amongst [my]0-i clothes and got quiet , [the majority were of a restless , uncomfortable sort]1403-the majority were of a restless , uncomfortable sort , and never stayed still , but went on prowling and hunting for [they]1403-the majority were of a restless , uncomfortable sort did not know what ; especially the ants , which went tickling along in wearisome procession from one end of [me]0-i to the other by the hour , and are a kind of creatures which [I]0-i never wish to sleep with again . It would be [my]0-i advice to [persons situated in this way , to not roll or thrash around]1404-persons situated in this way , to not roll or thrash around , because this excites the interest of all the different sorts of animals and makes every last one of [them]1402-them want to turn out and see what is going on , and this makes things worse than they were before , and of course makes [you]1405-you objurgate harder , too , if [you]1405-you can . Still , if [one]434-one did not roll and thrash around [he]434-one would die ; so perhaps it is as well to do one way as the other ; there is no real choice . Even after [I]0-i was frozen solid [I]0-i could still distinguish that tickling , just as a corpse does when [he]434-one is taking electric treatment . [I]0-i said [I]0-i would never wear armor after this trip . All those trying hours whilst [I]0-i was frozen and yet was in a living fire , as [you]1405-you may say , on account of that swarm of crawlers , that same unanswerable question kept circling and circling through [my]0-i tired head : How do [people]357-people stand this miserable armor ? How have [they]357-people managed to stand it all these generations ? How can [they]357-people sleep at night for dreading the tortures of next day ? When the morning came at last , [I]0-i was in a bad enough plight : seedy , drowsy , fagged , from want of sleep ; weary from thrashing around , famished from long fasting ; pining for a bath , and to get rid of the animals ; and crippled with rheumatism . And how had it fared with [the nobly born]1408-the nobly born , [the titled aristocrat]1409-the titled aristocrat , [the Demoiselle Alisande la Carteloise]195-alisande ? Why , [she]195-alisande was as fresh as a squirrel ; [she]195-alisande had slept like the dead ; and as for a bath , probably neither [she]195-alisande nor [any other noble in [the land]4486-the land]1410-any other noble in the land had ever had one , and so [she]195-alisande was not missing it . Measured by modern standards , [they]1412-they were merely [modified savages]1413-modified savages , [those people]823-those people . [This noble lady]1415-this noble lady showed no impatience to get to breakfast -- and that smacks of [the savage]1416-the savage , too . On [their]1412-they journeys [those Britons]1417-those britons were used to long fasts , and knew how to bear [them]1412-they ; and also how to freight up against probable fasts before starting , after the style of [the Indian]200-the indian and [the anaconda]1418-the anaconda . As like as not , [Sandy]199-sandy was loaded for a three - day stretch . [We]1419-we were off before sunrise , [Sandy]199-sandy riding and [I]0-i limping along behind . In half an hour [we]1419-we came upon a group of [ragged poor creatures who had assembled to mend the thing]1420-ragged poor creatures who had assembled to mend the thing which was regarded as [a road]1421-a road . [They]1412-they were as humble as animals to [me]0-i ; and when [I]0-i proposed to breakfast with [them]1412-they , [they]1412-they were so flattered , so overwhelmed by this extraordinary condescension of [mine]0-i that at first [they]1412-they were not able to believe that [I]0-i was in earnest . [[My]0-i lady]1422-my lady put up [her]1422-my lady scornful lip and withdrew to one side ; [she]1422-my lady said in [their]1412-they hearing that [she]1422-my lady would as soon think of eating with the other cattle -- a remark which embarrassed [these poor devils]1423-these poor devils merely because it referred to [them]1423-these poor devils , and not because it insulted or offended [them]1423-these poor devils , for it did n't . And yet [they]1412-they were not [slaves]924-slaves , not chattels . By a sarcasm of law and phrase [they]1412-they were [freemen]928-freemen . [Seven - tenths of [the free population of [the country]420-the country]1427-the free population of the country]1426-seven - tenths of the free population of the country were of just [their]1426-seven - tenths of the free population of the country class and degree : [small “ independent ”[1429-small “ independent ” farmers] farmers]1429-small “ independent ” farmers , [artisans]1430-artisans , etc . ; which is to say , [they]1412-they were [the nation]709-the nation , [the actual Nation]1432-the actual nation ; [they]1412-they were about all of it that was useful , or worth saving , or really respect - worthy , and to subtract [them]1412-they would have been to subtract [the Nation]709-the nation and leave behind [some dregs]1434-some dregs , some refuse , in the shape of [a king]891-a king , [nobility]908-nobility and [gentry]1437-gentry , idle , unproductive , acquainted mainly with the arts of wasting and destroying , and of no sort of use or value in [any rationally constructed world]1438-any rationally constructed world . And yet , by ingenious contrivance , this gilded minority , instead of being in the tail of [the procession where it belonged]1439-the procession where it belonged , was marching head up and banners flying , at the other end of it ; had elected [itself]1440-itself to be the Nation , and these innumerable clams had permitted it so long that [they]1412-they had come at last to accept it as a truth ; and not only that , but to believe it right and as it should be . [The priests]1232-the priests had told [[their]1232-the priests fathers]1442-their fathers and [themselves]1232-the priests that this ironical state of things was ordained of [God]121-god ; and so , not reflecting upon how unlike [God]121-god it would be to amuse [himself]121-god with sarcasms , and especially [such poor transparent ones]1443-such poor transparent ones as this , [they]1232-the priests had dropped the matter there and become respectfully quiet . The talk of [these meek people]1444-these meek people had a strange enough sound in a formerly American ear . [They]1444-these meek people were [freemen]928-freemen , but [they]1444-these meek people could not leave [the estates of [[their]1444-these meek people lord]1447-their lord or [[their]1444-these meek people bishop]1448-their bishop]1446-the estates of their lord or their bishop without [his]121-god permission ; [they]1444-these meek people could not prepare [their]1444-these meek people own bread , but must have [their]1444-these meek people corn ground and [their]1444-these meek people bread baked at [[his]121-god mill]1449-his mill and [[his]121-god bakery]1450-his bakery , and pay roundly for the same ; [they]1444-these meek people could not sell a piece of [[their]1444-these meek people own property]1451-their own property without paying [him]121-god a handsome percentage of the proceeds , nor buy a piece of [somebody else]915-somebody else 's without remembering [him]121-god in cash for the privilege ; [they]1444-these meek people had to harvest [his]121-god grain for [him]121-god gratis , and be ready to come at a moment 's notice , leaving [their]1444-these meek people own crop to destruction by the threatened storm ; [they]1444-these meek people had to let [him]121-god plant fruit trees in [[their]1444-these meek people fields]1453-their fields , and then keep [their]1444-these meek people indignation to [themselves]1444-these meek people when [[his]121-god heedless fruit - gatherers]1454-his heedless fruit - gatherers trampled the grain around the trees ; [they]1444-these meek people had to smother [their]1444-these meek people anger when [his]121-god hunting parties galloped through [[their]1444-these meek people fields]1453-their fields laying waste the result of [their]1444-these meek people patient toil ; [they]1444-these meek people were not allowed to keep doves [themselves]1444-these meek people , and when the swarms from [[my]0-i lord]1456-my lord 's dovecote settled on [their]1444-these meek people crops [they]1444-these meek people must not lose [their]1444-these meek people temper and kill a bird , for awful would the penalty be ; when the harvest was at last gathered , then came the procession of [robbers]1457-robbers to levy [their]1457-robbers blackmail upon it : first [the Church]900-the church carted off [its]900-the church fat tenth , then [[the king]4445-the king 's commissioner]1460-the king 's commissioner took [his]1460-the king 's commissioner twentieth , then [[my]0-i lord 's people]1461-my lord 's people made a mighty inroad upon the remainder ; after which , [the skinned freeman]1462-the skinned freeman had liberty to bestow the remnant in [[his]1462-the skinned freeman barn]1463-his barn , in case it was worth the trouble ; there were taxes , and taxes , and taxes , and more taxes , and taxes again , and yet other taxes -- upon [this free and independent pauper]1464-this free and independent pauper , but none upon [[his]1462-the skinned freeman lord]1465-his lord [the baron]1466-the baron or [the bishop]1020-the bishop , none upon [the wasteful nobility]1468-the wasteful nobility or [the all - devouring Church]1469-the all - devouring church ; if [the baron]1466-the baron would sleep unvexed , [the freeman]1471-the freeman must sit up all night after [his]1471-the freeman day 's work and whip the ponds to keep the frogs quiet ; if [[the freeman]1471-the freeman 's daughter]1473-the freeman 's daughter -- but no , that last infamy of monarchical government is unprintable ; and finally , if [the freeman]1471-the freeman , grown desperate with [his]1471-the freeman tortures , found [his]1471-the freeman life unendurable under such conditions , and sacrificed it and fled to death for mercy and refuge , [the gentle Church]1475-the gentle church condemned [him]1471-the freeman to eternal fire , [the gentle law]1476-the gentle law buried [him]1471-the freeman at midnight at [the cross - roads]1477-the cross - roads with a stake through [his]1471-the freeman back , and [[his]1462-the skinned freeman master]1478-his master [the baron]1466-the baron or [the bishop]1020-the bishop confiscated all [his]1462-the skinned freeman property and turned [[his]1462-the skinned freeman widow]1481-his widow and [[his]1462-the skinned freeman orphans]1482-his orphans out of doors . And here were [these freemen]1483-these freemen assembled in the early morning to work on [[their]1483-these freemen lord]1447-their lord [[the bishop]1020-the bishop 's road]1486-the bishop 's road three days each -- gratis ; [every head of [a family]1488-a family]1487-every head of a family , and [every son of a family]1489-every son of a family , three days each , gratis , and a day or so added for [[their]1483-these freemen servants]1490-their servants . Why , it was like reading about [France]17-france and [the French]30-the french , before the ever memorable and blessed Revolution , which swept a thousand years of such villany away in one swift tidal - wave of blood -- one : a settlement of that hoary debt in the proportion of half a drop of blood for each hogshead of it that had been pressed by slow tortures out of [that people]1491-that people in the weary stretch of ten centuries of wrong and shame and misery the like of which was not to be mated but in hell . There were two “ Reigns of Terror , ”[742-the one] if [we]1492-we would but remember it and consider it ; the one wrought murder in hot passion , the other in heartless cold blood ; the one lasted mere months , the other had lasted a thousand years ; [the one]742-the one inflicted death upon [ten thousand persons]1494-ten thousand persons , the other upon a hundred millions ; but [our]1492-we shudders are all for the “ horrors ”[742-the one] of the minor Terror , the momentary Terror , so to speak ; whereas , what is the horror of swift death by the axe , compared with lifelong death from hunger , cold , insult , cruelty , and heart - break ? What is swift death by lightning compared with death by slow fire at the stake ? [A city cemetery]1495-a city cemetery could contain the coffins filled by that brief Terror which [we]1492-we have all been so diligently taught to shiver at and mourn over ; but all [France]17-france could hardly contain the coffins filled by that older and real Terror --that unspeakably bitter and awful Terror which none of [us]1492-we has been taught to see in its vastness or pity as it deserves . [These poor ostensible freemen who were sharing [their]1496-these poor ostensible freemen who were sharing their breakfast and their talk with me breakfast and [their]1496-these poor ostensible freemen who were sharing their breakfast and their talk with me talk with [me]0-i]1496-these poor ostensible freemen who were sharing their breakfast and their talk with me , were as full of humble reverence for [[their]1496-these poor ostensible freemen who were sharing their breakfast and their talk with me king]907-their king and Church and [nobility]908-nobility as [[their]1496-these poor ostensible freemen who were sharing their breakfast and their talk with me worst enemy]1499-their worst enemy could desire . There was something pitifully ludicrous about it . [I]0-i asked [them]1496-these poor ostensible freemen who were sharing their breakfast and their talk with me if [they]1496-these poor ostensible freemen who were sharing their breakfast and their talk with me supposed a nation of [people]357-people ever existed , who , with a free vote in [every man]1501-every man 's hand , would elect that [a single family]1502-a single family and [its descendants]1503-its descendants should reign over it forever , whether gifted or boobies , to the exclusion of [all other families]1504-all other families -- including [the voter]1505-the voter 's ; and would also elect that [a certain hundred families]1506-a certain hundred families should be raised to dizzy summits of rank , and clothed on with offensive transmissible glories and privileges to the exclusion of the rest of [the nation]709-the nation 's families--_including [his]1501-every man own _ . [They]1496-these poor ostensible freemen who were sharing their breakfast and their talk with me all looked unhit , and said [they]1496-these poor ostensible freemen who were sharing their breakfast and their talk with me did n't know ; that [they]1496-these poor ostensible freemen who were sharing their breakfast and their talk with me had never thought about it before , and it had n't ever occurred to [them]1496-these poor ostensible freemen who were sharing their breakfast and their talk with me that [a nation]341-a nation could be so situated that [every man]1501-every man _ could _ have a say in the government . [I]0-i said [I]0-i had seen one -- and that it would last until it had [an Established Church]1510-an established church . Again [they]1496-these poor ostensible freemen who were sharing their breakfast and their talk with me were all unhit -- at first . But presently [one man]543-one man looked up and asked [me]0-i to state that proposition again ; and state it slowly , so it could soak into [his]543-one man understanding . [I]0-i did it ; and after a little [he]543-one man had the idea , and [he]543-one man brought [his]543-one man fist down and said _ [he]543-one man _ did n't believe [a nation where [every man]1501-every man had a vote]1512-a nation where every man had a vote would voluntarily get down in the mud and dirt in any such way ; and that to steal from [a nation]341-a nation [its]341-a nation will and preference must be a crime and the first of all crimes . [I]0-i said to [myself]0-i : “ [This one]4642-this one 's [a man]518-a man . If [I]0-i were backed by enough of [his]4642-this one sort , [I]0-i would make a strike for the welfare of [this country]4644-this country , and try to prove [myself]0-i [[its]4644-this country loyalest citizen]4645-its loyalest citizen by making a wholesome change in [its]4644-this country system of government . ”[0-i] [You]1515-you see [my]0-i kind of loyalty was loyalty to [one 's country]1516-one 's country , not to [its]1516-one 's country institutions or [[its]1516-one 's country office - holders]1517-its office - holders . [The country]420-the country is the real thing , the substantial thing , the eternal thing ; it is the thing to watch over , and care for , and be loyal to ; institutions are extraneous , they are its mere clothing , and clothing can wear out , become ragged , cease to be comfortable , cease to protect the body from winter , disease , and death . To be loyal to rags , to shout for rags , to worship rags , to die for rags -- that is a loyalty of unreason , it is pure animal ; it belongs to [monarchy]1519-monarchy , was invented by monarchy ; let monarchy keep it . [I]0-i was from [Connecticut]31-connecticut , whose Constitution declares “ that all political power is inherent in [the people]753-the people , and [all free governments]4647-all free governments are founded on [their]753-the people authority and instituted for [their]753-the people benefit ; and that [they]753-the people have _ at all times _ an undeniable and indefeasible right to _ alter [their]753-the people form of government _ in such a manner as [they]753-the people may think expedient . ”[1520-the citizen who thinks he sees that the commonwealth 's political clothes] Under that gospel , [the citizen who thinks [he]1520-the citizen who thinks he sees that the commonwealth 's political clothes sees that [the commonwealth]640-the commonwealth 's political clothes]1520-the citizen who thinks he sees that the commonwealth 's political clothes are worn out , and yet holds [his]1520-the citizen who thinks he sees that the commonwealth 's political clothes peace and does not agitate for a new suit , is disloyal ; [he]1520-the citizen who thinks he sees that the commonwealth 's political clothes is [a traitor]1522-a traitor . That [he]1520-the citizen who thinks he sees that the commonwealth 's political clothes may be [the only one who thinks [he]1520-the citizen who thinks he sees that the commonwealth 's political clothes sees this decay]1523-the only one who thinks he sees this decay , does not excuse [him]1520-the citizen who thinks he sees that the commonwealth 's political clothes ; it is [his]1520-the citizen who thinks he sees that the commonwealth 's political clothes duty to agitate anyway , and it is the duty of [the others]1524-the others to vote [him]1520-the citizen who thinks he sees that the commonwealth 's political clothes down if [they]1524-the others do not see the matter as [he]1520-the citizen who thinks he sees that the commonwealth 's political clothes does . And now here [I]0-i was , in [a country where a right to say how [the country]420-the country should be governed]1525-a country where a right to say how the country should be governed was restricted to [six persons in each thousand of [its]420-the country population]1527-six persons in each thousand of its population . For [the nine hundred and ninety - four]1528-the nine hundred and ninety - four to express dissatisfaction with the regnant system and propose to change it , would have made the whole six shudder as [one man]543-one man , it would have been so disloyal , so dishonorable , such putrid black treason . So to speak , [I]0-i was become [a stockholder in a corporation where [nine hundred and ninety - four of [the members]1532-the members]1531-nine hundred and ninety - four of the members furnished all the money and did all the work , and the other six elected [themselves]1533-themselves a permanent board of direction and took all the dividends]1530-a stockholder in a corporation where nine hundred and ninety - four of the members furnished all the money and did all the work , and the other six elected themselves a permanent board of direction and took all the dividends . It seemed to [me]0-i that what [the nine hundred and ninety - four dupes]1534-the nine hundred and ninety - four dupes needed was a new deal . [Clarence]131-clarence will fix [you]536-the man all right . ”[536-the man] CHAPTER XIV “ DEFEND [THEE]4668-your lord , [LORD]4670-lord ”[0-i] [I]0-i paid three pennies for [my]0-i breakfast , and a most extravagant price it was , too , seeing that [one]434-one could have breakfasted [a dozen persons]1544-a dozen persons for that money ; but [I]0-i was feeling good by this time , and [I]0-i had always been a kind of spendthrift anyway ; and then [these people]551-these people had wanted to give [me]0-i the food for nothing , scant as [their]551-these people provision was , and so it was a grateful pleasure to emphasize [my]0-i appreciation and sincere thankfulness with a good big financial lift where the money would do so much more good than it would in [my]0-i helmet , where , these pennies being made of iron and not stinted in weight , [my]0-i half - dollar 's worth was a good deal of a burden to [me]0-i . [I]0-i spent money rather too freely in those days , it is true ; but one reason for it was that [I]0-i had n't got the proportions of things entirely adjusted , even yet , after so long a sojourn in [Britain]32-britain -- hadn't got along to where [I]0-i was able to absolutely realize that a penny in [[Arthur]116-arthur 's land]1546-arthur 's land and a couple of dollars in [Connecticut]31-connecticut were about one and the same thing : just twins , as [you]1547-you may say , in purchasing power . If [my]0-i start from [Camelot]7-camelot could have been delayed a very few days [I]0-i could have paid [these people]551-these people in beautiful new coins from [[our]1549-our own mint]1550-our own mint , and that would have pleased [me]0-i ; and [them]551-these people , too , not less . [I]0-i had adopted the American values exclusively . In a week or two now , cents , nickels , dimes , quarters , and half - dollars , and also a trifle of gold , would be trickling in thin but steady streams all through the commercial veins of [the kingdom]517-the kingdom , and [I]0-i looked to see this new blood freshen up its life . [The farmers]1552-the farmers were bound to throw in something , to sort of offset [my]0-i liberality , whether [I]0-i would or no ; so [I]0-i let [them]1552-the farmers give [me]0-i a flint and steel ; and as soon as [they]1552-the farmers had comfortably bestowed [Sandy]199-sandy and [me]0-i on [our]1549-our horse , [I]0-i lit [my]0-i pipe . When the first blast of smoke shot out through the bars of [my]0-i helmet , [all those people]1553-all those people broke for [the woods]4638-the woods , and [Sandy]199-sandy went over backwards and struck the ground with a dull thud . [They]1553-all those people thought [I]0-i was [one of [those fire - belching dragons [they]1553-all those people had heard so much about from [knights]412-knights and [other professional liars]1558-other professional liars]1556-those fire - belching dragons they had heard so much about from knights and other professional liars]1555-one of those fire - belching dragons they had heard so much about from knights and other professional liars . [I]0-i had infinite trouble to persuade [those people]823-those people to venture back within explaining distance . Then [I]0-i told [them]823-those people that this was only a bit of enchantment which would work harm to none but [[my]0-i enemies]1560-my enemies . And [I]0-i promised , with [my]0-i hand on [my]0-i heart , that if [all who felt no enmity toward [me]0-i]1561-all who felt no enmity toward me would come forward and pass before [me]0-i [they]823-those people should see that [only those who remained behind]1562-only those who remained behind would be struck dead . [The procession]1563-the procession moved with a good deal of promptness . There were no casualties to report , for [nobody]476-nobody had curiosity enough to remain behind to see what would happen . [I]0-i lost some time , now , for [these big children]1565-these big children , [their]1565-these big children fears gone , became so ravished with wonder over [my]0-i awe - compelling fireworks that [I]0-i had to stay there and smoke a couple of pipes out before [they]1565-these big children would let [me]0-i go . Still the delay was not wholly unproductive , for it took all that time to get [Sandy]199-sandy thoroughly wonted to the new thing , [she]199-sandy being so close to it , [you]1566-you know . It plugged up [her]199-sandy conversation mill , too , for a considerable while , and that was a gain . But above all other benefits accruing , [I]0-i had learned something . [I]0-i was ready for any giant or any ogre that might come along , now . [We]1567-we tarried with [a holy hermit]1568-a holy hermit , that night , and [my]0-i opportunity came about the middle of the next afternoon . [We]1567-we were crossing [a vast meadow]1569-a vast meadow by way of [short - cut]1570-short - cut , and [I]0-i was musing absently , hearing nothing , seeing nothing , when [Sandy]199-sandy suddenly interrupted a remark which [she]199-sandy had begun that morning , with the cry : “ Defend [thee]0-i , [lord!--peril of life]4671-lord!--peril of life is toward ! ”[199-sandy] And [she]199-sandy slipped down from the horse and ran a little way and stood . [I]0-i looked up and saw , far off in the shade of a tree , half [a dozen armed knights]1571-a dozen armed knights and [[their]1571-a dozen armed knights squires]1572-their squires ; and straightway there was bustle among [them]1571-a dozen armed knights and tightening of saddle - girths for the mount . [My]0-i pipe was ready and would have been lit , if [I]0-i had not been lost in thinking about how to banish oppression from [this land]1573-this land and restore to [all [its]1573-this land people]1574-all its people [their]1574-all its people stolen rights and manhood without disobliging [anybody]553-anybody . [I]0-i lit up at once , and by the time [I]0-i had got a good head of reserved steam on , here [they]1571-a dozen armed knights came . All together , too ; none of those chivalrous magnanimities which one reads so much about --one courtly rascal at a time , and [the rest standing by to see fair play]1576-the rest standing by to see fair play . No , [they]1571-a dozen armed knights came in a body , [they]1571-a dozen armed knights came with a whirr and a rush , [they]1571-a dozen armed knights came like a volley from a battery ; came with heads low down , plumes streaming out behind , lances advanced at a level . It was a handsome sight , a beautiful sight -- for [a man up a tree]1577-a man up a tree . [I]0-i laid [my]0-i lance in rest and waited , with [my]0-i heart beating , till the iron wave was just ready to break over [me]0-i , then spouted a column of white smoke through the bars of [my]0-i helmet . [You]1578-you should have seen the wave go to pieces and scatter ! This was a finer sight than the other one . But [these people]551-these people stopped , two or three hundred yards away , and this troubled [me]0-i . [My]0-i satisfaction collapsed , and fear came ; [I]0-i judged [I]0-i was [a lost man]1580-a lost man . CHAPTER XV [SANDY]199-sandy 'S TALE “ And so [I]0-i 'm [proprietor of [some knights]4681-some knights]4680-proprietor of some knights , ”[0-i] said [I]0-i , as [we]1593-we rode off . “ Who would ever have supposed that [I]0-i should live to list up assets of that sort . And-- ”[1594-i] “ [Great Scott]196-great scott ! ”[1594-i] [You]1595-you see , [I]0-i recognized [my]0-i mistake at once . [I]0-i had set [her]1596-i works a - going ; it was [my]0-i own fault ; [she]1596-i would be thirty days getting down to those facts . And [she]1596-i generally began without a preface and finished without a result . If [you]1595-you interrupted [her]1596-i [she]1596-i would either go right along without noticing , or answer with a couple of words , and go back and say the sentence over again . So , interruptions only did harm ; and yet [I]0-i had to interrupt , and interrupt pretty frequently , too , in order to save [my]0-i life ; [a person]966-a person would die if [he]966-a person let [her]1596-i monotony drip on [him]966-a person right along all day . “ Great [Scott]196-great scott ! ”[0-i] [I]0-i said in [my]0-i distress . It is a mixture that is always ineffectual , and should never have been attempted in the first place . And yet , once [you]1608-you start a mistake , the trouble is done and [you]1608-you never know what is going to come of it . [The third damsel]4814-the third damsel was but fifteen year of age-- ”[195-alisande] Billows of thought came rolling over [my]0-i soul , and the voice faded out of [my]0-i hearing ! Fifteen ! Just [her]1610-my lost darling age who was so gentle , and lovely , and all [the world]374-the world to [me]0-i , and whom [I]0-i shall never see again ! [She]1610-my lost darling got three dollars a week , but [she]1610-my lost darling was worth it . [My]0-i interest was gone , [my]0-i thoughts were far away , and sad .
