And behold , it was [the five patriarchs that had been released from [the dungeons]4821-the dungeons the evening before]4963-the five patriarchs that had been released from the dungeons the evening before ! [Poor old creatures]4965-poor old creatures , it was all of twenty years since [any one of [them]4965-poor old creatures]4966-any one of them had known what it was to be equipped with any remaining snag or remnant of a tooth . “[2176-him] Blank - blank - blank [him]2176-him , ” said [Sir Madok]232-sir madok , “[2176-him] an [I]0-i do not stove - polish [him]2176-him an [I]0-i may find [him]2176-him , leave it to [me]0-i ; for never [no knight that hight Ossaise or aught else]2177-no knight that hight ossaise or aught else may do [me]0-i this disservice and bide on live , an [I]0-i may find [him]2176-him , the which [I]0-i have thereunto sworn a great oath this day . ” And with these words and others , [he]0-i lightly took [his]0-i spear and gat [him]2176-him thence . In the middle of the afternoon [we]4967-we came upon [one of [those very patriarchs [ourselves]4967-we]4969-those very patriarchs ourselves , in [the edge of [a poor village]4971-a poor village]4970-the edge of a poor village]4968-one of those very patriarchs ourselves , in the edge of a poor village . [He]4968-one of those very patriarchs ourselves , in the edge of a poor village was basking in the love of [[relatives]4972-relatives and [friends]4974-friends whom [he]4968-one of those very patriarchs ourselves , in the edge of a poor village had not seen for fifty years]4973-relatives and friends whom he had not seen for fifty years ; and about [him]4968-one of those very patriarchs ourselves , in the edge of a poor village and caressing [him]4968-one of those very patriarchs ourselves , in the edge of a poor village were also [descendants of [his]4968-one of those very patriarchs ourselves , in the edge of a poor village own body whom [he]4968-one of those very patriarchs ourselves , in the edge of a poor village had never seen at all till now]4975-descendants of his own body whom he had never seen at all till now ; but to [him]4968-one of those very patriarchs ourselves , in the edge of a poor village these were [all strangers]4976-all strangers , [his]4968-one of those very patriarchs ourselves , in the edge of a poor village memory was gone , [his]4968-one of those very patriarchs ourselves , in the edge of a poor village mind was stagnant . It seemed incredible that [a man]518-a man could outlast half a century shut up in a dark hole like a rat , but here were [[his]4968-one of those very patriarchs ourselves , in the edge of a poor village old wife]4978-his old wife and [some old comrades]4979-some old comrades to testify to it . [They]4979-some old comrades could remember [him]4968-one of those very patriarchs ourselves , in the edge of a poor village as [he]4968-one of those very patriarchs ourselves , in the edge of a poor village was in the freshness and strength of [his]4968-one of those very patriarchs ourselves , in the edge of a poor village young manhood , when [he]4968-one of those very patriarchs ourselves , in the edge of a poor village kissed [[his]4968-one of those very patriarchs ourselves , in the edge of a poor village child]4980-his child and delivered [it]4980-his child to [[its]4980-his child mother]4981-its mother 's hands and went away into that long oblivion . [The people at [the castle]721-the castle]4982-the people at the castle could not tell within half a generation the length of time [the man]536-the man had been shut up there for [his]4968-one of those very patriarchs ourselves , in the edge of a poor village unrecorded and forgotten offense ; but [this old wife]4985-this old wife knew ; and so did [[her]4985-this old wife old child , who stood there among [[her]4985-this old wife married sons]4987-her married sons and [daughters]4988-daughters trying to realize [a father who had been to [her]4985-this old wife]4989-a father who had been to her a name , a thought , a formless image , a tradition , all [her]4985-this old wife life , and now was suddenly concreted into actual flesh and blood and set before [her]4985-this old wife face]4986-her old child , who stood there among her married sons and daughters trying to realize a father who had been to her a name , a thought , a formless image , a tradition , all her life , and now was suddenly concreted into actual flesh and blood and set before her face . It was a curious situation ; yet it is not on that account that [I]0-i have made room for it [here]369-here , but on account of a thing which seemed to [me]0-i still more curious . To wit , that this dreadful matter brought from [these downtrodden people]4991-these downtrodden people no outburst of rage against [these oppressors]4992-these oppressors . [They]4991-these downtrodden people had been [heritors]4993-heritors and subjects of cruelty and outrage so long that nothing could have startled [them]4991-these downtrodden people but a kindness . Yes , here was a curious revelation , indeed , of the depth to which [this people]4994-this people had been sunk in slavery . [Their]4994-this people entire being was reduced to a monotonous dead level of patience , resignation , dumb uncomplaining acceptance of whatever might befall [them]4994-this people in this life . [Their]4994-this people very imagination was dead . When [you]4995-you can say that of [a man]518-a man , [he]518-a man has struck bottom , [I]0-i reckon ; there is no lower deep for [him]518-a man . [I]0-i rather wished [I]0-i had gone [some other road]4997-some other road . This was not the sort of experience for [a statesman to encounter who was planning out a peaceful revolution in [his]4998-a statesman to encounter who was planning out a peaceful revolution in his mind mind]4998-a statesman to encounter who was planning out a peaceful revolution in his mind . For it could not help bringing up the unget - aroundable fact that , all gentle ca nt and philosophizing to the contrary notwithstanding , [no people in [the world]374-the world]4999-no people in the world ever did achieve [their]4999-no people in the world freedom by goody - goody talk and moral suasion : it being immutable law that all revolutions that will succeed must _ begin _ in blood , whatever may answer afterward . If history teaches anything , it teaches that . What [this folk]5001-this folk needed , then , was a Reign of Terror and a guillotine , and [I]0-i was [the wrong man]5002-the wrong man for [them]5001-this folk . Two days later , toward noon , [Sandy]199-sandy began to show signs of excitement and feverish expectancy . [She]199-sandy said [we]5003-we were approaching [[the ogre]1369-the ogre 's castle]5005-the ogre 's castle . [I]0-i was surprised into an uncomfortable shock . The object of [our]5003-we quest had gradually dropped out of [my]0-i mind ; this sudden resurrection of it made it seem quite a real and startling thing for a moment , and roused up in [me]0-i a smart interest . [Sandy]199-sandy 's excitement increased every moment ; and so did [mine]0-i , for that sort of thing is catching . [My]0-i heart got to thumping . [You]5006-you ca n't reason with [your]5006-you heart ; it has its own laws , and thumps about things which [the intellect]5007-the intellect scorns . Presently , when [Sandy]199-sandy slid from the horse , motioned [me]0-i to stop , and went creeping stealthily , with [her]199-sandy head bent nearly to [her]199-sandy knees , toward a row of bushes that bordered a declivity , the thumpings grew stronger and quicker . And [they]5008-they kept it up while [she]199-sandy was gaining [her]199-sandy ambush and getting [her]199-sandy glimpse over the declivity ; and also while [I]0-i was creeping to [her]199-sandy side on [my]0-i knees . [Her]199-sandy eyes were burning now , as [she]199-sandy pointed with [her]199-sandy finger , and said in a panting whisper : “[0-i] [The castle]721-the castle ! [The castle]721-the castle ! Lo , where it looms ! ” What a welcome disappointment [I]0-i experienced ! [I]0-i said : “[0-i] Castle ? [It]721-the castle is nothing but a pigsty ; a pigsty with a wattled fence around [it]721-the castle . ” [She]199-sandy looked surprised and distressed . The animation faded out of [her]199-sandy face ; and during many moments [she]199-sandy was lost in thought and silent . Then : “[2180-its] It was not enchanted aforetime , ” [she]199-sandy said in a musing fashion , as if to [herself]199-sandy . “[2180-its] And how strange is this marvel , and how awful --that to the one perception it is enchanted and dight in a base and shameful aspect ; yet to the perception of the other it is not enchanted , [hath]2180-its suffered no change , but stands firm and stately still , girt with [its]2180-its moat and waving its banners in the blue air from [[its]2180-its towers]2181-its towers . And [God]121-god shield [us]2182-i , how it pricks the heart to see again [these gracious captives]2183-these gracious captives , and the sorrow deepened in [their]2183-these gracious captives sweet faces ! [We]2182-i have tarried along , and are to blame . ” [I]2182-i saw [my]2182-i cue . [The castle]721-the castle was enchanted to _ [me]2182-i _ , not to [her]199-sandy . It would be wasted time to try to argue [her]199-sandy out of [her]199-sandy delusion , it could n't be done ; [I]2182-i must just humor it . So [I]2182-i said : “[2182-i] This is a common case -- the enchanting of a thing to one eye and leaving it in its proper form to another . [You]2184-you have heard of it before , [Sandy]199-sandy , though [you]2184-you have n't happened to experience it . But no harm is done . In fact , it is lucky the way it is . If [these ladies]2185-these ladies were hogs to [everybody]600-everybody and to [themselves]2185-these ladies , it would be necessary to break the enchantment , and that might be impossible if [one]434-one failed to find out the particular process of the enchantment . And hazardous , too ; for in attempting a disenchantment without the true key , [you]2184-you are liable to err , and turn [your]2184-you hogs into dogs , and the dogs into cats , the cats into rats , and so on , and end by reducing [your]2184-you materials to nothing finally , or to an odorless gas which [you]2184-you ca n't follow -- which , of course , amounts to the same thing . But here , by good luck , [no one]2188-no one 's eyes but [mine]2189-mine are under the enchantment , and so it is of no consequence to dissolve it . [These ladies]2185-these ladies remain [ladies]1049-ladies to [you]2184-you , and to [themselves]2185-these ladies , and to [everybody else]631-everybody else ; and at the same time [they]2185-these ladies will suffer in no way from [my]0-i delusion , for when [I]0-i know that [an ostensible hog]2193-an ostensible hog is [a lady]1274-a lady , that is enough for [me]0-i , [I]0-i know how to treat [her]2193-an ostensible hog . ” “[0-i] Thanks , oh , sweet [my]0-i lord , [thou]2195-thou talkest like [an angel]2196-an angel . And [I]0-i know that [thou]2195-thou wilt deliver [them]2185-these ladies , for that [thou]2195-thou art minded to great deeds and art as strong [a knight of [your]2184-you hands]2197-a knight of your hands and as brave to will and to do , as [any that is on live]2198-any that is on live . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i will not leave [a princess]2199-a princess in the sty , [Sandy]199-sandy . Are those three yonder that to [my]0-i disordered eyes are starveling swine - herds-- ” “[2200-the ogres] [The ogres]2200-the ogres , Are _ [they]2200-the ogres _ changed also ? It is most wonderful . Now am [I]0-i fearful ; for how canst [thou]2195-thou strike with sure aim when five of [their]2200-the ogres nine cubits of stature are to [thee]2195-thou invisible ? Ah , go warily , [fair sir]4423-fair sir ; this is a mightier emprise than [I]0-i wend . ” “[199-sandy] [You]199-sandy be easy , [Sandy]199-sandy . All [I]0-i need to know is , how _ much _ of [an ogre]1368-an ogre is invisible ; then [I]0-i know how to locate [his]1368-an ogre vitals . Do n't [you]199-sandy be afraid , [I]0-i will make short work of [these bunco - steerers]2203-these bunco - steerers . Stay where [you]199-sandy are . ” [I]199-sandy left [Sandy]199-sandy kneeling there , corpse - faced but plucky and hopeful , and rode down to [the pigsty]5010-the pigsty , and struck up a trade with [the swine - herds]5011-the swine - herds . [I]199-sandy won [their]5011-the swine - herds gratitude by buying out all the hogs at the lump sum of sixteen pennies , which was rather above latest quotations . [I]199-sandy was just in time ; for [the Church]900-the church , [the lord of the manor]5013-the lord of the manor , and [the rest of [the tax - gatherers]5015-the tax - gatherers]5014-the rest of the tax - gatherers would have been along next day and swept off pretty much all the stock , leaving [the swine - herds]5011-the swine - herds very short of hogs and [Sandy]199-sandy out of [princesses]5017-princesses . But now [the tax people]5018-the tax people could be paid in cash , and there would be a stake left besides . [One of [the men]544-the men]5019-one of the men had [ten children]5021-ten children ; and [he]5019-one of the men said that last year when [a priest]4649-a priest came and of [his]5019-one of the men ten pigs took [the fattest one]5023-the fattest one for tithes , [the wife]5024-the wife burst out upon [him]5019-one of the men , and offered [him]5019-one of the men [a child]5025-a child and said : “[199-sandy] [Thou]2204-i beast without bowels of mercy , why leave [me]0-i [[my]0-i child]2205-my child , yet rob [me]0-i of the wherewithal to feed it ? ” How curious . The same thing had happened in the Wales of [my]2204-i day , under [this same old Established Church]5026-this same old established church , which was supposed by [many]473-many to have changed [its]5026-this same old established church nature when [it]5026-this same old established church changed [its]5026-this same old established church disguise . [I]2204-i sent [the three men]5028-the three men away , and then opened the sty gate and beckoned [Sandy]199-sandy to come -- which [she]199-sandy did ; and not leisurely , but with the rush of a prairie fire . And when [I]2204-i saw [her]199-sandy fling [herself]199-sandy upon those hogs , with tears of joy running down [her]199-sandy cheeks , and strain them to [her]199-sandy heart , and kiss them , and caress [them]5029-they , and call [them]5029-they reverently by grand princely names , [I]2204-i was ashamed of [her]199-sandy , ashamed of [the human race]1188-the human race . [We]5031-we had to drive those hogs [home]619-home -- ten miles ; and [no ladies]5033-no ladies were ever more fickle - minded or contrary . [They]5029-they would stay in [no road]5034-no road , [no path]5035-no path ; [they]5029-they broke out through the brush on all sides , and flowed away in all directions , over rocks , and [hills]5036-hills , and the roughest places [they]5029-they could find . And [they]5029-they must not be struck , or roughly accosted ; [Sandy]199-sandy could not bear to see [them]5029-they treated in ways unbecoming [their]5029-they rank . [The troublesomest old sow of the lot]5037-the troublesomest old sow of the lot had to be called [[my]2204-i Lady]1422-my lady , and [[your]5039-your Highness]4838-your highness , like the rest . It is annoying and difficult to scour around after hogs , in armor . There was [one small countess]5041-one small countess , with an iron ring in [her]5041-one small countess snout and hardly any hair on [her]5041-one small countess back , that was the devil for perversity . [She]5041-one small countess gave [me]2204-i a race of an hour , over [all sorts of country]5042-all sorts of country , and then [we]5043-we were right where [we]5043-we had started from , having made not a rod of real progress . [I]2204-i seized [her]5041-one small countess at last by the tail , and brought [her]5041-one small countess along squealing . When [I]2204-i overtook [Sandy]199-sandy [she]5041-one small countess was horrified , and said it was in the last degree indelicate to drag [a countess]5044-a countess by [[her]5041-one small countess train]5045-her train . [We]5043-we got [the hogs]5046-the hogs [home]619-home just at dark -- [most of [them]5046-the hogs]5048-most of them . [The princess Nerovens de Morganore]235-the princess nerovens de morganore was missing , and [two of [[her]235-the princess nerovens de morganore ladies]5050-her ladies in waiting]5049-two of her ladies in waiting : namely , [Miss Angela Bohun]236-miss angela bohun , and [the Demoiselle Elaine Courtemains]237-the demoiselle elaine courtemains , the former of these two being a young black sow with a white star in [her]235-the princess nerovens de morganore forehead , and [the latter a brown one with thin legs and a slight limp in the forward shank on the starboard side]5051-the latter a brown one with thin legs and a slight limp in the forward shank on the starboard side -- a couple of the tryingest blisters to drive that [I]2204-i ever saw . Also among the missing were [several mere baronesses]5052-several mere baronesses -- and [I]2204-i wanted [them]5052-several mere baronesses to stay missing ; but no , all that sausage - meat had to be found ; so [servants]5053-servants were sent out with torches to scour [the woods]4638-the woods and hills to that end . Of course , [the whole drove]5055-the whole drove was housed in [the house]584-the house , and , [great guns!--well]238-great guns!--well , [I]2204-i never saw anything like it . Nor ever heard anything like it . And never smelt anything like it . It was like an insurrection in a gasometer . CHAPTER XXI THE PILGRIMS When [I]2204-i did get to bed at last [I]2204-i was unspeakably tired ; the stretching out , and the relaxing of the long - tense muscles , how luxurious , how delicious ! but that was as far as [I]2204-i could get -- sleep was out of the question for the present . The ripping and tearing and squealing of [the nobility]1645-the nobility up and down [the halls]5058-the halls and [corridors]5059-corridors was pandemonium come again , and kept [me]2204-i broad awake . Being awake , [my]2204-i thoughts were busy , of course ; and mainly [they]1645-the nobility busied [themselves]1645-the nobility with [Sandy]199-sandy 's curious delusion . Here [she]199-sandy was , as sane a person as [the kingdom]517-the kingdom could produce ; and yet , from [my]2204-i point of view [she]199-sandy was acting like [a crazy woman]5061-a crazy woman . [[My]2204-i land]5062-my land , the power of training ! of influence ! of education ! It can bring [a body]427-a body up to believe anything . [I]2204-i had to put [myself]2204-i in [[Sandy]199-sandy 's place]5064-sandy 's place to realize that [she]199-sandy was not [a lunatic]4434-a lunatic . Yes , and put [her]199-sandy in [mine]2204-i , to demonstrate how easy it is to seem [a lunatic]4434-a lunatic to [a person who has not been taught as [you]5068-you have been taught]5067-a person who has not been taught as you have been taught . If [I]2204-i had told [Sandy]199-sandy [I]2204-i had seen [a wagon]5069-a wagon , uninfluenced by enchantment , spin along fifty miles an hour ; had seen [a man , unequipped with magic powers , get into a basket and soar out of sight among the clouds]5070-a man , unequipped with magic powers , get into a basket and soar out of sight among the clouds ; and had listened , without [any necromancer]5071-any necromancer 's help , to the conversation of [a person who was several hundred miles away]5072-a person who was several hundred miles away , [Sandy]199-sandy would not merely have supposed [me]2204-i to be crazy , [she]199-sandy would have thought [she]199-sandy knew it . [Everybody around [her]199-sandy]5073-everybody around her believed in enchantments ; [nobody]476-nobody had any doubts ; to doubt that [a castle]4622-a castle could be turned into a sty , and [its occupants]5076-its occupants into hogs , would have been the same as [my]2204-i doubting among [Connecticut people]5077-connecticut people the actuality of the telephone and its wonders,--and in both cases would be absolute proof of a diseased mind , an unsettled reason . Yes , [Sandy]199-sandy was sane ; that must be admitted . If [I]2204-i also would be sane -- to [Sandy]199-sandy --I must keep [my]2204-i superstitions about unenchanted and unmiraculous locomotives , balloons , and telephones , to [myself]2204-i . Also , [I]2204-i believed that [the world]374-the world was not flat , and had n't pillars under it to support it , nor a canopy over it to turn off a universe of water that occupied all space above ; but as [I]2204-i was [the only person in [the kingdom]517-the kingdom]5079-the only person in the kingdom afflicted with such impious and criminal opinions , [I]2204-i recognized that it would be good wisdom to keep quiet about this matter , too , if [I]2204-i did not wish to be suddenly shunned and forsaken by [everybody]600-everybody as [a madman]5082-a madman . The next morning [Sandy]199-sandy assembled [the swine]5083-the swine in [the dining - room]5084-the dining - room and gave [them]5083-the swine [their]5083-the swine breakfast , waiting upon [them]5083-the swine personally and manifesting in every way the deep reverence which [the natives of [[her]199-sandy island]5086-her island]5085-the natives of her island , ancient and modern , have always felt for rank , let its outward casket and the mental and moral contents be what [they]5083-the swine may . [I]2204-i could have eaten with the hogs if [I]2204-i had had birth approaching [my]2204-i lofty official rank ; but [I]2204-i had n't , and so accepted the unavoidable slight and made no complaint . [Sandy]199-sandy and [I]2204-i had [our]5087-our breakfast at the second table . [The family]1661-the family were not at [home]619-home . [I]2204-i said : “[2204-i] How many are in [the family]1661-the family , [Sandy]199-sandy , and where do [they]1661-the family keep [themselves]1661-the family ? ” “[1765-family] [Family]1765-family ? ” “[1765-family] Yes . ” “[1765-family] Which family , good [[my]0-i lord]1456-my lord ? ” “[1765-family] Why , [this family]2209-this family ; [[your]0-i own family]2210-your own family . ” “[2211-sooth] [Sooth]2211-sooth to say , [I]0-i understand [you]199-sandy not . [I]0-i have [no family]2212-no family . ” “[2212-no family] [No family]2212-no family ? Why , [Sandy]199-sandy , is n't [this]2214-this [[your]199-sandy home]2215-your home ? ” “[199-sandy] Now how indeed might that be ? [I]0-i have no [home]619-home . ” “[0-i] Well , then , whose house is this ? ” “[0-i] Ah , wit [you]199-sandy well [I]0-i would tell [you]199-sandy an [I]0-i knew [myself]0-i . ” “[0-i] Come -- [you]199-sandy do n't even know [these people]551-these people ? Then who invited [us]2218-we here ? ” “[557-none] [None]557-none invited [us]2218-we . [We]2218-we but came ; that is all . ” “[2218-we] Why , [woman]4829-woman , this is a most extraordinary performance . The effrontery of it is beyond admiration . [We]2218-we blandly march into [[a man]518-a man 's house]2222-a man 's house , and cram [it]2222-a man 's house full of the only really valuable nobility the sun has yet discovered in [the earth]399-the earth , and then it turns out that [we]2218-we do n't even know [the man]536-the man 's name . How did [you]199-sandy ever venture to take this extravagant liberty ? [I]0-i supposed , of course , it was [[your]199-sandy home]2215-your home . What will [the man]536-the man say ? ” “[536-the man] What will [he]536-the man say ? Forsooth what can [he]536-the man say but give thanks ? ” “[536-the man] Thanks for what ? ” [Her]199-sandy face was filled with a puzzled surprise : “[536-the man] Verily , [thou]2227-thou troublest [mine]0-i understanding with strange words . Do [ye]199-sandy dream that one of [[his]536-the man estate]2228-his estate is like to have the honor twice in [his]536-the man life to entertain company such as [we]2218-we have brought to grace [[his]536-the man house]1681-his house withal ? ” “[199-sandy] Well , no -- when [you]199-sandy come to that . No , it 's an even bet that this is the first time [he]536-the man has had a treat like this . ” “[536-the man] Then let [him]536-the man be thankful , and manifest the same by grateful speech and due humility ; [he]536-the man were a dog , else , and [the heir and ancestor of dogs]2230-the heir and ancestor of dogs . ” To [my]199-sandy mind , the situation was uncomfortable . It might become more so . It might be a good idea to muster the hogs and move on . So [I]199-sandy said : “[199-sandy] The day is wasting , [Sandy]199-sandy . It is time to get [the nobility]1645-the nobility together and be moving . ” “[4423-fair sir] Wherefore , [fair sir]4423-fair sir and [Boss]231-the boss ? ” “[231-the boss] [We]2218-we want to take [them]2233-them to [[their]2233-them home]2234-their home , do n't [we]2218-we ? ” “[2218-we] [La]183-la cote male taile , but list to [him]536-the man ! [They]2233-them be of [all the regions of [the earth]399-the earth]2235-all the regions of the earth ! [Each]2237-each must hie to [[her]2237-each own home]2238-her own home ; wend [you]2239-you [we]2218-we might do all these journeys in one so brief life as [He]536-the man hath appointed that created life , and thereto death likewise with help of [Adam]239-adam , who by sin done through persuasion of [his]239-adam helpmeet , [she]2240-she being wrought upon and bewrayed by the beguilements of [the great enemy of man]2241-the great enemy of man , that serpent hight [Satan]218-satan , aforetime consecrated and set apart unto that evil work by overmastering spite and envy begotten in [his]536-the man heart through fell ambitions that did blight and mildew a nature erst so white and pure whenso it hove with the shining multitudes [[its]2242-its brethren]2243-its brethren - born in glade and shade of [that fair heaven]2244-that fair heaven wherein [all such as native]2245-all such as native be to [that rich estate]2246-that rich estate and-- ” “[196-great scott] [Great Scott]196-great scott ! ” “[196-great scott] [[My]0-i lord]1456-my lord ? ” “[196-great scott] Well , [you]2239-you know [we]2218-we have n't got time for this sort of thing . Do n't [you]2239-you see , [we]2218-we could distribute [these people]551-these people around [the earth]399-the earth in less time than it is going to take [you]2239-you to explain that [we]2218-we ca n't . [We]2218-we must n't talk now , [we]2218-we must act . [You]2239-you want to be careful ; [you]2239-you must n't let [[your]2239-you mill]2250-your mill get the start of [you]2239-you that way , at a time like this . To business now -- and sharp 's the word . Who is to take [the aristocracy]2251-the aristocracy [home]619-home ? ” “[560-their friends] Even [[their]2251-the aristocracy friends]560-their friends . These will come for [them]2251-the aristocracy from [the far parts of [the earth]399-the earth]2254-the far parts of the earth . ” This was lightning from a clear sky , for unexpectedness ; and the relief of it was like pardon to [a prisoner]2025-a prisoner . [She]199-sandy would remain to deliver the goods , of course . “[199-sandy] Well , then , [Sandy]199-sandy , as [our]2218-we enterprise is handsomely and successfully ended , [I]0-i will go [home]619-home and report ; and if ever another one-- ” “[0-i] [I]0-i also am ready ; [I]0-i will go with [thee]199-sandy . ” This was recalling the pardon . “[0-i] How ? [You]199-sandy will go with [me]0-i ? Why should [you]199-sandy ? ” “[199-sandy] Will [I]0-i be traitor to [[my]0-i knight]2257-my knight , dost think ? That were dishonor . [I]0-i may not part from [thee]199-sandy until in knightly encounter in [the field]1674-the field [some overmatching champion]2259-some overmatching champion shall fairly win and fairly wear [me]0-i . [I]0-i were to blame an [I]0-i thought that that might ever hap . ” “[0-i] Elected for the long term , ” [I]0-i sighed to [myself]0-i . “[0-i] [I]0-i may as well make the best of it . ” So then [I]0-i spoke up and said : “[0-i] All right ; let [us]2260-we make a start . ” While [she]199-sandy was gone to cry [her]199-sandy farewells over the pork , [I]2261-i gave that whole peerage away to [the servants]1736-the servants . And [I]2261-i asked [them]1736-the servants to take a duster and dust around a little where the nobilities had mainly lodged and promenaded ; but [they]1736-the servants considered that that would be hardly worth while , and would moreover be a rather grave departure from custom , and therefore likely to make talk . A departure from custom -- that settled it ; it was [a nation]341-a nation capable of committing any crime but that . [The servants]1736-the servants said [they]1736-the servants would follow the fashion , a fashion grown sacred through immemorial observance ; [they]1736-the servants would scatter fresh rushes in all [the rooms]5094-the rooms and [halls]5095-halls , and then the evidence of the aristocratic visitation would be no longer visible . It was a kind of satire on Nature : it was the scientific method , the geologic method ; it deposited the history of [the family]1661-the family in a stratified record ; and [the antiquary]5097-the antiquary could dig through it and tell by the remains of each period what changes of diet [the family]1661-the family had introduced successively for a hundred years . The first thing [we]2260-we struck that day was a procession of [pilgrims]5099-pilgrims . It was not going [our]2260-we way , but [we]2260-we joined it , nevertheless ; for it was hourly being borne in upon [me]2261-i now , that if [I]2261-i would govern [this country]4644-this country wisely , [I]2261-i must be posted in the details of its life , and not at second hand , but by personal observation and scrutiny . [This company of [pilgrims]5099-pilgrims]5101-this company of pilgrims resembled [Chaucer]240-chaucer 's in this : that it had in it a sample of about all the upper occupations and professions [the country]420-the country could show , and a corresponding variety of costume . There were [young men]5104-young men and [old men]5105-old men , [young women]5106-young women and [old women]5107-old women , [lively folk]5108-lively folk and [grave folk]5109-grave folk . [They]2261-i rode upon mules and horses , and there was not a side - saddle in the party ; for this specialty was to remain unknown in [England]1-england for nine hundred years yet . It was [a pleasant , friendly , sociable herd ; pious , happy , merry and full of unconscious coarsenesses and innocent indecencies]5110-a pleasant , friendly , sociable herd ; pious , happy , merry and full of unconscious coarsenesses and innocent indecencies . What [they]2261-i regarded as the merry tale went the continual round and caused no more embarrassment than it would have caused in the best English society twelve centuries later . Practical jokes worthy of [the English wits of the first quarter of the far - off nineteenth century]5111-the english wits of the first quarter of the far - off nineteenth century were sprung here and there and yonder along the line , and compelled the delightedest applause ; and sometimes when a bright remark was made at one end of the procession and started on its travels toward the other , [you]5112-you could note its progress all the way by the sparkling spray of laughter it threw off from its bows as it plowed along ; and also by the blushes of the mules in its wake . [Sandy]199-sandy knew the goal and purpose of this pilgrimage , and [she]199-sandy posted [me]2261-i . [She]199-sandy said : “[2261-i] [They]2261-i journey to [the Valley of Holiness]2262-the valley of holiness , for to be blessed of [the godly hermits]2263-the godly hermits and drink of the miraculous waters and be cleansed from sin . ” “[2261-i] Where is [this watering place]2264-this watering place ? ” “[2261-i] It lieth a two - day journey hence , by the borders of [the land that hight [the Cuckoo Kingdom]43-the cuckoo kingdom]2265-the land that hight the cuckoo kingdom . ” “[2261-i] Tell [me]0-i about it . Is [it]2264-this watering place [a celebrated place]2266-a celebrated place ? ” “[2261-i] Oh , of a truth , yes . There be none more so . Of old time there lived [there]4491-there [an abbot]2268-an abbot and [[his]2268-an abbot monks]2269-his monks . [Belike]241-belike were none in [the world]374-the world more holy than these ; for [they]241-belike gave [themselves]241-belike to study of pious books , and spoke not the one to the other , or indeed to any , and ate decayed herbs and naught thereto , and slept hard , and prayed much , and washed never ; also [they]241-belike wore the same garment until it fell from [their]241-belike bodies through age and decay . Right so came [they]241-belike to be known of all [the world]374-the world by reason of these holy austerities , and visited by [rich and poor]2272-rich and poor , and reverenced . ” “[2276-the fiend] Proceed . ” “[2276-the fiend] But always there was lack of water there . Whereas , upon a time , [the holy abbot]2273-the holy abbot prayed , and for answer a great stream of clear water burst forth by miracle in [a desert place]2274-a desert place . Now were [the fickle monks]2275-the fickle monks tempted of [the Fiend]2276-the fiend , and [they]2275-the fickle monks wrought with [[their]2275-the fickle monks abbot]2277-their abbot unceasingly by beggings and beseechings that [he]2277-their abbot would construct a bath ; and when [he]2277-their abbot was become aweary and might not resist more , [he]2277-their abbot said have [ye]2278-ye [your]2278-ye will , then , and granted that [they]2275-the fickle monks asked . Now mark [thou]2279-thou what ' tis to forsake the ways of purity the which [He]2277-their abbot loveth , and wanton with such as be worldly and an offense . [These monks]2280-these monks did enter into the bath and come thence washed as white as snow ; and lo , in that moment [His]2277-their abbot sign appeared , in miraculous rebuke ! for [His]2277-their abbot insulted waters ceased to flow , and utterly vanished away . ” “[2280-these monks] [They]2280-these monks fared mildly , [Sandy]199-sandy , considering how that kind of crime is regarded in [this country]4644-this country . ” “[2280-these monks] Belike ; but it was [their]2280-these monks first sin ; and [they]2280-these monks had been of perfect life for long , and differing in naught from [the angels]2282-the angels . Prayers , tears , torturings of the flesh , all was vain to beguile that water to flow again . Even processions ; even burnt - offerings ; even votive candles to [the Virgin]2283-the virgin , did fail every each of [them]2280-these monks ; and all in [the land]4486-the land did marvel . ” “[199-sandy] How odd to find that even this industry has [its]2285-its financial panics , and at times sees [its]2285-its assignats and greenbacks languish to zero , and everything come to a standstill . Go on , [Sandy]199-sandy . ” “[199-sandy] And so upon a time , after year and day , [the good abbot]2286-the good abbot made humble surrender and destroyed the bath . And behold , [His]2277-their abbot anger was in that moment appeased , and the waters gushed richly forth again , and even unto this day [they]2280-these monks have not ceased to flow in that generous measure . ” “[0-i] Then [I]0-i take it [nobody]476-nobody has washed since . ” “[2277-their abbot] [He]2277-their abbot that would essay it could have [his]2277-their abbot halter free ; yes , and swiftly would [he]2277-their abbot need it , too . ” “[2288-the community] [The community]2288-the community has prospered since ? ” “[2288-the community] Even from that very day . The fame of the miracle went abroad into [all lands]2289-all lands . From [every land]2290-every land came [monks]4691-monks to join ; [they]4691-monks came even as the fishes come , in shoals ; and [the monastery]2292-the monastery added building to building , and yet others to these , and so spread wide its arms and took [them]4691-monks in . And [nuns]2293-nuns came , also ; and more again , and yet more ; and built over against [the monastery on [the yon side of [the vale]2296-the vale]2295-the yon side of the vale]2294-the monastery on the yon side of the vale , and added building to building , until mighty was [that nunnery]2297-that nunnery . And these were friendly unto [those]2298-those , and [they]2298-those joined [their]2298-those loving labors together , and together [they]2298-those built [a fair great foundling asylum midway of [the valley between]2300-the valley between]2299-a fair great foundling asylum midway of the valley between . ” “[2301-you] [You]2301-you spoke of [some hermits]2302-some hermits , [Sandy]199-sandy . ” “[2301-you] [These]2302-some hermits have gathered [there]4491-there from [the ends of [the earth]399-the earth]2304-the ends of the earth . [A hermit]1663-a hermit thriveth best where there be multitudes of [pilgrims]5099-pilgrims . [Ye]2308-ye shall not find [no hermit of no sort]2309-no hermit of no sort wanting . If any shall mention [a hermit of a kind]2310-a hermit of a kind [he]2310-a hermit of a kind thinketh new and not to be found but in [some far strange land]2311-some far strange land , let [him]2310-a hermit of a kind but scratch among [the holes and caves and swamps that line [that Valley of Holiness]2313-that valley of holiness]2312-the holes and caves and swamps that line that valley of holiness , and whatsoever be [his]2310-a hermit of a kind breed , it skills not , [he]2310-a hermit of a kind shall find a sample of it there . ” [I]2310-a hermit of a kind closed up alongside of [a burly fellow]5113-a burly fellow with a fat good - humored face , purposing to make [myself]2310-a hermit of a kind agreeable and pick up some further crumbs of fact ; but [I]2310-a hermit of a kind had hardly more than scraped acquaintance with [him]5113-a burly fellow when [he]5113-a burly fellow began eagerly and awkwardly to lead up , in the immemorial way , to that same old anecdote -- the one [Sir Dinadan]140-sir dinadan told [me]2310-a hermit of a kind , what time [I]2310-a hermit of a kind got into trouble with [Sir Sagramor]117-sir sagramor and was challenged of [him]5113-a burly fellow on account of it . [I]2310-a hermit of a kind excused [myself]2310-a hermit of a kind and dropped to the rear of [the procession]1563-the procession , sad at heart , willing to go hence from this troubled life , [this vale of tears]5115-this vale of tears , this brief day of broken rest , of cloud and storm , of weary struggle and monotonous defeat ; and yet shrinking from the change , as remembering how long eternity is , and how many have wended [thither who know that anecdote]5116-thither who know that anecdote . Early in the afternoon [we]5117-we overtook another procession of [pilgrims]5099-pilgrims ; but in this one was no merriment , no jokes , no laughter , no playful ways , nor any happy giddiness , whether of youth or age . Yet both were here , both age and youth ; [gray old men]5119-gray old men and [women]532-women , [strong men]5121-strong men and [women of middle age]5122-women of middle age , [young husbands]5123-young husbands , [young wives]5124-young wives , [little boys]5125-little boys and [girls]475-girls , and [three babies at the breast]5127-three babies at the breast . Even [the children]5128-the children were smileless ; there was not a face among [all these half a hundred people but was cast down , and bore that set expression of hopelessness which is bred of long and hard trials]5129-all these half a hundred people but was cast down , and bore that set expression of hopelessness which is bred of long and hard trials and old acquaintance with despair . [They]5128-the children were [slaves]924-slaves . Chains led from [their]5128-the children fettered feet and [their]5128-the children manacled hands to a sole - leather belt about [their]5128-the children waists ; and all except [the children]5128-the children were also linked together in a file six feet apart , by a single chain which led from collar to collar all down the line . [They]5128-the children were on foot , and had tramped three hundred miles in eighteen days , upon the cheapest odds and ends of food , and stingy rations of that . [They]5128-the children had slept in these chains every night , bundled together like swine . [They]5128-the children had upon [their]5128-the children bodies some poor rags , but [they]5128-the children could not be said to be clothed . [Their]5128-the children irons had chafed the skin from [their]5128-the children ankles and made sores which were ulcerated and wormy . [Their]5128-the children naked feet were torn , and none walked without a limp . Originally there had been [a hundred of [these unfortunates]5133-these unfortunates]5132-a hundred of these unfortunates , but about half had been sold on the trip . [The trader in charge of [them]5132-a hundred of these unfortunates]5134-the trader in charge of them rode a horse and carried a whip with a short handle and a long heavy lash divided into several knotted tails at the end . With this whip [he]5134-the trader in charge of them cut the shoulders of [any that tottered from weariness and pain]5135-any that tottered from weariness and pain , and straightened [them]5135-any that tottered from weariness and pain up . [He]5134-the trader in charge of them did not speak ; the whip conveyed [his]5134-the trader in charge of them desire without that . [None of these poor creatures]5136-none of these poor creatures looked up as [we]5137-we rode along by ; [they]5128-the children showed no consciousness of [our]5137-we presence . And [they]5128-the children made no sound but one ; that was the dull and awful clank of [their]5128-the children chains from end to end of the long file , as forty - three burdened feet rose and fell in unison . The file moved in a cloud of its own making . All these faces were gray with a coating of dust . [One]434-one has seen the like of this coating upon furniture in [unoccupied houses]5139-unoccupied houses , and has written [his]434-one idle thought in it with [his]434-one finger . [I]2310-a hermit of a kind was reminded of this when [I]2310-a hermit of a kind noticed the faces of [some of [those women]5141-those women]5140-some of those women , [young mothers carrying babes that were near to death and freedom]5142-young mothers carrying babes that were near to death and freedom , how a something in [their]5140-some of those women hearts was written in the dust upon [their]5140-some of those women faces , plain to see , and lord , how plain to read ! for it was the track of tears . [One of [these young mothers]5144-these young mothers]5143-one of these young mothers was but [a girl]4710-a girl , and it hurt [me]2310-a hermit of a kind to the heart to read that writing , and reflect that it was come up out of the breast of [such a child , a breast that ought not to know trouble yet , but only the gladness of the morning of life]5146-such a child , a breast that ought not to know trouble yet , but only the gladness of the morning of life ; and no doubt-- [She]5143-one of these young mothers reeled just then , giddy with fatigue , and down came the lash and flicked a flake of skin from [her]5143-one of these young mothers naked shoulder . It stung [me]2310-a hermit of a kind as if [I]2310-a hermit of a kind had been hit instead . [The master]5147-the master halted the file and jumped from [his]5147-the master horse . [He]5147-the master stormed and swore at [this girl]1277-this girl , and said [she]1277-this girl had made annoyance enough with [her]1277-this girl laziness , and as this was the last chance [he]5147-the master should have , [he]5147-the master would settle the account now . [She]1277-this girl dropped on [her]1277-this girl knees and put up [her]1277-this girl hands and began to beg , and cry , and implore , in a passion of terror , but [the master]5147-the master gave no attention . [He]5147-the master snatched [the child]5150-the child from [her]1277-this girl , and then made [the men - slaves who were chained before and behind [her]1277-this girl throw [her]1277-this girl on the ground and hold [her]1277-this girl there and expose [her]1277-this girl body]5151-the men - slaves who were chained before and behind her throw her on the ground and hold her there and expose her body ; and then [he]5147-the master laid on with [his]5147-the master lash like [a madman]5082-a madman till [her]1277-this girl back was flayed , [she]1277-this girl shrieking and struggling the while piteously . [One of [the men who was holding [her]1277-this girl]5154-the men who was holding her turned away [his]5153-one of the men who was holding her turned away his face , and for this humanity he was reviled and flogged face , and for this humanity [he]5153-one of the men who was holding her turned away his face , and for this humanity he was reviled and flogged was reviled and flogged]5153-one of the men who was holding her turned away his face , and for this humanity he was reviled and flogged . All [[our]5155-our pilgrims]5156-our pilgrims looked on and commented -- on the expert way in which the whip was handled . [They]5156-our pilgrims were too much hardened by lifelong everyday familiarity with slavery to notice that there was anything else in the exhibition that invited comment . This was what slavery could do , in the way of ossifying what one may call the superior lobe of human feeling ; for [these pilgrims]5157-these pilgrims were [kind - hearted people]5158-kind - hearted people , and [they]5157-these pilgrims would not have allowed [that man]1850-that man to treat a horse like that . [I]2310-a hermit of a kind wanted to stop the whole thing and set [the slaves]5160-the slaves free , but that would not do . [I]2310-a hermit of a kind must not interfere too much and get [myself]2310-a hermit of a kind a name for riding over [the country]420-the country 's laws and [the citizen]5162-the citizen 's rights roughshod . If [I]2310-a hermit of a kind lived and prospered [I]2310-a hermit of a kind would be the death of slavery , that [I]2310-a hermit of a kind was resolved upon ; but [I]2310-a hermit of a kind would try to fix it so that when [I]2310-a hermit of a kind became [its executioner]5163-its executioner it should be by command of [the nation]709-the nation . Just here was [the wayside shop of [a smith]5166-a smith]5165-the wayside shop of a smith ; and now arrived [a landed proprietor who had bought [this girl]1277-this girl a few miles back , deliverable here where [her]1277-this girl irons could be taken off]5167-a landed proprietor who had bought this girl a few miles back , deliverable here where her irons could be taken off . [They]5169-they were removed ; then there was a squabble between [the gentleman]5170-the gentleman and [the dealer]5171-the dealer as to which should pay [the blacksmith]5172-the blacksmith . The moment [the girl]1272-the girl was delivered from [her]1277-this girl irons , [she]1272-the girl flung [herself]1272-the girl , all tears and frantic sobbings , into the arms of [the slave who had turned away [his]5174-the slave who had turned away his face when she was whipped face when [she]1272-the girl was whipped]5174-the slave who had turned away his face when she was whipped . [He]5174-the slave who had turned away his face when she was whipped strained [her]1272-the girl to [his]5174-the slave who had turned away his face when she was whipped breast , and smothered [her]1272-the girl face and [the child]5150-the child 's with kisses , and washed them with the rain of [his]5174-the slave who had turned away his face when she was whipped tears . [I]2310-a hermit of a kind suspected . [I]2310-a hermit of a kind inquired . Yes , [I]2310-a hermit of a kind was right ; it was [husband]5176-husband and [wife]2084-wife . [They]5178-they had to be torn apart by force ; [the girl]1272-the girl had to be dragged away , and [she]1272-the girl struggled and fought and shrieked like one gone mad till a turn of [the road]460-the road hid [her]1272-the girl from sight ; and even after that , [we]5181-we could still make out the fading plaint of those receding shrieks . And [the husband]5182-the husband and [father]5183-father , with [[his]5182-the husband wife]1894-his wife and [child]4640-child gone , never to be seen by [him]5182-the husband again in life?--well , the look of [him]5182-the husband one might not bear at all , and so [I]2310-a hermit of a kind turned away ; but [I]2310-a hermit of a kind knew [I]2310-a hermit of a kind should never get [his]5182-the husband picture out of [my]2310-a hermit of a kind mind again , and there it is to this day , to wring [my]2310-a hermit of a kind heartstrings whenever [I]2310-a hermit of a kind think of it . [We]5181-we put up at [the inn in [a village]1008-a village]5186-the inn in a village just at nightfall , and when [I]2310-a hermit of a kind rose next morning and looked abroad , [I]2310-a hermit of a kind was ware where [a knight]1057-a knight came riding in the golden glory of the new day , and recognized [him]1057-a knight for [knight of [mine]2310-a hermit of a kind]5189-knight of mine -- [Sir Ozana le Cure Hardy]242-sir ozana . [He]1057-a knight was in [the gentlemen]5190-the gentlemen 's furnishing line , and [his]1057-a knight missionarying specialty was plug hats . [He]1057-a knight was clothed all in steel , in the beautifulest armor of the time -- up to where [his]1057-a knight helmet ought to have been ; but [he]1057-a knight had n't any helmet , [he]1057-a knight wore a shiny stove - pipe hat , and was ridiculous a spectacle as [one]434-one might want to see . It was another of [my]2310-a hermit of a kind surreptitious schemes for extinguishing knighthood by making it grotesque and absurd . [Sir Ozana]242-sir ozana 's saddle was hung about with leather hat boxes , and every time [he]1057-a knight overcame [a wandering knight]5192-a wandering knight [he]1057-a knight swore [him]1057-a knight into [my]2310-a hermit of a kind service and fitted [him]1057-a knight with a plug and made [him]1057-a knight wear it . [I]2310-a hermit of a kind dressed and ran down to welcome [Sir Ozana]242-sir ozana and get [his]242-sir ozana news . “[2310-a hermit of a kind] How is trade ? ” [I]2314-ye asked . “[2314-ye] [Ye]2314-ye will note that [I]0-i have but these four left ; yet were [they]2315-they sixteen whenas [I]0-i got [me]0-i from [Camelot]7-camelot . ” “[0-i] Why , [you]0-i have certainly done nobly , [Sir [Ozana]242-sir ozana]2316-sir ozana . Where have [you]0-i been foraging of late ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i am but now come from [the Valley of Holiness]2262-the valley of holiness , please [you]0-i sir . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i am pointed for [that place]2318-that place [myself]0-i . Give [him]242-sir ozana good feed , [boy]2320-boy , and stint it not , an [thou]2321-thou valuest [thy]2321-thou crown ; so get [ye]2320-boy lightly to [the stable]409-the stable and do even as [I]0-i bid .... [Sir]367-sir , it is parlous news [I]0-i bring , and -- be [these pilgrims]5157-these pilgrims ? Then [ye]2314-ye may not do better , [good folk]2325-good folk , than gather and hear the tale [I]0-i have to tell , sith it concerneth [you]2314-ye , forasmuch as [ye]2314-ye go to find that [ye]2314-ye will not find , and seek that [ye]2314-ye will seek in vain , [my]0-i life being hostage for [my]0-i word , and [my]0-i word and message being these , namely : That a hap has happened whereof the like has not been seen no more but once this two hundred years , which was the first and last time that that said misfortune strake [the holy valley]2326-the holy valley in that form by commandment of the Most High whereto by reasons just and causes thereunto contributing , wherein the matter-- ” “[2327-good people] The miraculous fount hath ceased to flow ! ” This shout burst from twenty pilgrim mouths at once . “[2314-ye] [Ye]2314-ye say well , [good people]2327-good people . [I]0-i was verging to it , even when [ye]2314-ye spake . ” “[0-i] Has [somebody]1383-somebody been washing again ? ” “[1383-somebody] Nay , it is suspected , but [none]557-none believe it . It is thought to be some other sin , but none wit what . ” “[5157-these pilgrims] How are [they]5157-these pilgrims feeling about the calamity ? ” “[5157-these pilgrims] None may describe it in words . The fount is these nine days dry . The prayers that did begin then , and the lamentations in sackcloth and ashes , and the holy processions , none of these have ceased nor night nor day ; and so [the monks]2330-the monks and [the nuns]2331-the nuns and [the foundlings]2332-the foundlings be all exhausted , and do hang up prayers writ upon parchment , sith that no strength is left in [man]4450-man to lift up voice . And at last [they]5157-these pilgrims sent for [thee]2314-ye , [Sir Boss]231-the boss , to try magic and enchantment ; and if [you]2314-ye could not come , then was [the messenger]2334-the messenger to fetch [Merlin]134-merlin , and [he]134-merlin is there these three days now , and saith [he]134-merlin will fetch that water though [he]134-merlin burst the globe and wreck its kingdoms to accomplish it ; and right bravely doth [he]134-merlin work [his]134-merlin magic and call upon [his]134-merlin hellions to hie [them]5157-these pilgrims hither and help , but not a whiff of moisture hath [he]134-merlin started yet , even so much as might qualify as mist upon a copper mirror an [ye]2314-ye count not the barrel of sweat [he]134-merlin sweateth betwixt sun and sun over the dire labors of [his]134-merlin task ; and if ye-- ” Breakfast was ready . As soon as it was over [I]2314-ye showed to [Sir Ozana]242-sir ozana these words which [I]2314-ye had written on the inside of [his]242-sir ozana hat : “[2314-ye] Chemical Department , Laboratory extension , Section G. Send two of first size , two of [No . 3]2335-no . 3 , and six of No . 4 , together with the proper complementary details -- and [two of [[my]0-i trained assistants]2337-my trained assistants]2336-two of my trained assistants . ” And [I]2337-my trained assistants said : “[2337-my trained assistants] Now get [you]2338-you to [Camelot]7-camelot as fast as [you]2338-you can fly , [brave knight]2339-brave knight , and show the writing to [Clarence]131-clarence , and tell [him]131-clarence to have these required matters in [the Valley of Holiness]2262-the valley of holiness with all possible dispatch . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i will well , [Sir Boss]231-the boss , ” and [he]0-i was off . CHAPTER XXII [THE HOLY FOUNTAIN]5193-the holy fountain [The pilgrims]5194-the pilgrims were [human beings]858-human beings . Otherwise [they]5194-the pilgrims would have acted differently . [They]5194-the pilgrims had come a long and difficult journey , and now when the journey was nearly finished , and [they]5194-the pilgrims learned that the main thing [they]5194-the pilgrims had come for had ceased to exist , [they]5194-the pilgrims did n't do as horses or cats or angle - worms would probably have done -- turn back and get at something profitable -- no , anxious as [they]5194-the pilgrims had before been to see [the miraculous fountain]5196-the miraculous fountain , [they]5194-the pilgrims were as much as forty times as anxious now to see the place where [it]5196-the miraculous fountain had used to be . There is no accounting for [human beings]858-human beings . [We]5198-we made good time ; and a couple of hours before sunset [we]5198-we stood upon [the high confines of [the Valley of Holiness]44-the valley of holiness]5199-the high confines of the valley of holiness , and [our]5198-we eyes swept [it]5199-the high confines of the valley of holiness from end to end and noted [its]5199-the high confines of the valley of holiness features . That is , [its]5199-the high confines of the valley of holiness large features . These were the three masses of [buildings]5200-buildings . [They]5201-they were distant and isolated temporalities shrunken to toy constructions in [the lonely waste of what seemed a desert -- and was]5202-the lonely waste of what seemed a desert -- and was . Such a scene is always mournful , [it]5199-the high confines of the valley of holiness is so impressively still , and looks so steeped in death . But there was a sound here which interrupted the stillness only to add to its mournfulness ; this was the faint far sound of tolling bells which floated fitfully to [us]5198-we on the passing breeze , and so faintly , so softly , that [we]5198-we hardly knew whether [we]5198-we heard it with [our]5198-we ears or with [our]5198-we spirits . [We]5198-we reached [the monastery]2292-the monastery before dark , and there [the males]5204-the males were given lodging , but [the women]472-the women were sent over to [the nunnery]5206-the nunnery . The bells were close at hand now , and their solemn booming smote upon the ear like a message of doom . A superstitious despair possessed the heart of [every monk]5207-every monk and published itself in [his]5207-every monk ghastly face . Everywhere , [these black - robed , soft - sandaled , tallow - visaged specters]5208-these black - robed , soft - sandaled , tallow - visaged specters appeared , flitted about and disappeared , noiseless as [the creatures of a troubled dream , and as uncanny]5209-the creatures of a troubled dream , and as uncanny . [The old abbot]5210-the old abbot 's joy to see [me]231-the boss was pathetic . Even to tears ; but [he]5210-the old abbot did the shedding [himself]5210-the old abbot . [He]5210-the old abbot said : “[231-the boss] Delay not , [son]2341-son , but get to [thy]2342-thy saving work . An [we]2343-we bring not the water back again , and soon , [we]2343-we are ruined , and the good work of two hundred years must end . And see [thou]2342-thy do it with enchantments that be holy , for [the Church]900-the church will not endure that work in [her]900-the church cause be done by devil 's magic . ” “[134-merlin] When [I]0-i work , [Father]5183-father , be sure there will be [no devil]2346-no devil 's work connected with it . [I]0-i shall use no arts that come of [the devil]2347-the devil , and no elements not created by the hand of [God]121-god . But is [Merlin]134-merlin working strictly on pious lines ? ” “[134-merlin] Ah , [he]134-merlin said [he]134-merlin would , [[my]0-i son]2348-my son , [he]134-merlin said [he]134-merlin would , and took oath to make [his]134-merlin promise good . ” “[134-merlin] Well , in that case , let [him]134-merlin proceed . ” “[134-merlin] But surely [you]0-i will not sit idle by , but help ? ” “[2349-it] [It]2349-it will not answer to mix methods , [Father]243-father ; neither would it be professional courtesy . Two of a trade must not underbid [each other]1058-each other . [We]2351-we might as well cut rates and be done with it ; it would arrive at that in the end . [Merlin]134-merlin has the contract ; [no other magician]2352-no other magician can touch it till [he]134-merlin throws it up . ” “[134-merlin] But [I]0-i will take it from [him]134-merlin ; it is a terrible emergency and the act is thereby justified . And if it were not so , who will give law to [the Church]900-the church ? [The Church]18-the church giveth law to [all]366-all ; and what [she]2355-she wills to do , that [she]2355-she may do , hurt whom it may . [I]0-i will take it from [him]134-merlin ; [you]243-father shall begin upon the moment . ” “[243-father] It may not be , [Father]243-father . No doubt , as [you]243-father say , where power is supreme , [one]434-one can do as [one]434-one likes and suffer no injury ; but [we]2351-we [poor magicians]2358-poor magicians are not so situated . [Merlin]134-merlin is [a very good magician]2359-a very good magician in a small way , and has quite a neat provincial reputation . [He]134-merlin is struggling along , doing the best [he]134-merlin can , and it would not be etiquette for [me]0-i to take [his]134-merlin job until [he]134-merlin [himself]134-merlin abandons it . ” [The abbot]5211-the abbot 's face lighted . “[134-merlin] Ah , that is simple . There are ways to persuade [him]134-merlin to abandon it . ” “[5183-father] No - no , [Father]5183-father , it skills not , as [these people]551-these people say . If [he]134-merlin were persuaded against [his]134-merlin will , [he]134-merlin would load that well with a malicious enchantment which would balk [me]0-i until [I]0-i found out its secret . It might take a month . [I]0-i could set up a little enchantment of [mine]0-i which [I]0-i call the telephone , and [he]134-merlin could not find out its secret in a hundred years . Yes , [you]5183-father perceive , [he]134-merlin might block [me]0-i for a month . Would [you]5183-father like to risk a month in a dry time like this ? ” “[5183-father] A month ! The mere thought of it maketh [me]0-i to shudder . Have it [thy]2362-thy way , [[my]0-i son]2348-my son . But [my]0-i heart is heavy with this disappointment . Leave [me]0-i , and let [me]0-i wear [my]0-i spirit with weariness and waiting , even as [I]0-i have done these ten long days , counterfeiting thus the thing that is called rest , the prone body making outward sign of repose where inwardly is none . ” Of course , it would have been best , all round , for [Merlin]134-merlin to waive etiquette and quit and call it half a day , since [he]134-merlin would never be able to start that water , for [he]134-merlin was [a true magician of the time]5212-a true magician of the time ; which is to say , the big miracles , the ones that gave [him]134-merlin [his]134-merlin reputation , always had the luck to be performed when nobody but [Merlin]134-merlin was present ; [he]134-merlin could n't start this well with all [this crowd around to see]5213-this crowd around to see ; [a crowd]5214-a crowd was as bad for [a magician]4535-a magician 's miracle in that day as it was for [a spiritualist]5216-a spiritualist 's miracle in [mine]5217-mine ; there was sure to be [some skeptic on hand to turn up the gas at the crucial moment and spoil everything]5218-some skeptic on hand to turn up the gas at the crucial moment and spoil everything . But [I]0-i did not want [Merlin]134-merlin to retire from the job until [I]0-i was ready to take hold of it effectively [myself]0-i ; and [I]0-i could not do that until [I]0-i got [my]0-i things from [Camelot]7-camelot , and that would take two or three days . [My]0-i presence gave [the monks]2330-the monks hope , and cheered [them]2330-the monks up a good deal ; insomuch that [they]2330-the monks ate a square meal that night for the first time in ten days . As soon as [their]2330-the monks stomachs had been properly reinforced with food , [their]2330-the monks spirits began to rise fast ; when the mead began to go round [they]2330-the monks rose faster . By the time [everybody]600-everybody was half - seas over , [the holy community]5221-the holy community was in good shape to make a night of it ; so [we]5222-we stayed by the board and put it through on that line . [Matters]244-matters got to be very jolly . Good old questionable stories were told that made the tears run down and cavernous mouths stand wide and the round bellies shake with laughter ; and questionable songs were bellowed out in a mighty chorus that drowned the boom of the tolling bells . At last [I]0-i ventured a story [myself]0-i ; and vast was the success of it . Not right off , of course , for [the native of [those islands]5224-those islands]5223-the native of those islands does not , as a rule , dissolve upon the early applications of a humorous thing ; but the fifth time [I]0-i told it , they began to crack in places ; the eight time [I]0-i told it , they began to crumble ; at the twelfth repetition they fell apart in chunks ; and at the fifteenth they disintegrated , and [I]0-i got a broom and swept them up . This language is figurative . [Those islanders]5225-those islanders -- well , [they]5225-those islanders are slow pay at first , in the matter of return for [your]5226-your investment of effort , but in the end [they]5225-those islanders make the pay of all other nations poor and small by contrast . [I]0-i was at the well next day betimes . [Merlin]134-merlin was there , enchanting away like a beaver , but not raising the moisture . [He]134-merlin was not in a pleasant humor ; and every time [I]0-i hinted that perhaps this contract was a shade too hefty for [a novice]5227-a novice [he]134-merlin unlimbered [his]134-merlin tongue and cursed like [a bishop]5228-a bishop -- [French bishop of the Regency days]5229-french bishop of the regency days , [I]0-i mean . Matters were about as [I]0-i expected to find [them]5225-those islanders . [The “[0-i] fountain ”]5230-the “ fountain ” was an ordinary well , [it]5230-the “ fountain ” had been dug in the ordinary way , and stoned up in the ordinary way . There was no miracle about it . Even the lie that had created [its]5230-the “ fountain ” reputation was not miraculous ; [I]0-i could have told it [myself]0-i , with one hand tied behind [me]0-i . [The well]5231-the well was in [a dark chamber which stood in the center of [a cut - stone chapel]5233-a cut - stone chapel , whose walls were hung with pious pictures of a workmanship that would have made a chromo feel good]5232-a dark chamber which stood in the center of a cut - stone chapel , whose walls were hung with pious pictures of a workmanship that would have made a chromo feel good ; pictures historically commemorative of curative miracles which had been achieved by [the waters]5234-the waters when [nobody]476-nobody was looking . That is , [nobody]476-nobody but [angels]5237-angels ; [they]5237-angels are always on [deck]5238-deck when there is a miracle to the fore -- so as to get put in the picture , perhaps . [Angels]5237-angels are as fond of that as [a fire company]5240-a fire company ; look at [the old masters]5241-the old masters . [The well - chamber]5242-the well - chamber was dimly lighted by lamps ; the water was drawn with a windlass and chain by [monks]4691-monks , and poured into troughs which delivered it into stone reservoirs outside in [the chapel]5244-the chapel -- when there was water to draw , [I]0-i mean -- and [none but [monks]4691-monks]5245-none but monks could enter [the well - chamber]5242-the well - chamber . [I]0-i entered [it]5242-the well - chamber , for [I]0-i had temporary authority to do so , by courtesy of [[my]0-i professional brother]5248-my professional brother and [subordinate]5249-subordinate . But [he]5248-my professional brother had n't entered it [himself]5248-my professional brother . [He]5248-my professional brother did everything by incantations ; [he]5248-my professional brother never worked [his]5248-my professional brother intellect . If [he]5248-my professional brother had stepped in [there]4491-there and used [his]5248-my professional brother eyes , instead of [his]5248-my professional brother disordered mind , [he]5248-my professional brother could have cured the well by natural means , and then turned it into a miracle in the customary way ; but no , [he]5248-my professional brother was [an old numskull]5251-an old numskull , [a magician who believed in [his]5248-my professional brother own magic]5252-a magician who believed in his own magic ; and [no magician]5253-no magician can thrive who is [handicapped with a superstition like that]5254-handicapped with a superstition like that . [I]0-i had an idea that the well had sprung a leak ; that some of the wall stones near the bottom had fallen and exposed fissures that allowed the water to escape . [I]0-i measured the chain--98 feet . Then [I]0-i called in [a couple of [monks]4691-monks]5255-a couple of monks , locked the door , took a candle , and made [them]5255-a couple of monks lower [me]0-i in the bucket . When the chain was all paid out , the candle confirmed [my]0-i suspicion ; a considerable section of the wall was gone , exposing a good big fissure . [I]0-i almost regretted that [my]0-i theory about the well 's trouble was correct , because [I]0-i had another one that had a showy point or two about it for a miracle . [I]0-i remembered that in [America]19-america , many centuries later , when an oil well ceased to flow , [they]5255-a couple of monks used to blast it out with a dynamite torpedo . If [I]0-i should find this well dry and no explanation of it , [I]0-i could astonish [these people]551-these people most nobly by having [a person of no especial value]5258-a person of no especial value drop a dynamite bomb into it . It was [my]0-i idea to appoint [Merlin]134-merlin . However , it was plain that there was no occasion for the bomb . [One]434-one can not have everything the way [he]434-one would like it . [A man]518-a man has no business to be depressed by a disappointment , anyway ; [he]518-a man ought to make up [his]518-a man mind to get even . That is what [I]0-i did . [I]0-i said to [myself]0-i , [I]0-i am in no hurry , [I]0-i can wait ; that bomb will come good yet . And it did , too . When [I]0-i was above ground again , [I]0-i turned out [the monks]2330-the monks , and let down a fish - line ; the well was a hundred and fifty feet deep , and there was forty - one feet of water in it . [I]0-i called in [a monk]722-a monk and asked : “[0-i] How deep is the well ? ” “[0-i] That , [sir]367-sir , [I]0-i wit not , having never been told . ” “[0-i] How does the water usually stand in it ? ” “[0-i] Near to the top , these two centuries , as the testimony goeth , brought down to [us]2365-us through [[our]2365-us predecessors]2366-our predecessors . ” It was true -- as to recent times at least -- for there was witness to it , and better witness than [a monk]722-a monk ; only about twenty or thirty feet of the chain showed wear and use , the rest of it was unworn and rusty . What had happened when the well gave out that other time ? Without doubt [some practical person]5264-some practical person had come along and mended the leak , and then had come up and told [the abbot]5211-the abbot [he]5264-some practical person had discovered by divination that if the sinful bath were destroyed the well would flow again . The leak had befallen again now , and [these children]5266-these children would have prayed , and processioned , and tolled [their]5266-these children bells for heavenly succor till [they]5266-these children all dried up and blew away , and [no innocent of [them]5266-these children all]5267-no innocent of them all would ever have thought to drop a fish - line into the well or go down in it and find out what was really the matter . Old habit of mind is one of the toughest things to get away from in [the world]374-the world . It transmits itself like physical form and feature ; and for [a man]518-a man , in those days , to have had an idea that [[his]518-a man ancestors]5270-his ancestors had n't had , would have brought [him]518-a man under suspicion of being illegitimate . [I]0-i said to [the monk]735-the monk : “[0-i] It is a difficult miracle to restore water in [a dry well]2367-a dry well , but [we]2365-us will try , if [[my]0-i brother]2368-my brother [Merlin]134-merlin fails . [Brother Merlin]245-merlin is [a very passable artist , but only in the parlor - magic line]2369-a very passable artist , but only in the parlor - magic line , and [he]134-merlin may not succeed ; in fact , is not likely to succeed . But that should be nothing to [his]134-merlin discredit ; [the man that can do _ this _ kind of miracle]2370-the man that can do _ this _ kind of miracle knows enough to keep hotel . ” “[2370-the man that can do _ this _ kind of miracle] [Hotel]2371-hotel ? [I]0-i mind not to have heard-- ” “[2370-the man that can do _ this _ kind of miracle] Of [hotel]2371-hotel ? It 's what [you]0-i call [hostel]2373-hostel . [The man that can do this miracle]2374-the man that can do this miracle can keep [hostel]2373-hostel . [I]0-i can do this miracle ; [I]0-i shall do this miracle ; yet [I]0-i do not try to conceal from [you]0-i that it is a miracle to tax the occult powers to the last strain . ” “[557-none] [None]557-none knoweth that truth better than [the brotherhood]2377-the brotherhood , indeed ; for it is of record that aforetime it was parlous difficult and took a year . [Natheless]246-natheless , [God]121-god send [you]0-i good success , and to that end will [we]2378-we pray . ” As a matter of business it was a good idea to get the notion around that the thing was difficult . Many a small thing has been made large by the right kind of advertising . [That monk]5272-that monk was filled up with the difficulty of this enterprise ; [he]5272-that monk would fill up the others . In two days the solicitude would be booming . On [my]0-i way [home]619-home at noon , [I]0-i met [Sandy]199-sandy . [She]199-sandy had been sampling [the hermits]5274-the hermits . [I]0-i said : “[0-i] [I]0-i would like to do that [myself]0-i . This is Wednesday . Is there a matinee ? ” “[0-i] A which , please [you]0-i , [sir]367-sir ? ” “[0-i] Matinee . Do [they]2380-they keep open afternoons ? ” “[2380-they] Who ? ” “[5274-the hermits] [The hermits]5274-the hermits , of course . ” “[5274-the hermits] Keep open ? ” “[5274-the hermits] Yes , keep open . Is n't that plain enough ? Do [they]2380-they knock off at noon ? ” “[2380-they] Knock off ? ” “[2380-they] Knock off?--yes , knock off . What is the matter with knock off ? [I]0-i never saw such a dunderhead ; ca n't [you]0-i understand anything at all ? [You]0-i ca n't seem to understand the simplest thing . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i would [I]0-i might please [thee]0-i , [sir]367-sir , and it is to [me]0-i dole and sorrow that [I]0-i fail , albeit sith [I]0-i am but [a simple damsel and taught of none]2385-a simple damsel and taught of none , being from [the cradle unbaptized in those deep waters of learning]2386-the cradle unbaptized in those deep waters of learning that do anoint with a sovereignty [him]0-i that partaketh of that most noble sacrament , investing [him]0-i with reverend state to the mental eye of [the humble mortal who , by bar and lack of that great consecration]2387-the humble mortal who , by bar and lack of that great consecration seeth in [his]2387-the humble mortal who , by bar and lack of that great consecration own unlearned estate but a symbol of that other sort of lack and loss which [men]508-men do publish to [the pitying eye with sackcloth trappings whereon the ashes of grief]2389-the pitying eye with sackcloth trappings whereon the ashes of grief do lie bepowdered and bestrewn , and so , when such shall in the darkness of [his]0-i mind encounter these golden phrases of high mystery , these shut -
