It was not fair to spring those nineteenth century technicalities upon the untutored infant of the sixth and then rail at [her]5275-she because [she]5275-she could n't get [their]5276-their drift ; and when [she]5275-she was making the honest best drive at it [she]5275-she could , too , and no fault of [hers]5275-she that [she]5275-she could n't fetch the home plate ; and so [I]2390-i apologized . Then [we]5277-we meandered pleasantly away toward the hermit holes in sociable converse together , and [better friends]5278-better friends than ever . [I]2390-i was gradually coming to have a mysterious and shuddery reverence for [this girl]1277-this girl ; nowadays whenever [she]5275-she pulled out from [the station]5280-the station and got [[her]5275-she train]5045-her train fairly started on one of those horizonless transcontinental sentences of [hers]5275-she , it was borne in upon [me]2390-i that [I]2390-i was standing in the awful presence of [the Mother of the German Language]5282-the mother of the german language . [I]2390-i was so impressed with this , that sometimes when [she]5275-she began to empty one of these sentences on [me]2390-i [I]2390-i unconsciously took the very attitude of reverence , and stood uncovered ; and if words had been water , [I]2390-i had been drowned , sure . [She]5275-she had exactly the German way ; whatever was in [her]5275-she mind to be delivered , whether a mere remark , or a sermon , or a cyclopedia , or the history of a war , [she]5275-she would get it into a single sentence or die . Whenever the literary German dives into a sentence , that is the last [you]5283-you are going to see of [him]5284-him till [he]5284-him emerges on the other side of [his]5284-him Atlantic with [his]5284-him verb in [his]5284-him mouth . [We]5285-we drifted from [hermit]5286-hermit to [hermit]5286-hermit all the afternoon . It was a most strange menagerie . The chief emulation among [them]5285-we seemed to be , to see which could manage to be [the uncleanest and most prosperous with vermin]5288-the uncleanest and most prosperous with vermin . [Their]5285-we manner and attitudes were the last expression of complacent self - righteousness . It was [one anchorite]5289-one anchorite 's pride to lie naked in the mud and let the insects bite [him]5284-him and blister [him]5284-him unmolested ; it was another 's to lean against a rock , all day long , conspicuous to the admiration of [the throng of pilgrims]5290-the throng of pilgrims and pray ; it was another 's to go naked and crawl around on all fours ; it was another 's to drag about with [him]5284-him , year in and year out , eighty pounds of iron ; it was another 's to never lie down when [he]5284-him slept , but to stand among the thorn - bushes and snore when there were [pilgrims around to look]5291-pilgrims around to look ; [a woman , who had the white hair of age , and no other apparel]5292-a woman , who had the white hair of age , and no other apparel , was black from crown to heel with forty - seven years of holy abstinence from water . [Groups of gazing pilgrims]5293-groups of gazing pilgrims stood around all and every of these strange objects , lost in reverent wonder , and envious of the fleckless sanctity which these pious austerities had won for [them]5285-we from [an exacting heaven]5294-an exacting heaven . By and by [we]5285-we went to see one of [the supremely great ones]5295-the supremely great ones . [He]5284-him was [a mighty celebrity]5296-a mighty celebrity ; [his]5284-him fame had penetrated all [Christendom]45-christendom ; [the noble]2009-the noble and [the renowned]5298-the renowned journeyed from [the remotest lands on [the globe]5300-the globe]5299-the remotest lands on the globe to pay [him]5284-him reverence . [[His]5284-him stand]5301-his stand was in the center of [the widest part of [the valley]2078-the valley]5302-the widest part of the valley ; and it took all that space to hold [his]5284-him crowds . [His]5284-him stand was a pillar sixty feet high , with a broad platform on the top of it . [He]5284-him was now doing what [he]5284-him had been doing every day for twenty years up there -- bowing [his]5284-him body ceaselessly and rapidly almost to [his]5284-him feet . It was [his]5284-him way of praying . [I]2390-i timed [him]5284-him with a stop watch , and [he]5284-him made 1,244 revolutions in 24 minutes and 46 seconds . It seemed a pity to have all this power going to waste . It was one of the most useful motions in mechanics , the pedal movement ; so [I]2390-i made a note in [my]2390-i memorandum book , purposing some day to apply a system of elastic cords to [him]5284-him and run a sewing machine with it . [I]2390-i afterward carried out that scheme , and got five years ' good service out of [him]5284-him ; in which time [he]5284-him turned out upward of eighteen thousand first - rate tow - linen shirts , which was ten a day . [I]2390-i worked [him]5284-him Sundays and all ; [he]5284-him was going , Sundays , the same as week days , and it was no use to waste the power . These shirts cost [me]2390-i nothing but just the mere trifle for the materials -- [I]2390-i furnished those [myself]2390-i , it would not have been right to make [him]5284-him do that -- and they sold like smoke to [pilgrims]5099-pilgrims at a dollar and a half apiece , which was the price of fifty cows or a blooded race horse in [Arthurdom]46-arthurdom . [They]5305-they were regarded as a perfect protection against sin , and advertised as such by [[my]2390-i knights]1591-my knights everywhere , with the paint - pot and stencil - plate ; insomuch that there was not a cliff or a boulder or a dead wall in [England]1-england but [you]5307-you could read on it at a mile distance : “[2390-i] Buy [the only genuine St. Stylite]2393-the only genuine st. stylite ; patronized by [the Nobility]1645-the nobility . Patent applied for . ” There was more money in the business than [one]434-one knew what to do with . As it extended , [I]2395-partner brought out a line of goods suitable for [kings]339-kings , and a nobby thing for [duchesses]5310-duchesses and that sort , with ruffles down the forehatch and the running - gear clewed up with a featherstitch to leeward and then hauled aft with a back - stay and triced up with a half - turn in the standing rigging forward of the weather - gaskets . Yes , it was a daisy . But about that time [I]2395-partner noticed that the motive power had taken to standing on one leg , and [I]2395-partner found that there was something the matter with the other one ; so [I]2395-partner stocked [the business]5311-the business and unloaded , taking [Sir Bors de Ganis]113-sir bors de ganis into [camp]2174-camp financially along with [certain of [[his]113-sir bors de ganis friends]1032-his friends]5313-certain of his friends ; for the works stopped within a year , and [the good saint]5315-the good saint got [him]113-sir bors de ganis to [his]113-sir bors de ganis rest . But [he]113-sir bors de ganis had earned it . [I]2395-partner can say that for [him]113-sir bors de ganis . When [I]2395-partner saw [him]113-sir bors de ganis that first time -- however , [his]113-sir bors de ganis personal condition will not quite bear description here . [You]5316-you can read it in the Lives of [the Saints]5317-the saints . * [ * All the details concerning [the hermits]5274-the hermits , in this chapter , are from [Lecky]47-lecky -- but greatly modified . This book not being a history but only a tale , the majority of [the historian]5319-the historian 's frank details were too strong for reproduction in it.--_Editor _ ] CHAPTER XXIII RESTORATION OF THE FOUNTAIN Saturday noon [I]2395-partner went to the well and looked on a while . [Merlin]134-merlin was still burning smoke - powders , and pawing the air , and muttering gibberish as hard as ever , but looking pretty down - hearted , for of course [he]134-merlin had not started even a perspiration in that well yet . Finally [I]2395-partner said : “[2395-partner] How does the thing promise by this time , [partner]2395-partner ? ” “[2395-partner] Behold , [I]0-i am even now busied with trial of the powerfulest enchantment known to [the princes of the occult arts]2396-the princes of the occult arts in [the lands of [the East]48-the east]2397-the lands of the east ; an it fail [me]0-i , naught can avail . Peace , until [I]0-i finish . ” [He]134-merlin raised a smoke this time that darkened all [the region]5320-the region , and must have made matters uncomfortable for [the hermits]5274-the hermits , for the wind was [their]5274-the hermits way , and it rolled down over [[their]5274-the hermits dens]5322-their dens in a dense and billowy fog . [He]134-merlin poured out volumes of speech to match , and contorted [his]134-merlin body and sawed the air with [his]134-merlin hands in a most extraordinary way . At the end of twenty minutes [he]134-merlin dropped down panting , and about exhausted . Now arrived [the abbot]5211-the abbot and [several hundred monks]5324-several hundred monks and [nuns]2293-nuns , and behind [them]5274-the hermits [a multitude of [pilgrims]5099-pilgrims and a couple of acres of foundlings]5326-a multitude of pilgrims and a couple of acres of foundlings , all drawn by the prodigious smoke , and all in a grand state of excitement . [The abbot]5211-the abbot inquired anxiously for results . [Merlin]134-merlin said : “[0-i] If any labor of mortal might break the spell that binds these waters , this which [I]0-i have but just essayed had done it . It has failed ; whereby [I]0-i do now know that that which [I]0-i had feared is a truth established ; the sign of this failure is , that the most potent spirit known to [the magicians of [the East]2399-the east]2398-the magicians of the east , and whose name [none may utter and live]2400-none may utter and live , has laid [his]0-i spell upon this well . [The mortal]2401-the mortal does not breathe , nor ever will , who can penetrate the secret of that spell , and without that secret none can break it . The water will flow no more forever , good [Father]243-father . [I]0-i have done what [man]4450-man could . Suffer [me]0-i to go . ” Of course this threw [the abbot]5211-the abbot into a good deal of a consternation . [He]5211-the abbot turned to [me]0-i with the signs of it in [his]5211-the abbot face , and said : “[0-i] [Ye]2403-ye have heard [him]0-i . Is it true ? ” “[0-i] Part of it is . ” “[0-i] Not all , then , not all ! What part is true ? ” “[0-i] That that spirit with the Russian name has put [his]0-i spell upon the well . ” “[0-i] [God]121-god 's wounds , then are [we]2404-we ruined ! ” “[2403-ye] Possibly . ” “[2403-ye] But not certainly ? [Ye]2403-ye mean , not certainly ? ” “[2403-ye] That is it . ” “[2403-ye] Wherefore , [ye]2403-ye also mean that when [he]0-i saith [none]557-none can break the spell-- ” “[0-i] Yes , when [he]0-i says that , [he]0-i says what is n't necessarily true . There are conditions under which an effort to break it may have some chance -- that is , some small , some trifling chance -- of success . ” “[0-i] The conditions-- ” “[0-i] Oh , they are nothing difficult . Only these : [I]0-i want [the well]5231-the well and [the surroundings]2407-the surroundings for the space of half a mile , entirely to [myself]0-i from sunset to - day until [I]0-i remove the ban -- and [nobody]476-nobody allowed to cross the ground but by [my]0-i authority . ” “[0-i] Are these all ? ” “[0-i] Yes . ” “[0-i] And [you]0-i have no fear to try ? ” “[0-i] Oh , none . [One]434-one may fail , of course ; and [one]434-one may also succeed . [One]247-one can try , and [I]0-i am ready to chance it . [I]0-i have [my]0-i conditions ? ” “[0-i] These and all others [ye]2403-ye may name . [I]0-i will issue commandment to that effect . ” “[0-i] Wait , ” said [Merlin]134-merlin , with an evil smile . “[2403-ye] [Ye]2403-ye wit that [he]0-i that would break this spell must know that spirit 's name ? ” “[0-i] Yes , [I]0-i know [his]0-i name . ” “[0-i] And wit [you]2403-ye also that to know it skills not of itself , but [ye]2403-ye must likewise pronounce it ? Ha - ha ! Knew [ye]2403-ye that ? ” “[0-i] Yes , [I]0-i knew that , too . ” “[0-i] [You]2403-ye had that knowledge ! [Art]2403-ye [a fool]4855-a fool ? Are [ye]2403-ye minded to utter that name and die ? ” “[2403-ye] Utter it ? Why certainly . [I]0-i would utter it if it was Welsh . ” “[0-i] [Ye]2403-ye are even [a dead man]2412-a dead man , then ; and [I]0-i go to tell [Arthur]116-arthur . ” “[0-i] That 's all right . Take [your]2403-ye gripsack and get along . The thing for _ [you]2403-ye _ to do is to go [home]619-home and work the weather , [John W. Merlin]248-merlin . ” It was a home shot , and it made [him]0-i wince ; for [he]0-i was the worst weather - failure in [the kingdom]517-the kingdom . Whenever [he]0-i ordered up the danger - signals along [the coast]5331-the coast there was a week 's dead calm , sure , and every time [he]0-i prophesied fair weather it rained brickbats . But [I]248-merlin kept [him]0-i in the weather bureau right along , to undermine [his]0-i reputation . However , that shot raised [his]0-i bile , and instead of starting [home]619-home to report [my]248-merlin death , [he]0-i said [he]0-i would remain and enjoy it . [[My]248-merlin two experts]5333-my two experts arrived in the evening , and pretty well fagged , for [they]5333-my two experts had traveled double tides . [They]5333-my two experts had pack - mules along , and had brought everything [I]248-merlin needed -- tools , pump , lead pipe , Greek fire , sheaves of big rockets , roman candles , colored fire sprays , electric apparatus , and a lot of sundries -- everything necessary for the stateliest kind of a miracle . [They]5333-my two experts got [their]5333-my two experts supper and a nap , and about midnight [we]5334-we sallied out through [a solitude so wholly vacant and complete that [it]5335-a solitude so wholly vacant and complete that it quite overpassed the required conditions quite overpassed the required conditions]5335-a solitude so wholly vacant and complete that it quite overpassed the required conditions . [We]5334-we took possession of [the well]5231-the well and [its]5231-the well surroundings . [[My]248-merlin boys]5337-my boys were experts in all sorts of things , from the stoning up of [a well]5338-a well to the constructing of a mathematical instrument . An hour before sunrise [we]5334-we had that leak mended in ship - shape fashion , and the water began to rise . Then [we]5334-we stowed [our]5334-we fireworks in [the chapel]5244-the chapel , locked up [the place]448-the place , and went [home]619-home to bed . Before the noon mass was over , [we]5334-we were at [the well]5231-the well again ; for there was a deal to do yet , and [I]248-merlin was determined to spring the miracle before midnight , for business reasons : for whereas a miracle worked for [the Church]900-the church on a week - day is worth a good deal , it is worth six times as much if [you]5344-you get it in on a Sunday . In nine hours the water had risen to its customary level -- that is to say , it was within twenty - three feet of the top . [We]5334-we put in a little iron pump , one of the first turned out by [[my]248-merlin works near [the capital]5346-the capital]5345-my works near the capital ; [we]5334-we bored into a stone reservoir which stood against the outer wall of [the well - chamber]5242-the well - chamber and inserted a section of lead pipe that was long enough to reach to the door of [the chapel]5244-the chapel and project beyond the threshold , where the gushing water would be visible to the two hundred and fifty acres of [people]357-people [I]248-merlin was intending should be present on [the flat plain in front of [this little holy hillock]5351-this little holy hillock]5350-the flat plain in front of this little holy hillock at the proper time . [We]5334-we knocked the head out of [an empty hogshead]5352-an empty hogshead and hoisted this hogshead to the flat roof of [the chapel]5244-the chapel , where [we]5334-we clamped it down fast , poured in gunpowder till it lay loosely an inch deep on the bottom , then [we]5334-we stood up rockets in the hogshead as thick as they could loosely stand , all the different breeds of rockets there are ; and they made a portly and imposing sheaf , [I]248-merlin can tell [you]5344-you . [We]5334-we grounded the wire of a pocket electrical battery in that powder , [we]5334-we placed a whole magazine of Greek fire on each corner of the roof -- blue on one corner , green on another , red on another , and purple on the last -- and grounded a wire in each . About two hundred yards off , in [the flat]5354-the flat , [we]5334-we built a pen of scantlings , about four feet high , and laid planks on it , and so made a platform . [We]5334-we covered [it]5354-the flat with swell tapestries borrowed for the occasion , and topped it off with [the abbot]5211-the abbot 's own throne . When [you]5344-you are going to do a miracle for [an ignorant race]5356-an ignorant race , [you]5344-you want to get in every detail that will count ; [you]5344-you want to make all the properties impressive to the public eye ; [you]5344-you want to make matters comfortable for [[your]5344-you head guest]5357-your head guest ; then [you]5344-you can turn [yourself]5344-you loose and play [your]5344-you effects for all they are worth . [I]248-merlin know the value of these things , for [I]248-merlin know human nature . [You]5344-you ca n't throw too much style into a miracle . It costs trouble , and work , and sometimes money ; but it pays in the end . Well , [we]5334-we brought the wires to the ground at [the chapel]5244-the chapel , and then brought them under the ground to [the platform]5359-the platform , and hid the batteries there . [We]5334-we put a rope fence a hundred feet square around [the platform]5359-the platform to keep off [the common multitude]5361-the common multitude , and that finished the work . [My]248-merlin idea was , doors open at 10:30 , performance to begin at 11:25 sharp . [I]248-merlin wished [I]248-merlin could charge admission , but of course that would n't answer . [I]248-merlin instructed [[my]248-merlin boys]5337-my boys to be in [the chapel]5244-the chapel as early as 10 , before [anybody]553-anybody was around , and be ready to man the pumps at the proper time , and make the fur fly . Then [we]5334-we went [home]619-home to supper . The news of the disaster to the well had traveled far by this time ; and now for two or three days a steady avalanche of [people]357-people had been pouring into [the valley]2078-the valley . [The lower end of [the valley]2078-the valley]5368-the lower end of the valley was become [one huge camp]5370-one huge camp ; [we]5334-we should have [a good house]5371-a good house , no question about that . [Criers]249-criers went the rounds early in the evening and announced the coming attempt , which put every pulse up to fever heat . [They]249-criers gave notice that [the abbot]5211-the abbot and [[his]5211-the abbot official suite]5373-his official suite would move in state and occupy [the platform]5359-the platform at 10:30 , up to which time [all the region which was under [my]248-merlin ban]5375-all the region which was under my ban must be clear ; the bells would then cease from tolling , and this sign should be permission to [the multitudes]5376-the multitudes to close in and take [their]5376-the multitudes places . [I]248-merlin was at [the platform]5359-the platform and all ready to do the honors when [the abbot]5211-the abbot 's solemn procession hove in sight -- which it did not do till it was nearly to the rope fence , because it was a starless black night and no torches permitted . With it came [Merlin]248-merlin , and took a front seat on [the platform]5359-the platform ; [he]5211-the abbot was as good as [his]5211-the abbot word for once . [One]434-one could not see [the multitudes banked together beyond the ban]5381-the multitudes banked together beyond the ban , but [they]5376-the multitudes were there , just the same . The moment the bells stopped , those banked masses broke and poured over the line like a vast black wave , and for as much as a half hour it continued to flow , and then it solidified itself , and [you]5382-you could have walked upon a pavement of human heads to -- well , miles . [We]5383-we had a solemn stage - wait , now , for about twenty minutes -- a thing [I]248-merlin had counted on for effect ; it is always good to let [[your]5382-you audience]5384-your audience have a chance to work up its expectancy . At length , out of the silence a noble Latin chant -- [men]508-men 's voices -- broke and swelled up and rolled away into the night , a majestic tide of melody . [I]248-merlin had put that up , too , and it was one of the best effects [I]248-merlin ever invented . When it was finished [I]248-merlin stood up on the platform and extended [my]248-merlin hands abroad , for two minutes , with [my]248-merlin face uplifted -- that always produces a dead hush -- and then slowly pronounced this ghastly word with a kind of awfulness which caused [hundreds]5386-hundreds to tremble , and [many women]5387-many women to faint : “[248-merlin] Constantinopolitanischerdudelsackspfeifenmachersgesellschafft ! ” Just as [I]248-merlin was moaning out the closing hunks of that word , [I]248-merlin touched off one of [my]248-merlin electric connections and all that murky world of [people]357-people stood revealed in a hideous blue glare ! It was immense --that effect ! [Lots of [people]357-people]5389-lots of people shrieked , [women]532-women curled up and quit in every direction , [foundlings]5392-foundlings collapsed by [platoons]5393-platoons . [The abbot]5211-the abbot and [the monks]2330-the monks crossed [themselves]2330-the monks nimbly and [their]2330-the monks lips fluttered with agitated prayers . [Merlin]248-merlin held [his]5211-the abbot grip , but [he]5211-the abbot was astonished clear down to [his]5211-the abbot corns ; [he]5211-the abbot had never seen anything to begin with that , before . Now was the time to pile in the effects . [I]248-merlin lifted [my]248-merlin hands and groaned out this word -- as it were in agony : “[248-merlin] Nihilistendynamittheaterkaestchenssprengungsattentaetsversuchungen ! ” --and turned on the red fire ! [You]5396-you should have heard [that Atlantic of [people]357-people]5397-that atlantic of people moan and howl when that crimson hell joined the blue ! After sixty seconds [I]248-merlin shouted : “[248-merlin] Transvaaltruppentropentransporttrampelthiertreibertrauungsthraenentrag- oedie ! ” --and lit up the green fire ! After waiting only forty seconds this time , [I]248-merlin spread [my]248-merlin arms abroad and thundered out the devastating syllables of this word of words : “[248-merlin] Mekkamuselmannenmassenmenchenmoerdermohrenmuttermarmormonumentenmacher ! ” --and whirled on the purple glare ! There [they]357-people were , all going at once , red , blue , green , purple!--four furious volcanoes pouring vast clouds of radiant smoke aloft , and spreading a blinding rainbowed noonday to the furthest confines of [that valley]5399-that valley . In the distance one could see [that fellow on the pillar standing rigid against the background of sky]5400-that fellow on the pillar standing rigid against the background of sky , [his]5400-that fellow on the pillar standing rigid against the background of sky seesaw stopped for the first time in twenty years . [I]248-merlin knew [the boys]1040-the boys were at the pump now and ready . So [I]248-merlin said to [the abbot]5211-the abbot : “[248-merlin] The time is come , [Father]243-father . [I]0-i am about to pronounce the dread name and command the spell to dissolve . [You]243-father want to brace up , and take hold of something . ” Then [I]135-lo shouted to [the people]753-the people : “[135-lo] Behold , in another minute the spell will be broken , or [no mortal]2414-no mortal can break it . If it break , [all]366-all will know it , for [you]366-all will see the sacred water gush from the chapel door ! ” [I]135-lo stood a few moments , to let [the hearers]5404-the hearers have a chance to spread [my]135-lo announcement to those who could n't hear , and so convey it to the furthest ranks , then [I]135-lo made a grand exhibition of extra posturing and gesturing , and shouted : “[135-lo] [Lo]135-lo , [I]0-i command the fell spirit that possesses the holy fountain to now disgorge into the skies all the infernal fires that still remain in [him]2416-it , and straightway dissolve [his]2416-it spell and flee hence to the pit , there to lie bound a thousand years . By [his]2416-it own dread name [I]0-i command it -- BGWJJILLIGKKK ! ” Then [I]0-i touched off the hogshead of rockets , and a vast fountain of dazzling lances of fire vomited itself toward the zenith with a hissing rush , and burst in mid - sky into a storm of flashing jewels ! One mighty groan of terror started up from [the massed people]5405-the massed people --then suddenly broke into a wild hosannah of joy -- for there , fair and plain in the uncanny glare , [they]5405-the massed people saw the freed water leaping forth ! [The old abbot]5210-the old abbot could not speak a word , for tears and the chokings in [his]5210-the old abbot throat ; without utterance of any sort , [he]5210-the old abbot folded [me]0-i in [his]5210-the old abbot arms and mashed [me]0-i . It was more eloquent than speech . And harder to get over , too , in [a country where there were really [no doctors that were worth a damaged nickel]5408-no doctors that were worth a damaged nickel]5407-a country where there were really no doctors that were worth a damaged nickel . [You]5409-you should have seen [those acres of [people]357-people]5410-those acres of people throw [themselves]5410-those acres of people down in that water and kiss it ; kiss it , and pet it , and fondle [it]2416-it , and talk to [it]2416-it as if it were alive , and welcome [it]2416-it back with the dear names [they]5405-the massed people gave [[their]5405-the massed people darlings]5412-their darlings , just as if it had been [a friend who was long gone away and lost]5413-a friend who was long gone away and lost , and was come [home]619-home again . Yes , it was pretty to see , and made [me]0-i think more of [them]5405-the massed people than [I]0-i had done before . [I]0-i sent [Merlin]248-merlin home on a shutter . [He]5415-he had caved in and gone down like a landslide when [I]0-i pronounced that fearful name , and had never come to since . [He]5415-he never had heard that name [before,--neither]250-before,--neither had [I]0-i -- but to [him]5415-he it was the right one . [Any jumble]5416-any jumble would have been the right one . [He]5415-he admitted , afterward , that [[that spirit]5417-that spirit 's own mother]5418-that spirit 's own mother could not have pronounced that name better than [I]0-i did . [He]5415-he never could understand how [I]0-i survived it , and [I]0-i did n't tell [him]5415-he . It is only young magicians that give away a secret like that . [Merlin]248-merlin spent three months working enchantments to try to find out the deep trick of how to pronounce that name and outlive it . But [he]5415-he did n't arrive . When [I]0-i started to [the chapel]5244-the chapel , [the populace]5420-the populace uncovered and fell back reverently to make a wide way for [me]0-i , as if [I]0-i had been some kind of [a superior being]5421-a superior being -- and [I]0-i was . [I]0-i was aware of that . [I]0-i took along a night shift of [monks]4691-monks , and taught [them]4691-monks the mystery of the pump , and set [them]4691-monks to work , for it was plain that [a good part of [the people out there]5424-the people out there]5423-a good part of the people out there were going to sit up with the water all night , consequently it was but right that [they]4691-monks should have all [they]4691-monks wanted of it . To [those monks]5425-those monks that pump was a good deal of a miracle itself , and [they]5425-those monks were full of wonder over it ; and of admiration , too , of the exceeding effectiveness of its performance . It was a great night , an immense night . There was reputation in it . [I]0-i could hardly get to sleep for glorying over it . CHAPTER XXIV [A RIVAL MAGICIAN]5426-a rival magician [My]0-i influence in [the Valley of Holiness]2262-the valley of holiness was something prodigious now . It seemed worth while to try to turn it to some valuable account . The thought came to [me]0-i the next morning , and was suggested by [my]0-i seeing [one of [[my]0-i knights who was in the soap line]5429-my knights who was in the soap line come riding in]5428-one of my knights who was in the soap line come riding in . According to history , [the monks of [this place]4515-this place]5430-the monks of this place two centuries before had been worldly minded enough to want to wash . It might be that there was a leaven of this unrighteousness still remaining . So [I]0-i sounded [a Brother]5432-a brother : “[0-i] Would n't [you]2417-you like a bath ? ” [He]5432-a brother shuddered at the thought -- the thought of the peril of it to the well -- but [he]5432-a brother said with feeling : “[434-one] [One]434-one needs not to ask that of [a poor body who has not known that blessed refreshment]2419-a poor body who has not known that blessed refreshment sith that [he]2419-a poor body who has not known that blessed refreshment was [a boy]2420-a boy . Would [God]121-god [I]0-i might wash [me]0-i ! but it may not be , [fair sir]4423-fair sir , tempt [me]0-i not ; it is forbidden . ” And then [he]5432-a brother sighed in such a sorrowful way that [I]121-god was resolved [he]5432-a brother should have at least one layer of [his]5432-a brother real estate removed , if it sized up [my]121-god whole influence and bankrupted the pile . So [I]121-god went to [the abbot]5211-the abbot and asked for a permit for [this Brother]5434-this brother . [He]5211-the abbot blenched at the idea -- [I]121-god do n't mean that [you]5211-the abbot could see [him]5432-a brother blench , for of course [you]5211-the abbot could n't see it without [you]5211-the abbot scraped [him]5432-a brother , and [I]121-god did n't care enough about it to scrape [him]5432-a brother , but [I]121-god knew the blench was there , just the same , and within a book - cover 's thickness of the surface , too -- blenched , and trembled . [He]5211-the abbot said : “[121-god] Ah , [son]2341-son , ask aught else [thou]2423-thou wilt , and it is thine , and freely granted out of a grateful heart -- but this , oh , this ! Would [you]2341-son drive away the blessed water again ? ” “[2341-son] No , [Father]243-father , [I]0-i will not drive it away . [I]0-i have mysterious knowledge which teaches [me]0-i that there was an error that other time when it was thought the institution of the bath banished the fountain . ” A large interest began to show up in [the old man]612-the old man 's face . “[0-i] [My]0-i knowledge informs [me]0-i that [the bath]2424-the bath was innocent of that misfortune , which was caused by quite another sort of sin . ” “[2426-this?--you] These are brave words -- but -- but right welcome , if they be true . ” “[2341-son] They are true , indeed . [Tarry]251-tarry not , tarry not , but go . ” [I]251-tarry and [[my]251-tarry boys]5337-my boys were at work , straight off . [The ruins of the old bath]5437-the ruins of the old bath were there yet in [the basement of [the monastery]2292-the monastery]5438-the basement of the monastery , not a stone missing . [They]5437-the ruins of the old bath had been left just so , all these lifetimes , and avoided with a pious fear , as things accursed . In two days [we]5440-we had it all done and the water in -- [a spacious pool of clear pure water that a body could swim in]5441-a spacious pool of clear pure water that a body could swim in . It was running water , too . It came in , and went out , through the ancient pipes . [The old abbot]5210-the old abbot kept [his]5210-the old abbot word , and was the first to try it . [He]5210-the old abbot went down black and shaky , leaving [the whole black community]5443-the whole black community above troubled and worried and full of bodings ; but [he]5210-the old abbot came back white and joyful , and the game was made ! another triumph scored . It was a good campaign that [we]5440-we made in [that Valley of Holiness]2313-that valley of holiness , and [I]251-tarry was very well satisfied , and ready to move on now , but [I]251-tarry struck a disappointment . [I]251-tarry caught a heavy cold , and it started up an old lurking rheumatism of [mine]251-tarry . Of course the rheumatism hunted up [my]251-tarry weakest place and located itself there . This was the place where [the abbot]5211-the abbot put [his]5211-the abbot arms about [me]251-tarry and mashed [me]251-tarry , what time [he]5211-the abbot was moved to testify [his]5211-the abbot gratitude to [me]251-tarry with an embrace . When at last [I]251-tarry got out , [I]251-tarry was a shadow . But [everybody]600-everybody was full of attentions and kindnesses , and these brought cheer back into [my]251-tarry life , and were the right medicine to help [a convalescent swiftly up toward health and strength]5447-a convalescent swiftly up toward health and strength again ; so [I]251-tarry gained fast . [Sandy]199-sandy was worn out with nursing ; so [I]251-tarry made up [my]251-tarry mind to turn out and go a cruise alone , leaving [her]199-sandy at [the nunnery]5206-the nunnery to rest up . [My]251-tarry idea was to disguise [myself]251-tarry as [a freeman of peasant degree]5449-a freeman of peasant degree and wander through [the country]420-the country a week or two on foot . This would give [me]251-tarry a chance to eat and lodge with [the lowliest and poorest class of [free citizens]5452-free citizens]5451-the lowliest and poorest class of free citizens on equal terms . There was no other way to inform [myself]251-tarry perfectly of [their]5451-the lowliest and poorest class of free citizens everyday life and the operation of the laws upon it . If [I]251-tarry went among [them]5451-the lowliest and poorest class of free citizens as [a gentleman]1956-a gentleman , there would be restraints and conventionalities which would shut [me]251-tarry out from [their]5451-the lowliest and poorest class of free citizens private joys and troubles , and [I]251-tarry should get no further than the outside shell . One morning [I]251-tarry was out on a long walk to get up muscle for [my]251-tarry trip , and had climbed the ridge which bordered [the northern extremity of [the valley]2078-the valley]5454-the northern extremity of the valley , when [I]251-tarry came upon [an artificial opening in the face of a low precipice]5456-an artificial opening in the face of a low precipice , and recognized [it]5456-an artificial opening in the face of a low precipice by [its]5456-an artificial opening in the face of a low precipice location as [a hermitage which had often been pointed out to [me]251-tarry from a distance]5457-a hermitage which had often been pointed out to me from a distance as [the den of [a hermit of]5459-a hermit of [high renown for dirt and austerity]5460-high renown for dirt and austerity]5458-the den of a hermit of high renown for dirt and austerity . [I]251-tarry knew [he]5459-a hermit of had lately been offered [a situation in [the Great Sahara]49-the great sahara]5461-a situation in the great sahara , where lions and sandflies made the hermit - life peculiarly attractive and difficult , and had gone to [Africa]50-africa to take possession , so [I]251-tarry thought [I]251-tarry would look in and see how the atmosphere of [this den]5462-this den agreed with [its]5462-this den reputation . [My]251-tarry surprise was great : [the place]448-the place was newly swept and scoured . Then there was another surprise . Back in the gloom of [the cavern]5464-the cavern [I]251-tarry heard the clink of a little bell , and then this exclamation : “[251-tarry] Hello Central ! Is this [you]2427-you , [Camelot?--Behold]252-camelot?--behold , [thou]2428-thou mayst glad [thy]2428-thou heart an [thou]2428-thou hast faith to believe the wonderful when that it cometh in unexpected guise and maketh itself manifest in impossible places -- here standeth in the flesh [his]2429-i mightiness [The Boss]1014-the boss , and with thine own ears shall [ye]2427-you hear [him]2429-i speak ! ” Now what a radical reversal of things this was ; what a jumbling together of extravagant incongruities ; what a fantastic conjunction of opposites and irreconcilables -- [the home of [the bogus miracle]5466-the bogus miracle]5465-the home of the bogus miracle become the home of [a real one]5467-a real one , [the den of [a mediaeval hermit]5469-a mediaeval hermit]5468-the den of a mediaeval hermit turned into [a telephone office]5470-a telephone office ! [The telephone clerk]5471-the telephone clerk stepped into the light , and [I]2429-i recognized [one of [[my]2429-i young fellows]5473-my young fellows]5472-one of my young fellows . [I]2429-i said : “[2429-i] How long has [this office]2431-this office been established here , [Ulfius]253-ulfius ? ” “[253-ulfius] But since midnight , fair Sir Boss , an it please [you]253-ulfius . [We]2432-we saw many lights in [the valley]2078-the valley , and so judged it well to make [a station]2434-a station , for that where so many lights be needs must [they]2435-they indicate [a town of goodly size]2436-a town of goodly size . ” “[2435-they] Quite right . [It]2437-it is n't [a town]2438-a town in the customary sense , but [it]2437-it ['s]2437-it [a good stand]2439-a good stand , anyway . Do [you]253-ulfius know where [you]253-ulfius are ? ” “[253-ulfius] Of that [I]0-i have had no time to make inquiry ; for whenas [[my]0-i comradeship]2440-my comradeship moved hence upon [their]2440-my comradeship labors , leaving [me]0-i in charge , [I]0-i got [me]0-i to needed rest , purposing to inquire when [I]0-i waked , and report the place 's name to [Camelot]7-camelot for record . ” “[0-i] Well , this is [the Valley of Holiness]2262-the valley of holiness . ” It did n't take ; [I]0-i mean , [he]0-i did n't start at the name , as [I]0-i had supposed [he]0-i would . [He]0-i merely said : “[0-i] [I]0-i will so report it . ” “[0-i] Why , [the surrounding regions]2442-the surrounding regions are filled with the noise of late wonders that have happened here ! [You]253-ulfius did n't hear of [them]2442-the surrounding regions ? ” “[253-ulfius] Ah , [ye]2443-ye will remember [we]2444-we move by night , and avoid speech with all . [We]2444-we learn naught but that [we]2444-we get by the telephone from [Camelot]7-camelot . ” “[2445-they] Why _ [they]2445-they _ know all about this thing . Have n't [they]2445-they told [you]253-ulfius anything about the great miracle of the restoration of a holy fountain ? ” “[2445-they] Oh , _ that _ ? Indeed yes . But the name of _ [this _ valley]2446-this _ valley doth woundily differ from the name of _ that _ one ; indeed to differ wider were not pos-- ” “[253-ulfius] What was that name , then ? ” “[253-ulfius] [The Valley of Hellishness]51-the valley of hellishness . ” “[253-ulfius] _ That _ explains it . Confound a telephone , anyway . It is the very demon for conveying similarities of sound that are miracles of divergence from similarity of sense . But no matter , [you]253-ulfius know the name of [the place]448-the place now . Call up [Camelot]7-camelot . ” [He]253-ulfius did it , and had [Clarence]131-clarence sent for . It was good to hear [[my]253-ulfius boy]4429-my boy 's voice again . It was like being [home]619-home . In this atmosphere of telephones and lightning communication with [distant regions]5476-distant regions , [I]0-i was breathing the breath of life again after long suffocation . [I]0-i realized , then , what a creepy , dull , inanimate horror [this land]1573-this land had been to [me]0-i all these years , and how [I]0-i had been in such a stifled condition of mind as to have grown used to it almost beyond the power to notice it . When [I]0-i got back to [the monastery]2292-the monastery , [I]0-i found a thing of interest going on . [The abbot]5211-the abbot and [[his]5211-the abbot monks]2269-his monks were assembled in [the great hall]524-the great hall , observing with childish wonder and faith the performances of [a new magician]5484-a new magician , a fresh arrival . [His]5484-a new magician dress was the extreme of the fantastic ; as showy and foolish as the sort of thing [an Indian medicine - man]5485-an indian medicine - man wears . [He]5484-a new magician was mowing , and mumbling , and gesticulating , and drawing mystical figures in the air and on the floor,--the regular thing , [you]5486-you know . [He]5484-a new magician was [a celebrity from [Asia]53-asia]5487-a celebrity from asia -- so [he]5484-a new magician said , and that was enough . That sort of evidence was as good as gold , and passed current everywhere . How easy and cheap it was to be [a great magician]5488-a great magician on [this fellow]440-this fellow 's terms . [His]5484-a new magician specialty was to tell [you]5486-you what [any individual on the face of the globe]5490-any individual on the face of the globe was doing at the moment ; and what [he]5484-a new magician had done at any time in the past , and what [he]5484-a new magician would do at any time in the future . [He]5484-a new magician asked if any would like to know what [the Emperor of [the East]48-the east]5491-the emperor of the east was doing now ? The sparkling eyes and the delighted rubbing of hands made eloquent answer -- [this reverend crowd]5492-this reverend crowd _ would _ like to know what [that monarch]5493-that monarch was at , just as this moment . The fraud went through some more mummery , and then made grave announcement : “[0-i] [The high and mighty Emperor of [the East]48-the east]2477-the high and mighty emperor of the east doth at this moment put money in the palm of [a holy begging friar]2478-a holy begging friar -- one , two , three pieces , and they be all of silver . ” A buzz of admiring exclamations broke out , all around : “[129-prithee] It is marvelous ! ” “[129-prithee] Wonderful ! ” “[129-prithee] What study , what labor , to have acquired a so amazing power as this ! ” Would [they]5492-this reverend crowd like to know what [the Supreme Lord of Inde]5494-the supreme lord of inde was doing ? And so on and so on ; and with each new marvel the astonishment at [his]5484-a new magician accuracy rose higher and higher . [They]5492-this reverend crowd thought [he]5484-a new magician must surely strike an uncertain place some time ; but no , [he]5484-a new magician never had to hesitate , [he]5484-a new magician always knew , and always with unerring precision . [I]129-prithee saw that if this thing went on [I]129-prithee should lose [my]129-prithee supremacy , [this fellow]440-this fellow would capture [my]129-prithee following , [I]129-prithee should be left out in the cold . [I]129-prithee said : “[129-prithee] If [I]0-i might ask , [I]0-i should very greatly like to know what [a certain person]2479-a certain person is doing . ” “[129-prithee] Speak , and freely . [I]0-i will tell [you]2480-you . ” “[0-i] It will be difficult -- perhaps impossible . ” “[0-i] [My]0-i art knoweth not that word . It had not occurred to [anybody in the crowd]5498-anybody in the crowd -- that simple trick of inquiring about somebody who was n't ten thousand miles away . [Good friends]2486-good friends , [this tramp]2487-this tramp is [a mere fraud and liar]2488-a mere fraud and liar . ” This distressed [the monks]2330-the monks and terrified [them]2330-the monks . [The magician]5499-the magician began to pull [his]5499-the magician wits together , and when [he]5499-the magician presently smiled an easy , nonchalant smile , it spread a mighty relief around ; for it indicated that [his]5499-the magician mood was not destructive . [[Our]2504-our Arthur]2505-our arthur the king-- ” “[2505-our arthur] Would [you]2496-you know of [him]2505-our arthur ? ” broke in [the enchanter]5504-the enchanter . “[2496-you] Most gladly , yea , and gratefully . ” [Everybody]600-everybody was full of awe and interest again right away , [the incorrigible idiots]5506-the incorrigible idiots . [Nobody]476-nobody knew which of [us]5509-us to believe ; [I]4445-the king still had some reputation left . [The magician]5499-the magician 's scorn was stirred , and [he]0-i said : “[4445-the king] [Lo]135-lo , [I]0-i have seen [many wonderful soothsayers]2510-many wonderful soothsayers and [prophets]2511-prophets and [magicians]2512-magicians in [my]0-i life days , but none before that could sit idle and see to the heart of things with never an incantation to help . ” “[135-lo] [You]135-lo have lived in [the woods]4638-the woods , and lost much by it . [I]0-i use incantations [myself]0-i , as [this good brotherhood]2514-this good brotherhood are aware -- but only on occasions of moment . ” When it comes to sarcasming , [I]2515-they reckon [I]2515-they know how to keep [my]2515-they end up . [The abbot]5211-the abbot inquired after [the queen]579-the queen and [the court]550-the court , and got this information : “[2515-they] [They]2515-they be all on sleep , being overcome by fatigue , like as to [the king]4445-the king . ” [I]2515-they said : “[2515-they] That is merely another lie . Half of [them]2515-they are about [their]2515-they amusements , [the queen]579-the queen and [the other half]2518-the other half are not sleeping , [they]2515-they ride . Now perhaps [you]2519-you can spread [yourself]2519-you a little , and tell [us]2520-us where [the king]4445-the king and [queen]1774-queen and all that are this moment riding with [them]2515-they are going ? ” “[2515-they] [They]2515-they sleep now , as [I]0-i said ; but on the morrow [they]2515-they will ride , for [they]2515-they go a journey toward [the sea]1047-the sea . ” “[2515-they] And where will [they]2515-they be the day after to - morrow at vespers ? ” “[2515-they] Far to [the north of [Camelot]7-camelot]2524-the north of camelot , and half [their]2515-they journey will be done . ” “[2515-they] That is another lie , by the space of a hundred and fifty miles . [Their]2515-they journey will not be merely half done , it will be all done , and [they]2515-they will be _ here _ , in [this valley]2525-this valley . ” _ That _ was a noble shot ! It set [the abbot]5211-the abbot and [the monks]2330-the monks in a whirl of excitement , and it rocked [the enchanter]5504-the enchanter to [his]5504-the enchanter base . [I]4445-the king followed the thing right up : “[4445-the king] If [the king]4445-the king does not arrive , [I]0-i will have [myself]0-i ridden on a rail : if [he]4445-the king does [I]0-i will ride [you]2527-you on a rail instead . ” Next day [I]0-i went up to [the telephone office]5519-the telephone office and found that [the king]4445-the king had passed through [two towns that were on the line]5521-two towns that were on the line . [I]0-i spotted [his]4445-the king progress on the succeeding day in the same way . [I]0-i kept these matters to [myself]0-i . The third day 's reports showed that if [he]4445-the king kept up [his]4445-the king gait [he]4445-the king would arrive by four in the afternoon . There was still no sign anywhere of interest in [his]4445-the king coming ; there seemed to be no preparations making to receive [him]4445-the king in state ; a strange thing , truly . Only one thing could explain this : [that other magician]5522-that other magician had been cutting under [me]0-i , sure . This was true . [I]0-i asked [a friend of mine]5523-a friend of mine , [a monk]722-a monk , about it , and [he]722-a monk said , yes , [the magician]5499-the magician had tried some further enchantments and found out that [the court]550-the court had concluded to make no journey at all , but stay at [home]619-home . Think of that ! Observe how much a reputation was worth in [such a country]5528-such a country . [These people]551-these people had seen [me]0-i do the very showiest bit of magic in history , and the only one within [their]551-these people memory that had a positive value , and yet here [they]551-these people were , ready to take up with [an adventurer who could offer no evidence of [his]4445-the king powers but [his]4445-the king mere unproven word]5530-an adventurer who could offer no evidence of his powers but his mere unproven word . However , it was not good politics to let [the king]4445-the king come without any fuss and feathers at all , so [I]0-i went down and drummed up [a procession of pilgrims and smoked out a batch of hermits]5532-a procession of pilgrims and smoked out a batch of hermits and started [them]5532-a procession of pilgrims and smoked out a batch of hermits out at two o'clock to meet [him]4445-the king . And that was the sort of state [he]4445-the king arrived in . [The abbot]5211-the abbot was helpless with rage and humiliation when [I]0-i brought [him]5211-the abbot out on [a balcony]5534-a balcony and showed [him]5211-the abbot [the head of the state marching in]5535-the head of the state marching in and never a monk on hand to offer [him]5211-the abbot welcome , and no stir of life or clang of joy - bell to glad [his]5211-the abbot spirit . [He]5211-the abbot took one look and then flew to rouse out [his]5211-the abbot forces . The next minute the bells were dinning furiously , and [the various buildings]5536-the various buildings were vomiting [monks]4691-monks and [nuns]2293-nuns , who went swarming in a rush toward [the coming procession]5539-the coming procession ; and with [them]5532-a procession of pilgrims and smoked out a batch of hermits went [that magician]5540-that magician --and [he]5540-that magician was on a rail , too , by [[the abbot]5211-the abbot 's order]5542-the abbot 's order ; and [his]5540-that magician reputation was in the mud , and mine was in the sky again . Yes , [a man]518-a man can keep [his]518-a man trademark current in [such a country]5528-such a country , but [he]518-a man ca n't sit around and do it ; [he]518-a man has got to be on [deck]5238-deck and attending to business right along . CHAPTER XXV A COMPETITIVE EXAMINATION When [the king]4445-the king traveled for change of air , or made a progress , or visited [a distant noble whom [he]4445-the king wished to bankrupt with the cost of [his]4445-the king keep]5547-a distant noble whom he wished to bankrupt with the cost of his keep , part of the administration moved with [him]4445-the king . It was a fashion of the time . [The Commission charged with the examination of candidates for posts in [the army]5549-the army]5548-the commission charged with the examination of candidates for posts in the army came with [the king]4445-the king to [the Valley]2078-the valley , whereas [they]5548-the commission charged with the examination of candidates for posts in the army could have transacted [their]5548-the commission charged with the examination of candidates for posts in the army business just as well at [home]619-home . And although this expedition was strictly a holiday excursion for [the king]4445-the king , [he]4445-the king kept some of [his]4445-the king business functions going just the same . [He]4445-the king touched for the evil , as usual ; [he]4445-the king held court in the gate at sunrise and tried cases , for [he]4445-the king was [himself]4445-the king [Chief Justice of [the King]4445-the king 's Bench]5554-chief justice of the king 's bench . [He]4445-the king shone very well in [this latter office]5556-this latter office . [He]4445-the king was [a wise and humane judge]5557-a wise and humane judge , and [he]4445-the king clearly did [his]4445-the king honest best and fairest,--according to [his]4445-the king lights . That is a large reservation . [His]4445-the king lights -- [I]0-i mean [his]4445-the king rearing -- often colored [his]4445-the king decisions . Whenever there was a dispute between [a noble]1128-a noble or [gentleman]5559-gentleman and [a person of lower degree]5560-a person of lower degree , [the king]4445-the king 's leanings and sympathies were for [the former class]5562-the former class always , whether [he]4445-the king suspected it or not . It was impossible that this should be otherwise . The blunting effects of slavery upon [the slaveholder]5563-the slaveholder 's moral perceptions are known and conceded , [the world]374-the world over ; and [a privileged class]5565-a privileged class , [an aristocracy]5566-an aristocracy , is but a band of [slaveholders under another name]5567-slaveholders under another name . This has a harsh sound , and yet should not be offensive to any -- even to [the noble]2009-the noble [himself]2009-the noble -- unless the fact itself be an offense : for the statement simply formulates a fact . The repulsive feature of slavery is the _ thing _ , not its name . [One]434-one needs but to hear [an aristocrat]5570-an aristocrat speak of [the classes that are below [him]5570-an aristocrat]5571-the classes that are below him to recognize -- and in but indifferently modified measure --the very air and tone of [the actual slaveholder]5572-the actual slaveholder ; and behind these are [the slaveholder]5563-the slaveholder 's spirit , [the slaveholder]5563-the slaveholder 's blunted feeling . They are the result of the same cause in both cases : [the possessor]5575-the possessor 's old and inbred custom of regarding [himself]5575-the possessor as [a superior being]5421-a superior being . [The king]4445-the king 's judgments wrought frequent injustices , but it was merely the fault of [his]4445-the king training , [his]4445-the king natural and unalterable sympathies . [He]4445-the king was as unfitted for a judgeship as would be [the average mother]5578-the average mother for the position of milk - distributor to [starving children]5579-starving children in famine - time ; [[her]5578-the average mother own children]5580-her own children would fare a shade better than the rest . One very curious case came before [the king]4445-the king . [A young girl]5582-a young girl , [an orphan]5583-an orphan , who had a considerable estate , married [a fine young fellow who had nothing]5584-a fine young fellow who had nothing . [The girl]1272-the girl 's property was within a seigniory held by [the Church]900-the church . [The bishop of [the diocese]5588-the diocese]5587-the bishop of the diocese , [an arrogant scion of [the great nobility]5590-the great nobility]5589-an arrogant scion of the great nobility , claimed [[the girl]1272-the girl 's estate]5592-the girl 's estate on the ground that [she]1272-the girl had married privately , and thus had cheated [the Church]900-the church out of one of [its]900-the church rights as [lord of the seigniory]5594-lord of the seigniory -- the one heretofore referred to as [le droit du seigneur]2006-le droit du seigneur . The penalty of refusal or avoidance was confiscation . [The girl]1272-the girl 's defense was , that the lordship of the seigniory was vested in [the bishop]1020-the bishop , and the particular right here involved was not transferable , but must be exercised by [the lord]5598-the lord [himself]5598-the lord or stand vacated ; and that an older law , of [the Church itself]5599-the church itself , strictly barred [the bishop]1020-the bishop from exercising it . It was a very odd case , indeed . It reminded [me]0-i of something [I]0-i had read in [my]0-i youth about the ingenious way in which [the aldermen of [London]16-london]5601-the aldermen of london raised the money that built [the Mansion House]5602-the mansion house . [A person who had not taken the Sacrament according to the Anglican rite]5603-a person who had not taken the sacrament according to the anglican rite could not stand as a candidate for [sheriff of [London]16-london]5604-sheriff of london . Thus [Dissenters]5605-dissenters were ineligible ; [they]5605-dissenters could not run if asked , [they]5605-dissenters could not serve if elected . [The aldermen , who without any question]5606-the aldermen , who without any question were [Yankees in disguise]5607-yankees in disguise , hit upon this neat device : [they]5606-the aldermen , who without any question passed a by - law imposing a fine of L400 upon [any one who should refuse to be a candidate for sheriff]5608-any one who should refuse to be a candidate for sheriff , and a fine of L600 upon [any person who , after being elected sheriff , refused to serve]5609-any person who , after being elected sheriff , refused to serve . Then [they]5606-the aldermen , who without any question went to work and elected [a lot of Dissenters]5610-a lot of dissenters , one after another , and kept it up until [they]5606-the aldermen , who without any question had collected L15,000 in fines ; and there stands the stately [Mansion House]54-mansion house to this day , to keep [the blushing citizen]5611-the blushing citizen in mind of a long past and lamented day when [a band of [Yankees]257-yankees]5612-a band of yankees slipped into [London]16-london and played games of the sort that has given [their]5612-a band of yankees race a unique and shady reputation among [all truly good and holy peoples that be in [the earth]399-the earth]5613-all truly good and holy peoples that be in the earth . [The girl]1272-the girl 's case seemed strong to [me]0-i ; [the bishop]1020-the bishop 's case was just as strong . [I]0-i did not see how [the king]4445-the king was going to get out of this hole . But [he]4445-the king got out . [I]0-i append [his]4445-the king decision : “[0-i] Truly [I]0-i find small difficulty here , the matter being even [a child]5025-a child 's affair for simpleness . An [the young bride]2529-the young bride had conveyed notice , as in duty bound , to [[her]2529-the young bride feudal lord]2530-her feudal lord and [proper master]2531-proper master and [protector [the bishop]1020-the bishop]2532-protector the bishop , [she]2529-the young bride had suffered no loss , for [the said bishop]2534-the said bishop could have got a dispensation making [him]2534-the said bishop , for temporary conveniency , eligible to the exercise of [his]2534-the said bishop said right , and thus would [she]2529-the young bride have kept all [she]2529-the young bride had . Whereas , failing in [her]2529-the young bride first duty , [she]2529-the young bride hath by that failure failed in all ; for whoso , clinging to a rope , severeth it above [his]2534-the said bishop hands , must fall ; it being no defense to claim that the rest of the rope is sound , neither any deliverance from [his]2534-the said bishop peril , as [he]2534-the said bishop shall find . [Pardy]258-pardy , [the woman]1872-the woman 's case is rotten at the source . It is the decree of [the court]550-the court that [she]1872-the woman forfeit to [the said lord bishop]2537-the said lord bishop all [her]1872-the woman goods , even to the last farthing that [she]1872-the woman doth possess , and be thereto mulcted in the costs . Next ! ” Here was a tragic end to a beautiful honeymoon not yet three months old . [Poor young creatures]5618-poor young creatures ! [They]5618-poor young creatures had lived these three months lapped to the lips in worldly comforts . These clothes and trinkets [they]5618-poor young creatures were wearing were as fine and dainty as the shrewdest stretch of the sumptuary laws allowed to [people of]5619-people of [their]5618-poor young creatures degree ; and in these pretty clothes , [she]2529-the young bride crying on [his]2534-the said bishop shoulder , and [he]2534-the said bishop trying to comfort [her]2529-the young bride with hopeful words set to the music of despair , [they]5618-poor young creatures went from the judgment seat out into [the world]374-the world homeless , bedless , breadless ; why , [the very beggars by the roadsides]5621-the very beggars by the roadsides were not so poor as [they]5618-poor young creatures . Well , [the king]4445-the king was out of the hole ; and on terms satisfactory to [the Church]900-the church and [the rest of [the aristocracy]2251-the aristocracy]5624-the rest of the aristocracy , no doubt . [Men]508-men write many fine and plausible arguments in support of monarchy , but the fact remains that where [every man in [a State]5628-a state]5627-every man in a state has a vote , brutal laws are impossible . [[Arthur]116-arthur 's people]5629-arthur 's people were of course poor material for [a republic]5630-a republic , because [they]5629-arthur 's people had been debased so long by monarchy ; and yet even [they]5629-arthur 's people would have been intelligent enough to make short work of that law which [the king]4445-the king had just been administering if it had been submitted to [their]5629-arthur 's people full and free vote . There is a phrase which has grown so common in [the world]374-the world 's mouth that it has come to seem to have sense and meaning -- the sense and meaning implied when it is used ; that is the phrase which refers to this or that or the other nation as possibly being “[260-webster] capable of self - government ” ; and the implied sense of it is , that there has been [a nation somewhere]5633-a nation somewhere , some time or other which _ was n't _ capable of it -- wasn't as able to govern [itself]5633-a nation somewhere as [some self - appointed specialists]5634-some self - appointed specialists were or would be to govern it . [The master minds of all nations , in all ages]5635-the master minds of all nations , in all ages , have sprung in affluent multitude from the mass of [the nation]709-the nation , and from the mass of [the nation]709-the nation only -- not from [[its]709-the nation privileged classes]5638-its privileged classes ; and so , no matter what [the nation]709-the nation 's intellectual grade was ; whether high or low , the bulk of [its]709-the nation ability was in the long ranks of [its]709-the nation nameless and [[its]709-the nation poor]5640-its poor , and so [it]709-the nation never saw the day that it had not the material in abundance whereby to govern [itself]709-the nation . Which is to assert an always self - proven fact : that even [the best governed and most free and most enlightened monarchy]5641-the best governed and most free and most enlightened monarchy is still behind the best condition attainable by [[its]709-the nation people]5642-its people ; and that the same is true of [kindred governments of lower grades]5643-kindred governments of lower grades , all the way down to the lowest . [King Arthur]116-arthur had hurried up the army business altogether beyond [my]262-weaver!--god calculations . [I]262-weaver!--god had not supposed [he]116-arthur would move in the matter while [I]262-weaver!--god was away ; and so [I]262-weaver!--god had not mapped out a scheme for determining the merits of [officers]5644-officers ; [I]262-weaver!--god had only remarked that it would be wise to submit [every candidate]5645-every candidate to a sharp and searching examination ; and privately [I]262-weaver!--god meant to put together a list of military qualifications that [nobody]476-nobody could answer to but [my]262-weaver!--god West Pointers . That ought to have been attended to before [I]262-weaver!--god left ; for [the king]4445-the king was so taken with the idea of a standing army that [he]4445-the king could n't wait but must get about it at once , and get up as good a scheme of examination as [he]4445-the king could invent out of [his]4445-the king own head . [I]262-weaver!--god was impatient to see what this was ; and to show , too , how much more admirable was the one which [I]262-weaver!--god should display to [the Examining Board]5648-the examining board . [I]262-weaver!--god intimated this , gently , to [the king]4445-the king , and it fired [his]4445-the king curiosity . [I]261-weaver had had a blackboard prepared , and it was put up now , and the circus began . It was beautiful to hear [the lad]613-the lad lay out the science of war , and wallow in details of battle and siege , of supply , transportation , mining and countermining , grand tactics , big strategy and little strategy , signal service , [infantry]5687-infantry , cavalry , artillery , and all about siege guns , field guns , gatling guns , rifled guns , smooth bores , musket practice , revolver practice -- and not a solitary word of it all could [these catfish]5688-these catfish make head or tail of , [you]5689-you understand -- and it was handsome to see [him]613-the lad chalk off mathematical nightmares on the blackboard that would stump [the angels themselves]5690-the angels themselves , and do it like nothing , too -- all about eclipses , and comets , and solstices , and constellations , and mean time , and sidereal time , and dinner time , and bedtime , and every other imaginable thing above the clouds or under them that [you]5689-you could harry or bullyrag [an enemy]5691-an enemy with and make [him]5691-an enemy wish [he]5691-an enemy had n't come -- and when [the boy]506-the boy made [his]506-the boy military salute and stood aside at last , [I]261-weaver was proud enough to hug [him]506-the boy , and [all those other people]5693-all those other people were so dazed [they]5693-all those other people looked partly petrified , partly drunk , and wholly caught out and snowed under . In the one case [a man]518-a man lies dead - alive four generations -- mummified in ignorance and sloth -- and that qualifies [him]518-a man to command [live people]2574-live people , and take [their]2574-live people weal and woe into [his]518-a man impotent hands ; and in the other case , [a man lies bedded with death and worms four generations]2575-a man lies bedded with death and worms four generations , and that qualifies [him]518-a man for office in [the celestial camp]2576-the celestial camp . Does [the king]4445-the king 's grace approve of this strange law ? ” [The king]4445-the king said : “[4445-the king] Why , truly [I]0-i see naught about it that is strange . The rule is but to mark a limit . Its purpose is to keep out too recent blood , which would bring into contempt [these offices]2579-these offices , and [men of lofty lineage]2580-men of lofty lineage would turn [their]2580-men of lofty lineage backs and scorn to take [them]2579-these offices .
