Proceed , [[sir Chief of the Herald]2583-sir chief of the herald 's College]2584-sir chief of the herald 's college . ” [The chairman]5675-the chairman resumed as follows : “[2583-sir chief of the herald] By what illustrious achievement for the honor of the Throne and State did [the founder of [your]2584-sir chief of the herald 's college great line]2585-the founder of your great line lift [himself]2585-the founder of your great line to the sacred dignity of [the British nobility]2586-the british nobility ? ” “[2585-the founder of your great line] [He]2585-the founder of your great line built [a brewery]2587-a brewery . ” “[2585-the founder of your great line] [Sire]2588-sire , [the Board]5650-the board finds [this candidate]2590-this candidate perfect in all the requirements and qualifications for military command , and doth hold [his]2590-this candidate case open for decision after due examination of [[his]2590-this candidate competitor]2591-his competitor . ” [The competitor]5709-the competitor came forward and proved exactly four generations of [nobility]908-nobility [himself]5709-the competitor . So there was a tie in military qualifications that far . [He]5709-the competitor stood aside a moment , and [Sir Pertipole]265-sir pertipole was questioned further : “[2590-this candidate] Of what condition was [the wife of [the founder of [your]2584-sir chief of the herald 's college line]2593-the founder of your line]2592-the wife of the founder of your line ? ” “[2592-the wife of the founder of your line] [She]2592-the wife of the founder of your line came of [the highest landed gentry]2594-the highest landed gentry , yet [she]2592-the wife of the founder of your line was not noble ; [she]2592-the wife of the founder of your line was gracious and pure and charitable , of a blameless life and character , insomuch that in these regards was [she]2592-the wife of the founder of your line [peer of [the best lady in [the land]4486-the land]2596-the best lady in the land]2595-peer of the best lady in the land . ” “[2592-the wife of the founder of your line] That will do . Stand down . ” [He]2584-sir chief of the herald 's college called up [the competing lordling]5711-the competing lordling again , and asked : “[2592-the wife of the founder of your line] What was the rank and condition of [the great - grandmother who conferred British nobility upon [[your]2584-sir chief of the herald 's college great house]2599-your great house]2598-the great - grandmother who conferred british nobility upon your great house ? ” “[2592-the wife of the founder of your line] [She]2592-the wife of the founder of your line was [[a king]891-a king 's leman]994-a king 's leman and did climb to that splendid eminence by [her]2592-the wife of the founder of your line own unholpen merit from [the sewer where [she]2592-the wife of the founder of your line was born]2602-the sewer where she was born . ” “[2592-the wife of the founder of your line] Ah , this , indeed , is [true nobility]2603-true nobility , this is the right and perfect intermixture . The lieutenancy is [yours]2584-sir chief of the herald 's college , [fair lord]4600-fair lord . Hold it not in contempt ; it is the humble step which will lead to grandeurs more worthy of the splendor of an origin like to thine . ” [I]2605-i was down in the bottomless pit of humiliation . [I]2605-i had promised [myself]2605-i an easy and zenith - scouring triumph , and this was the outcome ! [I]2605-i was almost ashamed to look [[my]2605-i poor disappointed cadet]5712-my poor disappointed cadet in the face . [I]2605-i told [him]5712-my poor disappointed cadet to go [home]619-home and be patient , this was n't the end . [I]2605-i had a private audience with [the king]4445-the king , and made a proposition . [I]2605-i said it was quite right to officer [that regiment with nobilities]5715-that regiment with nobilities , and [he]5712-my poor disappointed cadet could n't have done a wiser thing . It would also be a good idea to add [five hundred officers]5716-five hundred officers to [it]5715-that regiment with nobilities ; in fact , add as many [officers]5644-officers as there were [nobles]953-nobles and [relatives of [nobles]953-nobles in [the country]420-the country]5719-relatives of nobles in the country , even if there should finally be five times as many [officers as privates in]5722-officers as privates in [it]5715-that regiment with nobilities ; and thus make it the crack regiment , [the envied regiment]5723-the envied regiment , [[the King]4445-the king 's Own regiment]5725-the king 's own regiment , and entitled to fight on [its]5715-that regiment with nobilities own hook and in [its]5715-that regiment with nobilities own way , and go whither it would and come when it pleased , in time of war , and be utterly swell and independent . This would make [that regiment]2466-that regiment the heart 's desire of [all the nobility]5727-all the nobility , and [they]5727-all the nobility would all be satisfied and happy . Then [we]5728-we would make up the rest of [the standing army]2461-the standing army out of commonplace materials , and officer [it]2461-the standing army with nobodies , as was proper -- [nobodies selected on a basis of mere efficiency]5730-nobodies selected on a basis of mere efficiency -- and [we]5728-we would make [this regiment]5731-this regiment toe the line , allow [it]5731-this regiment no aristocratic freedom from restraint , and force [it]5731-this regiment to do all the work and persistent hammering , to the end that whenever [[the King]4445-the king 's Own]5733-the king 's own was tired and wanted to go off for a change and rummage around amongst [ogres]5734-ogres and have a good time , it could go without uneasiness , knowing that matters were in safe hands behind it , and business going to be continued at [the old stand]5735-the old stand , same as usual . [The king]4445-the king was charmed with the idea . When [I]2605-i noticed that , it gave [me]2605-i a valuable notion . [I]2605-i thought [I]2605-i saw [my]2605-i way out of an old and stubborn difficulty at last . [You]5737-you see , the royalties of [the Pendragon stock]5738-the pendragon stock were a long - lived race and very fruitful . Whenever [a child]5025-a child was born to any of these --and it was pretty often -- there was wild joy in [the nation]709-the nation 's mouth , and piteous sorrow in [the nation]709-the nation 's heart . The joy was questionable , but the grief was honest . Because the event meant another call for a Royal Grant . Long was the list of these royalties , and they were a heavy and steadily increasing burden upon the treasury and a menace to the crown . Yet [Arthur]116-arthur could not believe this latter fact , and [he]116-arthur would not listen to any of [my]2605-i various projects for substituting something in the place of the royal grants . If [I]2605-i could have persuaded [him]116-arthur to now and then provide a support for one of [these outlying scions]5742-these outlying scions from [his]116-arthur own pocket , [I]2605-i could have made a grand to - do over it , and it would have had a good effect with [the nation]709-the nation ; but no , [he]116-arthur would n't hear of such a thing . [He]116-arthur had something like a religious passion for royal grant ; [he]116-arthur seemed to look upon it as a sort of sacred swag , and one could not irritate [him]116-arthur in any way so quickly and so surely as by an attack upon [that venerable institution]5744-that venerable institution . If [I]2605-i ventured to cautiously hint that there was [not another respectable family in [England]1-england]5745-not another respectable family in england that would humble itself to hold out the hat -- however , that is as far as [I]2605-i ever got ; [he]116-arthur always cut [me]2605-i short there , and peremptorily , too . But [I]2605-i believed [I]2605-i saw [my]2605-i chance at last . [I]2605-i would form [this crack regiment]5746-this crack regiment out of [officers]5644-officers alone -- [not a single private]5748-not a single private . Half of it should consist of [nobles]953-nobles , who should fill all the places up to [Major - General]5750-major - general , and serve [gratis]5751-gratis and pay [their]953-nobles own expenses ; and [they]953-nobles would be glad to do this when [they]953-nobles should learn that [the rest of [the regiment]5753-the regiment]5752-the rest of the regiment would consist exclusively of [princes of the blood]5754-princes of the blood . [These princes of the blood]5755-these princes of the blood should range in rank from [Lieutenant - General]5756-lieutenant - general up to [Field Marshal]5757-field marshal , and be gorgeously salaried and equipped and fed by [the state]4579-the state . Moreover -- and this was the master stroke --it should be decreed that [these princely grandees]5759-these princely grandees should be always addressed by a stunningly gaudy and awe - compelling title ( which [I]2605-i would presently invent ) , and [they]5759-these princely grandees and [they]5759-these princely grandees only in all [England]1-england should be so addressed . Finally , [all princes of the blood]5760-all princes of the blood should have free choice ; join [that regiment]2466-that regiment , get that great title , and renounce the royal grant , or stay out and receive a grant . Neatest touch of all : unborn but [imminent princes of the blood]5762-imminent princes of the blood could be _ born _ into [the regiment]5753-the regiment , and start fair , with good wages and a permanent situation , upon due notice from [the parents]5764-the parents . [All the boys]5765-all the boys would join , [I]2605-i was sure of that ; so , all existing grants would be relinquished ; that [the newly born]5766-the newly born would always join was equally certain . Within sixty days that quaint and bizarre anomaly , [the Royal Grant]5767-the royal grant , would cease to be a living fact , and take its place among the curiosities of the past . CHAPTER XXVI THE FIRST NEWSPAPER When [I]2605-i told [the king]4445-the king [I]2605-i was going out disguised as [a petty freeman]5769-a petty freeman to scour [the country]420-the country and familiarize [myself]2605-i with the humbler life of [the people]753-the people , [he]4445-the king was all afire with the novelty of the thing in a minute , and was bound to take a chance in the adventure [himself]4445-the king -- nothing should stop [him]4445-the king -- [he]4445-the king would drop everything and go along -- it was the prettiest idea [he]4445-the king had run across for many a day . [He]4445-the king wanted to glide out the back way and start at once ; but [I]2605-i showed [him]4445-the king that that would n't answer . [You]5772-you see , [he]4445-the king was billed for the king's - evil -- to touch for it , [I]2605-i mean -- and it would n't be right to disappoint [the house]584-the house and it would n't make a delay worth considering , anyway , it was only a one - night stand . And [I]2605-i thought [he]4445-the king ought to tell [the queen]579-the queen [he]4445-the king was going away . [He]4445-the king clouded up at that and looked sad . [I]2605-i was sorry [I]2605-i had spoken , especially when [he]4445-the king said mournfully : “[2605-i] [Thou]2605-i forgettest that [Launcelot]122-sir launcelot is [here]369-here ; and where [Launcelot]122-sir launcelot is , [she]2607-she noteth not the going forth of [the king]4445-the king , nor what day [he]4445-the king returneth . ” Of course , [I]2609-sir boss changed the Subject . Yes , [Guenever]124-guenever was beautiful , it is true , but take [her]124-guenever all around [she]124-guenever was pretty slack . [I]2609-sir boss never meddled in these matters , they were n't [my]2609-sir boss affair , but [I]2609-sir boss did hate to see the way things were going on , and [I]2609-sir boss do n't mind saying that much . Many 's the time [she]124-guenever had asked [me]2609-sir boss , “[2609-sir boss] [Sir Boss]2609-sir boss , hast seen [Sir Launcelot]122-sir launcelot about ? ” but if ever [she]124-guenever went fretting around for [the king]4445-the king [I]2609-sir boss did n't happen to be around at the time . There was a very good lay - out for [the king's - evil business]5776-the king's - evil business -- very tidy and creditable . [The king]4445-the king sat under a canopy of state ; about [him]4445-the king were clustered [a large body of [the clergy in full canonicals]5779-the clergy in full canonicals]5778-a large body of the clergy in full canonicals . [Conspicuous]266-conspicuous , both for location and personal outfit , stood [Marinel]267-marinel , [a hermit of the quack - doctor species]5780-a hermit of the quack - doctor species , to introduce [the sick]5781-the sick . All abroad over the spacious floor , and clear down to the doors , in a thick jumble , lay or sat the scrofulous , under a strong light . It was as good as a tableau ; in fact , it had all the look of being gotten up for that , though it was n't . There were [eight hundred sick people present]5782-eight hundred sick people present . The work was slow ; it lacked the interest of novelty for [me]2609-sir boss , because [I]2609-sir boss had seen the ceremonies before ; the thing soon became tedious , but the proprieties required [me]2609-sir boss to stick it out . [The doctor]5783-the doctor was there for the reason that in all such crowds there were [many people who only imagined something was the matter]5784-many people who only imagined something was the matter with [them]5784-many people who only imagined something was the matter , and [many who were consciously sound but wanted the immortal honor of fleshly contact with [a king]891-a king]5785-many who were consciously sound but wanted the immortal honor of fleshly contact with a king , and yet [others who pretended to illness in order to get the piece of coin that went with the touch]5787-others who pretended to illness in order to get the piece of coin that went with the touch . Up to this time this coin had been a wee little gold piece worth about a third of a dollar . When [you]5788-you consider how much that amount of money would buy , in that age and [country]1221-country , and how usual it was to be scrofulous , when not dead , [you]5788-you would understand that the annual king's - evil appropriation was just the River and Harbor bill of [that government]5790-that government for the grip it took on the treasury and the chance it afforded for skinning the surplus . So [I]2609-sir boss had privately concluded to touch the treasury itself for the king's - evil . [I]2609-sir boss covered six - sevenths of the appropriation into the treasury a week before starting from [Camelot]7-camelot on [my]2609-sir boss adventures , and ordered that the other seventh be inflated into five - cent nickels and delivered into the hands of [the head clerk of the King 's Evil Department]5791-the head clerk of the king 's evil department ; a nickel to take the place of each gold coin , [you]5788-you see , and do its work for [it]5792-it . It might strain the nickel some , but [I]2609-sir boss judged it could stand it . As a rule , [I]2609-sir boss do not approve of watering stock , but [I]2609-sir boss considered it square enough in this case , for it was just a gift , anyway . Of course , [you]5788-you can water a gift as much as [you]5788-you want to ; and [I]2609-sir boss generally do . The old gold and silver coins of [the country]420-the country were of ancient and unknown origin , as a rule , but some of them were Roman ; they were ill - shapen , and seldom rounder than a moon that is a week past the full ; they were hammered , not minted , and they were so worn with use that the devices upon them were as illegible as blisters , and looked like them . [I]2609-sir boss judged that a sharp , bright new nickel , with a first - rate likeness of [the king]4445-the king on one side of it and [Guenever]124-guenever on the other , and a blooming pious motto , would take the tuck out of scrofula as handy as a nobler coin and please [the scrofulous fancy]5795-the scrofulous fancy more ; and [I]2609-sir boss was right . This batch was the first it was tried on , and it worked to a charm . The saving in expense was a notable economy . [You]5788-you will see that by these figures : [We]5796-we touched a trifle over 700 of [the 800 patients]5797-the 800 patients ; at former rates , this would have cost [the government]864-the government about $ 240 ; at the new rate [we]5796-we pulled through for about $ 35 , thus saving upward of $ 200 at one swoop . To appreciate the full magnitude of this stroke , consider these other figures : the annual expenses of [a national government]5799-a national government amount to the equivalent of a contribution of three days ' average wages of [every individual of [the population]5801-the population]5800-every individual of the population , counting [every individual]5802-every individual as if [he]5802-every individual were [a man]518-a man . If [you]5788-you take a nation of 60,000,000 , where average wages are $ 2 per day , three days ' wages taken from [each individual]5804-each individual will provide $ 360,000,000 and pay [the government]864-the government 's expenses . In [my]2609-sir boss day , in [[my]2609-sir boss own country]5806-my own country , this money was collected from imposts , and [the citizen]5162-the citizen imagined that [the foreign importer]5808-the foreign importer paid it , and it made [him]5162-the citizen comfortable to think so ; whereas , in fact , it was paid by [the American people]5809-the american people , and was so equally and exactly distributed among [them]5809-the american people that the annual cost to [the 100 - millionaire]5810-the 100 - millionaire and the annual cost to [the sucking child of the day - laborer]5811-the sucking child of the day - laborer was precisely the same -- [each]2237-each paid $ 6 . Nothing could be equaler than that , [I]2609-sir boss reckon . Well , [Scotland]22-scotland and [Ireland]21-ireland were tributary to [Arthur]116-arthur , and [the united populations of [the British Islands]5814-the british islands]5813-the united populations of the british islands amounted to something less than 1,000,000 . [A mechanic]5815-a mechanic 's average wage was 3 cents a day , when [he]5815-a mechanic paid [his]5815-a mechanic own keep . By this rule [the national government]5816-the national government 's expenses were $ 90,000 a year , or about $ 250 a day . Thus , by the substitution of nickels for gold on a king's - evil day , [I]2609-sir boss not only injured [no one]2188-no one , dissatisfied [no one]2188-no one , but pleased [all concerned]5819-all concerned and saved four - fifths of that day 's national expense into the bargain -- a saving which would have been the equivalent of $ 800,000 in [my]2609-sir boss day in [America]19-america . In making this substitution [I]2609-sir boss had drawn upon the wisdom of a very remote source -- the wisdom of [[my]2609-sir boss boyhood]5820-my boyhood -- for [the true statesman]5821-the true statesman does not despise any wisdom , howsoever lowly may be its origin : in [my]2609-sir boss boyhood [I]2609-sir boss had always saved [my]2609-sir boss pennies and contributed buttons to the foreign missionary cause . The buttons would answer [the ignorant savage]5822-the ignorant savage as well as the coin , the coin would answer [me]2609-sir boss better than the buttons ; all hands were happy and [nobody]476-nobody hurt . [Marinel]267-marinel took [the patients]5824-the patients as [they]5824-the patients came . [He]267-marinel examined [the candidate]2564-the candidate ; if [he]267-marinel could n't qualify [he]267-marinel was warned off ; if [he]267-marinel could [he]267-marinel was passed along to [the king]4445-the king . [A priest]4649-a priest pronounced the words , “[2609-sir boss] [They]2610-they shall lay [their]2610-they hands on [the sick]5781-the sick , and [they]2610-they shall recover . ” Then [the king]4445-the king stroked the ulcers , while the reading continued ; finally , [the patient]5829-the patient graduated and got [his]5829-the patient nickel -- [the king]4445-the king hanging it around [his]4445-the king neck [himself]4445-the king -- and was dismissed . Would [you]5831-you think that that would cure ? [It]5832-it certainly did . [Any mummery]5833-any mummery will cure if [the patient]5829-the patient 's faith is strong in it . Up by [Astolat]268-astolat there was [a chapel]5835-a chapel where [the Virgin]2283-the virgin had once appeared to [a girl who used to herd geese around there]5837-a girl who used to herd geese around there -- [the girl]1272-the girl said so [herself]1272-the girl -- and [they]5839-they built [the chapel]5244-the chapel upon that spot and hung a picture in it representing the occurrence -- a picture which [you]5831-you would think it dangerous for [a sick person]681-a sick person to approach ; whereas , on the contrary , [thousands of the lame]5842-thousands of the lame and [the sick]5781-the sick came and prayed before it every year and went away whole and sound ; and [even the well]5844-even the well could look upon it and live . Of course , when [I]2612-i was told these things [I]2612-i did not believe them ; but when [I]2612-i went [there]4491-there and saw them [I]2612-i had to succumb . [I]2612-i saw the cures effected [myself]2612-i ; and they were real cures and not questionable . [I]2612-i saw [cripples whom [I]2612-i had seen around [Camelot]7-camelot]5846-cripples whom i had seen around camelot for years on crutches , arrive and pray before that picture , and put down [their]5846-cripples whom i had seen around camelot crutches and walk off without a limp . There were piles of crutches there which had been left by [such people]1055-such people as a testimony . In other places [people]357-people operated on [a patient]4427-a patient 's mind , without saying a word to [him]4427-a patient , and cured [him]4427-a patient . In others , [experts]1158-experts assembled [patients]5851-patients in [a room]776-a room and prayed over [them]5851-patients , and appealed to [their]5851-patients faith , and [those patients]5853-those patients went away cured . Wherever [you]5854-you find [a king who ca n't cure [the king's]5856-the king's - evil [you]5854-you can be sure that the most valuable superstition that supports [his]4427-a patient throne -- [the subject]5857-the subject 's belief in the divine appointment of [[his]4427-a patient sovereign]5858-his sovereign]5855-a king who ca n't cure the king's - evil you can be sure that the most valuable superstition that supports his throne -- the subject 's belief in the divine appointment of his sovereign -- has passed away . In [my]2612-i youth [the monarchs of [England]1-england]5859-the monarchs of england had ceased to touch for the evil , but there was no occasion for this diffidence : [they]5859-the monarchs of england could have cured it forty - nine times in fifty . Well , when [the priest]739-the priest had been droning for three hours , and [the good king]5861-the good king polishing the evidences , and [the sick]5781-the sick were still pressing forward as plenty as ever , [I]2612-i got to feeling intolerably bored . [I]2612-i was sitting by an open window not far from the canopy of state . For the five hundredth time [a patient]4427-a patient stood forward to have [his]4427-a patient repulsivenesses stroked ; again those words were being droned out : “[2612-i] [they]2612-i shall lay [their]2612-i hands on the sick”--when outside there rang clear as a clarion a note that enchanted [my]2609-sir boss soul and tumbled thirteen worthless centuries about [my]2609-sir boss ears : “[2609-sir boss] [Camelot _ Weekly Hosannah]56-camelot _ weekly hosannah and Literary Volcano!_--latest irruption -- only two cents --all about the big miracle in the [Valley of Holiness]2613-valley of holiness ! ” One greater than [kings]339-kings had arrived -- [the newsboy]5865-the newsboy . But [I]2609-sir boss was [the only person in all that throng who knew the meaning of this mighty birth]5866-the only person in all that throng who knew the meaning of this mighty birth , and what [this imperial magician]5867-this imperial magician was come into [the world]374-the world to do . [I]2609-sir boss dropped a nickel out of the window and got [my]2609-sir boss paper ; [the Adam - newsboy of [the world]374-the world]5869-the adam - newsboy of the world went around the corner to get [my]2609-sir boss change ; is around the corner yet . It was delicious to see a newspaper again , yet [I]2609-sir boss was conscious of a secret shock when [my]2609-sir boss eye fell upon the first batch of display head - lines . [I]2609-sir boss had lived in a clammy atmosphere of reverence , respect , deference , so long that [they]2612-i sent a quivery little cold wave through [me]2609-sir boss : HIGH TIMES IN [THE VALLEY OF HOLINESS]2262-the valley of holiness ! ---- [THE WATER]57-the water - WORKS CORKED ! ---- [BRER MERLIN]134-merlin WORKS [HIS]134-merlin ARTS , BUT GETS LEFT ? ---- But [the Boss]1014-the boss scores on [his]1014-the boss first Innings ! ---- [The Miraculous Well Uncorked amid awful outbursts of INFERNAL FIRE AND [SMOKE ATHUNDER]58-smoke athunder]5873-the miraculous well uncorked amid awful outbursts of infernal fire and smoke athunder ! ---- [THE BUZZARD - ROOST ASTONISHED]5874-the buzzard - roost astonished ! ---- UNPARALLELED REJOIBINGS ! --and so on , and so on . Yes , it was too loud . Once [I]2609-sir boss could have enjoyed it and seen nothing out of the way about it , but now its note was discordant . It was good Arkansas journalism , but this was not [Arkansas]9-arkansas . Moreover , the next to the last line was calculated to give offense to [the hermits]5274-the hermits , and perhaps lose [us]5876-us [their]5274-the hermits advertising . Indeed , there was too lightsome a tone of flippancy all through the paper . It was plain [I]2609-sir boss had undergone a considerable change without noticing it . [I]2609-sir boss found [myself]2609-sir boss unpleasantly affected by pert little irreverencies which would have seemed but proper and airy graces of speech at an earlier period of [my]2609-sir boss life . There was an abundance of the following breed of items , and they discomforted [me]2609-sir boss : [LOCAL SMOKE AND CINDERS]269-local smoke and cinders . [The widow]5879-the widow has been notified . [Young Barker]276-young barker [the bellows - mender]5902-the bellows - mender is hoMe again , and looks much improved by [his]276-young barker vacation round - up among [the out- lying smithies]5903-the out- lying smithies . See [his]276-young barker ad . Of course it was good enough journalism for a beginning ; [I]2609-sir boss knew that quite well , and yet it was somehow disappointing . The “[2609-sir boss] Court Circular ” pleased [me]2609-sir boss better ; indeed , its simple and dignified respectfulness was a distinct refreshment to [me]2609-sir boss after all those disgraceful familiarities . But even it could have been improved . Do what [one]434-one may , there is no getting an air of variety into a court circular , [I]2609-sir boss acknowledge that . There is a profound monotonousness about its facts that baffles and defeats [one]434-one 's sincerest efforts to make them sparkle and enthuse . The best way to manage -- in fact , the only sensible way -- is to disguise repetitiousness of fact under variety of form : skin [your]5906-you fact each time and lay on a new cuticle of words . It deceives the eye ; [you]5906-you think it is a new fact ; it gives [you]5906-you the idea that [the court]550-the court is carrying on like everything ; this excites [you]5906-you , and [you]5906-you drain the whole column , with a good appetite , and perhaps never notice that it 's a barrel of soup made out of a single bean . [Clarence]131-clarence 's way was good , it was simple , it was dignified , it was direct and business - like ; all [I]2609-sir boss say is , it was not the best way : COURT CIRCULAR . On Monday , [the king]4445-the king rode in [the park]5909-the park . “[2609-sir boss] Tuesday , “ “[2609-sir boss] ” “[2609-sir boss] Wendesday “ “[2609-sir boss] ” “[2609-sir boss] Thursday “ “[2609-sir boss] ” “[2609-sir boss] Friday , “ “[2609-sir boss] ” “[2609-sir boss] Saturday “ “[2609-sir boss] ” “[2609-sir boss] Sunday , “ “[2609-sir boss] ” However , take the paper by and large , [I]2609-sir boss was vastly pleased with it . Little crudities of a mechanical sort were observable here and there , but there were not enough of them to amount to anything , and it was good enough Arkansas proof - reading , anyhow , and better than was needed in [Arthur]116-arthur 's day and realm . As a rule , the grammar was leaky and the construction more or less lame ; but [I]2609-sir boss did not much mind these things . They are common defects of [my]2609-sir boss own , and [one]434-one must n't criticise [other people]4446-other people on grounds where [he]434-one ca n't stand perpendicular [himself]434-one . [I]2609-sir boss was hungry enough for literature to want to take down the whole paper at this one meal , but [I]2609-sir boss got only a few bites , and then had to postpone , because [the monks around [me]2609-sir boss]5912-the monks around me besieged [me]2609-sir boss so with eager questions : What is this curious thing ? What is it for ? Is it a handkerchief?--saddle blanket?--part of a shirt ? What is it made of ? How thin it is , and how dainty and frail ; and how it rattles . Will it wear , do [you]5913-you think , and wo n't the rain injure it ? Is it writing that appears on it , or is it only ornamentation ? [They]5912-the monks around me suspected it was writing , because [those among [them]5912-the monks around me who knew how to read Latin and had a smattering of Greek]5914-those among them who knew how to read latin and had a smattering of greek , recognized some of the letters , but [they]5912-the monks around me could make nothing out of the result as a whole . [I]2609-sir boss put [my]2609-sir boss information in the simplest form [I]2609-sir boss could : “[2609-sir boss] It is a public journal ; [I]0-i will explain what that is , another time . It is not cloth , it is made of paper ; some time [I]0-i will explain what paper is . The lines on it are reading matter ; and not written by hand , but printed ; by and by [I]0-i will explain what printing is . A thousand of these sheets have been made , all exactly like this , in every minute detail -- they ca n't be told apart . ” Then [they]5912-the monks around me all broke out with exclamations of surprise and admiration : “[0-i] A thousand ! Verily a mighty work -- a year 's work for [many men]2614-many men . ” “[0-i] No -- merely a day 's work for [a man]518-a man and [a boy]2420-a boy . ” [They]5912-the monks around me crossed [themselves]5912-the monks around me , and whiffed out a protective prayer or two . “[0-i] Ah - h -- a miracle , a wonder ! Dark work of enchantment . ” [I]0-i let it go at that . Then [I]0-i read in a low voice , to as many as could crowd [their]5912-the monks around me shaven heads within hearing distance , part of the account of the miracle of the restoration of the well , and was accompanied by astonished and reverent ejaculations all through : “[0-i] Ah - h - h ! ” “[0-i] How true ! ” “[0-i] Amazing , amazing ! ” “[0-i] [These]2617-i be [the very haps]2618-the very haps as [they]2617-i happened , in marvelous exactness ! ” And might [they]5912-the monks around me take this strange thing in [their]5912-the monks around me hands , and feel of it and examine [it?--they]5915-it?--they would be very careful . Yes . So [they]5912-the monks around me took it , handling it as cautiously and devoutly as if it had been some holy thing come from [some supernatural region]5916-some supernatural region ; and gently felt of its texture , caressed its pleasant smooth surface with lingering touch , and scanned [the mysterious characters]5917-the mysterious characters with fascinated eyes . These grouped bent heads , these charmed faces , these speaking eyes --how beautiful to [me]2617-i ! For was not this [[my]2617-i darling]5918-my darling , and was not all this mute wonder and interest and homage a most eloquent tribute and unforced compliment to it ? [I]2617-i knew , then , how [a mother]5919-a mother feels when [women]532-women , whether [strangers]562-strangers or [friends]4974-friends , take [[her]5919-a mother new baby]5923-her new baby , and close [themselves]532-women about it with one eager impulse , and bend [their]532-women heads over it in a tranced adoration that makes all the rest of [the universe]5924-the universe vanish out of [their]532-women consciousness and be as if it were not , for that time . [I]2617-i knew how [she]5919-a mother feels , and that there is no other satisfied ambition , whether of [king]1026-king , [conqueror]5926-conqueror , or [poet]5927-poet , that ever reaches half - way to that serene far summit or yields half so divine a contentment . During all the rest of the seance [my]2617-i paper traveled from [group]5928-group to group all up and down and about [that huge hall]5929-that huge hall , and [my]2617-i happy eye was upon it always , and [I]2617-i sat motionless , steeped in satisfaction , drunk with enjoyment . Yes , this was heaven ; [I]2617-i was tasting it once , if [I]2617-i might never taste it more . CHAPTER XXVII [THE YANKEE]5930-the yankee AND [THE KING]4445-the king TRAVEL INCOGNITO About bedtime [I]2617-i took [the king]4445-the king to [[my]2617-i private quarters]5933-my private quarters to cut [his]4445-the king hair and help [him]4445-the king get the hang of the lowly raiment [he]4445-the king was to wear . [The high classes]5934-the high classes wore [their]5934-the high classes hair banged across the forehead but hanging to the shoulders the rest of the way around , whereas [the lowest ranks of [commoners]5936-commoners]5935-the lowest ranks of commoners were banged fore and aft both ; [the slaves]5160-the slaves were bangless , and allowed [their]5160-the slaves hair free growth . So [I]2617-i inverted a bowl over [his]4445-the king head and cut away all the locks that hung below it . [I]2617-i also trimmed [his]4445-the king whiskers and mustache until they were only about a half - inch long ; and tried to do it inartistically , and succeeded . It was a villainous disfigurement . When [he]4445-the king got [his]4445-the king lubberly sandals on , and [his]4445-the king long robe of coarse brown linen cloth , which hung straight from [his]4445-the king neck to [his]4445-the king ankle - bones , [he]4445-the king was no longer [the comeliest man in [[his]4445-the king kingdom]5939-his kingdom]5938-the comeliest man in his kingdom , but one of the unhandsomest and most commonplace and unattractive . [We]5940-we were dressed and barbered alike , and could pass for [small farmers]5941-small farmers , or [farm bailiffs]5942-farm bailiffs , or [shepherds]5943-shepherds , or [carters]5944-carters ; yes , or for [village artisans]5945-village artisans , if [we]5940-we chose , [our]5940-we costume being in effect universal among [the poor]5946-the poor , because of its strength and cheapness . [I]2617-i do n't mean that it was really cheap to [a very poor person]5947-a very poor person , but [I]2617-i do mean that it was the cheapest material there was for male attire -- manufactured material , [you]5948-you understand . [We]5940-we slipped away an hour before dawn , and by broad sun - up had made eight or ten miles , and were in the midst of [a sparsely settled country]5949-a sparsely settled country . [I]2617-i had a pretty heavy knapsack ; it was laden with provisions -- provisions for [the king]4445-the king to taper down on , till [he]4445-the king could take to the coarse fare of [the country]420-the country without damage . [I]2617-i found a comfortable seat for [the king]4445-the king by [the roadside]5953-the roadside , and then gave [him]4445-the king a morsel or two to stay [his]4445-the king stomach with . Then [I]2617-i said [I]2617-i would find some water for [him]4445-the king , and strolled away . Part of [my]2617-i project was to get out of sight and sit down and rest a little [myself]2617-i . It had always been [my]2617-i custom to stand when in [his]4445-the king presence ; even at the council board , except upon those rare occasions when the sitting was a very long one , extending over hours ; then [I]2617-i had a trifling little backless thing which was like a reversed culvert and was as comfortable as the toothache . [I]2617-i did n't want to break [him]4445-the king in suddenly , but do it by degrees . [We]5954-we should have to sit together now when in company , or [people]357-people would notice ; but it would not be good politics for [me]2617-i to be playing equality with [him]4445-the king when there was no necessity for it . [I]2617-i found the water some three hundred yards away , and had been resting about twenty minutes , when [I]2617-i heard voices . That is all right , [I]2617-i thought -- [peasants]5956-peasants going to work ; [nobody else]5957-nobody else likely to be stirring this early . But the next moment [these comers]5958-these comers jingled into sight around a turn of [the road]460-the road -- [smartly clad people of quality]5960-smartly clad people of quality , with luggage - [mules]5961-mules and [servants]5053-servants in [[their]5958-these comers train]5963-their train ! [I]2617-i was off like a shot , through the bushes , by the shortest cut . For a while it did seem that [these people]551-these people would pass [the king]4445-the king before [I]2617-i could get to [him]4445-the king ; but desperation gives [you]2619-my king wings , [you]2619-my king know , and [I]2617-i canted [my]2617-i body forward , inflated [my]2617-i breast , and held [my]2617-i breath and flew . [I]2617-i arrived . And in plenty good enough time , too . “[2617-i] Pardon , [[my]0-i king]2619-my king , but it 's no time for ceremony -- jump ! Jump to [your]2619-my king feet -- some quality are coming ! ” “[2620-them] Is that a marvel ? Let [them]2620-them come . ” “[2620-them] But [[my]0-i liege]2621-my liege ! [You]2619-my king must not be seen sitting . [Rise!--and]2622-rise!--and stand in humble posture while [they]2620-them pass . [You]2619-my king are [a peasant]2623-a peasant , [you]2619-my king know . ” “[2623-a peasant] True -- [I]0-i had forgot it , so lost was [I]0-i in planning of a huge war with [Gaul”--he]277-gaul”--he was up by this time , but [a farm]5966-a farm could have got up quicker , if there was any kind of a boom in real estate--“and[4445-the king] right - so a thought came randoming overthwart this majestic dream the which-- ” “[4445-the king] A humbler attitude , [[my]0-i lord [the king]4445-the king]2624-my lord the king -- and quick ! Duck [your]2619-my king head ! --more!--still more!--droop it ! ” [He]4445-the king did [his]4445-the king honest best , but lord , it was no great things . [He]4445-the king looked as humble as [the leaning tower at [Pisa]68-pisa]5967-the leaning tower at pisa . It is the most [you]5968-you could say of it . Indeed , it was such a thundering poor success that it raised wondering scowls all along the line , and [a gorgeous flunkey at the tail end of it]5969-a gorgeous flunkey at the tail end of it raised [his]4445-the king whip ; but [I]4445-the king jumped in time and was under it when it fell ; and under cover of the volley of coarse laughter which followed , [I]4445-the king spoke up sharply and warned [the king]4445-the king to take no notice . [He]4445-the king mastered [himself]4445-the king for the moment , but it was a sore tax ; [he]4445-the king wanted to eat up [the procession]1563-the procession . [I]4445-the king said : “[4445-the king] It would end [our]2626-we adventures at the very start ; and [we]2626-we , being without weapons , could do nothing with [that armed gang]2627-that armed gang . If [we]2626-we are going to succeed in [our]2626-we emprise , [we]2626-we must not only look [the peasant]2628-the peasant but act [the peasant]2628-the peasant . ” “[2628-the peasant] It is wisdom ; none can gainsay it . Let [us]2626-we go on , [Sir Boss]2609-sir boss . [I]0-i will take note and learn , and do the best [I]0-i may . ” [He]4445-the king kept [his]4445-the king word . [He]4445-the king did the best [he]4445-the king could , but [I]0-i 've seen better . If [you]5972-you have ever seen [an active , heedless , enterprising child]5973-an active , heedless , enterprising child going diligently out of one mischief and into another all day long , and [an anxious mother]5974-an anxious mother at [its]5973-an active , heedless , enterprising child heels all the while , and just saving [it]5973-an active , heedless , enterprising child by a hair from drowning itself or breaking [its]5973-an active , heedless , enterprising child neck with each new experiment , [you]5972-you 've seen [the king]4445-the king and [me]0-i . If [I]0-i could have foreseen what the thing was going to be like , [I]0-i should have said , No , if [anybody]553-anybody wants to make [his]553-anybody living exhibiting [a king]891-a king as [a peasant]2623-a peasant , let [him]553-anybody take the layout ; [I]0-i can do better with a menagerie , and last longer . And yet , during the first three days [I]0-i never allowed [him]553-anybody to enter [a hut]5979-a hut or [other dwelling]5980-other dwelling . If [he]553-anybody could pass muster anywhere during [his]553-anybody early novitiate it would be in [small inns]5981-small inns and on [the road]460-the road ; so to these places [we]5983-we confined [ourselves]5983-we . Yes , [he]553-anybody certainly did the best [he]553-anybody could , but what of that ? [He]553-anybody did n't improve a bit that [I]0-i could see . [He]553-anybody was always frightening [me]0-i , always breaking out with fresh astonishers , in new and unexpected places . Toward evening on the second day , what does [he]553-anybody do but blandly fetch out a dirk from inside [his]553-anybody robe ! “[0-i] Great guns , [[my]0-i liege]2621-my liege , where did [you]2621-my liege get that ? ” “[2621-my liege] From [a smuggler at [the inn]2633-the inn]2632-a smuggler at the inn , [yester eve]2634-yester eve . ” “[2621-my liege] What in [the world]374-the world possessed [you]2621-my liege to buy it ? ” “[2636-we] [We]2636-we have escaped divers dangers by wit -- [thy]2637-i wit -- but [I]0-i have bethought [me]0-i that it were but prudence if [I]0-i bore a weapon , too . [Thine]2638-thine might fail [thee]2637-i in some pinch . ” “[2638-thine] But [people of]5619-people of [our]2636-we condition are not allowed to carry arms . What would [a lord]2041-a lord say -- yes , or [any other person of whatever condition]2641-any other person of whatever condition --if [he]2041-a lord caught [an upstart peasant]2642-an upstart peasant with a dagger on [his]2041-a lord person ? ” It was a lucky thing for [us]2636-we that [nobody]476-nobody came along just then . [I]2041-a lord persuaded [him]2041-a lord to throw the dirk away ; and it was as easy as persuading [a child]5025-a child to give up some bright fresh new way of killing itself . [We]2636-we walked along , silent and thinking . Finally [the king]4445-the king said : “[2041-a lord] When [ye]2637-i know that [I]0-i meditate a thing inconvenient , or that hath a peril in it , why do [you]2637-i not warn [me]0-i to cease from that project ? ” It was a startling question , and a puzzler . [I]2637-i did n't quite know how to take hold of it , or what to say , and so , of course , [I]2637-i ended by saying the natural thing : “[2637-i] But , [sire]2588-sire , how can [I]0-i know what [your]2588-sire thoughts are ? ” [The king]4445-the king stopped dead in [his]4445-the king tracks , and stared at [me]0-i . “[0-i] [I]0-i believed [thou]2644-thou wert greater than [Merlin]134-merlin ; and truly in magic [thou]2644-thou art . But prophecy is greater than magic . [Merlin]134-merlin is [a prophet]2645-a prophet . ” [I]2588-sire saw [I]2588-sire had made a blunder . [I]2588-sire must get back [my]2588-sire lost ground . After a deep reflection and careful planning , [I]2588-sire said : “[2588-sire] [Sire]2588-sire , [I]0-i have been misunderstood . [I]0-i will explain . There are two kinds of prophecy . One is the gift to foretell things that are but a little way off , the other is the gift to foretell things that are whole ages and centuries away . Which is the mightier gift , do [you]2588-sire think ? ” “[2588-sire] Oh , the last , most surely ! ” “[2588-sire] True . Does [Merlin]134-merlin possess it ? ” “[134-merlin] Partly , yes . [He]134-merlin foretold mysteries about [my]0-i birth and future kingship that were twenty years away . ” “[134-merlin] Has [he]134-merlin ever gone beyond that ? ” “[134-merlin] [He]134-merlin would not claim more , [I]0-i think . ” “[0-i] It is probably [his]134-merlin limit . [All prophets]2647-all prophets have [their]2647-all prophets limit . The limit of some of [the great prophets]2648-the great prophets has been a hundred years . ” “[2648-the great prophets] These are few , [I]0-i ween . ” “[2648-the great prophets] There have been [two still greater ones , whose limit was four hundred and six hundred years]2649-two still greater ones , whose limit was four hundred and six hundred years , and one whose limit compassed even seven hundred and twenty . ” “[0-i] Gramercy , it is marvelous ! ” “[0-i] But what are these in comparison with [me]0-i ? They are nothing . ” “[2621-my liege] What ? Canst [thou]2650-thou truly look beyond even so vast a stretch of time as-- ” “[2621-my liege] Seven hundred years ? [[My]0-i liege]2621-my liege , as clear as the vision of an eagle does [my]0-i prophetic eye penetrate and lay bare the future of [this world]352-this world for nearly thirteen centuries and a half ! ” [[My]0-i land]5062-my land , [you]2621-my liege should have seen [the king]4445-the king 's eyes spread slowly open , and lift [the earth]399-the earth 's entire atmosphere as much as an inch ! That settled [Brer Merlin]134-merlin . [One]434-one never had any occasion to prove [his]434-one facts , with [these people]551-these people ; all [he]434-one had to do was to state them . It never occurred to [anybody]553-anybody to doubt the statement . “[0-i] Now , then , ” [I]0-i continued , “[0-i] [I]0-i _ could _ work both kinds of prophecy --the long and the short -- if [I]0-i chose to take the trouble to keep in practice ; but [I]0-i seldom exercise any but the long kind , because the other is beneath [my]0-i dignity . It is properer to [[Merlin]134-merlin 's sort --stump - tail prophets]2653-merlin 's sort --stump - tail prophets , as [we]2654-we call [them]2653-merlin 's sort --stump - tail prophets in the profession . Of course , [I]0-i whet up now and then and flirt out a minor prophecy , but not often -- hardly ever , in fact . [You]2655-you will remember that there was great talk , when [you]2655-you reached [the Valley of Holiness]2262-the valley of holiness , about [my]0-i having prophesied [your]2655-you coming and the very hour of [your]2655-you arrival , two or three days beforehand . ” “[0-i] Indeed , yes , [I]0-i mind it now . ” “[0-i] Well , [I]0-i could have done it as much as forty times easier , and piled on a thousand times more detail into the bargain , if it had been five hundred years away instead of two or three days . ” “[2657-a genuine expert] How amazing that it should be so ! ” “[2657-a genuine expert] Yes , [a genuine expert]2657-a genuine expert can always foretell a thing that is five hundred years away easier than [he]2657-a genuine expert can a thing that 's only five hundred seconds off . ” “[2657-a genuine expert] And yet in reason it should clearly be the other way ; it should be five hundred times as easy to foretell the last as the first , for , indeed , it is so close by that one uninspired might almost see it . In truth , the law of prophecy doth contradict the likelihoods , most strangely making the difficult easy , and the easy difficult . ” It was a wise head . [A peasant]2623-a peasant 's cap was no safe disguise for it ; [you]2655-you could know it for [a king]891-a king 's under a diving - bell , if [you]2655-you could hear it work its intellect . [I]2588-sire had a new trade now , and plenty of business in it . [The king]4445-the king was as hungry to find out everything that was going to happen during the next thirteen centuries as if [he]4445-the king were expecting to live in them . From that time out , [I]2588-sire prophesied [myself]2588-sire bald - headed trying to supply the demand . [I]2588-sire have done some indiscreet things in [my]2588-sire day , but this thing of playing [myself]2588-sire for [a prophet]2645-a prophet was the worst . Still , it had its ameliorations . [A prophet]2645-a prophet does n't have to have any brains . [They]2645-a prophet are good to have , of course , for the ordinary exigencies of life , but they are no use in professional work . It is the restfulest vocation there is . When the spirit of prophecy comes upon [you]2655-you , [you]2655-you merely take [your]2655-you intellect and lay it off in a cool place for a rest , and unship [your]2655-you jaw and leave it alone ; it will work itself : the result is prophecy . Every day [a knight - errant or so]5999-a knight - errant or so came along , and the sight of them fired [the king]4445-the king 's martial spirit every time . [He]4445-the king would have forgotten [himself]4445-the king , sure , and said something to [them]5999-a knight - errant or so in a style a suspicious shade or so above [his]4445-the king ostensible degree , and so [I]2588-sire always got [him]4445-the king well out of [the road]460-the road in time . Then [he]4445-the king would stand and look with all [his]4445-the king eyes ; and a proud light would flash from them , and [his]4445-the king nostrils would inflate like a war - horse 's , and [I]2588-sire knew [he]4445-the king was longing for a brush with them . But about noon of the third day [I]2588-sire had stopped in [the road]460-the road to take a precaution which had been suggested by the whip - stroke that had fallen to [my]2588-sire share two days before ; a precaution which [I]2588-sire had afterward decided to leave untaken , [I]2588-sire was so loath to institute it ; but now [I]2588-sire had just had a fresh reminder : while striding heedlessly along , with jaw spread and intellect at rest , for [I]2588-sire was prophesying , [I]2588-sire stubbed [my]2588-sire toe and fell sprawling . [I]2588-sire was so pale [I]2588-sire could n't think for a moment ; then [I]2588-sire got softly and carefully up and unstrapped [my]2588-sire knapsack . [I]2588-sire had that dynamite bomb in it , done up in wool in a box . It was a good thing to have along ; the time would come when [I]2588-sire could do a valuable miracle with it , maybe , but it was a nervous thing to have about [me]2588-sire , and [I]2588-sire did n't like to ask [the king]4445-the king to carry it . Yet [I]2588-sire must either throw it away or think up some safe way to get along with [its society]6004-its society . [I]2588-sire got it out and slipped it into [my]2588-sire scrip , and just then here came [a couple of knights]6005-a couple of knights . [The king]4445-the king stood , stately as a statue , gazing toward [them]6005-a couple of knights -- had forgotten [himself]4445-the king again , of course -- and before [I]2588-sire could get a word of warning out , it was time for [him]4445-the king to skip , and well that [he]4445-the king did it , too . [He]4445-the king supposed [they]6005-a couple of knights would turn aside . Turn aside to avoid trampling peasant dirt under foot ? When had [he]4445-the king ever turned aside [himself]4445-the king -- or ever had the chance to do it , if [a peasant]2623-a peasant saw [him]4445-the king or [any other noble knight]6008-any other noble knight in time to judiciously save [him]4445-the king the trouble ? [The knights]1587-the knights paid no attention to [the king]4445-the king at all ; it was [his]4445-the king place to look out [himself]4445-the king , and if [he]4445-the king had n't skipped [he]4445-the king would have been placidly ridden down , and laughed at besides . [The king]4445-the king was in a flaming fury , and launched out [his]4445-the king challenge and epithets with a most royal vigor . [The knights]1587-the knights were some little distance by now . [They]1587-the knights halted , greatly surprised , and turned in [their]1587-the knights saddles and looked back , as if wondering if it might be worth while to bother with such scum as [we]6013-we . Then [they]1587-the knights wheeled and started for [us]6013-we . Not a moment must be lost . [I]2588-sire started for _ [them]1587-the knights _ . [I]2588-sire passed [them]1587-the knights at a rattling gait , and as [I]2588-sire went by [I]2588-sire flung out a hair - lifting soul - scorching thirteen - jointed insult which made [the king]4445-the king 's effort poor and cheap by comparison . [I]2588-sire got it out of the nineteenth century where [they]1587-the knights know how . [They]1587-the knights had such headway that [they]1587-the knights were nearly to [the king]4445-the king before [they]1587-the knights could check up ; then , frantic with rage , [they]1587-the knights stood up [their]1587-the knights horses on [their]1587-the knights hind hoofs and whirled [them]1587-the knights around , and the next moment here [they]1587-the knights came , breast to breast . [I]2588-sire was seventy yards off , then , and scrambling up a great bowlder at the roadside . When [they]1587-the knights were within thirty yards of [me]2588-sire [they]1587-the knights let [their]1587-the knights long lances droop to a level , depressed [their]1587-the knights mailed heads , and so , with [their]1587-the knights horse - hair plumes streaming straight out behind , most gallant to see , this lightning express came tearing for [me]2588-sire ! When [they]1587-the knights were within fifteen yards , [I]2588-sire sent that bomb with a sure aim , and it struck the ground just under the horses ' noses . Yes , it was a neat thing , very neat and pretty to see . It resembled a steamboat explosion on [the Mississippi]69-the mississippi ; and during the next fifteen minutes [we]6016-we stood under a steady drizzle of microscopic fragments of [knights]412-knights and [hardware and horse - flesh]6018-hardware and horse - flesh . [I]2588-sire say [we]6016-we , for [the king]4445-the king joined [the audience]6020-the audience , of course , as soon as [he]4445-the king had got [his]4445-the king breath again . There was a hole there which would afford steady work for [all the people in [that region]1216-that region]6021-all the people in that region for some years to come --in trying to explain it , [I]2588-sire mean ; as for filling it up , that service would be comparatively prompt , and would fall to the lot of [a select few -- [peasants of that seignory]6024-peasants of that seignory]6023-a select few -- peasants of that seignory ; and [they]6023-a select few -- peasants of that seignory would n't get anything for it , either . But [I]2588-sire explained it to [the king]4445-the king [myself]2588-sire . [I]2588-sire said it was done with a dynamite bomb . This information did [him]4445-the king no damage , because it left [him]4445-the king as intelligent as [he]4445-the king was before . However , it was a noble miracle , in [his]4445-the king eyes , and was another settler for [Merlin]134-merlin . [I]2588-sire thought it well enough to explain that this was a miracle of so rare a sort that it could n't be done except when the atmospheric conditions were just right . Otherwise [he]4445-the king would be encoring it every time [we]6026-we had a good subject , and that would be inconvenient , because [I]2588-sire had n't any more bombs along . CHAPTER XXVIII DRILLING THE KING On the morning of the fourth day , when it was just sunrise , and [we]6026-we had been tramping an hour in the chill dawn , [I]2588-sire came to a resolution : [the king]4445-the king _ must _ be drilled ; things could not go on so , [he]4445-the king must be taken in hand and deliberately and conscientiously drilled , or [we]6026-we could n't ever venture to enter [a dwelling]6028-a dwelling ; [the very cats]6029-the very cats would know [this masquerader]6030-this masquerader for [a humbug]676-a humbug and [no peasant]6032-no peasant . So [I]2588-sire called a halt and said : “[2588-sire] [Sire]2588-sire , as between clothes and countenance , [you]2588-sire are all right , there is no discrepancy ; but as between [your]2588-sire clothes and [your]2588-sire bearing , [you]2588-sire are all wrong , there is a most noticeable discrepancy . [Your]2588-sire soldierly stride , [your]2588-sire lordly port -- these will not do . [You]2588-sire stand too straight , [your]2588-sire looks are too high , too confident . The cares of [a kingdom]1192-a kingdom do not stoop the shoulders , [they]2660-they do not droop the chin , [they]2660-they do not depress the high level of the eye - glance , [they]2660-they do not put doubt and fear in the heart and hang out the signs of [them]2660-they in slouching body and unsure step . It is the sordid cares of [the lowly born that do these things]2661-the lowly born that do these things . [You]2588-sire must learn the trick ; [you]2588-sire must imitate the trademarks of poverty , misery , oppression , insult , and the other several and common inhumanities that sap the manliness out of [a man]518-a man and make [him]518-a man [a loyal and proper and approved subject]2663-a loyal and proper and approved subject and a satisfaction to [[his]518-a man masters]2664-his masters , or [the very infants]2665-the very infants will know [you]2588-sire for better than [your]2588-sire disguise , and [we]2666-we shall go to pieces at [the first hut [we]2666-we stop at]2667-the first hut we stop at . Pray try to walk like this . ” [The king]4445-the king took careful note , and then tried an imitation . “[2665-the very infants] Pretty fair -- pretty fair . Chin a little lower , please -- there , very good . Eyes too high ; pray do n't look at the horizon , look at the ground , ten steps in front of [you]2588-sire . Ah -- that is better , that is very good . Wait , please ; [you]2588-sire betray too much vigor , too much decision ; [you]2588-sire want more of a shamble . Look at [me]0-i , please -- this is what [I]0-i mean .... Now [you]2588-sire are getting it ; that is the idea -- at least , it sort of approaches it .... Yes , that is pretty fair . _ But ! _ There is a great big something wanting , [I]0-i do n't quite know what it is . Please walk thirty yards , so that [I]0-i can get a perspective on the thing .... Now , then -- [your]2588-sire head 's right , speed 's right , shoulders right , eyes right , chin right , gait , carriage , general style right -- everything 's right ! And yet the fact remains , the aggregate 's wrong . The account do n't balance . Do it again , please .... _ Now _ [I]0-i think [I]0-i begin to see what it is . Yes , [I]0-i 've struck it . [You]2588-sire see , the genuine spiritlessness is wanting ; that 's what 's the trouble . It 's all _ amateur_--mechanical details all right , almost to a hair ; everything about the delusion perfect , except that it do n't delude . ” “[434-one] What , then , must [one]434-one do , to prevail ? ” “[434-one] Let [me]0-i think ... [I]0-i ca n't seem to quite get at it . In fact , there is n't anything that can right the matter but practice . This is a good place for it : roots and stony ground to break up [your]2588-sire stately gait , [a region not liable to interruption]2669-a region not liable to interruption , only one field and one hut in sight , and they so far away that [nobody]476-nobody could see [us]2671-us from there . It will be well to move a little off [the road]460-the road and put in the whole day drilling [you]2588-sire , [sire]2588-sire . ” After the drill had gone on a little while , [I]2588-sire said : “[2588-sire] Now , [sire]2588-sire , imagine that [we]2671-us are at the door of [the hut yonder]2675-the hut yonder , and [the family]1661-the family are before [us]2671-us . Proceed , please -- accost [the head of [the house]584-the house]2677-the head of the house . ” [The king]4445-the king unconsciously straightened up like a monument , and said , with frozen austerity : “[278-varlet] [Varlet]278-varlet , bring a seat ; and serve to [me]0-i what cheer [ye]278-varlet have . ” “[278-varlet] Ah , [[your]2588-sire grace]2679-your grace , that is not well done . ” “[278-varlet] In what lacketh it ? ” “[278-varlet] [These people]551-these people do not call _ [each other _ varlets]2681-each other _ varlets . ” “[551-these people] Nay , is that true ? ” “[551-these people] Yes ; only those above [them]551-these people call [them]551-these people so . ” “[551-these people] Then must [I]0-i try again . [I]0-i will call [him]2682-him villein . ” “[0-i] No - no ; for [he]2682-him may be [a freeman]2683-a freeman . ” “[0-i] Ah -- so . Then peradventure [I]0-i should call [him]2682-him [goodman]2684-goodman . ” “[2684-goodman] That would answer , [[your]2588-sire grace]2679-your grace , but it would be still better if [you]0-i said [friend]4425-friend , or [brother]2687-brother . ” “[0-i] [Brother!--to dirt]2688-brother!--to dirt like that ? ” “[2688-brother!--to dirt] Ah , but _ [we]2689-we _ are pretending to be dirt like that , too . ” “[2688-brother!--to dirt] It is even true . [I]0-i will say it . [Brother]245-merlin , bring a seat , and thereto what cheer [ye]245-merlin have , withal . Now ' tis right . ” “[245-merlin] Not quite , not wholly right . [You]245-merlin have asked for one , not _ [us]2689-we _ --for one , not both ; food for one , a seat for one . ” [The king]4445-the king looked puzzled -- [he]4445-the king was n't a very heavy weight , intellectually . [His]4445-the king head was an hour - glass ; it could stow an idea , but it had to do it a grain at a time , not the whole idea at once . “[245-merlin] Would _ [you]245-merlin _ have a seat also -- and sit ? ” “[245-merlin] If [I]0-i did not sit , [the man]536-the man would perceive that [we]2689-we were only pretending to be [equals]2691-equals -- and playing the deception pretty poorly , too . ” “[536-the man] It is well and truly said ! How wonderful is truth , come it in whatsoever unexpected form it may ! Yes , [he]536-the man must bring out seats and food for both , and in serving [us]2689-we present not ewer and napkin with more show of respect to [the one]742-the one than to [the other]2021-the other . ” “[536-the man] And there is even yet a detail that needs correcting . [He]536-the man must bring nothing outside ; [we]2689-we will go in -- in among the dirt , and possibly other repulsive things,--and take the food with [the household]1783-the household , and after the fashion of [the house]584-the house , and all on equal terms , except [the man]536-the man be of [the serf class]2697-the serf class ; and finally , there will be no ewer and no napkin , whether [he]536-the man be serf or free . Please walk again , [[my]0-i liege]2621-my liege . There -- it is better -- it is the best yet ; but not perfect . The shoulders have known no ignobler burden than iron mail , and [they]2699-they will not stoop . ” “[2699-they] Give [me]0-i , then , the bag . [I]0-i will learn the spirit that goeth with burdens that have not honor . It is the spirit that stoopeth the shoulders , [I]0-i ween , and not the weight ; for armor is heavy , yet it is a proud burden , and [a man]518-a man standeth straight in it .... Nay , but [me]0-i no buts , offer [me]0-i no objections . [I]0-i will have the thing . Strap it upon [my]0-i back . ” [He]536-the man was complete now with that knapsack on , and looked as little like [a king]891-a king as [any man [I]0-i had ever seen]6037-any man i had ever seen . But it was [an obstinate pair of shoulders]6038-an obstinate pair of shoulders ; [they]6038-an obstinate pair of shoulders could not seem to learn the trick of stooping with any sort of deceptive naturalness . The drill went on , [I]0-i prompting and correcting : “[0-i] Now , make believe [you]2621-my liege are in debt , and eaten up by [relentless creditors]2701-relentless creditors ; [you]2621-my liege are out of work -- which is horse - shoeing , let [us]2702-us say -- and can get none ; and [[your]2621-my liege wife]4891-your wife is sick , [[your]2621-my liege children]2704-your children are crying because [they]2704-your children are hungry-- ” And so on , and so on . [I]2705-the working classes drilled [him]536-the man as representing in turn all sorts of [people]357-people out of luck and suffering dire privations and misfortunes . But lord , it was only just words , words -- they meant nothing in [the world]374-the world to [him]536-the man , [I]2705-the working classes might just as well have whistled . Words realize nothing , vivify nothing to [you]2621-my liege , unless [you]2621-my liege have suffered in [[your]2621-my liege own person]6041-your own person the thing which the words try to describe . There are [wise people]6042-wise people who talk ever so knowingly and complacently about “[2705-the working classes] [the working classes]2705-the working classes , ” and satisfy [themselves]6042-wise people that a day 's hard intellectual work is very much harder than a day 's hard manual toil , and is righteously entitled to much bigger pay . Why , [they]6042-wise people really think that , [you]2621-my liege know , because [they]6042-wise people know all about the one , but have n't tried the other . But [I]2705-the working classes know all about both ; and so far as [I]2705-the working classes am concerned , there is n't money enough in [the universe]5924-the universe to hire [me]2705-the working classes to swing a pickaxe thirty days , but [I]2705-the working classes will do the hardest kind of intellectual work for just as near nothing as [you]2621-my liege can cipher it down -- and [I]2705-the working classes will be satisfied , too . Intellectual “[2705-the working classes] work ” is misnamed ; it is a pleasure , a dissipation , and is its own highest reward . [The poorest paid architect]6044-the poorest paid architect , [engineer]6045-engineer , [general]6046-general , [author , sculptor]6047-author , sculptor , [painter]6048-painter , [lecturer]6049-lecturer , [advocate]6050-advocate , [legislator]6051-legislator , [actor]6052-actor , [preacher]6053-preacher , [singer]6054-singer is constructively in [heaven]4564-heaven when [he]6044-the poorest paid architect is at work ; and as for [the musician with the fiddle - bow in [his]6056-the musician with the fiddle - bow in his hand who sits in the midst of a great orchestra with the ebbing and flowing tides of divine sound washing over him hand who sits in the midst of a great orchestra with the ebbing and flowing tides of divine sound washing over [him]6056-the musician with the fiddle - bow in his hand who sits in the midst of a great orchestra with the ebbing and flowing tides of divine sound washing over him]6056-the musician with the fiddle - bow in his hand who sits in the midst of a great orchestra with the ebbing and flowing tides of divine sound washing over him -- why , certainly , [he]6056-the musician with the fiddle - bow in his hand who sits in the midst of a great orchestra with the ebbing and flowing tides of divine sound washing over him is at work , if [you]2621-my liege wish to call it that , but [lord]6057-lord , it 's a sarcasm just the same . The law of work does seem utterly unfair -- but there it is , and nothing can change it : the higher the pay in enjoyment [the worker]6058-the worker gets out of it , the higher shall be [his]6058-the worker pay in cash , also . And it 's also the very law of those transparent swindles , transmissible nobility and kingship . CHAPTER XXIX [THE SMALLPOX HUT]6059-the smallpox hut When [we]6060-we arrived at [that hut]6061-that hut at mid - afternoon , [we]6060-we saw no signs of life about [it]6061-that hut . [The field near by]6062-the field near by had been denuded of [its]6062-the field near by crop some time before , and had a skinned look , so exhaustively had it been harvested and gleaned . [Fences]6063-fences , [sheds]6064-sheds , everything had a ruined look , and were eloquent of poverty . No animal was around anywhere , no living thing in sight . The stillness was awful , it was like the stillness of death . [The cabin]6065-the cabin was [a one - story one]6066-a one - story one , whose thatch was black with age , and ragged from lack of repair . The door stood a trifle ajar . [We]6060-we approached [it]6065-the cabin stealthily -- on tiptoe and at half - breath -- for that is the way [one]434-one 's feeling makes [him]434-one do , at such a time . [The king]4445-the king knocked . [We]6060-we waited . No answer . Knocked again . No answer . [I]2705-the working classes pushed the door softly open and looked in . [I]2705-the working classes made out some dim forms , and [a woman]6069-a woman started up from the ground and stared at [me]2705-the working classes , as one does who is wakened from sleep . Presently [she]6069-a woman found [her]6069-a woman voice : “[2705-the working classes] Have mercy ! ” [she]6069-a woman pleaded . “[2705-the working classes] All is taken , nothing is left . ” “[2705-the working classes] [I]0-i have not come to take anything , [poor woman]2706-poor woman . ” “[0-i] [You]0-i are not [a priest]4649-a priest ? ” “[0-i] No . ” “[0-i] Nor come not from [the lord of the manor]5013-the lord of the manor ? ” “[5013-the lord of the manor] No , [I]0-i am [a stranger]798-a stranger . ” “[798-a stranger] Oh , then , for the fear of [God]121-god , who visits with misery and death such as be harmless , tarry not here , but fly ! [This place]4515-this place is under [his]121-god curse -- and [[his]121-god Church 's]2711-his church 's . ” “[0-i] Let [me]0-i come in and help [you]2706-poor woman -- [you]2706-poor woman are sick and in trouble . ” [I]0-i was better used to the dim light now . [I]0-i could see [her]2706-poor woman hollow eyes fixed upon [me]0-i . [I]0-i could see how emaciated [she]2706-poor woman was . “[0-i] [I]0-i tell [you]2706-poor woman [the place]448-the place is under [the Church 's ban]2713-the church 's ban . Save [yourself]2706-poor woman --and go , before [some straggler]2714-some straggler see [thee]2706-poor woman here , and report it . ” “[2706-poor woman] Give [yourself]2706-poor woman no trouble about [me]0-i ; [I]0-i do n't care anything for the Church 's curse . Let [me]0-i help [you]2706-poor woman . ” “[0-i] Now [all good spirits]2715-all good spirits -- if there be any such -- bless [thee]2706-poor woman for that word . Would [God]121-god [I]0-i had a sup of water!--but hold , hold , forget [I]0-i said it , and fly ; for there is that here that even [he]121-god that feareth not [the Church]900-the church must fear : this disease whereof [we]2717-we die . Leave [us]2717-we , [thou]2706-poor woman brave , [good stranger]2718-good stranger , and take with [thee]2706-poor woman such whole and sincere blessing as [them]2719-them that be accursed can give . ” But before this [I]2588-sire had picked up a wooden bowl and was rushing past [the king]4445-the king on [my]2588-sire way to [the brook]6071-the brook . [It]6071-the brook was ten yards away . When [I]2588-sire got back and entered , [the king]4445-the king was within , and was opening the shutter that closed the window - hole , to let in air and light . [The place]448-the place was full of a foul stench . [I]2588-sire put the bowl to [the woman]1872-the woman 's lips , and as [she]1872-the woman gripped it with [her]1872-the woman eager talons the shutter came open and a strong light flooded [her]1872-the woman face . Smallpox ! [I]2588-sire sprang to [the king]4445-the king , and said in [his]4445-the king ear : “[2588-sire] Out of the door on the instant , [sire]2588-sire ! [the woman]1872-the woman is dying of that disease that wasted the skirts of [Camelot]7-camelot two years ago . ” [He]4445-the king did not budge . “[1872-the woman] Of a truth [I]0-i shall remain -- and likewise help . ” [I]1026-king whispered again : “[1026-king] [King]1026-king , it must not be . [You]1026-king must go . ” “[1026-king] [Ye]1026-king mean well , and [ye]1026-king speak not unwisely . But it were shame that [a king]891-a king should know fear , and shame that [belted knight]2724-belted knight should withhold [his]2724-belted knight hand where be such as need succor . Peace , [I]0-i will not go . It is [you]1026-king who must go . [The Church]18-the church 's ban is not upon [me]0-i , but it forbiddeth [you]1026-king to be [here]369-here , and [she]1872-the woman will deal with [you]1026-king with a heavy hand an word come to [her]1872-the woman of [your]1026-king trespass . ” It was a desperate place for [him]1026-king to be in , and might cost [him]1026-king [his]1026-king life , but it was no use to argue with [him]1026-king . If [he]1026-king considered [his]1026-king knightly honor at stake here , that was the end of argument ; [he]1026-king would stay , and nothing could prevent it ; [I]1872-the woman was aware of that . And so [I]1872-the woman dropped the subject . [The woman]1872-the woman spoke : “[1872-the woman] Fair sir , of [your]1026-king kindness will [ye]1026-king climb the ladder there , and bring [me]0-i news of what [ye]1026-king find ? Be not afraid to report , for times can come when even [a mother]5919-a mother 's heart is past breaking --being already broke . ” “[1872-the woman] Abide , ” said [the king]4445-the king , “[1872-the woman] and give [the woman]1872-the woman to eat . [I]0-i will go . ” And [he]4445-the king put down the knapsack . [I]0-i turned to start , but [the king]4445-the king had already started . [He]4445-the king halted , and looked down upon [a man who lay in a dim light]6079-a man who lay in a dim light , and had not noticed [us]6080-us thus far , or spoken . “[0-i] Is it [[your]1026-king husband]2728-your husband ? ” [the king]4445-the king asked . “[2728-your husband] Yes . ” “[2728-your husband] Is [he]2728-your husband asleep ? ” “[2728-your husband] [God]121-god be thanked for that one charity , yes -- these three hours . Where shall [I]0-i pay to the full , [my]0-i gratitude ! for [my]0-i heart is bursting with it for that sleep [he]2728-your husband sleepeth now . ” [I]2728-your husband said : “[2728-your husband] [We]2729-we will be careful . [We]2729-we will not wake [him]2728-your husband . ” “[2729-we] Ah , no , that [ye]1026-king will not , for [he]2728-your husband is dead . ” “[2728-your husband] Dead ? ” “[2728-your husband] Yes , what triumph it is to know it ! [None]557-none can harm [him]2728-your husband , none insult [him]2728-your husband more . [He]2728-your husband is in [heaven]4564-heaven now , and happy ; or if not there , [he]2728-your husband bides in hell and is content ; for in [that place]2318-that place [he]2728-your husband will find neither [abbot]2733-abbot nor yet [bishop]4654-bishop . [We]2729-we were [boy]2320-boy and [girl]2736-girl together ; [we]2729-we were [man]4450-man and [wife]2084-wife these five and twenty years , and never separated till this day . Think how long that is to love and suffer together . This morning was [he]2728-your husband out of [his]2728-your husband mind , and in [his]2728-your husband fancy [we]2729-we were [boy and girl]2739-boy and girl again and wandering in [the happy fields]2740-the happy fields ; and so in [that innocent glad converse]2741-that innocent glad converse wandered [he]2728-your husband far and farther , still lightly gossiping , and entered into [those other fields]2742-those other fields [we]2729-we know not of , and was shut away from mortal sight . And so there was no parting , for in [his]2728-your husband fancy [I]0-i went with [him]2728-your husband ; [he]2728-your husband knew not but [I]0-i went with [him]2728-your husband , [my]0-i hand in [his]2728-your husband -- [my]0-i young soft hand , not this withered claw . Ah , yes , to go , and know it not ; to separate and know it not ; how could [one]434-one go peacefuler than that ? It was [his]2728-your husband reward for a cruel life patiently borne . ” There was a slight noise from the direction of the dim corner where the ladder was . It was [the king]4445-the king descending . [I]2728-your husband could see that [he]4445-the king was bearing something in one arm , and assisting [himself]4445-the king with the other . [He]4445-the king came forward into the light ; upon [his]4445-the king breast lay [a slender girl of fifteen]6083-a slender girl of fifteen . [She]6083-a slender girl of fifteen was but half conscious ; [she]6083-a slender girl of fifteen was dying of smallpox . Here was heroism at its last and loftiest possibility , its utmost summit ; this was challenging death in [the open field]6084-the open field unarmed , with all the odds against [the challenger]6085-the challenger , no reward set upon the contest , and no admiring world in silks and cloth of gold to gaze and applaud ; and yet [the king]4445-the king 's bearing was as serenely brave as it had always been in those cheaper contests where [knight]372-knight meets [knight]372-knight in equal fight and clothed in protecting steel . [He]4445-the king was great now ; sublimely great . [The rude statues of [[his]4445-the king ancestors]5270-his ancestors in [[his]4445-the king palace]1286-his palace]6089-the rude statues of his ancestors in his palace should have an addition -- [I]2728-your husband would see to that ; and it would not be [a mailed king]6092-a mailed king killing a giant or a dragon , like the rest , it would be [a king in [commoner]6094-commoner 's garb bearing death in [his]4445-the king arms that [a peasant mother]6095-a peasant mother might look [her]6095-a peasant mother last upon [[her]6095-a peasant mother child]6096-her child and be comforted . [He]4445-the king laid [the girl]1272-the girl down by [[her]1272-the girl mother]6098-her mother , who poured out endearments and caresses from an overflowing heart , and one could detect a flickering faint light of response in [the child]5150-the child 's eyes]6093-a king in commoner 's garb bearing death in his arms that a peasant mother might look her last upon her child and be comforted . he laid the girl down by her mother , who poured out endearments and caresses from an overflowing heart , and one could detect a flickering faint light of response in the child 's eyes , but that was all . [The mother]6100-the mother hung over [her]1272-the girl , kissing [her]1272-the girl , petting [her]1272-the girl , and imploring [her]1272-the girl to speak , but the lips only moved and no sound came . [I]2728-your husband snatched [my]2728-your husband liquor flask from [my]2728-your husband knapsack , but [the woman]1872-the woman forbade [me]2728-your husband , and said : “[2728-your husband] No -- [she]2744-her does not suffer ; it is better so .
