It might bring [her]2744-her back to life . None that be so good and kind as [ye]2745-ye are would do [her]2744-her that cruel hurt . For look [you]2745-ye -- what is left to live for ? [[Her]2744-her brothers]2746-her brothers are gone , [[her]2744-her father]2004-her father is gone , [[her]2744-her mother]6098-her mother goeth , [the Church]900-the church 's curse is upon [her]2744-her , and [none]557-none may shelter or befriend [her]2744-her even though [she]2744-her lay perishing in [the road]460-the road . [She]2744-her is desolate . [I]0-i have not asked [you]2745-ye , good heart , if [[her]2744-her sister]2752-her sister be still on live , here overhead ; [I]0-i had no need ; [ye]2745-ye had gone back , else , and not left the poor thing forsaken-- ” “[2744-her] [She]2744-her lieth at peace , ” interrupted [the king]4445-the king , in a subdued voice . “[2744-her] [I]0-i would not change it . How rich is this day in happiness ! Ah , [[my]0-i Annis]2753-my annis , [thou]2754-thy shalt join [[thy]2754-thy sister]2755-thy sister soon -- thou'rt on [thy]2754-thy way , and these be merciful friends that will not hinder . ” And so [she]2744-her fell to murmuring and cooing over [the girl]1272-the girl again , and softly stroking [her]1272-the girl face and hair , and kissing [her]1272-the girl and calling [her]1272-the girl by endearing names ; but there was scarcely sign of response now in the glazing eyes . [I]2753-my annis saw tears well from [the king]4445-the king 's eyes , and trickle down [his]4445-the king face . [The woman]1872-the woman noticed them , too , and said : “[2753-my annis] Ah , [I]0-i know that sign : thou'st [a wife]2089-a wife at [home]619-home , [poor soul]2758-poor soul , and [you]2754-thy and [she]2089-a wife have gone hungry to bed , many 's the time , that [the little ones]2759-the little ones might have [your]2754-thy crust ; [you]2754-thy know what poverty is , and the daily insults of [[your]2754-thy betters]2760-your betters , and the heavy hand of [the Church]900-the church and [the king]4445-the king . ” [The king]4445-the king winced under this accidental home - shot , but kept still ; [he]4445-the king was learning [his]4445-the king part ; and [he]4445-the king was playing it well , too , for [a pretty dull beginner]6107-a pretty dull beginner . [I]2763-i struck up a diversion . [I]2763-i offered [the woman]1872-the woman food and liquor , but [she]1872-the woman refused both . [She]1872-the woman would allow nothing to come between [her]1872-the woman and the release of death . Then [I]2763-i slipped away and brought [the dead child]6109-the dead child from aloft , and laid it by [her]1872-the woman . This broke [her]1872-the woman down again , and there was another scene that was full of heartbreak . By and by [I]2763-i made another diversion , and beguiled [her]1872-the woman to sketch [her]1872-the woman story . “[2763-i] [Ye]2763-i know it well [yourselves]2763-i , having suffered it -- for truly none of [our]2764-our condition in [Britain]32-britain escape it . It is the old , weary tale . [We]2764-our fought and struggled and succeeded ; meaning by success , that [we]2764-our lived and did not die ; more than that is not to be claimed . No troubles came that [we]2764-our could not outlive , till this year brought [them]2765-them ; then came [they]2765-them all at once , as [one]434-one might say , and overwhelmed [us]2764-our . Years ago [the lord of [the manor]2768-the manor]5013-the lord of the manor planted certain fruit trees on [[our]2764-our farm]2769-our farm ; in the best part of it , too -- a grievous wrong and shame-- ” “[5013-the lord of the manor] But it was [his]5013-the lord of the manor right , ” interrupted [the king]4445-the king . “[5013-the lord of the manor] None denieth that , indeed ; an the law mean anything , what is [the lord]5598-the lord 's is [his]5598-the lord , and what is [mine]2771-mine is [his]5013-the lord of the manor also . [[Our]2764-our farm]2769-our farm was [ours]2764-our by lease , therefore ' twas likewise [his]5013-the lord of the manor , to do with it as [he]5013-the lord of the manor would . Some little time ago , three of those trees were found hewn down . [[Our]2764-our three grown sons]2773-our three grown sons ran frightened to report the crime . Well , in [[[his]5013-the lord of the manor lordship]2774-his lordship 's dungeon]2775-his lordship 's dungeon there [they]2773-our three grown sons lie , who saith there shall [they]2773-our three grown sons lie and rot till [they]2773-our three grown sons confess . [They]2773-our three grown sons have naught to confess , being innocent , wherefore there will [they]2773-our three grown sons remain until [they]2773-our three grown sons die . [Ye]2776-ye know that right well , [I]0-i ween . Think how this left [us]2764-our ; [a man]518-a man , [a woman]6069-a woman and [two children]2779-two children , to gather a crop that was planted by so much greater force , yes , and protect it night and day from pigeons and prowling animals that be sacred and must not be hurt by any of [our]2764-our sort . When [[my]0-i lord]1456-my lord 's crop was nearly ready for the harvest , so also was [ours]2764-our ; when [his]5013-the lord of the manor bell rang to call [us]2764-our to [[his]5013-the lord of the manor fields]2781-his fields to harvest [his]5013-the lord of the manor crop for nothing , [he]5013-the lord of the manor would not allow that [I]0-i and [[my]0-i two girls]2782-my two girls should count for [[our]2764-our three captive sons]2783-our three captive sons , but for only two of [them]2783-our three captive sons ; so , for [the lacking one]2784-the lacking one were [we]2764-our daily fined . All this time [our]2764-our own crop was perishing through neglect ; and so both [the priest]739-the priest and [[his]739-the priest lordship]2774-his lordship fined [us]2764-our because [their]2787-they shares of it were suffering through damage . In the end the fines ate up [our]2764-our crop -- and [they]2787-they took it all ; [they]2787-they took it all and made [us]2764-our harvest it for [them]2787-they , without pay or food , and [we]2764-our starving . Then the worst came when [I]0-i , being out of [my]0-i mind with hunger and loss of [[my]0-i boys]5337-my boys , and grief to see [[my]0-i husband]2789-my husband and [[my]0-i little maids]2790-my little maids in rags and misery and despair , uttered a deep blasphemy -- oh ! [a thousand of [them]2787-they]2791-a thousand of them ! --against [the Church]900-the church and [the Church]900-the church 's ways . It was ten days ago . [I]0-i had fallen sick with this disease , and it was to [the priest]739-the priest [I]0-i said the words , for [he]739-the priest was come to chide [me]0-i for lack of due humility under the chastening hand of [God]121-god . [He]739-the priest carried [my]0-i trespass to [his]739-the priest betters ; [I]0-i was stubborn ; wherefore , presently upon [my]0-i head and upon all heads that were dear to [me]0-i , fell the curse of [Rome]34-rome . “ Since that day [we]6111-we are avoided , shunned with horror . [None]557-none has come near [this hut]6113-this hut to know whether [we]6111-we live or not . [The rest of [us]6111-we]6114-the rest of us were taken down . Then [I]2795-i roused [me]2795-i and got up , as [wife]2084-wife and [mother]6116-mother will . It was little [they]6114-the rest of us could have eaten in any case ; it was less than little [they]6114-the rest of us had to eat . But there was water , and [I]2795-i gave [them]6114-the rest of us that . How [they]6114-the rest of us craved it ! and how [they]6114-the rest of us blessed it ! But the end came yesterday ; [my]2795-i strength broke down . Yesterday was the last time [I]2795-i ever saw [[my]2795-i husband]2789-my husband and [this youngest child]6118-this youngest child alive . [I]2795-i have lain [here]369-here all these hours -- these ages , [ye]6120-ye may say -- listening , listening for any sound up there that-- ”[2795-i] [She]2795-i gave a sharp quick glance at [[her]2795-i eldest daughter]2796-her eldest daughter , then cried out , “ Oh , [[my]2795-i darling]5918-my darling ! ”[2795-i] and feebly gathered the stiffening form to [her]2795-i sheltering arms . [She]2795-i had recognized the death - rattle . CHAPTER XXX THE TRAGEDY OF [THE MANOR - HOUSE]70-the manor - house At midnight all was over , and [we]2797-we sat in the presence of [four corpses]2798-four corpses . [We]2797-we covered [them]2798-four corpses with such rags as [we]2797-we could find , and started away , fastening the door behind [us]2797-we . [[Their]2798-four corpses home]2234-their home must be [[these people]551-these people 's grave]2801-these people 's grave , for [they]2798-four corpses could not have Christian burial , or be admitted to [consecrated ground]2802-consecrated ground . [They]2798-four corpses were as dogs , wild beasts , [lepers]2803-lepers , and [no soul that valued its hope of eternal life]2804-no soul that valued its hope of eternal life would throw it away by meddling in any sort with [these rebuked and smitten outcasts]2805-these rebuked and smitten outcasts . [We]2797-we had not moved four steps when [I]0-i caught a sound as of footsteps upon gravel . [My]0-i heart flew to [my]0-i throat . [We]2797-we must not be seen coming from [that house]2806-that house . [I]0-i plucked at [the king]4445-the king 's robe and [we]2797-we drew back and took shelter behind the corner of [the cabin]6065-the cabin . “ Now [we]2797-we are safe , ”[0-i] [I]0-i said , “ but it was a close call -- so to speak . If the night had been lighter [he]4445-the king might have seen [us]2797-we , no doubt , [he]4445-the king seemed to be so near . ”[0-i] “ Mayhap it is but a beast and not [a man]518-a man at all . ”[0-i] “ True . But [man]4450-man or beast , it will be wise to stay [here]369-here a minute and let it get by and out of the way . ”[0-i] “ Hark ! It cometh hither . ”[0-i] True again . The step was coming toward [us]2797-we -- straight toward [the hut]2809-the hut . It must be a beast , then , and [we]2797-we might as well have saved [our]2797-we trepidation . [I]0-i was going to step out , but [the king]4445-the king laid [his]4445-the king hand upon [my]0-i arm . There was a moment of silence , then [we]2797-we heard a soft knock on [the cabin]6065-the cabin door . It made [me]0-i shiver . Presently the knock was repeated , and then [we]2797-we heard these words in a guarded voice : “ [Mother]279-mother ! [Father]5183-father ! Open -- [we]2797-we have got free , and [we]2797-we bring news to pale [your]4445-the king cheeks but glad [your]4445-the king hearts ; and [we]2797-we may not tarry , but must fly ! And -- but [they]2815-those desolate men answer not . [Mother]279-mother ! father!-- ”[0-i] [I]0-i drew [the king]4445-the king toward the other end of [the hut]2809-the hut and whispered : “ Come -- now [we]2797-we can get to [the road]460-the road . ”[0-i] [The king]4445-the king hesitated , was going to demur ; but just then [we]2797-we heard the door give way , and knew that [those desolate men]2815-those desolate men were in the presence of [their]2815-those desolate men dead . “ Come , [[my]4445-the king liege]2621-my liege ! in a moment [they]2815-those desolate men will strike a light , and then will follow that which it would break [your]2621-my liege heart to hear . ”[4445-the king] [He]4445-the king did not hesitate this time . The moment [we]2797-we were in [the road]460-the road [I]0-i ran ; and after a moment [he]4445-the king threw dignity aside and followed . [I]0-i did not want to think of what was happening in [the hut]2809-the hut -- [I]0-i could n't bear it ; [I]0-i wanted to drive it out of [my]0-i mind ; so [I]0-i struck into the first subject that lay under that one in [my]0-i mind : “ [I]4445-the king have had the disease [those people]823-those people died of , and so have nothing to fear ; but if [you]2621-my liege have not had it also-- ”[4445-the king] [He]4445-the king broke in upon [me]0-i to say [he]4445-the king was in trouble , and it was [his]4445-the king conscience that was troubling [him]4445-the king : “ [These young men]6129-these young men have got free , [they]6129-these young men say -- but _ how _ ? It is not likely that [[their]6129-these young men lord]1447-their lord hath set [them]6129-these young men free . ”[4445-the king] “ Oh , no , [I]4445-the king make no doubt [they]6129-these young men escaped . ”[4445-the king] “ That is [my]4445-the king trouble ; [I]4445-the king have a fear that this is so , and [your]2621-my liege suspicion doth confirm it , [you]2621-my liege having the same fear . ”[4445-the king] “ [I]4445-the king should not call it by that name though . [I]4445-the king do suspect that [they]6129-these young men escaped , but if [they]6129-these young men did , [I]4445-the king am not sorry , certainly . ”[4445-the king] “ [I]4445-the king am not sorry , [I]4445-the king _ think_--but-- ”[4445-the king] “ What is it ? What is there for one to be troubled about ? ”[4445-the king] “ _ If _ [they]6129-these young men did escape , then are [we]6131-we bound in duty to lay hands upon [them]6129-these young men and deliver [them]6129-these young men again to [[their]6129-these young men lord]1447-their lord ; for it is not seemly that one of [his]2818-his quality should suffer a so insolent and high - handed outrage from persons of [their]6129-these young men base degree . ”[4445-the king] There it was again . [He]2818-his could see only one side of it . [He]2818-his was born so , educated so , [his]2818-his veins were full of ancestral blood that was rotten with this sort of unconscious brutality , brought down by inheritance from a long procession of hearts that had each done its share toward poisoning [the stream]4795-the stream . To imprison [these men]2820-these men without proof , and starve [their]2820-these men kindred , was no harm , for [they]2820-these men were merely [peasants]5956-peasants and subject to the will and pleasure of [[their]2820-these men lord]1447-their lord , no matter what fearful form it might take ; but for [these men]2820-these men to break out of unjust captivity was insult and outrage , and a thing not to be countenanced by [any conscientious person who knew [his]2824-any conscientious person who knew his duty to his sacred caste duty to [his]2824-any conscientious person who knew his duty to his sacred caste sacred caste]2824-any conscientious person who knew his duty to his sacred caste . [I]0-i worked more than half an hour before [I]0-i got [him]2818-his to change the subject -- and even then an outside matter did it for [me]0-i . This was a something which caught [our]2825-our eyes as [we]2825-our struck [the summit of [a small hill]2827-a small hill]2826-the summit of a small hill -- a red glow , a good way off . “ That 's a fire , ”[0-i] said [I.]0-i Fires interested [me]0-i considerably , because [I]0-i was getting a good deal of an insurance business started , and was also training some horses and building some steam fire - engines , with an eye to [a paid fire department]2828-a paid fire department by and by . [The priests]1232-the priests opposed both [my]0-i fire and life insurance , on the ground that it was an insolent attempt to hinder the decrees of [God]121-god ; and if [you]2830-you pointed out that [they]1232-the priests did not hinder the decrees in the least , but only modified the hard consequences of them if [you]2830-you took out policies and had luck , [they]1232-the priests retorted that that was gambling against the decrees of [God]121-god , and was just as bad . So [they]1232-the priests managed to damage those industries more or less , but [I]0-i got even on [my]0-i accident business . As a rule , [a knight]1057-a knight is [a lummux]2832-a lummux , and some times even [a labrick]2833-a labrick , and hence open to pretty poor arguments when [they]1232-the priests come glibly from a superstition - monger , but even _ [he]121-god _ could see the practical side of a thing once in a while ; and so of late [you]2830-you could n't clean up a tournament and pile the result without finding one of [my]0-i accident - tickets in every helmet . [We]2834-we stood there awhile , in the thick darkness and stillness , looking toward the red blur in the distance , and trying to make out the meaning of a far - away murmur that rose and fell fitfully on the night . Sometimes it swelled up and for a moment seemed less remote ; but when [we]2834-we were hopefully expecting it to betray its cause and nature , it dulled and sank again , carrying its mystery with it . [We]2834-we started down [the hill]1334-the hill in [its]1334-the hill direction , and [the winding road]2836-the winding road plunged [us]2834-we at once into almost solid darkness -- darkness that was packed and crammed in between two tall forest walls . [We]2834-we groped along down for half a mile , perhaps , that murmur growing more and more distinct all the time . The coming storm threatening more and more , with now and then a little shiver of wind , a faint show of lightning , and dull grumblings of distant thunder . [I]0-i was in the lead . [I]0-i ran against something -- a soft heavy something which gave , slightly , to the impulse of [my]0-i weight ; at the same moment the lightning glared out , and within a foot of [my]0-i face was the writhing face of [a man who was hanging from the limb of a tree]2837-a man who was hanging from the limb of a tree ! That is , it seemed to be writhing , but it was not . It was a grewsome sight . Straightway there was an ear - splitting explosion of thunder , and the bottom of heaven fell out ; the rain poured down in a deluge . No matter , [we]2834-we must try to cut [this man]441-this man down , on the chance that there might be life in [him]441-this man yet , must n't [we]2834-we ? The lightning came quick and sharp now , and [the place]448-the place was alternately noonday and midnight . One moment [the man]536-the man would be hanging before [me]0-i in an intense light , and the next [he]536-the man was blotted out again in the darkness . [I]0-i told [the king]4445-the king [we]2834-we must cut [him]536-the man down . [The king]4445-the king at once objected . “ If [he]536-the man hanged [himself]536-the man , [he]536-the man was willing to lose [him]536-the man property to [[his]536-the man lord]1465-his lord ; so let [him]536-the man be . If [others]1365-others hanged [him]536-the man , belike [they]1365-others had the right -- let [him]536-the man hang . ”[4445-the king] “ But-- ”[4445-the king] “ But [me]2843-two others no buts , but even leave [him]536-the man as [he]536-the man is . And for yet another reason . When the lightning cometh again -- there , look abroad . ”[2843-two others] [Two others]2843-two others hanging , within fifty yards of [us]2834-we ! “ It is not weather meet for doing useless courtesies unto [dead folk]6135-dead folk . [They]2848-they are past thanking [you]6136-you . Come -- it is unprofitable to tarry here . ”[4445-the king] There was reason in what [he]4445-the king said , so [we]2834-we moved on . Within the next mile [we]2834-we counted [six more hanging forms by the blaze of the lightning]2844-six more hanging forms by the blaze of the lightning , and altogether it was a grisly excursion . That murmur was a murmur no longer , it was a roar ; a roar of [men]508-men 's voices . [A man]518-a man came flying by now , dimly through the darkness , and [other men chasing [him]518-a man]2847-other men chasing him . [They]2848-they disappeared . Presently another case of the kind occurred , and then another and another . Then a sudden turn of [the road]460-the road brought [us]2834-we in sight of that fire -- [it]2850-it was [a large manor - house]2851-a large manor - house , and little or nothing was left of [it]2850-it -- and everywhere [men]508-men were flying and [other men]2853-other men raging after [them]508-men in pursuit . [I]0-i warned [the king]4445-the king that this was not [a safe place for [strangers]562-strangers]2855-a safe place for strangers . [We]2834-we would better get away from the light , until matters should improve . [We]2834-we stepped back a little , and hid in the edge of the wood . From [this hiding - place]2857-this hiding - place [we]2834-we saw [both men]2858-both men and [women hunted by the mob]2859-women hunted by the mob . The fearful work went on until nearly dawn . Then , the fire being out and the storm spent , the voices and flying footsteps presently ceased , and darkness and stillness reigned again . [We]2834-we ventured out , and hurried cautiously away ; and although [we]2834-we were worn out and sleepy , [we]2834-we kept on until [we]2834-we had put this place some miles behind [us]2834-we . Then [we]2834-we asked hospitality at [the hut of a charcoal burner]2860-the hut of a charcoal burner , and got what was to be had . [A woman]6069-a woman was up and about , but [the man]536-the man was still asleep , on a straw shake - down , on the clay floor . [The woman]1872-the woman seemed uneasy until [I]0-i explained that [we]2834-we were [travelers]2864-travelers and had lost [our]2834-we way and been wandering in [the woods]4638-the woods all night . [She]1872-the woman became talkative , then , and asked if [we]2834-we had heard of the terrible goings - on at [the manor - house of Abblasoure]2866-the manor - house of abblasoure . Yes , [we]2834-we had heard of [them]2867-them , but what [we]2834-we wanted now was rest and sleep . [The king]4445-the king broke in : “ Sell [us]2834-we [the house]584-the house and take [yourselves]2834-we away , for [we]2834-we be perilous company , being late come from [people that died of the Spotted Death]6138-people that died of the spotted death . ”[4445-the king] It was good of [him]4445-the king , but unnecessary . One of the commonest decorations of [the nation]709-the nation was the waffle - iron face . [I]0-i had early noticed that [the woman]1872-the woman and [[her]1872-the woman husband]2871-her husband were both so decorated . [She]1872-the woman made [us]2834-we entirely welcome , and had no fears ; and plainly [she]1872-the woman was immensely impressed by [the king]4445-the king 's proposition ; for , of course , it was a good deal of an event in [her]1872-the woman life to run across [a person of [the king]4445-the king 's humble appearance who was ready to buy [[a man]518-a man 's house]2222-a man 's house for the sake of a night 's lodging]2873-a person of the king 's humble appearance who was ready to buy a man 's house for the sake of a night 's lodging . It gave [her]1872-the woman a large respect for [us]2834-we , and [she]1872-the woman strained the lean possibilities of [her]1872-the woman hovel to the utmost to make [us]2834-we comfortable . [We]2834-we slept till far into the afternoon , and then got up hungry enough to make cotter fare quite palatable to [the king]4445-the king , the more particularly as it was scant in quantity . And also in variety ; it consisted solely of onions , salt , and the national black bread made out of horse - feed . [The woman]1872-the woman told [us]2834-we about the affair of the evening before . At ten or eleven at night , when [everybody]600-everybody was in bed , [the manor - house]2880-the manor - house burst into flames . [The country - side]2881-the country - side swarmed to the rescue , and [the family]1661-the family were saved , with one exception , [the master]5147-the master . [He]5147-the master did not appear . [Everybody]600-everybody was frantic over this loss , and [two brave yeomen]2885-two brave yeomen sacrificed [their]2885-two brave yeomen lives in ransacking [the burning house]2886-the burning house seeking [that valuable personage]2887-that valuable personage . But after a while [he]5147-the master was found -- what was left of [him]5147-the master -- which was [his]5147-the master corpse . [It]2888-it was in a copse three hundred yards away , bound , gagged , stabbed in a dozen places . Who had done this ? Suspicion fell upon [a humble family in [the neighborhood]2890-the neighborhood who had been lately treated with peculiar harshness by [the baron]1466-the baron]2889-a humble family in the neighborhood who had been lately treated with peculiar harshness by the baron ; and from [these people]551-these people the suspicion easily extended itself to [[their]551-these people relatives]2893-their relatives and [familiars]2894-familiars . A suspicion was enough ; [[my]0-i lord 's liveried retainers]2895-my lord 's liveried retainers proclaimed an instant crusade against [these people]551-these people , and were promptly joined by [the community]2288-the community in general . [[The woman]1872-the woman 's husband]2899-the woman 's husband had been active with [the mob]2900-the mob , and had not returned [home]619-home until nearly dawn . [He]2899-the woman 's husband was gone now to find out what the general result had been . While [we]2902-we were still talking [he]2899-the woman 's husband came back from [his]2899-the woman 's husband quest . [His]2899-the woman 's husband report was revolting enough . [Eighteen persons]2903-eighteen persons hanged or butchered , and two yeomen and [thirteen prisoners]2904-thirteen prisoners lost in the fire . “ And how many [prisoners]6139-prisoners were there altogether in [the vaults]6140-the vaults ? ”[2899-the woman 's husband] “ Thirteen . ”[536-the man] “ Then every one of [them]6139-prisoners was lost ? ”[536-the man] “ Yes , all . ”[536-the man] “ But [the people]753-the people arrived in time to save [the family]1661-the family ; how is it [they]753-the people could save [none of [the prisoners]576-the prisoners]6143-none of the prisoners ? ”[536-the man] [The man]536-the man looked puzzled , and said : “ Would one unlock [the vaults]6140-the vaults at such a time ? [Marry]128-marry , [some]617-some would have escaped . ”[536-the man] “ Then [you]536-the man mean that [nobody]476-nobody _ did _ unlock [them]6140-the vaults ? ”[536-the man] “ [None]557-none went near [them]6140-the vaults , either to lock or unlock . It standeth to reason that the bolts were fast ; wherefore it was only needful to establish a watch , so that if any broke the bonds [he]4445-the king might not escape , but be taken . None were taken . ”[536-the man] “ [Natheless]246-natheless , [three]6149-three did escape , ”[4445-the king] said [the king]4445-the king , “ and [ye]246-natheless will do well to publish it and set justice upon [their]6149-three track , for these murthered [the baron]1466-the baron and fired [the house]584-the house . ”[4445-the king] [I]0-i was just expecting [he]4445-the king would come out with that . For a moment [the man]536-the man and [[his]536-the man wife]1894-his wife showed an eager interest in this news and an impatience to go out and spread it ; then a sudden something else betrayed itself in [their]2909-their faces , and [they]2909-their began to ask questions . [I]0-i answered the questions [myself]0-i , and narrowly watched the effects produced . [I]0-i was soon satisfied that the knowledge of who [these three prisoners]2910-these three prisoners were had somehow changed the atmosphere ; that [[our]2911-our hosts]2912-our hosts ' continued eagerness to go and spread the news was now only pretended and not real . [The king]4445-the king did not notice the change , and [I]0-i was glad of that . [I]0-i worked the conversation around toward other details of the night 's proceedings , and noted that [these people]551-these people were relieved to have it take that direction . The painful thing observable about all this business was the alacrity with which [this oppressed community]2915-this oppressed community had turned [their]2915-this oppressed community cruel hands against [[their]2915-this oppressed community own class]2916-their own class in the interest of [the common oppressor]2917-the common oppressor . [This man]441-this man and [woman]4829-woman seemed to feel that in a quarrel between [a person of [[their]2909-their own class]2916-their own class and [[his]441-this man lord]1465-his lord]2920-a person of their own class and his lord , it was the natural and proper and rightful thing for [[that poor devil]2923-that poor devil 's whole caste]2924-that poor devil 's whole caste to side with [the master]5147-the master and fight [his]5147-the master battle for [him]5147-the master , without ever stopping to inquire into the rights or wrongs of the matter . [This man]441-this man had been out helping to hang [[his]441-this man neighbors]2927-his neighbors , and had done [his]441-this man work with zeal , and yet was aware that there was nothing against [them]2927-his neighbors but a mere suspicion , with nothing back of it describable as evidence , still neither [he]441-this man nor [[his]441-this man wife]1894-his wife seemed to see anything horrible about it . This was depressing -- to [a man with the dream of a republic in [his]441-this man head]2929-a man with the dream of a republic in his head . And there was only one redeeming feature connected with that pitiful piece of history ; and that was , that secretly [the “ poor white ”]6152-the “ poor white ”[6152-the “ poor white ”] did detest [the slave - lord]2935-the slave - lord , and did feel [his]2935-the slave - lord own shame . That feeling was not brought to the surface , but the fact that it was there and could have been brought out , under favoring circumstances , was something -- in fact , it was enough ; for it showed that [a man]518-a man is at bottom [a man]518-a man , after all , even if it does n't show on the outside . Well , as it turned out , [this charcoal burner]2938-this charcoal burner was just the twin of [the Southern “ poor white ”[4445-the king] of the far future]2939-the southern “ poor white ” of the far future . [The king]4445-the king presently showed impatience , and said : “ An [ye]6153-ye prattle here all the day , justice will miscarry . Think [ye]6153-ye [the criminals]6154-the criminals will abide in [[[their]6154-the criminals father]4940-their father 's house]6156-their father 's house ? [They]6154-the criminals are fleeing , [they]6154-the criminals are not waiting . [You]6153-ye should look to it that a party of horse be set upon [their]6154-the criminals track . ”[4445-the king] [The woman]1872-the woman paled slightly , but quite perceptibly , and [the man]536-the man looked flustered and irresolute . On [the road]460-the road [the man]536-the man pulled [his]536-the man resolution together , and began the march with a steady gait , but there was no eagerness in it . By and by [I]0-i said : “ What relation were [these men]2820-these men to [you]536-the man -- [cousins]6162-cousins ? ”[0-i] [He]536-the man turned as white as [his]536-the man layer of charcoal would let [him]536-the man , and stopped , trembling . “ Ah , [[my]536-the man God]6163-my god , how know [ye]536-the man that ? ”[536-the man] “ [I]0-i did n't know it ; it was a chance guess . ”[0-i] “ [Poor lads]6164-poor lads , [they]2820-these men are lost . [And good lads]6165-and good lads [they]2820-these men were , too . ”[536-the man] “ Were [you]536-the man actually going yonder to tell on [them]2820-these men ? ”[536-the man] [He]536-the man did n't quite know how to take that ; but [he]536-the man said , hesitatingly : “ [Ye]0-i - s. ”[536-the man] “ Then [I]536-the man think [you]536-the man are [a damned scoundrel]6166-a damned scoundrel ! ”[536-the man] It made [him]536-the man as glad as if [I]0-i had called [him]536-the man [an angel]2196-an angel . “ Say the good words again , [brother]2687-brother ! for surely [ye]536-the man mean that [ye]536-the man would not betray [me]0-i an [I]0-i failed of [my]0-i duty . ”[0-i] “ Duty ? There is no duty in the matter , except the duty to keep still and let [those men]6168-those men get away . [They]6168-those men 've done a righteous deed . ”[536-the man] [He]536-the man looked pleased ; pleased , and touched with apprehension at the same time . [He]536-the man looked up and down [the road]460-the road to see that [no one]2188-no one was coming , and then said in a cautious voice : “ From [what land]6169-what land come [you]2687-brother , [brother]2687-brother , that [you]2687-brother speak such perilous words , and seem not to be afraid ? ”[536-the man] “ [They]6171-they are not perilous words when spoken to one of [[my]536-the man own caste]6172-my own caste , [I]536-the man take it . [That old baron]6175-that old baron got only what [he]6175-that old baron deserved . If [I]536-the man had [my]536-the man way , [all [his]6175-that old baron kind]6176-all his kind should have the same luck . ”[536-the man] Fear and depression vanished from [the man]536-the man 's manner , and gratefulness and a brave animation took [their]2950-i place : “ Even though [you]536-the man be [a spy]6177-a spy , and [your]536-the man words a trap for [my]2950-i undoing , yet are they such refreshment that to hear them again and others like to [them]2950-i , [I]2950-i would go to the gallows happy , as having had one good feast at least in a starved life . And [I]2950-i will say [my]2950-i say now , and [ye]536-the man may report it if [ye]536-the man be so minded . [I]2950-i helped to hang [[my]2950-i neighbors]6178-my neighbors for that it were peril to [my]2950-i own life to show lack of zeal in [the master]5147-the master 's cause ; [the others]1524-the others helped for none other reason . [All]366-all rejoice to - day that [he]5147-the master is dead , but [all]366-all do go about seemingly sorrowing , and shedding [the hypocrite]6183-the hypocrite 's tear , for in that lies safety . [I]2950-i have said the words , [I]2950-i have said the words ! the only ones that have ever tasted good in [my]2950-i mouth , and the reward of that taste is sufficient . Lead on , an ye will , be it even to the scaffold , for [I]2950-i am ready . ”[2950-i] There it was , [you]2951-you see . [A man]518-a man is [a man]518-a man , at bottom . Whole ages of abuse and oppression can not crush the manhood clear out of [him]518-a man . [Whoever]2954-whoever thinks it a mistake is [himself]2954-whoever mistaken . Yes , there is plenty good enough material for a republic in [the most degraded people that ever existed]2955-the most degraded people that ever existed -- even [the Russians]280-the russians ; plenty of manhood in [them]2955-the most degraded people that ever existed -- even in [the Germans]2956-the germans -- if one could but force [it]2957-it out of [its]2957-it timid and suspicious privacy , to overthrow and trample in the mud any throne that ever was set up and [any nobility that ever supported [it]2957-it]2958-any nobility that ever supported it . [We]2959-we should see certain things yet , let [us]2959-we hope and believe . First , a modified monarchy , till [Arthur]116-arthur 's days were done , then the destruction of the throne , [nobility]908-nobility abolished , [every member of [it]2957-it]2961-every member of it bound out to some useful trade , universal suffrage instituted , and the whole government placed in the hands of [the men and women of [the nation]709-the nation]2962-the men and women of the nation there to remain . Yes , there was no occasion to give up [my]0-i dream yet a while . CHAPTER XXXI MARCO [We]2959-we strolled along in a sufficiently indolent fashion now , and talked . [We]2959-we must dispose of about the amount of time it ought to take to go to [the little hamlet of Abblasoure]2964-the little hamlet of abblasoure and put justice on the track of [those murderers]2965-those murderers and get back [home]619-home again . And meantime [I]0-i had an auxiliary interest which had never paled yet , never lost its novelty for [me]0-i since [I]0-i had been in [[Arthur]116-arthur 's kingdom]2967-arthur 's kingdom : the behavior -- born of nice and exact subdivisions of caste -- of [chance passers - by]2968-chance passers - by toward [each other]1058-each other . Toward [the shaven monk who trudged along with [his]2970-the shaven monk who trudged along with his cowl tilted back and the sweat washing down his fat jowls cowl tilted back and the sweat washing down [his]2970-the shaven monk who trudged along with his cowl tilted back and the sweat washing down his fat jowls fat jowls]2970-the shaven monk who trudged along with his cowl tilted back and the sweat washing down his fat jowls , [the coal - burner]2971-the coal - burner was deeply reverent ; to [the gentleman]5170-the gentleman [he]2970-the shaven monk who trudged along with his cowl tilted back and the sweat washing down his fat jowls was abject ; with [the small farmer]2973-the small farmer and [the free mechanic]2974-the free mechanic [he]2970-the shaven monk who trudged along with his cowl tilted back and the sweat washing down his fat jowls was cordial and gossipy ; and when [a slave]910-a slave passed by with a countenance respectfully lowered , [this chap]2976-this chap 's nose was in the air -- [he]910-a slave could n't even see [him]910-a slave . Well , there are times when one would like to hang [the whole human race]2977-the whole human race and finish the farce . Presently [we]2978-we struck an incident . [A small mob of half - naked boys]2979-a small mob of half - naked boys and [girls]475-girls came tearing out of [the woods]4638-the woods , scared and shrieking . [The eldest among [them]2979-a small mob of half - naked boys]2982-the eldest among them were not more than twelve or fourteen years old . [They]2982-the eldest among them implored help , but [they]2982-the eldest among them were so beside [themselves]2982-the eldest among them that [we]2978-we could n't make out what the matter was . However , [we]2978-we plunged into the wood , [they]2982-the eldest among them skurrying in the lead , and the trouble was quickly revealed : [they]2982-the eldest among them had hanged [a little fellow with a bark rope]2983-a little fellow with a bark rope , and [he]2983-a little fellow with a bark rope was kicking and struggling , in the process of choking to death . [We]2978-we rescued [him]2983-a little fellow with a bark rope , and fetched [him]2983-a little fellow with a bark rope around . It was some more human nature ; [the admiring little folk]2984-the admiring little folk imitating [[their]2984-the admiring little folk elders]2985-their elders ; [they]2984-the admiring little folk were playing mob , and had achieved a success which promised to be a good deal more serious than [they]2984-the admiring little folk had bargained for . It was not a dull excursion for [me]0-i . [I]0-i managed to put in the time very well . [I]0-i made various acquaintanceships , and in [my]0-i quality of [stranger]2986-stranger was able to ask as many questions as [I]0-i wanted to . A thing which naturally interested [me]0-i , as [a statesman]1034-a statesman , was the matter of wages . [I]0-i picked up what [I]0-i could under that head during the afternoon . [A man who has n't had much experience , and does n't think , is apt to measure [a nation]341-a nation 's prosperity or lack of prosperity by the mere size of the prevailing wages]2988-a man who has n't had much experience , and does n't think , is apt to measure a nation 's prosperity or lack of prosperity by the mere size of the prevailing wages ; if the wages be high , [the nation]709-the nation is prosperous ; if low , it is n't . Which is an error . It is n't what sum [you]2991-you get , it 's how much [you]2991-you can buy with it , that 's the important thing ; and it 's that that tells whether [your]2991-you wages are high in fact or only high in name . [I]0-i could remember how it was in the time of [our]2992-our great civil war in the nineteenth century . In [the North]2993-the north [a carpenter]2994-a carpenter got three dollars a day , gold valuation ; in [the South]2995-the south [he]2994-a carpenter got fifty -- payable in Confederate shinplasters worth a dollar a bushel . In [the North]71-the north a suit of overalls cost three dollars -- a day 's wages ; in [the South]2995-the south it cost seventy - five --which was two days ' wages . Other things were in proportion . Consequently , wages were twice as high in [the North]71-the north as they were in [the South]2995-the south , because the one wage had that much more purchasing power than [the other]2021-the other had . Yes , [I]0-i made various acquaintances in [the hamlet]2999-the hamlet and a thing that gratified [me]0-i a good deal was to find [our]2992-our new coins in circulation --lots of milrays , [lots of mills]3000-lots of mills , lots of cents , a good many nickels , and some silver ; all this among [the artisans]3001-the artisans and commonalty generally ; yes , and even some gold -- but that was at [the bank]3002-the bank , that is to say , [the goldsmith]3003-the goldsmith 's . [I]0-i dropped in [there]4491-there while [Marco]281-marco , [the son of [Marco]281-marco]3005-the son of marco , was haggling with [a shopkeeper]3006-a shopkeeper over a quarter of a pound of salt , and asked for change for a twenty - dollar gold piece . [They]3007-they furnished it -- that is , after [they]3007-they had chewed the piece , and rung it on the counter , and tried acid on it , and asked [me]0-i where [I]0-i got it , and who [I]0-i was , and where [I]0-i was from , and where [I]0-i was going to , and when [I]0-i expected to get [there]4491-there , and perhaps a couple of hundred more questions ; and when [they]3007-they got aground , [I]0-i went right on and furnished [them]3007-they a lot of information voluntarily ; told [them]3007-they [I]0-i owned a dog , and [his]3009-his name was [Watch]282-watch , and [[my]0-i first wife]3010-my first wife was [a Free Will Baptist]3011-a free will baptist , and [[her]3010-my first wife grandfather]3012-her grandfather was [a Prohibitionist]3013-a prohibitionist , and [I]0-i used to know [a man who had two thumbs on each hand and a wart on the]3014-a man who had two thumbs on each hand and a wart on the inside of [his]3014-a man who had two thumbs on each hand and a wart on the upper lip , and died in the hope of a glorious resurrection , and so on , and so on , and so on , till [even that hungry village questioner]3015-even that hungry village questioner began to look satisfied , and also a shade put out ; but [he]3015-even that hungry village questioner had to respect [a man of [my]0-i financial strength]3016-a man of my financial strength , and so [he]3015-even that hungry village questioner did n't give [me]0-i any lip , but [I]0-i noticed [he]3015-even that hungry village questioner took it out of [[his]3015-even that hungry village questioner underlings]3017-his underlings , which was a perfectly natural thing to do . Yes , [they]3018-they changed [my]0-i twenty , but [I]0-i judged it strained [the bank]3002-the bank a little , which was a thing to be expected , for it was the same as walking into [a paltry village store]3020-a paltry village store in the nineteenth century and requiring [the boss of [it]3020-a paltry village store]3021-the boss of it to change a two thousand - dollar bill for [you]3022-you all of a sudden . [He]3015-even that hungry village questioner could do it , maybe ; but at the same time [he]3015-even that hungry village questioner would wonder how [a small farmer]3023-a small farmer happened to be carrying so much money around in [his]3023-a small farmer pocket ; which was probably [this goldsmith]3024-this goldsmith 's thought , too ; for [he]3015-even that hungry village questioner followed [me]0-i to the door and stood there gazing after [me]0-i with reverent admiration . [Our]3025-our new money was not only handsomely circulating , but its language was already glibly in use ; that is to say , [people]357-people had dropped the names of the former moneys , and spoke of things as being worth so many dollars or cents or mills or milrays now . It was very gratifying . [We]3025-our were progressing , that was sure . [I]0-i got to know [several master mechanics]3027-several master mechanics , but about [the most interesting fellow]3028-the most interesting fellow among [them]3027-several master mechanics was [the blacksmith]5172-the blacksmith , [Dowley]283-dowley . [He]3015-even that hungry village questioner was [a live man]3030-a live man and [a brisk talker]3031-a brisk talker , and had [two journeymen]3032-two journeymen and [three apprentices]3033-three apprentices , and was doing a raging business . In fact , [he]3015-even that hungry village questioner was getting rich , hand over fist , and was vastly respected . [Marco]281-marco was very proud of having [such a man]3034-such a man for [a friend]2057-a friend . [He]3015-even that hungry village questioner had taken [me]0-i [there]4491-there ostensibly to let [me]0-i see [the big establishment which bought so much of [his]3015-even that hungry village questioner charcoal]3037-the big establishment which bought so much of his charcoal , but really to let [me]0-i see what easy and almost familiar terms [he]3015-even that hungry village questioner was on with [this great man]3038-this great man . But [I]0-i knew what was the matter with [him]3015-even that hungry village questioner ; it was the expense . [I]0-i am only [a farm bailiff]6187-a farm bailiff , it is true ; but [I]0-i am not poor , nevertheless . [You]3015-even that hungry village questioner 've opened [[your]3015-even that hungry village questioner house]6188-your house to [Jones]141-jones and [me]0-i in the most generous way ; [Jones]141-jones was remarking upon it to - day , just before [you]3015-even that hungry village questioner came back from [the village]811-the village ; for although [he]141-jones would n't be likely to say such a thing to [you]3015-even that hungry village questioner -- because [Jones]141-jones is n't [a talker]6190-a talker , and is diffident in [society]4705-society -- [he]141-jones has a good heart and a grateful , and knows how to appreciate it when [he]141-jones is well treated ; yes , [you]3015-even that hungry village questioner and [[your]3015-even that hungry village questioner wife]4891-your wife have been very hospitable toward [us--]6193-us-- ”[0-i] “ Ah , [brother]2687-brother , ' tis nothing--_such _ hospitality ! ”[0-i] “ But it _ is _ something ; the best [a man]518-a man has , freely given , is always something , and is as good as [a prince]4587-a prince can do , and ranks right along beside it -- for even [a prince]4587-a prince can but do [his]4587-a prince best . The raiment of [Marco]281-marco and [[his]3055-his wife]1894-his wife was of coarse tow - linen and linsey - woolsey respectively , and resembled township maps , it being made up pretty exclusively of patches which had been added , township by [township]3057-township , in the course of five or six years , until hardly a hand's - breadth of the original garments was surviving and present . Now [I]0-i wanted to fit [these people]551-these people out with new suits , on account of [that swell company]3059-that swell company , and [I]0-i did n't know just how to get at it --with delicacy , until at last it struck [me]0-i that as [I]0-i had already been liberal in inventing wordy gratitude for [the king]4445-the king , it would be just the thing to back it up with evidence of a substantial sort ; so [I]0-i said : “ And [Marco]281-marco , there 's another thing which [you]281-marco must permit -- out of kindness for [Jones]141-jones -- because [you]281-marco would n't want to offend [him]141-jones . [He]141-jones was very anxious to testify [his]141-jones appreciation in some way , but [he]141-jones is so diffident [he]141-jones could n't venture it [himself]141-jones , and so [he]141-jones begged [me]0-i to buy some little things and give them to [you]281-marco and [Dame Phyllis]286-dame phyllis and let [him]141-jones pay for them without [your]281-marco ever knowing they came from [him]141-jones -- [you]281-marco know how [a delicate person]6198-a delicate person feels about that sort of thing --and so [I]0-i said [I]0-i would , and [we]6199-we would keep [mum]6200-mum . That will please [Jones]141-jones . ”[0-i] It tickled [Marco]281-marco to the marrow to hear about [such an odd character]3061-such an odd character ; but it also prepared [him]3062-he for accidents ; and in [my]0-i experience when [you]3063-you travel with [a king who is letting on to be something else]3064-a king who is letting on to be something else and ca n't remember it more than about half the time , [you]3063-you ca n't take too many precautions . This was [the best store [we]3066-we had come across yet]3065-the best store we had come across yet ; [it]3065-the best store we had come across yet had everything in [it]3065-the best store we had come across yet , in small quantities , from anvils and drygoods all the way down to fish and pinchbeck jewelry . [I]0-i concluded [I]0-i would bunch [my]0-i whole invoice right here , and not go pricing around any more . So [I]0-i got rid of [Marco]281-marco , by sending [him]3062-he off to invite [the mason]3067-the mason and [the wheelwright]3068-the wheelwright , which left [the field]1674-the field free to [me]0-i . For [I]0-i never care to do a thing in a quiet way ; it 's got to be theatrical or [I]0-i do n't take any interest in it . [I]0-i showed up money enough , in a careless way , to corral [the shopkeeper]3070-the shopkeeper 's respect , and then [I]0-i wrote down a list of the things [I]0-i wanted , and handed it to [him]3062-he to see if [he]3062-he could read it . [He]3062-he could , and was proud to show that [he]3062-he could . [He]3062-he said [he]3062-he had been educated by [a priest]4649-a priest , and could both read and write . [He]3062-he ran it through , and remarked with satisfaction that it was a pretty heavy bill . Well , and so it was , for a little concern like that . [I]0-i was not only providing a swell dinner , but some odds and ends of extras . [I]0-i ordered that the things be carted out and delivered at [the dwelling of [Marco]281-marco]3072-the dwelling of marco , [the son of [Marco]281-marco]3005-the son of marco , by Saturday evening , and send [me]0-i the bill at dinner - time Sunday . [He]3062-he had a mighty opinion of that clever device . [I]0-i said : “ And please fill them up to the middle mark , too ; and add that to the bill . ”[0-i] [He]3062-he would , with pleasure . [He]3062-he filled them , and [I]0-i took them with [me]0-i . [We]3080-we furnished them for nothing . [The king]4445-the king had hardly missed [us]3080-we when [we]3080-we got back at nightfall . CHAPTER XXXII [DOWLEY]283-dowley 'S HUMILIATION Well , when [that cargo]3083-that cargo arrived toward sunset , Saturday afternoon , [I]0-i had [my]0-i hands full to keep [the Marcos]288-the marcos from fainting . [They]3084-they were sure [Jones]141-jones and [I]0-i were ruined past help , and [they]3084-they blamed [themselves]3084-they as accessories to this bankruptcy . [You]3085-you see , in addition to the dinner - materials , which called for a sufficiently round sum , [I]0-i had bought a lot of extras for the future comfort of [the family]1661-the family : for instance , a big lot of wheat , a delicacy as rare to the tables of [[their]3084-they class]3087-their class as was ice - cream to [a hermit]1663-a hermit 's ; also a sizeable deal dinner - table ; also two entire pounds of salt , which was another piece of extravagance in [those people]823-those people 's eyes ; also crockery , stools , the clothes , a small cask of beer , and so on . [I]0-i instructed [the Marcos]288-the marcos to keep quiet about this sumptuousness , so as to give [me]0-i a chance to surprise [the guests]3090-the guests and show off a little . Concerning the new clothes , [the simple couple]3091-the simple couple were like [children]533-children ; [they]3091-the simple couple were up and down , all night , to see if it was n't nearly daylight , so that [they]3091-the simple couple could put them on , and [they]3091-the simple couple were into [them]3091-the simple couple at last as much as an hour before dawn was due . Then [their]3091-the simple couple pleasure -- not to say delirium -- was so fresh and novel and inspiring that the sight of it paid [me]0-i well for the interruptions which [my]0-i sleep had suffered . [The king]4445-the king had slept just as usual -- like the dead . [The Marcos]288-the marcos could not thank [him]4445-the king for [their]3091-the simple couple clothes , that being forbidden ; but [they]3091-the simple couple tried every way [they]3091-the simple couple could think of to make [him]4445-the king see how grateful [they]3091-the simple couple were . Which all went for nothing : [he]4445-the king did n't notice any change . It turned out to be one of those rich and rare fall days which is just a June day toned down to a degree where it is heaven to be out of doors . Toward noon [the guests]3090-the guests arrived , and [we]3095-we assembled under a great tree and were soon as sociable as [old acquaintances]3096-old acquaintances . Even [the king]4445-the king 's reserve melted a little , though it was some little trouble to [him]4445-the king to adjust [himself]4445-the king to the name of [Jones]141-jones along at first . [I]0-i had asked [him]4445-the king to try to not forget that [he]4445-the king was [a farmer]6203-a farmer ; but [I]0-i had also considered it prudent to ask [him]4445-the king to let the thing stand at that , and not elaborate it any . Because [he]4445-the king was just the kind of person [you]3099-you could depend on to spoil a little thing like that if [you]3099-you did n't warn [him]4445-the king , [his]4445-the king tongue was so handy , and [his]4445-the king spirit so willing , and [his]4445-the king information so uncertain . [Dowley]283-dowley was in fine feather , and [I]0-i early got [him]283-dowley started , and then adroitly worked [him]283-dowley around onto [his]283-dowley own history for a text and [himself]283-dowley for [a hero]3100-a hero , and then it was good to sit there and hear [him]283-dowley hum . [Self - made man]3101-self - made man , [you]3099-you know . [They]3101-self - made man know how to talk . [They]3101-self - made man do deserve more credit than [any other breed of men]3102-any other breed of men , yes , that is true ; and [they]3101-self - made man are among the very first to find it out , too . [He]283-dowley told how [he]283-dowley had begun life [an orphan lad without money]3103-an orphan lad without money and without [friends]4974-friends able to help [him]283-dowley ; how [he]283-dowley had lived as [the slaves of [the meanest master lived]3106-the meanest master lived]3105-the slaves of the meanest master lived ; how [his]283-dowley day 's work was from sixteen to eighteen hours long , and yielded [him]283-dowley only enough black bread to keep [him]283-dowley in a half - fed condition ; how [his]283-dowley faithful endeavors finally attracted the attention of [a good blacksmith]3107-a good blacksmith , who came near knocking [him]283-dowley dead with kindness by suddenly offering , when [he]283-dowley was totally unprepared , to take [him]283-dowley as [[his]283-dowley bound apprentice]3108-his bound apprentice for nine years and give [him]283-dowley board and clothes and teach [him]283-dowley the trade -- or “ mystery ”[283-dowley] as [Dowley]283-dowley called it . That was [his]283-dowley first great rise , [his]283-dowley first gorgeous stroke of fortune ; and [you]3109-you saw that [he]283-dowley could n't yet speak of it without a sort of eloquent wonder and delight that such a gilded promotion should have fallen to the lot of [a common human being]3110-a common human being . [He]283-dowley got no new clothing during [his]283-dowley apprenticeship , but on [his]283-dowley graduation day [[his]283-dowley master]1478-his master tricked [him]283-dowley out in spang - new tow - linens and made [him]283-dowley feel unspeakably rich and fine . “ [I]3068-the wheelwright remember [me]3068-the wheelwright of that day ! ”[3068-the wheelwright] [the wheelwright]3068-the wheelwright sang out , with enthusiasm . “ And [I]3067-the mason likewise ! ”[3067-the mason] cried [the mason]3067-the mason . “ [I]3067-the mason would not believe [they]6213-they were thine own ; in faith [I]3067-the mason could not . ”[3067-the mason] “ Nor other ! ”[283-dowley] shouted [Dowley]283-dowley , with sparkling eyes . “ [I]283-dowley was like to lose [my]283-dowley character , the neighbors wending [I]283-dowley had mayhap been stealing . It was a great day , a great day ; [one]434-one forgetteth not days like that . ”[283-dowley] Yes , and [[his]283-dowley master]1478-his master was [a fine man]3115-a fine man , and prosperous , and always had a great feast of meat twice in the year , and with it white bread , true wheaten bread ; in fact , lived like [a lord]2041-a lord , so to speak . And in time [Dowley]283-dowley succeeded to the business and married [the daughter]3117-the daughter . “ And now consider what is come to pass , ”[283-dowley] said [he]283-dowley , impressively . “ Two times in every month there is fresh meat upon [my]283-dowley table . ”[283-dowley] [He]283-dowley made a pause here , to let that fact sink home , then added --“and eight times salt meat . ”[283-dowley] “ It is even true , ”[3068-the wheelwright] said [the wheelwright]3068-the wheelwright , with bated breath . “ [I]3067-the mason know it of [mine]3067-the mason own knowledge , ”[3067-the mason] said [the mason]3067-the mason , in the same reverent fashion . “ On [my]3120-the master smith table appeareth white bread every Sunday in the year , ”[3120-the master smith] added [the master smith]3120-the master smith , with solemnity . “ [I]3120-the master smith leave it to [your]3067-the mason own consciences , [friends]4974-friends , if this is not also true ? ”[3120-the master smith] “ By [my]3067-the mason head , yes , ”[3067-the mason] cried [the mason]3067-the mason . “ [I]3068-the wheelwright can testify it -- and [I]3068-the wheelwright do , ”[3068-the wheelwright] said [the wheelwright]3068-the wheelwright . “ And as to furniture , [ye]3067-the mason shall say [yourselves]3067-the mason what [mine]283-dowley equipment is . ”[283-dowley] [He]283-dowley waved [his]283-dowley hand in fine gesture of granting frank and unhampered freedom of speech , and added : “ Speak as [ye]3067-the mason are moved ; speak as [ye]3067-the mason would speak ; an [I]283-dowley were not [here]369-here . ”[283-dowley] “ [Ye]3067-the mason have five stools , and of the sweetest workmanship at that , albeit [[your]3067-the mason family]4667-your family is but three , ”[3068-the wheelwright] said [the wheelwright]3068-the wheelwright , with deep respect . “ And six wooden goblets , and six platters of wood and two of pewter to eat and drink from withal , ”[3067-the mason] said [the mason]3067-the mason , impressively . “ And [I]3067-the mason say it as knowing [God]121-god is [[my]3067-the mason judge]6218-my judge , and [we]6219-we tarry not here alway , but must answer at the last day for the things said in the body , be they false or be they sooth . ”[3067-the mason] “ Now [ye]3067-the mason know what manner of [man]4450-man [I]3125-the smith am , [brother Jones]141-jones , ”[3125-the smith] said [the smith]3125-the smith , with a fine and friendly condescension , “ and doubtless [ye]3067-the mason would look to find [me]3126-he [a man jealous of [his]6221-a man jealous of his due of respect and but sparing of outgo to strangers due of respect and but sparing of outgo to [strangers]562-strangers]6221-a man jealous of his due of respect and but sparing of outgo to strangers till [their]562-strangers rating and quality be assured , but trouble [yourself]3067-the mason not , as concerning that ; wit [ye]3067-the mason well [ye]3067-the mason shall find [me]3126-he [a man that regardeth not these matters]6223-a man that regardeth not these matters but is willing to receive any [he]6221-a man jealous of his due of respect and but sparing of outgo to strangers as [[his]6221-a man jealous of his due of respect and but sparing of outgo to strangers fellow]363-his fellow and equal that carrieth a right heart in [his]6221-a man jealous of his due of respect and but sparing of outgo to strangers body , be [his]6221-a man jealous of his due of respect and but sparing of outgo to strangers worldly estate howsoever modest . And in token of it , here is [my]3126-he hand ; and [I]3126-he say with [my]3126-he own mouth [we]6225-we are [equals]2691-equals -- equals”--and[3126-he] [he]3126-he smiled around on the company with the satisfaction of [a god who is doing the handsome and gracious thing and is quite well aware of it]3127-a god who is doing the handsome and gracious thing and is quite well aware of it . [The king]4445-the king took the hand with a poorly disguised reluctance , and let go of it as willingly as [a lady]1274-a lady lets go of a fish ; all of which had a good effect , for it was mistaken for an embarrassment natural to [one who was being called upon by greatness]3130-one who was being called upon by greatness . [The dame]3131-the dame brought out the table now , and set it under the tree . It caused a visible stir of surprise , it being brand new and a sumptuous article of deal . But the surprise rose higher still when [the dame]3131-the dame , with a body oozing easy indifference at every pore , but eyes that gave it all away by absolutely flaming with vanity , slowly unfolded an actual simon - pure tablecloth and spread it . That was a notch above even [the blacksmith]5172-the blacksmith 's domestic grandeurs , and it hit [him]3126-he hard ; [you]3134-you could see it . But [Marco]281-marco was in [Paradise]73-paradise ; [you]3134-you could see that , too . Then [the dame]3131-the dame brought two fine new stools -- whew ! that was a sensation ; it was visible in the eyes of [every guest]3136-every guest . Then [she]3131-the dame brought two more -- as calmly as [she]3131-the dame could . Sensation again -- with awed murmurs . Again [she]3131-the dame brought two --walking on air , [she]3131-the dame was so proud . [The guests]3090-the guests were petrified , and [the mason]3067-the mason muttered : “ There is that about earthly pomps which doth ever move to reverence . ”[3067-the mason] As [the dame]3131-the dame turned away , [Marco]281-marco could n't help slapping on the climax while the thing was hot ; so [he]3126-he said with what was meant for a languid composure but was a poor imitation of it : “ These suffice ; leave the rest . ”[3126-he] So there were more yet ! It was a fine effect . [I]0-i could n't have played the hand better [myself]0-i . From this out , [the madam]3140-the madam piled up the surprises with a rush that fired the general astonishment up to a hundred and fifty in the shade , and at the same time paralyzed expression of it down to gasped “ Oh 's ”[3140-the madam] and “ Ah 's , ”[3140-the madam] and mute upliftings of hands and eyes . [She]3140-the madam fetched crockery -- new , and plenty of it ; new wooden goblets and other table furniture ; and beer , fish , chicken , a goose , eggs , roast beef , roast mutton , a ham , a small roast pig , and a wealth of genuine white wheaten bread . Take it by and large , that spread laid everything far and away in the shade that [ever that crowd]3141-ever that crowd had seen before . And while [they]3090-the guests sat there just simply stupefied with wonder and awe , [I]0-i sort of waved [my]0-i hand as if by accident , and [[the storekeeper]3142-the storekeeper 's son]3143-the storekeeper 's son emerged from space and said [he]3143-the storekeeper 's son had come to collect . “ That 's all right , ”[0-i] [I]0-i said , indifferently . “ What is the amount ? give [us]3144-those three amazed men the items . ”[0-i] Then [he]3126-he read off this bill , while [those three amazed men]3144-those three amazed men listened , and serene waves of satisfaction rolled over [my]0-i soul and alternate waves of terror and admiration surged over [Marco]281-marco 's : 2 pounds salt . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 200 8 dozen pints beer , in the wood . . . . . 800 3 bushels wheat . . . . . . . . . . . . . 2,700 2 pounds fish . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 100 3 hens . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 400 1 goose . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 400 3 dozen eggs . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 150 1 roast of beef . . . . . . . . . . . . . 450 1 roast of mutton . . . . . . . . . . . . 400 1 ham . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 800 1 sucking pig . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 500 2 crockery dinner sets . . . . . . . . . 6,000 2 [men]508-men 's suits and underwear . . . . . . . 2,800 1 stuff and 1 linsey - woolsey gown and underwear . . . . . . . . . . . . . 1,600 8 wooden goblets . . . . . . . . . . . . 800 Various table furniture . . . . . . . . .10,000 1 deal table . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 3,000 8 stools . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 4,000 2 miller guns , loaded . . . . . . . . . . 3,000 [He]3126-he ceased . There was a pale and awful silence . Not a limb stirred . Not a nostril betrayed the passage of breath . “ Is that all ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i asked , in a voice of the most perfect calmness . “ All , [fair sir]4423-fair sir , save that certain matters of light moment are placed together under a head hight sundries . If it would like [you]4423-fair sir , [I]0-i will sepa-- ”[0-i] “ It is of no consequence , ”[0-i] [I]0-i said , accompanying the words with a gesture of the most utter indifference ; “ give [me]0-i the grand total , please . ”[0-i] [The clerk]3146-the clerk leaned against the tree to stay [himself]3146-the clerk , and said : “ Thirty - nine thousand one hundred and fifty milrays ! ”[3146-the clerk] [The wheelwright]3068-the wheelwright fell off [his]3068-the wheelwright stool , [the others]1524-the others grabbed the table to save [themselves]1524-the others , and there was a deep and general ejaculation of : “ [God]121-god be with [us]6228-us in the day of disaster ! ”[3146-the clerk] [The clerk]3146-the clerk hastened to say : “ [[My]3146-the clerk father]422-my father chargeth [me]3146-the clerk to say [he]422-my father can not honorably require [you]0-i to pay it all at this time , and therefore only prayeth [you--]0-i ”[3146-the clerk] [I]0-i paid no more heed than if it were the idle breeze , but , with an air of indifference amounting almost to weariness , got out [my]0-i money and tossed four dollars on to the table . Ah , [you]0-i should have seen [them]1524-the others stare ! [The clerk]3146-the clerk was astonished and charmed . [He]3146-the clerk asked [me]0-i to retain one of the dollars as security , until [he]3146-the clerk could go to [town]4776-town and --I interrupted : “ What , and fetch back nine cents ? Nonsense ! Take the whole . Keep the change . ”[3146-the clerk] There was an amazed murmur to this effect : “ Verily this being is _ made _ of money ! [He]5172-the blacksmith throweth it away even as if it were dirt . ”[3146-the clerk] [The blacksmith]5172-the blacksmith was [a crushed man]3153-a crushed man . [The clerk]3146-the clerk took [his]5172-the blacksmith money and reeled away drunk with fortune . [I]0-i said to [Marco]281-marco and [[his]3146-the clerk wife]1894-his wife : “ [Good folk]2325-good folk , here is a little trifle for you”--handing[0-i] the miller - guns as if it were a matter of no consequence , though each of them contained fifteen cents in solid cash ; and while [the poor creatures]3156-the poor creatures went to pieces with astonishment and gratitude , [I]0-i turned to [the others]1524-the others and said as calmly as [one]434-one would ask the time of day : “ Well , if [we]1524-the others are all ready , [I]0-i judge the dinner is . Come , fall to . ”[0-i] Ah , well , it was immense ; yes , it was a daisy . [I]0-i do n't know that [I]0-i ever put a situation together better , or got happier spectacular effects out of the materials available . [The blacksmith]5172-the blacksmith -- well , [he]5172-the blacksmith was simply mashed . [Land]14-land ! [I]0-i would n't have felt what [that man]1850-that man was feeling , for anything in [the world]374-the world . Here [he]5172-the blacksmith had been blowing and bragging about [his]5172-the blacksmith grand meat - feast twice a year , and [his]5172-the blacksmith fresh meat twice a month , and [his]5172-the blacksmith salt meat twice a week , and [his]5172-the blacksmith white bread every Sunday the year round -- all for [a family of three]3162-a family of three ; the entire cost for the year not above 69.2.6 ( sixty - nine cents , two mills and six milrays ) , and all of a sudden here comes along [a man who slashes out nearly four dollars on a single blow - out]3163-a man who slashes out nearly four dollars on a single blow - out ; and not only that , but acts as if it made [him]3163-a man who slashes out nearly four dollars on a single blow - out tired to handle such small sums . Yes , [Dowley]283-dowley was a good deal wilted , and shrunk - up and collapsed ; [he]283-dowley had the aspect of a bladder - balloon that 's been stepped on by a cow . CHAPTER XXXIII SIXTH CENTURY POLITICAL ECONOMY However , [I]0-i made a dead set at [him]283-dowley , and before the first third of the dinner was reached , [I]0-i had [him]283-dowley happy again . It was easy to do -- in [a country of ranks and castes]3164-a country of ranks and castes . [You]3165-you see , in [[a country]1238-a country where [they]3168-they have ranks and [castes]3169-castes]3167-a country where they have ranks and castes , [a man]518-a man is n't ever [a man]518-a man , [he]518-a man is only part of [a man]518-a man , [he]518-a man ca n't ever get [his]518-a man full growth . [You]3165-you prove [your]3165-you superiority over [him]518-a man in station , or rank , or fortune , and that 's the end of it -- [he]518-a man knuckles down . [You]3165-you ca n't insult [him]518-a man after that . No , [I]0-i do n't mean quite that ; of course [you]3165-you _ can _ insult [him]518-a man , [I]0-i only mean it 's difficult ; and so , unless [you]3165-you 've got a lot of useless time on [your]3165-you hands it does n't pay to try . [I]0-i had [the smith]3125-the smith 's reverence now , because [I]0-i was apparently immensely prosperous and rich ; [I]0-i could have had [his]518-a man adoration if [I]0-i had had some little gimcrack title of nobility . And not only [his]518-a man , but [any commoner]3174-any commoner 's in [the land]4486-the land , though [he]3176-he were [the mightiest production of all the ages]3177-the mightiest production of all the ages , in intellect , worth , and character , and [I]0-i bankrupt in all three . This was to remain so , as long as [England]1-england should exist in [the earth]399-the earth . With the spirit of prophecy upon [me]0-i , [I]0-i could look into the future and see [her]1-england erect statues and monuments to [her]1-england unspeakable Georges and other royal and noble clothes - horses , and leave unhonored [the creators of [this world]352-this world]3179-the creators of this world -- after [God]121-god -- [Gutenburg]289-gutenburg , [Watt]290-watt , [Arkwright]291-arkwright , [Whitney]292-whitney , [Morse]293-morse , [Stephenson]294-stephenson , [Bell]295-bell . [The king]4445-the king got [his]4445-the king cargo aboard , and then , the talk not turning upon battle , conquest , or iron - clad duel , [he]4445-the king dulled down to drowsiness and went off to take a nap . [Mrs. Marco]281-marco cleared the table , placed the beer keg handy , and went away to eat [her]281-marco dinner of leavings in humble privacy , and [the rest of [us]3183-us]6114-the rest of us soon drifted into matters near and dear to the hearts of [our]3183-us sort -- business and wages , of course . At a first glance , things appeared to be exceeding prosperous in [this little tributary kingdom]3184-this little tributary kingdom -- whose lord was [King Bagdemagus]296-king bagdemagus -- as compared with the state of things in [[my]0-i own region]3185-my own region . [They]3186-they had the “ protection ”[3186-they] system in full force here , whereas [we]3183-us were working along down toward free trade , by easy stages , and were now about half way . Before long , [Dowley]283-dowley and [I]0-i were doing all the talking , [the others]1524-the others hungrily listening . [Dowley]283-dowley warmed to [his]283-dowley work , snuffed an advantage in the air , and began to put questions which [he]283-dowley considered pretty awkward ones for [me]0-i , and [they]3186-they did have something of that look : “ In [[your]3125-the smith country]6231-your country , [brother]2687-brother , what is the wage of [a master bailiff]6233-a master bailiff , [master hind]6234-master hind , [carter , shepherd , swineherd]6235-carter , shepherd , swineherd ? ”[3186-they] “ [Twenty - five milrays]6236-twenty - five milrays a day ; that is to say , a quarter of a cent . ”[3125-the smith] [The smith]3125-the smith 's face beamed with joy . [He]3125-the smith said : “ With [us]3183-us [they]3186-they are allowed the double of it ! And what may [a mechanic]5815-a mechanic get -- [carpenter]6238-carpenter , [dauber]6239-dauber , [mason]6240-mason , [painter]6048-painter , [blacksmith]6242-blacksmith , [wheelwright]6243-wheelwright , and [the like]6244-the like ? ”[3125-the smith] “ On the average , fifty milrays ; half a cent a day . ”[3186-they] “ Ho - ho ! With [us]3183-us [they]3186-they are allowed a hundred ! With [us]3183-us [any good mechanic]6245-any good mechanic is allowed a cent a day ! [I]3189-you count out [the tailor]6246-the tailor , but not [the others]1524-the others -- [they]1524-the others are all allowed a cent a day , and in driving times [they]1524-the others get more -- yes , up to a hundred and ten and even fifteen milrays a day . [I]3189-you 've paid a hundred and fifteen [myself]3189-you , within the week . ' Rah for protection -- to [Sheol]39-sheol with free - trade ! ”[3189-you] And [his]3189-you face shone upon [the company]607-the company like a sunburst . But [I]0-i did n't scare at all . [I]0-i rigged up [[my]0-i pile - driver]3191-my pile - driver , and allowed [myself]0-i fifteen minutes to drive [him]3189-you into [the earth]399-the earth -- drive [him]3189-you _ all _ in --drive [him]3189-you in till not even the curve of [his]3189-you skull should show above ground . Here is the way [I]0-i started in on [him]3189-you . [I]0-i asked : “ What do [you]3189-you pay a pound for salt ? ”[0-i] “ [A hundred milrays]6248-a hundred milrays . ”[0-i] “ [We]6249-we pay forty . What do [you]3189-you pay for beef and mutton -- when [you]3189-you buy it ? ”[0-i] That was a neat hit ; it made the color come . “ It varieth somewhat , but not much ; one may say seventy - five milrays the pound . ”[0-i] “ _ [We]6249-we _ pay thirty - three . What do [you]3189-you pay for eggs ? ”[0-i] “ Fifty milrays the dozen . ”[0-i] “ [We]6249-we pay twenty .
