What do [you]3189-you pay for wheat ? ”[0-i] “ At the rate of nine hundred milrays the bushel . ”[0-i] “ [We]6249-we pay four hundred . What do [you]3189-you pay for [a man]518-a man 's tow - linen suit ? ”[0-i] “ Thirteen cents . ”[0-i] “ [We]6249-we pay six . What do [you]3189-you pay for a stuff gown for [the wife of [the laborer]6252-the laborer]6251-the wife of the laborer or [the mechanic]6253-the mechanic ? ”[0-i] “ [We]6249-we pay eight cents , four mills . ”[0-i] “ Well , observe the difference : [you]3189-you pay eight cents and four mills , [we]6249-we pay only four cents . ”[0-i] [I]0-i prepared now to sock it to [him]3193-you . [I]0-i said : “ Look here , [dear friend]6254-dear friend , _ what 's become of [your]3193-you high wages [you]3193-you were bragging so about a few minutes ago?_”--and[0-i] [I]0-i looked around on [the company]607-the company with placid satisfaction , for [I]0-i had slipped up on [him]3193-you gradually and tied [him]3193-you hand and foot , [you]3195-you see , without [his]3193-you ever noticing that [he]3193-you was being tied at all . “ What 's become of those noble high wages of yours?--I seem to have knocked the stuffing all out of them , it appears to [me]0-i . ”[0-i] But if [you]3195-you will believe [me]0-i , [he]3193-you merely looked surprised , that is all ! [he]3193-you did n't grasp the situation at all , did n't know [he]3193-you had walked into a trap , did n't discover that [he]3193-you was _ in _ a trap . [I]0-i could have shot [him]3193-you , from sheer vexation . With cloudy eye and a struggling intellect [he]3193-you fetched this out : “ [Marry]128-marry , [I]3193-you seem not to understand . It is _ proved _ that [our]6255-ours wages be double thine ; how then may it be that thou'st knocked therefrom the stuffing?--an miscall not the wonderly word , this being the first time under grace and providence of [God]121-god it hath been granted [me]3193-you to hear it . ”[3193-you] Well , [I]0-i was stunned ; partly with this unlooked - for stupidity on [his]3193-you part , and partly because [[his]3193-you fellows]583-his fellows so manifestly sided with [him]3193-you and were of [his]3193-you mind -- if [you]3195-you might call it mind . [My]0-i position was simple enough , plain enough ; how could it ever be simplified more ? However , [I]0-i must try : “ Why , look here , [brother Dowley]283-dowley , do n't [you]3193-you see ? [Your]3193-you wages are merely higher than [ours]6255-ours in _ name _ , not in _ fact _ . ”[0-i] “ Hear [him]3193-you ! [They]6256-them are the _ double_--ye have confessed it [yourself]3193-you . ”[3197-i] “ Yes - yes , [I]0-i do n't deny that at all . But that 's got nothing to do with it ; the _ amount _ of the wages in mere coins , with meaningless names attached to [them]6256-them to know [them]6256-them by , has got nothing to do with it . The thing is , how much can [you]3193-you _ buy _ with [your]3193-you wages ? --that 's the idea . While it is true that with [you]3193-you [a good mechanic]6257-a good mechanic is allowed about three dollars and a half a year , and with [us]6255-ours only about a dollar and seventy - five-- ”[0-i] “ There -- [ye're]3193-you confessing it again , [ye're]3193-you confessing it again ! ”[0-i] “ Confound it , [I]3197-i 've never denied it , [I]3197-i tell [you]3193-you ! What [I]3197-i say is this . With [us]6255-ours _ half _ a dollar buys more than a _ dollar _ buys with [you]3193-you -- and THEREFORE it stands to reason and the commonest kind of common - sense , that [our]6255-ours wages are _ higher _ than [yours]3193-you . ”[3197-i] [He]3197-i looked dazed , and said , despairingly : “ Verily , [I]3197-i can not make it out . [Ye've]3193-you just said [ours]6255-ours are the higher , and with the same breath [ye]3193-you take it back . ”[3197-i] “ Oh , [great Scott]196-great scott , is n't it possible to get such a simple thing through [your]3197-i head ? Now look here -- let [me]0-i illustrate . [We]6255-ours pay four cents for [a woman]6069-a woman 's stuff gown , [you]3193-you pay 8.4.0 , which is four mills more than _ double _ . What do [you]3193-you allow [a laboring woman who works on [a farm]5966-a farm]6259-a laboring woman who works on a farm ? ”[0-i] “ Two mills a day . ”[3197-i] “ Very good ; [we]6255-ours allow but half as much ; [we]6255-ours pay [her]6069-a woman only a tenth of a cent a day ; and-- ”[3197-i] “ Again [ye're]3193-you conf-- ”[0-i] “ Wait ! Now , [you]3193-you see , the thing is very simple ; this time [you]3193-you 'll understand it . For instance , it takes [[your]3193-you woman]6261-your woman 42 days to earn [her]6261-your woman gown , at 2 mills a day--7 weeks ' work ; but [ours]6255-ours earns [hers]6261-your woman in forty days -- two days _ short _ of 7 weeks . [[Your]3193-you woman]6261-your woman has a gown , and [her]6261-your woman whole seven weeks wages are gone ; [ours]6255-ours has a gown , and two days ' wages left , to buy something else with . There--_now _ [you]3193-you understand it ! ”[3198-he] [He]3198-he looked -- well , [he]3198-he merely looked dubious , it 's the most [I]0-i can say ; so did [the others]1524-the others . [I]0-i waited -- to let the thing work . [Dowley]283-dowley spoke at last -- and betrayed the fact that [he]283-dowley actually had n't gotten away from [his]283-dowley rooted and grounded superstitions yet . [He]283-dowley said , with a trifle of hesitancy : “ But -- but -- [ye]3193-you can not fail to grant that two mills a day is better than one . ”[283-dowley] Shucks ! Well , of course , [I]0-i hated to give it up . So [I]0-i chanced another flyer : “ Let [us]6255-ours suppose a case . Suppose [one of [[your]3193-you journeymen]6264-your journeymen]6263-one of your journeymen goes out and buys the following articles : “[0-i] 1 pound of salt ; 1 dozen eggs ; 1 dozen pints of beer ; 1 bushel of wheat ; 1 tow - linen suit ; 5 pounds of beef ; 5 pounds of mutton . “ The lot will cost [him]6263-one of your journeymen 32 cents . It takes [him]6263-one of your journeymen 32 working days to earn the money--5 weeks and 2 days . Let [him]6263-one of your journeymen come to [us]6255-ours and work 32 days at _ half _ the wages ; [he]6263-one of your journeymen can buy all those things for a shade under 14 1/2 cents ; they will cost [him]6263-one of your journeymen a shade under 29 days ' work , and [he]6263-one of your journeymen will have about half a week 's wages over . Carry it through the year ; [he]6263-one of your journeymen would save nearly a week 's wages every two months , _ [[your]3193-you _ man]6265-your _ man nothing ; thus saving five or six weeks ' wages in a year , [[your]3193-you man]6266-your man not a cent . _ Now _ [I]3200-a crusher reckon [you]3193-you understand that ' high wages ' and ' low wages ' are phrases that do n't mean anything in [the world]374-the world until [you]3193-you find out which of [them]823-those people will _ buy _ the most ! ”[3200-a crusher] It was [a crusher]3200-a crusher . But , alas ! it did n't crush . No , [I]0-i had to give it up . What [those people]823-those people valued was _ high wages _ ; it did n't seem to be a matter of any consequence to [them]823-those people whether the high wages would buy anything or not . [They]823-those people stood for “ protection , ”[823-those people] and swore by it , which was reasonable enough , because [interested parties]3202-interested parties had gulled [them]823-those people into the notion that it was protection which had created [their]823-those people high wages . [I]0-i proved to [them]823-those people that in a quarter of a century [their]823-those people wages had advanced but 30 per cent . , while the cost of living had gone up 100 ; and that with [us]3203-us , in a shorter time , wages had advanced 40 per cent . while the cost of living had gone steadily down . But it did n't do any good . Nothing could unseat [their]823-those people strange beliefs . Well , [I]0-i was smarting under a sense of defeat . Undeserved defeat , but what of that ? That did n't soften the smart any . And to think of the circumstances ! [the first statesman of the age]3204-the first statesman of the age , [the capablest man]3205-the capablest man , [the best - informed man in [the entire world]3207-the entire world]3206-the best - informed man in the entire world , [the loftiest uncrowned head that had moved through the clouds of any political firmament for centuries , sitting here apparently defeated in argument by [an ignorant country blacksmith]3209-an ignorant country blacksmith]3208-the loftiest uncrowned head that had moved through the clouds of any political firmament for centuries , sitting here apparently defeated in argument by an ignorant country blacksmith ! And [I]0-i could see that [those others]3210-those others were sorry for [me]0-i -- which made [me]0-i blush till [I]0-i could smell [my]0-i whiskers scorching . Put [yourself]3211-you in [my]0-i place ; feel as mean as [I]0-i did , as ashamed as [I]0-i felt -- wouldn't _ [you]3211-you _ have struck below the belt to get even ? Yes , [you]3211-you would ; it is simply human nature . Well , that is what [I]0-i did . [I]0-i am not trying to justify it ; [I]0-i 'm only saying that [I]0-i was mad , and _ [anybody]553-anybody _ would have done it . Well , when [I]0-i make up [my]0-i mind to hit [a man]518-a man , [I]0-i do n't plan out a love - tap ; no , that is n't [my]0-i way ; as long as [I]0-i 'm going to hit [him]518-a man at all , [I]0-i 'm going to hit [him]518-a man a lifter . And [I]0-i do n't jump at [him]518-a man all of a sudden , and risk making a blundering half - way business of it ; no , [I]0-i get away off yonder to one side , and work up on [him]518-a man gradually , so that [he]518-a man never suspects that [I]0-i 'm going to hit [him]518-a man at all ; and by and by , all in a flash , [he]518-a man 's flat on [his]518-a man back , and [he]518-a man ca n't tell for the life of [him]518-a man how it all happened . That is the way [I]0-i went for [brother Dowley]283-dowley . [I]0-i started to talking lazy and comfortable , as if [I]0-i was just talking to pass the time ; and [the oldest man in [the world]374-the world]3214-the oldest man in the world could n't have taken the bearings of [[my]0-i starting place]3216-my starting place and guessed where [I]0-i was going to fetch up : “ [Boys]1338-boys , there 's a good many curious things about law , and custom , and usage , and all that sort of thing , when [you]1338-boys come to look at it ; yes , and about the drift and progress of human opinion and movement , too . There are written laws -- they perish ; but there are also unwritten laws--_they _ are eternal . Take the unwritten law of wages : it says [they]6269-they 've got to advance , little by little , straight through the centuries . And notice how it works . [We]6270-we know what wages are now , here and there and yonder ; [we]6270-we strike an average , and say that 's the wages of to - day . [We]6270-we know what the wages were a hundred years ago , and what they were two hundred years ago ; that 's as far back as [we]6270-we can get , but it suffices to give [us]6270-we the law of progress , the measure and rate of the periodical augmentation ; and so , without a document to help [us]6270-we , [we]6270-we can come pretty close to determining what the wages were three and four and five hundred years ago . Good , so far . Do [we]6270-we stop there ? No . [We]6270-we stop looking backward ; [we]6270-we face around and apply the law to the future . [[My]3214-the oldest man in the world friends]4435-my friends , [I]3214-the oldest man in the world can tell [you]4435-my friends what [people]357-people 's wages are going to be at any date in the future [you]4435-my friends want to know , for hundreds and hundreds of years . ”[3214-the oldest man in the world] “ What , [goodman]2684-goodman , what ! ”[3219-his] “ Yes . In seven hundred years wages will have risen to six times what they are now , here in [[your]4435-my friends region]6274-your region , and [farm hands]6275-farm hands will be allowed 3 cents a day , and [mechanics]6276-mechanics 6 . ”[3068-the wheelwright] “ [I]285-smug would't [I]285-smug might die now and live then ! ”[285-smug] interrupted [Smug]285-smug , [the wheelwright]3068-the wheelwright , with a fine avaricious glow in [his]3068-the wheelwright eye . “ And that is n't all ; [they]6276-mechanics 'll get [their]6276-mechanics board besides -- such as it is : it wo n't bloat [them]6276-mechanics . Two hundred and fifty years later -- pay attention now -- [a mechanic]5815-a mechanic 's wages will be -- mind [you]3220-ye , this is law , not guesswork ; [a mechanic]5815-a mechanic 's wages will then be _ twenty _ cents a day ! ”[285-smug] There was a general gasp of awed astonishment , [Dickon]284-dickon [the mason]3067-the mason murmured , with raised eyes and hands : “ More than three weeks ' pay for one day 's work ! ”[3067-the mason] “ Riches!--of a truth , yes , riches ! ”[281-marco] muttered [Marco]281-marco , [his]3219-his breath coming quick and short , with excitement . “ Wages will keep on rising , little by little , little by little , as steadily as a tree grows , and at the end of three hundred and forty years more there 'll be at least _ one _ country where [the mechanic]6253-the mechanic 's average wage will be _ two hundred _ cents a day ! ”[281-marco] It knocked [them]3220-ye absolutely dumb ! [Not a man of them]3221-not a man of them could get [his]3221-not a man of them breath for upwards of two minutes . Then [the coal - burner]2971-the coal - burner said prayerfully : “ Might [I]2971-the coal - burner but live to see it ! ”[2971-the coal - burner] “ It is the income of [an earl]6280-an earl ! ”[285-smug] said [Smug]285-smug . “ [An earl]6280-an earl , say [ye]3220-ye ? ”[283-dowley] said [Dowley]283-dowley ; “ [ye]3220-ye could say more than that and speak no lie ; there 's no earl in [the realm of [Bagdemagus]189-bagdemagus]6282-the realm of bagdemagus that hath an income like to that . Income of [an earl]6280-an earl -- mf ! it 's the income of [an angel]2196-an angel ! ”[283-dowley] “ Now , then , that is what is going to happen as regards wages . In that remote day , [that man]1850-that man will earn , with _ one _ week 's work , that bill of goods which it takes [you]3220-ye upwards of _ fifty _ weeks to earn now . Some other pretty surprising things are going to happen , too . [Brother Dowley]283-dowley , who is it that determines , every spring , what the particular wage of each kind of [mechanic]6286-mechanic , [laborer]6287-laborer , and [servant]6288-servant shall be for that year ? ”[2971-the coal - burner] “ Sometimes [the courts]6289-the courts , sometimes [the town council]6290-the town council ; but most of all , [the magistrate]6291-the magistrate . [Ye]3220-ye may say , in general terms , it is [the magistrate that fixes the wages]6292-the magistrate that fixes the wages . ”[2971-the coal - burner] “ Does n't ask any of [those poor devils]6293-those poor devils to _ help _ [him]6292-the magistrate that fixes the wages fix [their]6293-those poor devils wages for [them]6293-those poor devils , does [he]6292-the magistrate that fixes the wages ? ”[283-dowley] “ Hm ! That _ were _ an idea ! The master that 's to pay [him]6292-the magistrate that fixes the wages the money is the one that 's rightly concerned in that matter , [ye]3220-ye will notice . ”[2971-the coal - burner] “ Yes -- but [I]2971-the coal - burner thought [the other man]466-the other man might have some little trifle at stake in it , too ; and even [[his]466-the other man wife]1894-his wife and [children]533-children , [poor creatures]6297-poor creatures . [The masters]6298-the masters are these : [nobles]953-nobles , [rich men]6300-rich men , [the prosperous generally]6301-the prosperous generally . [These few , who do no work]6302-these few , who do no work , determine what pay [the vast hive]6303-the vast hive shall have who _ do _ work . [You]3220-ye see ? [They]6304-they 're a ' [combine'--a trade union]6305-combine'--a trade union , to coin a new phrase -- who band [themselves]6304-they together to force [[their]6304-they lowly brother]6306-their lowly brother to take what [they]6304-they choose to give . Thirteen hundred years hence -- so says the unwritten law -- the ' combine ' will be the other way , and then how [these fine people]6307-these fine people 's posterity will fume and fret and grit [their]6307-these fine people teeth over the insolent tyranny of [trade unions]6308-trade unions ! Yes , indeed ! [the magistrate]6291-the magistrate will tranquilly arrange the wages from now clear away down into the nineteenth century ; and then all of a sudden [the wage - earner]6310-the wage - earner will consider that a couple of thousand years or so is enough of this one - sided sort of thing ; and [he]6310-the wage - earner will rise up and take a hand in fixing [his]6310-the wage - earner wages [himself]6310-the wage - earner . Ah , [he]6310-the wage - earner will have a long and bitter account of wrong and humiliation to settle . ”[2971-the coal - burner] “ Do [ye]3220-ye believe-- ”[283-dowley] “ That [he]6310-the wage - earner actually will help to fix [his]6310-the wage - earner own wages ? Yes , indeed . And [he]6310-the wage - earner will be strong and able , then . ”[2971-the coal - burner] “ Brave times , brave times , of a truth ! ”[3223-the prosperous smith] sneered [the prosperous smith]3223-the prosperous smith . “ Oh,--and there 's another detail . In that day , [a master]1950-a master may hire [a man]518-a man for only just one day , or one week , or one month at a time , if [he]6310-the wage - earner wants to . ”[3223-the prosperous smith] “ What ? ”[2971-the coal - burner] “ It 's true . Moreover , [a magistrate]6313-a magistrate wo n't be able to force [a man]518-a man to work for [a master]1950-a master a whole year on a stretch whether [the man]536-the man wants to or not . ”[2971-the coal - burner] “ Will there be _ no _ law or sense in that day ? ”[2971-the coal - burner] “ [Both of [them]6317-both of them]6317-both of them , [Dowley]283-dowley . And [he]518-a man can leave [town]4776-town whenever [he]518-a man wants to , if the wages do n't suit him!--and [they]6322-they ca n't put [him]518-a man in [the pillory]6323-the pillory for it . ”[2971-the coal - burner] “ Perdition catch such an age ! ”[283-dowley] shouted [Dowley]283-dowley , in strong indignation . “ An age of dogs , an age barren of reverence for [superiors]970-superiors and respect for authority ! [The pillory--]6325-the pillory-- ”[283-dowley] “ Oh , wait , [brother]2687-brother ; say no good word for [that institution]6327-that institution . [I]0-i had scored [my]0-i first point ! For the first time , [the smith]3125-the smith was n't up and ready . [The company]607-the company noticed it . [The mob]2900-the mob try to have some fun with [him]6335-a poor fellow , do n't [they]2900-the mob ? ”[607-the company] “ Yes . ”[283-dowley] “ [They]2900-the mob begin by clodding [him]6335-a poor fellow ; and [they]2900-the mob laugh [themselves]2900-the mob to pieces to see [him]6335-a poor fellow try to dodge one clod and get hit with another ? ”[283-dowley] “ Yes . ”[607-the company] “ Then [they]2900-the mob throw dead cats at [him]6335-a poor fellow , do n't [they]2900-the mob ? ”[283-dowley] “ Yes . ”[283-dowley] “ Well , then , suppose [he]6335-a poor fellow has [a few personal enemies in that mob]6339-a few personal enemies in that mob and here and there [a man]518-a man or [a woman with a secret grudge against [him]6335-a poor fellow]6341-a woman with a secret grudge against him -- and suppose especially that [he]6335-a poor fellow is unpopular in [the community]2288-the community , for [his]6335-a poor fellow pride , or [his]6335-a poor fellow prosperity , or one thing or another -- stones and bricks take the place of clods and cats presently , do n't [they]2900-the mob ? ”[283-dowley] “ There is no doubt of it . ”[607-the company] “ As a rule [he]6335-a poor fellow is crippled for life , is n't he?--jaws broken , teeth smashed out?--or legs mutilated , gangrened , presently cut off ? --or an eye knocked out , maybe both eyes ? ”[283-dowley] “ It is true , [God]121-god knoweth it . ”[283-dowley] “ And if [he]6335-a poor fellow is unpopular [he]6335-a poor fellow can depend on _ dying _ , right there in [the stocks]6343-the stocks , ca n't [he]6335-a poor fellow ? ”[607-the company] “ [He]6335-a poor fellow surely can ! [One]434-one may not deny it . ”[283-dowley] “ [I]283-dowley take it none of _ [you]0-i _ are unpopular -- by reason of pride or insolence , or conspicuous prosperity , or any of those things that excite envy and malice among [the base scum of [a village]1008-a village]6345-the base scum of a village ? _ [You]0-i _ would n't think it much of a risk to take a chance in [the stocks]6343-the stocks ? ”[283-dowley] [Dowley]283-dowley winced , visibly . [I]0-i judged [he]283-dowley was hit . But [he]283-dowley did n't betray it by any spoken word . As for [the others]1524-the others , [they]1524-the others spoke out plainly , and with strong feeling . [They]1524-the others said [they]1524-the others had seen enough of the stocks to know what [a man]518-a man 's chance in [them]1524-the others was , and [they]1524-the others would never consent to enter [them]1524-the others if [they]1524-the others could compromise on a quick death by hanging . “ Well , to change the subject -- for [I]1524-the others think [I]1524-the others 've established [my]1524-the others point that the stocks ought to be abolished . [I]1524-the others think some of [our]6348-our laws are pretty unfair . For instance , if [I]1524-the others do a thing which ought to deliver [me]1524-the others to the stocks , and [you]6349-you know [I]1524-the others did it and yet keep still and do n't report [me]1524-the others , _ [you]6349-you _ will get the stocks if [anybody]553-anybody informs on [you]6349-you . ”[1524-the others] “ Ah , but that would serve [you]6349-you but right , ”[283-dowley] said [Dowley]283-dowley , “ for [you]6349-you _ must _ inform . So saith the law . ”[1524-the others] [The others]1524-the others coincided . “ Well , all right , let it go , since [you]6349-you vote [me]1524-the others down . But there 's one thing which certainly is n't fair . [The magistrate]6291-the magistrate fixes [a mechanic]5815-a mechanic 's wage at one cent a day , for instance . The law says that if [any master]6353-any master shall venture , even under utmost press of business , to pay anything _ over _ that cent a day , even for a single day , [he]6353-any master shall be both fined and pilloried for it ; and whoever knows [he]6353-any master did it and does n't inform , [they]3230-they also shall be fined and pilloried . Now it seems to [me]1524-the others unfair , [Dowley]283-dowley , and a deadly peril to [all of [us]6354-all of us]6354-all of us , that because [you]3229-you thoughtlessly confessed , a while ago , that within a week [you]3229-you have paid a cent and fifteen mil-- ”[1524-the others] Oh , [I]0-i tell _ [you]3229-you _ it was a smasher ! [You]3229-you ought to have seen [them]3230-they to go to pieces , [the whole gang]3231-the whole gang . [I]0-i had just slipped up on [poor smiling and complacent Dowley]283-dowley so nice and easy and softly , that [he]283-dowley never suspected anything was going to happen till the blow came crashing down and knocked [him]283-dowley all to rags . A fine effect . In fact , as fine as any [I]0-i ever produced , with so little time to work it up in . But [I]0-i saw in a moment that [I]0-i had overdone the thing a little . [I]0-i was expecting to scare [them]3230-they , but [I]0-i was n't expecting to scare [them]3230-they to death . [They]3230-they were mighty near it , though . [You]3229-you see [they]3230-they had been a whole lifetime learning to appreciate the pillory ; and to have that thing staring [them]3230-they in the face , and [every one of [them]3230-they]3232-every one of them distinctly at the mercy of [me]0-i , [a stranger]798-a stranger , if [I]0-i chose to go and report -- well , it was awful , and [they]3230-they could n't seem to recover from the shock , [they]3230-they could n't seem to pull [themselves]3230-they together . Pale , shaky , dumb , pitiful ? Why , [they]3230-they were n't any better than [so many dead men]3234-so many dead men . It was very uncomfortable . Of course , [I]0-i thought [they]3230-they would appeal to [me]0-i to keep [mum]6200-mum , and then [we]3236-we would shake hands , and take a drink all round , and laugh it off , and there an end . But no ; [you]3229-you see [I]0-i was [an unknown person]3237-an unknown person , among [a cruelly oppressed and suspicious people]3238-a cruelly oppressed and suspicious people , [a people always accustomed to having advantage taken of [their]3239-a people always accustomed to having advantage taken of their helplessness , and never expecting just or kind treatment from any but their own families and very closest intimates helplessness , and never expecting just or kind treatment from any but [[their]3239-a people always accustomed to having advantage taken of their helplessness , and never expecting just or kind treatment from any but their own families and very closest intimates own families]3240-their own families and [very closest intimates]3241-very closest intimates]3239-a people always accustomed to having advantage taken of their helplessness , and never expecting just or kind treatment from any but their own families and very closest intimates . Appeal to _ [me]0-i _ to be gentle , to be fair , to be generous ? Of course , [they]3230-they wanted to , but [they]3230-they could n't dare . CHAPTER XXXIV [THE YANKEE]297-the yankee AND [THE KING SOLD AS SLAVES]3242-the king sold as slaves Well , what had [I]0-i better do ? Nothing in a hurry , sure . [I]0-i must get up a diversion ; anything to employ [me]0-i while [I]0-i could think , and while [these poor fellows]2075-these poor fellows could have a chance to come to life again . There sat [Marco]281-marco , petrified in the act of trying to get the hang of [his]3244-his miller - gun -- turned to stone , just in the attitude [he]3244-his was in when [[my]0-i pile - driver]3191-my pile - driver fell , the toy still gripped in [his]3244-his unconscious fingers . So [I]0-i took it from [him]3244-his and proposed to explain its mystery . Mystery ! a simple little thing like that ; and yet it was mysterious enough , for that race and that age . [I]0-i never saw [such an awkward people]3246-such an awkward people , with machinery ; [you]3247-you see , [they]3246-such an awkward people were totally unused to it . The miller - gun was a little double - barreled tube of toughened glass , with a neat little trick of a spring to it , which upon pressure would let a shot escape . But the shot would n't hurt [anybody]553-anybody , it would only drop into [your]3247-you hand . In the gun were two sizes -- wee mustard - seed shot , and another sort that were several times larger . [They]3249-they were money . The mustard - seed shot represented [milrays]3250-milrays , [the larger ones mills]3251-the larger ones mills . So the gun was a purse ; and very handy , too ; [you]3247-you could pay out money in the dark with it , with accuracy ; and [you]3247-you could carry it in [your]3247-you mouth ; or in [your]3247-you vest pocket , if [you]3247-you had one . [I]0-i made them of several sizes --one size so large that it would carry the equivalent of a dollar . Using shot for money was a good thing for [the government]864-the government ; the metal cost nothing , and the money could n't be counterfeited , for [I]0-i was [the only person in [the kingdom]517-the kingdom who knew how to manage [a shot tower]3255-a shot tower]3253-the only person in the kingdom who knew how to manage a shot tower . “ Paying the shot ”[4445-the king] soon came to be a common phrase . Yes , and [I]0-i knew it would still be [passing men]3256-passing men 's lips , away down in the nineteenth century , yet [none]557-none would suspect how and when it originated . [The king]4445-the king joined [us]3259-we , about this time , mightily refreshed by [his]4445-the king nap , and feeling good . Anything could make [me]0-i nervous now , [I]0-i was so uneasy -- for [our]3259-we lives were in danger ; and so it worried [me]0-i to detect a complacent something in [the king]4445-the king 's eye which seemed to indicate that [he]4445-the king had been loading [himself]4445-the king up for a performance of some kind or other ; confound it , why must [he]4445-the king go and choose such a time as this ? [I]0-i was right . [He]4445-the king began , straight off , in the most innocently artful , and transparent , and lubberly way , to lead up to the subject of agriculture . The cold sweat broke out all over [me]0-i . [I]0-i wanted to whisper in [his]4445-the king ear , “ [Man]4450-man , [we]3259-we are in awful danger ! every moment is worth a principality till [we]3259-we get back [these men]2820-these men 's confidence ; _ do n't _ waste any of this golden time . ”[0-i] But of course [I]0-i could n't do it . Whisper to [him]4445-the king ? It would look as if [we]3259-we were conspiring . So [I]0-i had to sit there and look calm and pleasant while [the king]4445-the king stood over that dynamite mine and mooned along about [his]4445-the king damned onions and things . At first the tumult of [my]0-i own thoughts , summoned by the danger - signal and swarming to the rescue from every quarter of [my]0-i skull , kept up such a hurrah and confusion and fifing and drumming that [I]0-i could n't take in a word ; but presently when [my]0-i mob of gathering plans began to crystallize and fall into position and form line of battle , a sort of order and quiet ensued and [I]0-i caught the boom of [the king]4445-the king 's batteries , as if out of remote distance : “ --were not the best way , methinks , albeit it is not to be denied that [authorities]6357-authorities differ as concerning this point , some contending that the onion is but an unwholesome berry when stricken early from the tree-- ”[4445-the king] [The audience]6020-the audience showed signs of life , and sought [each other]1058-each other 's eyes in a surprised and troubled way . “ --whileas [others]1365-others do yet maintain , with much show of reason , that this is not of necessity the case , instancing that plums and other like cereals do be always dug in the unripe state-- ”[6020-the audience] [The audience]6020-the audience exhibited distinct distress ; yes , and also fear . “ --yet are [they]2820-these men clearly wholesome , the more especially when [one]434-one doth assuage the asperities of [their]2820-these men nature by admixture of the tranquilizing juice of the wayward cabbage-- ”[6020-the audience] The wild light of terror began to glow in [these men]2820-these men 's eyes , and one of [them]2820-these men muttered , “ These be errors , [every one -- [God]121-god hath surely smitten the mind of [this farmer]6361-this farmer]6360-every one -- god hath surely smitten the mind of this farmer . ”[2820-these men] [I]0-i was in miserable apprehension ; [I]0-i sat upon thorns . “ --and further instancing the known truth that in the case of animals , the young , which may be called the green fruit of the creature , is the better , all confessing that when a goat is ripe , [his]3267-his fur doth heat and sore engame [his]3267-his flesh , the which defect , taken in connection with [his]3267-his several rancid habits , and fulsome appetites , and godless attitudes of mind , and bilious quality of morals-- ”[0-i] [They]2820-these men rose and went for [him]3267-his ! With a fierce shout , “ [The one]742-the one would betray [us]3268-us , the other is mad ! Kill [them]2820-these men ! Kill [them]2820-these men ! ”[2820-these men] [they]2820-these men flung [themselves]2820-these men upon [us]3268-us . What joy flamed up in [the king]4445-the king 's eye ! [He]4445-the king might be lame in agriculture , but this kind of thing was just in [his]4445-the king line . [He]4445-the king had been fasting long , [he]4445-the king was hungry for a fight . [He]4445-the king hit [the blacksmith]5172-the blacksmith a crack under the jaw that lifted [him]4445-the king clear off [his]4445-the king feet and stretched [him]4445-the king flat on [his]4445-the king back . “ [St. George]158-george for [Britain]32-britain ! ”[4445-the king] and [he]4445-the king downed [the wheelwright]3068-the wheelwright . [The mason]3067-the mason was big , but [I]0-i laid [him]3067-the mason out like nothing . [The three]3273-the three gathered [themselves]3273-the three up and came again ; went down again ; came again ; and kept on repeating this , with [native British pluck]3274-native british pluck , until [they]3273-the three were battered to jelly , reeling with exhaustion , and so blind that [they]3273-the three could n't tell [us]3275-we from [each other]1058-each other ; and yet [they]3273-the three kept right on , hammering away with what might was left in [them]3273-the three . Hammering [each other]1058-each other -- for [we]3275-we stepped aside and looked on while [they]3273-the three rolled , and struggled , and gouged , and pounded , and bit , with the strict and wordless attention to business of so many bulldogs . [We]3275-we looked on without apprehension , for [they]3273-the three were fast getting past ability to go for help against [us]3275-we , and [the arena]3278-the arena was far enough from [the public road]3279-the public road to be safe from intrusion . Well , while [they]3273-the three were gradually playing out , it suddenly occurred to [me]0-i to wonder what had become of [Marco]281-marco . [I]0-i looked around ; [he]3280-he was nowhere to be seen . Oh , but this was ominous ! [I]0-i pulled [the king]4445-the king 's sleeve , and [we]3275-we glided away and rushed for [the hut]2809-the hut . No [Marco]281-marco there , [no Phyllis there]3283-no phyllis there ! [They]3273-the three had gone to [the road]460-the road for help , sure . [I]0-i told [the king]4445-the king to give [his]4445-the king heels wings , and [I]0-i would explain later . [We]3275-we made good time across [the open ground]3286-the open ground , and as [we]3275-we darted into the shelter of [the wood]3287-the wood [I]0-i glanced back and saw [a mob of excited peasants]3288-a mob of excited peasants swarm into view , with [Marco]281-marco and [[his]3280-he wife]1894-his wife at [their]3288-a mob of excited peasants head . [They]3288-a mob of excited peasants were making a world of noise , but that could n't hurt [anybody]553-anybody ; the wood was dense , and as soon as [we]3275-we were well into [its]3287-the wood depths [we]3275-we would take to a tree and let [them]3288-a mob of excited peasants whistle . Ah , but then came another sound -- dogs ! Yes , that was quite another matter . It magnified [our]3275-we contract -- [we]3275-we must find running water . [We]3275-we tore along at a good gait , and soon left the sounds far behind and modified to a murmur . [We]3275-we struck [a stream]3291-a stream and darted into it . [We]3275-we waded swiftly down [it]3291-a stream , in the dim forest light , for as much as three hundred yards , and then came across an oak with a great bough sticking out over the water . [We]3275-we climbed up on this bough , and began to work [our]3275-we way along it to the body of the tree ; now [we]3275-we began to hear those sounds more plainly ; so [the mob]2900-the mob had struck [our]3275-we trail . For a while the sounds approached pretty fast . And then for another while [they]3288-a mob of excited peasants did n't . No doubt the dogs had found [the place where [we]3275-we had entered [the stream]4795-the stream]3293-the place where we had entered the stream , and were now waltzing up and down [the shores]3295-the shores trying to pick up [the trail]3296-the trail again . When [we]3275-we were snugly lodged in the tree and curtained with foliage , [the king]4445-the king was satisfied , but [I]0-i was doubtful . [I]0-i believed [we]3275-we could crawl along a branch and get into the next tree , and [I]0-i judged it worth while to try . [We]3275-we tried it , and made a success of it , though [the king]4445-the king slipped , at the junction , and came near failing to connect . [We]3275-we got comfortable lodgment and satisfactory concealment among the foliage , and then [we]3275-we had nothing to do but listen to the hunt . Presently [we]3275-we heard it coming -- and coming on the jump , too ; yes , and down [both sides of [the stream]4795-the stream]3299-both sides of the stream . Louder -- louder -- next minute it swelled swiftly up into a roar of shoutings , barkings , tramplings , and swept by like a cyclone . “ [I]0-i was afraid that the overhanging branch would suggest something to [them]6363-they , ”[0-i] said [I]0-i , “ but [I]0-i do n't mind the disappointment . Come , [[my]0-i liege]2621-my liege , it were well that [we]3275-we make good use of [our]3275-we time . [We]3275-we 've flanked [them]6363-they . Dark is coming on , presently . If [we]3275-we can cross [the stream]4795-the stream and get a good start , and borrow a couple of horses from [[somebody]1383-somebody 's pasture]6367-somebody 's pasture to use for a few hours , [we]3275-we shall be safe enough . ”[0-i] [We]3275-we started down , and got nearly to the lowest limb , when [we]3275-we seemed to hear the hunt returning . [We]3275-we stopped to listen . “ Yes , ”[0-i] said [I]0-i , “ [they]6363-they 're baffled , [they]6363-they 've given it up , [they]6363-they 're on [their]6363-they way [home]619-home . [We]3275-we will climb back to [our]3275-we roost again , and let [them]6363-they go by . ”[0-i] So [we]3275-we climbed back . [The king]4445-the king listened a moment and said : “ [They]6363-they still search -- [I]4445-the king wit the sign . [We]3275-we did best to abide . ”[4445-the king] [He]4445-the king was right . [He]4445-the king knew more about hunting than [I]0-i did . The noise approached steadily , but not with a rush . [The king]4445-the king said : “ [They]6363-they reason that [we]3275-we were advantaged by no parlous start of [them]6363-they , and being on foot are as yet no mighty way from where [we]3275-we took [the water]4480-the water . ”[4445-the king] “ Yes , [sire]2588-sire , that is about it , [I]4445-the king am afraid , though [I]4445-the king was hoping better things . ”[4445-the king] The noise drew nearer and nearer , and soon [the van]3303-the van was drifting under [us]3275-we , on both sides of [the water]4480-the water . A voice called a halt from [the other bank]3305-the other bank , and said : “ An [they]6363-they were so minded , [they]6363-they could get to yon tree by this branch that overhangs , and yet not touch ground . [Ye]3306-ye will do well to send [a man]518-a man up it . ”[4445-the king] “ [Marry]128-marry , that [we]3275-we will do ! ”[0-i] [I]0-i was obliged to admire [my]0-i cuteness in foreseeing this very thing and swapping trees to beat it . But , do n't [you]3306-ye know , there are some things that can beat smartness and foresight ? Awkwardness and stupidity can . [The best swordsman in [the world]374-the world]3307-the best swordsman in the world does n't need to fear [the second best swordsman in [the world]374-the world]3309-the second best swordsman in the world ; no , [the person for [him]3311-the person for him to be afraid of to be afraid of]3311-the person for him to be afraid of is [some ignorant antagonist who has never had a sword in [his]3311-the person for him to be afraid of hand before]3312-some ignorant antagonist who has never had a sword in his hand before ; [he]3311-the person for him to be afraid of does n't do the thing [he]3311-the person for him to be afraid of ought to do , and so [the expert]3313-the expert is n't prepared for [him]3311-the person for him to be afraid of ; [he]3311-the person for him to be afraid of does the thing [he]3311-the person for him to be afraid of ought not to do ; and often it catches [the expert]3313-the expert out and ends [him]3311-the person for him to be afraid of on the spot . Well , how could [I]0-i , with all [my]0-i gifts , make any valuable preparation against [a near - sighted , cross - eyed , pudding - headed clown who would aim [himself]3315-a near - sighted , cross - eyed , pudding - headed clown who would aim himself at the wrong tree and hit the right one at the wrong tree and hit [the right one]3316-the right one]3315-a near - sighted , cross - eyed , pudding - headed clown who would aim himself at the wrong tree and hit the right one ? Matters were serious now . [We]3317-we remained still , and awaited developments . [The peasant]2628-the peasant toiled [his]2628-the peasant difficult way up . [The king]4445-the king raised [himself]4445-the king up and stood ; [he]4445-the king made a leg ready , and when [the comer]3320-the comer 's head arrived in reach of it there was a dull thud , and down went [the man]536-the man floundering to the ground . There was a wild outbreak of anger below , and [the mob]2900-the mob swarmed in from all around , and there [we]3317-we were treed , and [prisoners]6139-prisoners . [Another man]3324-another man started up ; the bridging bough was detected , and [a volunteer]3325-a volunteer started up the tree that furnished [the bridge]3326-the bridge . [The king]4445-the king ordered [me]0-i to play [Horatius]298-horatius and keep [the bridge]3326-the bridge . For a while [the enemy]3329-the enemy came thick and fast ; but no matter , [the head man of each procession]3330-the head man of each procession always got a buffet that dislodged [him]3330-the head man of each procession as soon as [he]3330-the head man of each procession came in reach . [The king]4445-the king 's spirits rose , [his]4445-the king joy was limitless . [He]4445-the king said that if nothing occurred to mar the prospect [we]3317-we should have a beautiful night , for on this line of tactics [we]3317-we could hold the tree against [the whole country - side]3332-the whole country - side . However , [the mob]2900-the mob soon came to that conclusion [themselves]2900-the mob ; wherefore [they]2900-the mob called off the assault and began to debate other plans . [They]2900-the mob had no weapons , but there were plenty of stones , and stones might answer . [We]3317-we had no objections . A stone might possibly penetrate to [us]3317-we once in a while , but it was n't very likely ; [we]3317-we were well protected by boughs and foliage , and were not visible from any good aiming point . If [they]2900-the mob would but waste half an hour in stone - throwing , the dark would come to [our]3317-we help . [We]3317-we were feeling very well satisfied . [We]3317-we could smile ; almost laugh . But [we]3317-we did n't ; which was just as well , for [we]3317-we should have been interrupted . Before the stones had been raging through the leaves and bouncing from the boughs fifteen minutes , [we]3317-we began to notice a smell . A couple of sniffs of it was enough of an explanation --it was smoke ! [Our]3317-we game was up at last . [We]3317-we recognized that . When smoke invites [you]3334-you , [you]3334-you have to come . [They]2900-the mob raised [their]2900-the mob pile of dry brush and damp weeds higher and higher , and when [they]2900-the mob saw the thick cloud begin to roll up and smother the tree , [they]2900-the mob broke out in a storm of joy - clamors . [I]0-i got enough breath to say : “ Proceed , [[my]0-i liege]2621-my liege ; after [you]2621-my liege is manners . ”[0-i] [The king]4445-the king gasped : “ Follow [me]4445-the king down , and then back [thyself]6373-thyself against one side of the trunk , and leave [me]4445-the king the other . [I]0-i struck the ground an instant after [him]4445-the king ; [we]3336-we sprang to [our]3336-we appointed places , and began to give and take with all [our]3336-we might . The powwow and racket were prodigious ; it was a tempest of riot and confusion and thick - falling blows . Suddenly [some horsemen]3337-some horsemen tore into the midst of [the crowd]2064-the crowd , and a voice shouted : “ Hold -- or [ye]3337-some horsemen are [dead men]6374-dead men ! ”[3337-some horsemen] How good it sounded ! [The owner of the voice]3339-the owner of the voice bore all the marks of [a gentleman]1956-a gentleman : picturesque and costly raiment , the aspect of command , a hard countenance , with complexion and features marred by dissipation . [The mob]2900-the mob fell humbly back , like so many spaniels . [Meantime]299-meantime [the gentleman]5170-the gentleman had been questioning [us]3352-we more closely , but had dug no particulars out of [us]3352-we . [They]3400-they take a _ meaning _ , and get to be very vivid , when [you]3398-ye come to apply them to [yourself]3398-ye . The law is clear : it doth not require [the claimant]6403-the claimant to prove [ye]3398-ye are [slaves]924-slaves , it requireth [you]3398-ye to prove [ye]3398-ye are not . ”[0-i] [I]0-i said : “ [Dear sir]6405-dear sir , give [us]6399-us only time to send to [Astolat]268-astolat ; or give [us]6399-us only time to send to [the Valley of Holiness--]6406-the valley of holiness-- ”[0-i] “ Peace , [good man]6407-good man , these are extraordinary requests , and [you]6407-good man may not hope to have them granted . [We]3406-we were in trouble enough already ; it could not help [us]3406-we any to give [these people]551-these people the notion that [we]3406-we were [lunatics]509-lunatics . There is no use in stringing out the details . [The earl]1019-the earl put [us]3406-we up and sold [us]3406-we at auction . This same infernal law had existed in [[our]3406-we own South in [my]0-i own time]3410-our own south in my own time , more than thirteen hundred years later , and under it [hundreds of freemen who could not prove that [they]3411-hundreds of freemen who could not prove that they were freemen were [freemen]928-freemen]3411-hundreds of freemen who could not prove that they were freemen had been sold into lifelong slavery without the circumstance making any particular impression upon [me]0-i ; but the minute law and the auction block came into [my]0-i personal experience , a thing which had been merely improper before became suddenly hellish . Well , that 's the way [we]3406-we are made . Yes , [we]3406-we were sold at auction , like swine . In [a big town]3413-a big town and [an active market]3414-an active market [we]3406-we should have brought a good price ; but [this place]4515-this place was utterly stagnant and so [we]3406-we sold at a figure which makes [me]0-i ashamed , every time [I]0-i think of it . [The King of [England]1-england]3416-the king of england brought seven dollars , and [[his]3416-the king of england prime minister]3417-his prime minister nine ; whereas [the king]4445-the king was easily worth twelve dollars and [I]0-i as easily worth fifteen . But that is the way things always go ; if [you]3419-you force a sale on a dull market , [I]0-i do n't care what [the property]3420-the property is , [you]3419-you are going to make a poor business of it , and [you]3419-you can make up [your]3419-you mind to it . If [the earl]1019-the earl had had wit enough to-- However , there is no occasion for [my]0-i working [my]0-i sympathies up on [his]1019-the earl account . Let [him]1019-the earl go , for the present ; [I]0-i took [his]1019-the earl number , so to speak . [The slave - dealer]3422-the slave - dealer bought [us]3423-us both , and hitched [us]3423-us onto that long chain of [his]1019-the earl , and [we]3423-us constituted the rear of [[his]1019-the earl procession]3424-his procession . [We]3423-us took up [our]3423-us line of march and passed out of [Cambenet]75-cambenet at noon ; and it seemed to [me]0-i unaccountably strange and odd that [the King of [England]1-england]3416-the king of england and [[his]3416-the king of england chief minister]3426-his chief minister , marching manacled and fettered and yoked , in [a slave convoy]3427-a slave convoy , could move by all manner of [idle men]3428-idle men and [women]532-women , and under windows where sat [the sweet and the lovely , and yet never attract a curious eye]3430-the sweet and the lovely , and yet never attract a curious eye , never provoke a single remark . [Dear]664-dear , [dear]664-dear , it only shows that there is nothing diviner about [a king]891-a king than there is about [a tramp]662-a tramp , after all . [He]891-a king is just a cheap and hollow artificiality when [you]664-dear do n't know [he]891-a king is [a king]891-a king . But reveal [his]891-a king quality , and dear [me]0-i it takes [your]664-dear very breath away to look at [him]891-a king . [I]0-i reckon [we]3436-we are [all fools]3437-all fools . Born so , no doubt . CHAPTER XXXV A PITIFUL INCIDENT It 's [a world of surprises]3438-a world of surprises . [The king]4445-the king brooded ; this was natural . What would [he]4445-the king brood about , should [you]664-dear say ? Why , about the prodigious nature of [his]4445-the king fall , of course -- from the loftiest place in [the world]374-the world to the lowest ; from [the most illustrious station in [the world]374-the world]3441-the most illustrious station in the world to the obscurest ; from the grandest vocation among [men]508-men to the basest . No , [I]0-i take [my]0-i oath that the thing that graveled [him]4445-the king most , to start with , was not this , but the price [he]4445-the king had fetched ! [He]4445-the king could n't seem to get over that seven dollars . Well , it stunned [me]0-i so , when [I]0-i first found it out , that [I]0-i could n't believe it ; it did n't seem natural . But as soon as [my]0-i mental sight cleared and [I]0-i got a right focus on it , [I]0-i saw [I]0-i was mistaken ; it _ was _ natural . For this reason : [a king]891-a king is a mere artificiality , and so [a king]891-a king 's feelings , like the impulses of an automatic doll , are mere artificialities ; but as [a man]518-a man , [he]518-a man is a reality , and [his]518-a man feelings , as [a man]518-a man , are real , not phantoms . It shames [the average man]3448-the average man to be valued below [his]3448-the average man own estimate of [his]3448-the average man worth , and [the king]4445-the king certainly was n't anything more than [an average man]3450-an average man , if [he]4445-the king was up that high . Confound [him]4445-the king , [he]4445-the king wearied [me]0-i with arguments to show that in anything like a fair market [he]4445-the king would have fetched twenty - five dollars , sure -- a thing which was plainly nonsense , and full of the baldest conceit ; [I]0-i was n't worth it [myself]0-i . But it was tender ground for [me]0-i to argue on . In fact , [I]0-i had to simply shirk argument and do the diplomatic instead . [I]0-i had to throw conscience aside , and brazenly concede that [he]4445-the king ought to have brought twenty - five dollars ; whereas [I]0-i was quite well aware that in all the ages , [the world]374-the world had never seen [a king that was worth half the money]3452-a king that was worth half the money , and during the next thirteen centuries would n't see one that was worth the fourth of it . Yes , [he]4445-the king tired [me]0-i . If [he]4445-the king began to talk about the crops ; or about the recent weather ; or about the condition of politics ; or about dogs , or cats , or morals , or theology -- no matter what [--I]0-i sighed , for [I]0-i knew what was coming ; [he]4445-the king was going to get out of it a palliation of that tiresome seven - dollar sale . Wherever [we]3453-we halted where there was [a crowd]5214-a crowd , [he]4445-the king would give [me]0-i a look which said plainly : “ if that thing could be tried over again now , with [this kind of folk]6412-this kind of folk , [you]0-i would see a different result . ”[4445-the king] Well , when [he]4445-the king was first sold , it secretly tickled [me]0-i to see [him]4445-the king go for seven dollars ; but before [he]4445-the king was done with [his]4445-the king sweating and worrying [I]0-i wished [he]4445-the king had fetched a hundred . The thing never got a chance to die , for every day , at one place or another , [possible purchasers]3455-possible purchasers looked [us]3453-we over , and , as often as any other way , [their]3455-possible purchasers comment on [the king]4445-the king was something like this : “ Here 's [a two - dollar - and - a - half chump with a thirty - dollar style]6413-a two - dollar - and - a - half chump with a thirty - dollar style . Pity but style was marketable . ”[3455-possible purchasers] At last this sort of remark produced an evil result . [[Our]3453-we owner]3457-our owner was [a practical person]3458-a practical person and [he]3457-our owner perceived that this defect must be mended if [he]3457-our owner hoped to find [a purchaser for [the king]4445-the king]3459-a purchaser for the king . So [he]3457-our owner went to work to take the style out of [[his]3457-our owner sacred majesty]3461-his sacred majesty . [I]0-i could have given [the man]536-the man some valuable advice , but [I]0-i did n't ; [you]3463-you must n't volunteer advice to [a slave - driver]3464-a slave - driver unless [you]3463-you want to damage the cause [you]3463-you are arguing for . [I]0-i had found it a sufficiently difficult job to reduce [the king]4445-the king 's style to [a peasant]2623-a peasant 's style , even when [he]536-the man was [a willing and anxious pupil]3467-a willing and anxious pupil ; now then , to undertake to reduce [the king]4445-the king 's style to [a slave]910-a slave 's style -- and by force -- go to ! it was a stately contract . Never mind the details -- it will save [me]0-i trouble to let [you]3463-you imagine them . [I]0-i will only remark that at the end of a week there was plenty of evidence that lash and club and fist had done [their]3470-their work well ; [the king]4445-the king 's body was a sight to see -- and to weep over ; but [his]4445-the king spirit?--why , it was n't even phased . [Even that dull clod of]3472-even that dull clod of [a slave - driver]3464-a slave - driver was able to see that there can be such a thing as [a slave who will remain [a man]518-a man till [he]4445-the king dies]3474-a slave who will remain a man till he dies ; whose bones [you]3463-you can break , but whose manhood [you]3463-you ca n't . [This man]441-this man found that from [his]441-this man first effort down to [his]441-this man latest , [he]441-this man could n't ever come within reach of [the king]4445-the king , but [the king]4445-the king was ready to plunge for [him]441-this man , and did it . So [he]441-this man gave up at last , and left [the king]4445-the king in possession of [his]4445-the king style unimpaired . The fact is , [the king]4445-the king was a good deal more than [a king]891-a king , [he]4445-the king was [a man]518-a man ; and when [a man]518-a man is [a man]518-a man , [you]3463-you ca n't knock it out of [him]518-a man . [We]3485-we had a rough time for a month , tramping to and fro in [the earth]399-the earth , and suffering . And what [Englishman]302-englishman was the most interested in the slavery question by that time ? [[His]4445-the king grace [the king]4445-the king]3487-his grace the king ! Yes ; from being the most indifferent , [he]3487-his grace the king was become the most interested . [He]3487-his grace the king was become [the bitterest hater of [the institution]3490-the institution [I]0-i had ever heard talk]3489-the bitterest hater of the institution i had ever heard talk . And so [I]0-i ventured to ask once more a question which [I]0-i had asked years before and had gotten such a sharp answer that [I]0-i had not thought it prudent to meddle in the matter further . Would [he]3487-his grace the king abolish slavery ? [His]3487-his grace the king answer was as sharp as before , but it was music this time ; [I]0-i should n't ever wish to hear pleasanter , though the profanity was not good , being awkwardly put together , and with the crash - word almost in the middle instead of at the end , where , of course , it ought to have been . [I]0-i was ready and willing to get free now ; [I]0-i had n't wanted to get free any sooner . No , [I]0-i can not quite say that . [I]0-i had wanted to , but [I]0-i had not been willing to take desperate chances , and had always dissuaded [the king]4445-the king from [them]3492-them . But now -- ah , it was a new atmosphere ! Liberty would be worth any cost that might be put upon it now . [I]0-i set about a plan , and was straightway charmed with it . It would require time , yes , and patience , too , a great deal of both . [One]434-one could invent quicker ways , and fully as sure ones ; but none that would be as picturesque as this ; none that could be made so dramatic . And so [I]0-i was not going to give this one up . It might delay [us]3494-we months , but no matter , [I]0-i would carry it out or break something . Now and then [we]3494-we had an adventure . One night [we]3494-we were overtaken by a snow - storm while still a mile from [the village]811-the village [we]3494-we were making for . Almost instantly [we]3494-we were shut up as in a fog , the driving snow was so thick . [You]3496-you could n't see a thing , and [we]3494-we were soon lost . [The slave - driver]3497-the slave - driver lashed [us]3494-we desperately , for [he]3497-the slave - driver saw ruin before [him]3497-the slave - driver , but [his]3497-the slave - driver lashings only made matters worse , for [they]3492-them drove [us]3494-we further from [the road]460-the road and from likelihood of succor . So [we]3494-we had to stop at last and slump down in the snow where [we]3494-we were . The storm continued until toward midnight , then ceased . By this time [two of [[our]3494-we feebler men]3500-our feebler men and three of [[our]3494-we women]3501-our women]3499-two of our feebler men and three of our women were dead , and [others]1365-others past moving and threatened with death . [[Our]3494-we master]3503-our master was nearly beside [himself]3503-our master . [He]3503-our master stirred up the living , and made [us]3494-we stand , jump , slap [ourselves]3494-we , to restore [our]3494-we circulation , and [he]3503-our master helped as well as [he]3503-our master could with [his]3503-our master whip . Now came a diversion . [We]3494-we heard shrieks and yells , and soon [a woman]6069-a woman came running and crying ; and seeing [[our]3494-we group]3505-our group , [she]6069-a woman flung [herself]6069-a woman into [our]3494-we midst and begged for protection . [A mob of people]3506-a mob of people came tearing after [her]6069-a woman , [some with torches]3507-some with torches , and [they]3506-a mob of people said [she]6069-a woman was [a witch who had caused several cows to die by a strange disease , and practiced [her]6069-a woman arts by help of [a devil in the form of a black cat]3509-a devil in the form of a black cat]3508-a witch who had caused several cows to die by a strange disease , and practiced her arts by help of a devil in the form of a black cat . [This poor woman]3510-this poor woman had been stoned until [she]3510-this poor woman hardly looked human , [she]3510-this poor woman was so battered and bloody . [The mob]2900-the mob wanted to burn [her]3510-this poor woman . Well , now , what do [you]3512-you suppose [[our]3494-we master]3503-our master did ? When [we]3494-we closed around this poor creature to shelter [her]3510-this poor woman , [he]3503-our master saw [his]3503-our master chance . [He]3503-our master said , burn [her]3510-this poor woman here , or [they]2900-the mob should n't have [her]3510-this poor woman at all . Imagine that ! [They]2900-the mob were willing . [They]2900-the mob fastened [her]3510-this poor woman to a post ; [they]2900-the mob brought wood and piled it about [her]3510-this poor woman ; [they]2900-the mob applied the torch while [she]3510-this poor woman shrieked and pleaded and strained [[her]3510-this poor woman two young daughters]3514-her two young daughters to [her]3510-this poor woman breast ; and [[our]3494-we brute]3515-our brute , with a heart solely for business , lashed [us]3494-we into position about the stake and warmed [us]3494-we into life and commercial value by the same fire which took away the innocent life of [that poor harmless mother]3516-that poor harmless mother . That was the sort of master [we]3494-we had . [I]0-i took _ [his]3517-his _ number . That snow - storm cost [him]3517-his nine of [[his]3517-his flock]3518-his flock ; and [he]3517-his was more brutal to [us]3494-we than ever , after that , for many days together , [he]3517-his was so enraged over [his]3517-his loss . [We]3494-we had adventures all along . One day [we]3494-we ran into a procession . And such a procession ! All the riffraff of [the kingdom]517-the kingdom seemed to be comprehended in it ; and all drunk at that . In [the van]3303-the van was [a cart with a coffin in [it]3521-a cart with a coffin in it]3521-a cart with a coffin in it , and on the coffin sat [a comely young girl of about eighteen suckling a baby]3522-a comely young girl of about eighteen suckling a baby , which [she]3522-a comely young girl of about eighteen suckling a baby squeezed to [her]3522-a comely young girl of about eighteen suckling a baby breast in a passion of love every little while , and every little while wiped from [its]3522-a comely young girl of about eighteen suckling a baby face the tears which [her]3522-a comely young girl of about eighteen suckling a baby eyes rained down upon it ; and always the foolish little thing smiled up at [her]3522-a comely young girl of about eighteen suckling a baby , happy and content , kneading [her]3522-a comely young girl of about eighteen suckling a baby breast with its dimpled fat hand , which [she]3522-a comely young girl of about eighteen suckling a baby patted and fondled right over [her]3522-a comely young girl of about eighteen suckling a baby breaking heart . [Men]508-men and [women]532-women , [boys]1338-boys and [girls]475-girls , trotted along beside or after [the cart]3527-the cart , hooting , shouting profane and ribald remarks , singing snatches of foul song , skipping , dancing -- a very holiday of hellions , a sickening sight . [We]3494-we had struck [a suburb of [London]16-london]3528-a suburb of london , outside the walls , and this was a sample of one sort of [London]16-london society . [[Our]3494-we master]3503-our master secured [a good place for [us]3494-we near [the gallows]3531-the gallows]3530-a good place for us near the gallows . [A priest]4649-a priest was in attendance , and [he]4649-a priest helped [the girl]1272-the girl climb up , and said comforting words to [her]1272-the girl , and made [the under - sheriff]3534-the under - sheriff provide a stool for [her]1272-the girl . Then [he]4649-a priest stood there by [her]1272-the girl on the gallows , and for a moment looked down upon the mass of upturned faces at [his]4649-a priest feet , then out over the solid pavement of heads that stretched away on every side occupying the vacancies far and near , and then began to tell the story of the case . And there was pity in [his]4649-a priest voice --how seldom a sound that was in [that ignorant and savage land]3535-that ignorant and savage land ! [I]0-i remember every detail of what [he]4649-a priest said , except the words [he]4649-a priest said it in ; and so [I]0-i change it into [my]0-i own words : “ Law is intended to mete out justice . Sometimes it fails . This can not be helped . [We]3494-we can only grieve , and be resigned , and pray for the soul of [him]4649-a priest who falls unfairly by the arm of the law , and that [[his]4649-a priest fellows]583-his fellows may be few . A law sends [this poor young thing]6415-this poor young thing to death -- and it is right . But another law had placed [her]1272-the girl where [she]1272-the girl must commit [her]1272-the girl crime or starve with [[her]1272-the girl child]6096-her child -- and before [God]121-god that law is responsible for both [her]1272-the girl crime and [her]1272-the girl ignominious death ! “[4649-a priest] A little while ago [this young thing]3536-this young thing , [this child of eighteen years]3537-this child of eighteen years , was as happy [a wife]2089-a wife and [mother]6116-mother as any in [England]1-england ; and [her]3536-this young thing lips were blithe with song , which is the native speech of glad and innocent hearts . [[Her]3536-this young thing young husband]3540-her young husband was as happy as [she]3536-this young thing ; for [he]3540-her young husband was doing [his]3540-her young husband whole duty , [he]3540-her young husband worked early and late at [his]3540-her young husband handicraft , [his]3540-her young husband bread was honest bread well and fairly earned , [he]3540-her young husband was prospering , [he]3540-her young husband was furnishing shelter and sustenance to [[his]3540-her young husband family]1966-his family , [he]3540-her young husband was adding [his]3540-her young husband mite to the wealth of [the nation]709-the nation . By consent of a treacherous law , instant destruction fell upon [this holy home]3543-this holy home and swept it away ! [That young husband]3544-that young husband was waylaid and impressed , and sent to [sea]1326-sea . [The wife]5024-the wife knew nothing of it . [She]5024-the wife sought [him]3544-that young husband everywhere , [she]5024-the wife moved the hardest hearts with the supplications of [her]5024-the wife tears , the broken eloquence of [her]5024-the wife despair . Weeks dragged by , [she]5024-the wife watching , waiting , hoping , [her]5024-the wife mind going slowly to wreck under the burden of [her]5024-the wife misery . Little by little all [her]5024-the wife small possessions went for food . When [she]5024-the wife could no longer pay [her]5024-the wife rent , [they]3547-they turned [her]5024-the wife out of doors . [She]5024-the wife begged , while [she]5024-the wife had strength ; when [she]5024-the wife was starving at last , and [her]5024-the wife milk failing , [she]5024-the wife stole a piece of linen cloth of the value of a fourth part of a cent , thinking to sell it and save [[her]5024-the wife child]6096-her child . But [she]5024-the wife was seen by [the owner of the cloth]3549-the owner of the cloth . [She]5024-the wife was put in [jail]3550-jail and brought to trial . [The man]536-the man testified to the facts . A plea was made for [her]5024-the wife , and [her]5024-the wife sorrowful story was told in [her]5024-the wife behalf . [She]5024-the wife spoke , too , by permission , and said [she]5024-the wife did steal the cloth , but that [her]5024-the wife mind was so disordered of late by trouble that when [she]5024-the wife was overborne with hunger all acts , criminal or other , swam meaningless through [her]5024-the wife brain and [she]5024-the wife knew nothing rightly , except that [she]5024-the wife was so hungry ! For a moment all were touched , and there was disposition to deal mercifully with [her]5024-the wife , seeing that [she]5024-the wife was so young and friendless , and [her]5024-the wife case so piteous , and the law that robbed [her]5024-the wife of [her]5024-the wife support to blame as being the first and only cause of [her]5024-the wife transgression ; but [the prosecuting officer]3552-the prosecuting officer replied that whereas these things were all true , and most pitiful as well , still there was much small theft in these days , and mistimed mercy here would be a danger to property -- oh , [[my]0-i God]6163-my god , is there no property in [ruined homes]3554-ruined homes , and [orphaned babes]3555-orphaned babes , and broken hearts that British law holds precious!--and so [he]3552-the prosecuting officer must require sentence . “ When [the judge]6417-the judge put on [his]6417-the judge black cap , [the owner of the stolen linen]6418-the owner of the stolen linen rose trembling up , [his]6418-the owner of the stolen linen lip quivering , [his]6418-the owner of the stolen linen face as gray as ashes ; and when the awful words came , [he]6418-the owner of the stolen linen cried out , ' Oh , [poor child]1729-poor child , [poor child]1729-poor child , [I]3556-i did not know it was death ! ' and fell as a tree falls . When [they]6421-they lifted [him]6418-the owner of the stolen linen up [his]6418-the owner of the stolen linen reason was gone ; before the sun was set , [he]6418-the owner of the stolen linen had taken [his]6418-the owner of the stolen linen own life . [A kindly man]6422-a kindly man ; [a man whose heart was right , at bottom]6423-a man whose heart was right , at bottom ; add [his]6418-the owner of the stolen linen murder to this that is to be now done here ; and charge [them]6421-they both where [they]6421-they belong --to [the rulers]6424-the rulers and the bitter laws of [Britain]32-britain . The time is come , [[my]3556-i child]2205-my child ; let [me]3556-i pray over [thee]2205-my child -- not _ for _ [thee]2205-my child , dear abused poor heart and innocent , but for [them]6421-they that be guilty of [thy]2205-my child ruin and death , who need it more . ”[3556-i] After [his]3556-i prayer [they]3557-they put the noose around [the young girl]3558-the young girl 's neck , and [they]3557-they had great trouble to adjust the knot under [her]3558-the young girl ear , because [she]3558-the young girl was devouring [the baby]1891-the baby all the time , wildly kissing it , and snatching it to [her]3558-the young girl face and [her]3558-the young girl breast , and drenching it with tears , and half moaning , half shrieking all the while , and [the baby]1891-the baby crowing , and laughing , and kicking [its]1891-the baby feet with delight over what it took for romp and play . Even [the hangman]3561-the hangman could n't stand it , but turned away . When all was ready [the priest]739-the priest gently pulled and tugged and forced [the child]5150-the child out of [the mother]6100-the mother 's arms , and stepped quickly out of [her]3558-the young girl reach ; but [she]3558-the young girl clasped [her]3558-the young girl hands , and made a wild spring toward [him]3556-i , with a shriek ; but the rope -- and [the under - sheriff]3534-the under - sheriff -- held [her]3558-the young girl short . Then [she]3558-the young girl went on [her]3558-the young girl knees and stretched out [her]3558-the young girl hands and cried : “ One more kiss -- oh , [my]3558-the young girl God , one more , one more,--it is [the dying that begs it]6426-the dying that begs it ! ”[3558-the young girl] [She]3558-the young girl got it ; [she]3558-the young girl almost smothered the little thing . And when [they]3566-they got it away again , [she]3558-the young girl cried out : “ Oh , [[my]3558-the young girl child]2205-my child , [[my]3558-the young girl darling]5918-my darling , it will die ! [It]6429-it has [no home]6430-no home , it has [no father]6431-no father , [no friend]6432-no friend , [no mother--]6433-no mother-- ”[3558-the young girl] “ It has [them]6434-them all ! ”[3567-that good priest] said [that good priest]3567-that good priest . “ All these will [I]3558-the young girl be to it till [I]3558-the young girl die . ”[3558-the young girl] [You]3568-you should have seen [her]3558-the young girl face then ! Gratitude ? [Lord]3569-lord , what do [you]3568-you want with words to express that ? Words are only painted fire ; a look is the fire itself . [She]3558-the young girl gave that look , and carried it away to [the treasury of [heaven]4564-heaven]3570-the treasury of heaven , where all things that are divine belong . CHAPTER XXXVI AN ENCOUNTER IN [THE DARK [London]16-london]3572-the dark london -- to [a slave]910-a slave -- was [a sufficiently interesting place]3574-a sufficiently interesting place . [It]16-london was merely [a great big village]3575-a great big village ; and [mainly mud and thatch]3576-mainly mud and thatch . [The streets]484-the streets were muddy , crooked , unpaved . [The populace]5420-the populace was [an ever flocking and drifting swarm of rags , and splendors , of nodding plumes and shining armor]3579-an ever flocking and drifting swarm of rags , and splendors , of nodding plumes and shining armor . [The king]4445-the king had [a palace]1678-a palace [there]4491-there ; [he]4445-the king saw the outside of [it]1678-a palace . It made [him]4445-the king sigh ; yes , and swear a little , in a poor juvenile sixth century way . [We]3583-we saw [knights]412-knights and grandees whom [we]3583-we knew , but [they]3585-they did n't know [us]3583-we in [our]3583-we rags and dirt and raw welts and bruises , and would n't have recognized [us]3583-we if [we]3583-we had hailed [them]3585-they , nor stopped to answer , either , it being unlawful to speak with [slaves on a chain]3586-slaves on a chain . [Sandy]199-sandy passed within ten yards of [me]0-i on a mule -- hunting for [me]0-i , [I]0-i imagined . But the thing which clean broke [my]0-i heart was something which happened in front of [[our]3583-we old barrack]3587-our old barrack in [a square]3588-a square , while [we]3583-we were enduring the spectacle of [a man]518-a man being boiled to death in oil for counterfeiting pennies . It was the sight of [a newsboy]3590-a newsboy -- and [I]0-i could n't get at [him]3590-a newsboy ! Still , [I]0-i had one comfort -- here was proof that [Clarence]131-clarence was still alive and banging away . [I]0-i meant to be with [him]131-clarence before long ; the thought was full of cheer . [I]0-i had one little glimpse of another thing , one day , which gave [me]0-i a great uplift . It was a wire stretching from [housetop]3591-housetop to [housetop]3591-housetop . Telegraph or telephone , sure . [I]0-i did very much wish [I]0-i had a little piece of it . It was just what [I]0-i needed , in order to carry out [my]0-i project of escape . [My]0-i idea was to get loose some night , along with [the king]4445-the king , then gag and bind [[our]3583-we master]3503-our master , change clothes with [him]3503-our master , batter [him]3503-our master into the aspect of [a stranger]798-a stranger , hitch [him]3503-our master to the slave - chain , assume possession of [the property]3420-the property , march to [Camelot]7-camelot , and-- But [you]3597-you get [my]0-i idea ; [you]3597-you see what a stunning dramatic surprise [I]0-i would wind up with at [the palace]5896-the palace . It was all feasible , if [I]0-i could only get hold of a slender piece of iron which [I]0-i could shape into a lock - pick . [I]0-i could then undo the lumbering padlocks with which [our]3583-we chains were fastened , whenever [I]0-i might choose . But [I]0-i never had any luck ; no such thing ever happened to fall in [my]0-i way . However , [my]0-i chance came at last . [A gentleman who had come twice before to dicker for [me]0-i , without result , or indeed any approach to a result]3599-a gentleman who had come twice before to dicker for me , without result , or indeed any approach to a result , came again . [I]0-i was far from expecting ever to belong to [him]3599-a gentleman who had come twice before to dicker for me , without result , or indeed any approach to a result , for the price asked for [me]0-i from the time [I]0-i was first enslaved was exorbitant , and always provoked either anger or derision , yet [[my]0-i master]4439-my master stuck stubbornly to it -- twenty - two dollars . [He]4439-my master would n't bate a cent . [The king]4445-the king was greatly admired , because of [his]4445-the king grand physique , but [his]4445-the king kingly style was against [him]4445-the king , and [he]4445-the king was n't salable ; [nobody]476-nobody wanted that kind of [a slave]910-a slave . [I]0-i considered [myself]0-i safe from parting from [him]3599-a gentleman who had come twice before to dicker for me , without result , or indeed any approach to a result because of [my]0-i extravagant price . No , [I]0-i was not expecting to ever belong to [this gentleman whom [I]0-i have spoken of]3604-this gentleman whom i have spoken of , but [he]3599-a gentleman who had come twice before to dicker for me , without result , or indeed any approach to a result had something which [I]0-i expected would belong to [me]0-i eventually , if [he]3599-a gentleman who had come twice before to dicker for me , without result , or indeed any approach to a result would but visit [us]3605-us often enough . It was a steel thing with a long pin to it , with which [his]3599-a gentleman who had come twice before to dicker for me , without result , or indeed any approach to a result long cloth outside garment was fastened together in front . There were three of them . [He]3599-a gentleman who had come twice before to dicker for me , without result , or indeed any approach to a result had disappointed [me]0-i twice , because [he]3599-a gentleman who had come twice before to dicker for me , without result , or indeed any approach to a result did not come quite close enough to [me]0-i to make [my]0-i project entirely safe ; but this time [I]0-i succeeded ; [I]0-i captured the lower clasp of the three , and when [he]3599-a gentleman who had come twice before to dicker for me , without result , or indeed any approach to a result missed it [he]3599-a gentleman who had come twice before to dicker for me , without result , or indeed any approach to a result thought [he]3599-a gentleman who had come twice before to dicker for me , without result , or indeed any approach to a result had lost it on the way . [I]0-i had a chance to be glad about a minute , then straightway a chance to be sad again . For when the purchase was about to fail , as usual , [the master]5147-the master suddenly spoke up and said what would be worded thus --in modern English : “ [I]5147-the master 'll tell [you]0-i what [I]5147-the master 'll do . [I]5147-the master 'm tired supporting these two for no good . Give [me]5147-the master twenty - two dollars for this one , and [I]5147-the master 'll throw the other one in . ”[5147-the master] [The king]4445-the king could n't get [his]4445-the king breath , [he]4445-the king was in such a fury . [He]4445-the king began to choke and gag , and meantime [the master]5147-the master and [the gentleman]5170-the gentleman moved away discussing . “ An [ye]0-i will keep the offer open-- ”[5147-the master] “ ' Tis open till the morrow at this hour . ”[5170-the gentleman] “ Then [I]5170-the gentleman will answer [you]0-i at that time , ”[5170-the gentleman] said [the gentleman]5170-the gentleman , and disappeared , [the master]5147-the master following [him]5170-the gentleman . [I]0-i had a time of it to cool [the king]4445-the king down , but [I]0-i managed it . And so shall [I.]0-i To - night [we]6436-we shall both be free . ”[0-i] “ Ah ! How is that ? ”[0-i] “ With this thing which [I]0-i have stolen , [I]0-i will unlock these locks and cast off these chains to - night .
