That evening [we]3614-we waited patiently for [[our]3614-we fellow - slaves]3615-our fellow - slaves to get to sleep and signify it by the usual sign , for [you]3616-you must not take many chances on [those poor fellows]3617-those poor fellows if [you]3616-you can avoid it . It is best to keep [your]3616-you own secrets . No doubt [they]3617-those poor fellows fidgeted only about as usual , but it did n't seem so to [me]0-i . It seemed to [me]0-i that [they]3617-those poor fellows were going to be forever getting down to [their]3617-those poor fellows regular snoring . As the time dragged on [I]0-i got nervously afraid [we]3614-we should n't have enough of it left for [our]3614-we needs ; so [I]0-i made several premature attempts , and merely delayed things by it ; for [I]0-i could n't seem to touch a padlock , there in the dark , without starting a rattle out of it which interrupted [somebody]1383-somebody 's sleep and made [him]1383-somebody turn over and wake [some more of [the gang]3620-the gang]3619-some more of the gang . But finally [I]0-i did get [my]0-i last iron off , and was [a free man]4875-a free man once more . [I]0-i took a good breath of relief , and reached for [the king]4445-the king 's irons . Too late ! in comes [the master]5147-the master , with a light in one hand and [his]5147-the master heavy walking - staff in the other . [I]0-i snuggled close among the wallow of snorers , to conceal as nearly as possible that [I]0-i was naked of irons ; and [I]0-i kept a sharp lookout and prepared to spring for [[my]0-i man]3624-my man the moment [he]3624-my man should bend over [me]0-i . But [he]3624-my man did n't approach . [He]3624-my man stopped , gazed absently toward [our]3625-us dusky mass a minute , evidently thinking about something else ; then set down [his]3624-my man light , moved musingly toward the door , and before a body could imagine what [he]3624-my man was going to do , [he]3624-my man was out of the door and had closed it behind [him]3624-my man . “ Quick ! ”[4445-the king] said [the king]4445-the king . “ Fetch [him]3624-my man back ! ”[4445-the king] Of course , it was the thing to do , and [I]0-i was up and out in a moment . But , dear [me]0-i , there were no lamps in those days , and it was a dark night . But [I]0-i glimpsed a dim figure a few steps away . [I]0-i darted for it , threw [myself]0-i upon it , and then there was a state of things and lively ! [We]3625-us fought and scuffled and struggled , and drew [a crowd]5214-a crowd in no time . [They]3628-they took an immense interest in the fight and encouraged [us]3625-us all [they]3628-they could , and , in fact , could n't have been pleasanter or more cordial if it had been [their]3628-they own fight . Then a tremendous row broke out behind [us]3625-us , and as much as half of [[our]3625-us audience]3629-our audience left [us]3625-us , with a rush , to invest some sympathy in that . Lanterns began to swing in all directions ; it was [the watch gathering from far and near]3630-the watch gathering from far and near . Presently a halberd fell across [my]0-i back , as a reminder , and [I]0-i knew what it meant . [I]0-i was in [custody]3631-custody . So was [[my]0-i adversary]3632-my adversary . [We]3625-us were marched off toward [prison]377-prison , one on each side of [the watchman]3634-the watchman . Here was disaster , here was a fine scheme gone to sudden destruction ! [I]0-i tried to imagine what would happen when [the master]5147-the master should discover that it was [I]0-i who had been fighting [him]5147-the master ; and what would happen if [they]3628-they jailed [us]3625-us together in [the general apartment]3636-the general apartment for [brawlers]3637-brawlers and [petty law - breakers]3638-petty law - breakers , as was the custom ; and what might-- Just then [[my]0-i antagonist]3639-my antagonist turned [his]3639-my antagonist face around in [my]0-i direction , the freckled light from [the watchman]3634-the watchman 's tin lantern fell on it , and , by [George]158-george , [he]3639-my antagonist was [the wrong man]5002-the wrong man ! CHAPTER XXXVII AN AWFUL PREDICAMENT Sleep ? It was impossible . It would naturally have been impossible in [that noisome cavern of [a jail]3643-a jail]3642-that noisome cavern of a jail , with [[its]3642-that noisome cavern of a jail mangy crowd of [drunken , quarrelsome , and song - singing rapscallions]3645-drunken , quarrelsome , and song - singing rapscallions]3644-its mangy crowd of drunken , quarrelsome , and song - singing rapscallions . But the thing that made sleep all the more a thing not to be dreamed of , was [my]0-i racking impatience to get out of [this place]4515-this place and find out the whole size of what might have happened yonder in [the slave - quarters]3647-the slave - quarters in consequence of that intolerable miscarriage of [mine]0-i . It was a long night , but the morning got around at last . [I]0-i made a full and frank explanation to [the court]550-the court . [I]0-i said [I]0-i was [a slave]910-a slave , the property of [the great Earl Grip]300-grip , who had arrived just after dark at [the Tabard inn in [the village]811-the village on [the other side of [the water]4480-the water]3652-the other side of the water]3650-the tabard inn in the village on the other side of the water , and had stopped there over night , by compulsion , [he]300-grip being taken deadly sick with a strange and sudden disorder . [I]0-i had been ordered to cross to [the city]3654-the city in all haste and bring [the best physician]3655-the best physician ; [I]0-i was doing [my]0-i best ; naturally [I]0-i was running with all [my]0-i might ; the night was dark , [I]0-i ran against [this common person here]3656-this common person here , who seized [me]0-i by the throat and began to pummel [me]0-i , although [I]0-i told [him]3656-this common person here [my]0-i errand , and implored [him]3656-this common person here , for the sake of [the great earl]3657-the great earl [[my]0-i master]4439-my master 's mortal peril-- [The common person]3659-the common person interrupted and said it was a lie ; and was going to explain how [I]0-i rushed upon [him]3656-this common person here and attacked [him]3656-this common person here without a word-- “ Silence , [sirrah]6441-sirrah ! ”[0-i] from [the court]550-the court . “ Take [him]3656-this common person here hence and give [him]3656-this common person here a few stripes whereby to teach [him]3656-this common person here how to treat [the servant of [a nobleman]1606-a nobleman]6442-the servant of a nobleman after a different fashion another time . Go ! ”[0-i] Then [the court]550-the court begged [my]0-i pardon , and hoped [I]0-i would not fail to tell [[his]3656-this common person here lordship]2774-his lordship it was in no wise [the court]550-the court 's fault that this high - handed thing had happened . [I]0-i said [I]0-i would make it all right , and so took [my]0-i leave . Took it just in time , too ; [he]3656-this common person here was starting to ask [me]0-i why [I]0-i did n't fetch out these facts the moment [I]0-i was arrested . [I]0-i said [I]0-i would if [I]0-i had thought of it -- which was true --but that [I]0-i was so battered by [that man]1850-that man that all [my]0-i wit was knocked out of [me]0-i -- and so forth and so on , and got [myself]0-i away , still mumbling . [I]0-i did n't wait for breakfast . No grass grew under [my]0-i feet . [I]0-i was soon at [the slave quarters]3665-the slave quarters . Empty -- [everybody]600-everybody gone ! That is , [everybody]600-everybody except one body -- [the slave - master]3668-the slave - master 's . It lay there all battered to pulp ; and all about were the evidences of a terrific fight . [I]0-i fell to ciphering . In half an hour it would be nine o'clock . [Knights]412-knights and horses in heavy armor could n't travel very fast . These would make the best time [they]3694-they could , and now that the ground was in good condition , and no snow or mud , [they]3694-they would probably make a seven - mile gait ; [they]3694-they would have to change horses a couple of times ; [they]3694-they would arrive about six , or a little after ; it would still be plenty light enough ; [they]3694-they would see the white cloth which [I]0-i should tie around [my]0-i right arm , and [I]0-i would take command . But [I]0-i must proceed cautiously , for it was a risky business . [I]0-i must get into sumptuous raiment , and it would n't do to run and jump into it . So [I]0-i started . But the scheme fell through like scat ! The first corner [I]0-i turned , [I]0-i came plump upon [one of [[our]3695-our slaves]3704-our slaves]3703-one of our slaves , snooping around with [a watchman]3705-a watchman . [I]0-i turned immediately into [a shop]3706-a shop and worked along down the counter , pricing things and watching out of the corner of [my]0-i eye . [She]3711-my pard was blazing with eagerness to see [one of [those already celebrated murderers]3716-those already celebrated murderers]3715-one of those already celebrated murderers , and [she]3711-my pard started on the errand at once . [I]0-i slipped out the back way , locked the door behind [me]0-i , put the key in [my]0-i pocket and started off , chuckling to [myself]0-i and comfortable . Well , [I]0-i had gone and spoiled it again , made another mistake . A double one , in fact . There were plenty of ways to get rid of [that officer]3717-that officer by some simple and plausible device , but no , [I]0-i must pick out a picturesque one ; it is the crying defect of [my]0-i character . And then , [I]0-i had ordered [my]0-i procedure upon what [the officer]3718-the officer , being human , would _ naturally _ do ; whereas when [you]3719-you are least expecting it , [a man]518-a man will now and then go and do the very thing which it 's _ not _ natural for [him]518-a man to do . The natural thing for [the officer]3718-the officer to do , in this case , was to follow straight on [my]0-i heels ; [he]3718-the officer would find a stout oaken door , securely locked , between [him]3718-the officer and [me]0-i ; before [he]3718-the officer could break it down , [I]0-i should be far away and engaged in slipping into a succession of baffling disguises which would soon get [me]0-i into a sort of raiment which was a surer protection from meddling law - dogs in [Britain]32-britain than any amount of mere innocence and purity of character . But instead of doing the natural thing , [the officer]3718-the officer took [me]0-i at [my]0-i word , and followed [my]0-i instructions . And so , as [I]0-i came trotting out of [that cul de sac]3723-that cul de sac , full of satisfaction with [my]0-i own cleverness , [he]3718-the officer turned the corner and [I]0-i walked right into [his]3718-the officer handcuffs . Well , [the missing slave]3741-the missing slave was found . CHAPTER XXXVIII [SIR LAUNCELOT]122-sir launcelot AND [KNIGHTS]305-knights TO THE RESCUE Nearing four in the afternoon . The scene was just outside [the walls of [London]16-london]3743-the walls of london . A cool , comfortable , superb day , with a brilliant sun ; the kind of day to make [one want to live]3744-one want to live , not die . The multitude was prodigious and far - reaching ; and yet [we]3745-we fifteen [poor devils]3746-poor devils had n't [a friend]2057-a friend in it . There was something painful in that thought , look at it how [you]3748-you might . There [we]3745-we sat , on [our]3745-we tall scaffold , the butt of the hate and mockery of [all those enemies]3749-all those enemies . [We]3745-we were being made a holiday spectacle . [We]3745-we recognized [a good many of [them]3749-all those enemies]3753-a good many of them . [The crowd]2064-the crowd got a brief and unexpected dash of diversion out of [the king]4445-the king . [You]3813-your may want to make a note of that . Up to the day set , there was no talk in all [Britain]32-britain of anything but this combat . All other topics sank into insignificance and passed out of [men]508-men 's thoughts and interest . It was not because a tournament was a great matter , it was not because [Sir Sagramor]117-sir sagramor had found the Holy Grail , for [he]117-sir sagramor had not , but had failed ; it was not because [the second ( official ) personage in [the kingdom]517-the kingdom]3818-the second ( official ) personage in the kingdom was one of [the duellists]3820-the duellists ; no , all these features were commonplace . Yet there was abundant reason for the extraordinary interest which this coming fight was creating . It was born of the fact that all [the nation]709-the nation knew that this was not to be a duel between [mere men]3822-mere men , so to speak , but a duel between [two mighty magicians]3823-two mighty magicians ; a duel not of muscle but of mind , not of human skill but of superhuman art and craft ; a final struggle for supremacy between [the two master enchanters of the age]3824-the two master enchanters of the age . It was realized that the most prodigious achievements of [the most renowned knights]3825-the most renowned knights could not be worthy of comparison with a spectacle like this ; [they]3826-they could be but [child]4640-child 's play , contrasted with this mysterious and awful battle of the gods . Yes , all [the world]374-the world knew it was going to be in reality a duel between [Merlin]245-merlin and [me]0-i , a measuring of [his]117-sir sagramor magic powers against [mine]0-i . It was known that [Merlin]245-merlin had been busy whole days and nights together , imbuing [Sir Sagramor]117-sir sagramor 's arms and armor with supernal powers of offense and defense , and that [he]117-sir sagramor had procured for [him]117-sir sagramor from the spirits of the air a fleecy veil which would render [the wearer]3829-the wearer invisible to [[his]117-sir sagramor antagonist]3830-his antagonist while still visible to [other men]2853-other men . Against [Sir Sagramor]117-sir sagramor , so weaponed and protected , [a thousand knights]3832-a thousand knights could accomplish nothing ; against [him]117-sir sagramor no known enchantments could prevail . These facts were sure ; regarding [them]3833-them there was no doubt , no reason for doubt . There was but one question : might there be still other enchantments , _ unknown _ to [Merlin]245-merlin , which could render [Sir Sagramor]117-sir sagramor 's veil transparent to [me]0-i , and make [his]117-sir sagramor enchanted mail vulnerable to [my]0-i weapons ? This was the one thing to be decided in the lists . Until then [the world]374-the world must remain in suspense . So [the world]374-the world thought there was a vast matter at stake here , and [the world]374-the world was right , but it was not the one [they]374-the world had in [their]374-the world minds . No , a far vaster one was upon the cast of this die : _ the life of [knight - errantry]3837-knight - errantry _ . [I]0-i was [a champion]3838-a champion , it was true , but not [the champion of the frivolous black arts]3839-the champion of the frivolous black arts , [I]0-i was [the champion of hard unsentimental common - sense and reason]3840-the champion of hard unsentimental common - sense and reason . [I]0-i was entering the lists to either destroy [knight - errantry]3837-knight - errantry or be its victim . [All the multitude]3863-all the multitude caught [their]3863-all the multitude breath , and an eager curiosity flashed into every face . Out from [[his]117-sir sagramor tent]3864-his tent rode [great Sir Sagramor]117-sir sagramor , an imposing tower of iron , stately and rigid , [his]117-sir sagramor huge spear standing upright in its socket and grasped in [his]117-sir sagramor strong hand , [his]117-sir sagramor grand horse 's face and breast cased in steel , [his]117-sir sagramor body clothed in rich trappings that almost dragged the ground -- oh , a most noble picture . There was a wondering and eloquent silence for a moment , then a great wave of laughter began to sweep along [that human sea]3865-that human sea , but a warning bugle - blast cut its career short . [I]0-i was in the simplest and comfortablest of gymnast costumes -- flesh - colored tights from neck to heel , with blue silk puffings about [my]0-i loins , and bareheaded . [My]0-i horse was not above medium size , but [he]117-sir sagramor was alert , slender - limbed , muscled with watchsprings , and just a greyhound to go . [He]117-sir sagramor was [a beauty]3866-a beauty , glossy as silk , and naked as [he]117-sir sagramor was when [he]117-sir sagramor was born , except for bridle and ranger - saddle . A chorus of encouraging shouts burst out for [him]117-sir sagramor , and one brave voice flung out a heartening word for [me]0-i -- said : “ Go it , [slim Jim]310-slim jim ! ”[131-clarence] It was an even bet that [Clarence]131-clarence had procured that favor for [me]0-i --and furnished the language , too . When that formidable lance - point was within a yard and a half of [my]0-i breast [I]0-i twitched [my]0-i horse aside without an effort , and [the big knight]3879-the big knight swept by , scoring a blank . [I]0-i got plenty of applause that time . [We]3880-we turned , braced up , and down [we]3880-we came again . Another blank for [the knight]398-the knight , a roar of applause for [me]0-i . This same thing was repeated once more ; and it fetched such a whirlwind of applause that [Sir Sagramor]117-sir sagramor lost [his]117-sir sagramor temper , and at once changed [his]117-sir sagramor tactics and set [himself]117-sir sagramor the task of chasing [me]0-i down . Why , [he]117-sir sagramor had n't any show in [the world]374-the world at that ; it was a game of tag , with all the advantage on [my]0-i side ; [I]0-i whirled out of [his]117-sir sagramor path with ease whenever [I]0-i chose , and once [I]0-i slapped [him]117-sir sagramor on the back as [I]0-i went to the rear . Finally [I]0-i took the chase into [my]0-i own hands ; and after that , turn , or twist , or do what [he]117-sir sagramor would , [he]117-sir sagramor was never able to get behind [me]0-i again ; [he]117-sir sagramor found [himself]117-sir sagramor always in front at the end of [his]117-sir sagramor maneuver . So [he]117-sir sagramor gave up that business and retired to [his]117-sir sagramor end of the lists . [His]117-sir sagramor temper was clear gone now , and [he]117-sir sagramor forgot [himself]117-sir sagramor and flung an insult at [me]0-i which disposed of [mine]0-i . [I]0-i slipped [my]0-i lasso from the horn of [my]0-i saddle , and grasped the coil in [my]0-i right hand . This time [you]3883-you should have seen [him]117-sir sagramor come!--it was a business trip , sure ; by [his]117-sir sagramor gait there was blood in [his]117-sir sagramor eye . [I]0-i was sitting [my]0-i horse at ease , and swinging the great loop of [my]0-i lasso in wide circles about [my]0-i head ; the moment [he]117-sir sagramor was under way , [I]0-i started for [him]117-sir sagramor ; when the space between [us]3884-us had narrowed to forty feet , [I]0-i sent the snaky spirals of the rope a - cleaving through the air , then darted aside and faced about and brought [my]0-i trained animal to a halt with all [his]117-sir sagramor feet braced under [him]117-sir sagramor for a surge . The next moment the rope sprang taut and yanked [Sir Sagramor]117-sir sagramor out of the saddle ! [Great Scott]196-great scott , but there was a sensation ! Unquestionably , the popular thing in [this world]352-this world is novelty . [These people]551-these people had never seen anything of that cowboy business before , and it carried [them]551-these people clear off [their]551-these people feet with delight . From all around and everywhere , the shout went up : “ Encore ! encore ! ”[0-i] [I]0-i wondered where [they]551-these people got the word , but there was no time to cipher on philological matters , because [the whole knight - errantry hive]3887-the whole knight - errantry hive was just humming now , and [my]0-i prospect for trade could n't have been better . CHAPTER XL THREE YEARS LATER When [I]0-i broke the back of [knight - errantry]3837-knight - errantry that time , [I]0-i no longer felt obliged to work in secret . That is to say , [I]0-i exposed the nineteenth century to the inspection of the sixth . Well , it is always a good plan to follow up an advantage promptly . [The knights]1587-the knights were temporarily down , but if [I]0-i would keep [them]1587-the knights so [I]0-i must just simply paralyze [them]1587-the knights -- nothing short of that would answer . [You]3953-you see , [I]0-i was “ bluffing ”[3953-you] that last time in [the field]1674-the field ; it would be natural for [them]1587-the knights to work around to that conclusion , if [I]0-i gave [them]1587-the knights a chance . So [I]0-i must not give [them]1587-the knights time ; and [I]0-i did n't . [I]0-i renewed [my]0-i challenge , engraved it on brass , posted it up where [any priest]3955-any priest could read it to [them]1587-the knights , and also kept it standing in the advertising columns of the paper . [I]0-i not only renewed it , but added to its proportions . [I]0-i said , name the day , and [I]0-i would take [fifty assistants]3956-fifty assistants and stand up _ against the massed chivalry of [the whole earth]3957-the whole earth and destroy it _ . [I]0-i was not bluffing this time . [I]0-i meant what [I]0-i said ; [I]0-i could do what [I]0-i promised . There was n't any way to misunderstand the language of that challenge . [Even the dullest of the chivalry]3958-even the dullest of the chivalry perceived that this was [a plain case of “ put up , or shut up]6528-a plain case of “ put up , or shut up . ”[3958-even the dullest of the chivalry] [They]3958-even the dullest of the chivalry were wise and did the latter . [A happy and prosperous country]3959-a happy and prosperous country , and strangely altered . [They]3983-they went clothed in steel and equipped with sword and lance and battle - axe , and if [they]3983-they could n't persuade [a person]966-a person to try a sewing - machine on the installment plan , or a melodeon , or a barbed - wire fence , or a prohibition journal , or any of the other thousand and one things [they]3983-they canvassed for , [they]3983-they removed [him]966-a person and passed on . [I]0-i was very happy . Things were working steadily toward a secretly longed - for point . [You]3993-you see , [I]0-i had two schemes in [my]0-i head which were the vastest of all [my]0-i projects . The one was to overthrow [the Catholic Church]3994-the catholic church and set up the Protestant faith on [its]3994-the catholic church ruins --not as an [Established Church]40-the established church , but a go - as - [you]3993-you - please one ; and the other project was to get a decree issued by and by , commanding that upon [Arthur]116-arthur 's death unlimited suffrage should be introduced , and given to [men]508-men and [women]532-women alike -- at any rate to [all men]2102-all men , wise or unwise , and to [all mothers who at middle age]3998-all mothers who at middle age should be found to know nearly as much as [[their]3998-all mothers who at middle age sons]3999-their sons at twenty - one . [Arthur]116-arthur was good for thirty years yet , [he]116-arthur being about [my]0-i own age -- that is to say , forty -- and [I]0-i believed that in that time [I]0-i could easily have the active part of [the population of that day]4000-the population of that day ready and eager for an event which should be the first of its kind in the history of [the world]374-the world -- a rounded and complete governmental revolution without bloodshed . The result to be a republic . Well , [I]0-i may as well confess , though [I]0-i do feel ashamed when [I]0-i think of it : [I]0-i was beginning to have a base hankering to be [its first president [myself]0-i]4002-its first president myself . Yes , there was more or less human nature in [me]0-i ; [I]0-i found that out . [Clarence]131-clarence was with [me]0-i as concerned the revolution , but in a modified way . [His]131-clarence idea was [a republic]5630-a republic , without privileged orders , but with [a hereditary royal family]4004-a hereditary royal family at the head of [it]5630-a republic instead of [an elective chief magistrate]4005-an elective chief magistrate . [He]131-clarence believed that [no nation that had ever known the joy of worshiping [a royal family]4007-a royal family]4006-no nation that had ever known the joy of worshiping a royal family could ever be robbed of it and not fade away and die of melancholy . [I]0-i urged that [kings]339-kings were dangerous . [He]131-clarence said , then have cats . [He]131-clarence was sure that [a royal family of cats]4009-a royal family of cats would answer every purpose . [They]4009-a royal family of cats would be as useful as [any other royal family]4010-any other royal family , [they]4009-a royal family of cats would know as much , [they]4009-a royal family of cats would have the same virtues and the same treacheries , the same disposition to get up shindies with other royal cats , [they]4009-a royal family of cats would be laughably vain and absurd and never know it , [they]4009-a royal family of cats would be wholly inexpensive ; finally , [they]4009-a royal family of cats would have as sound a divine right as [any other royal house]4011-any other royal house , and “ [Tom VII]312-tom vii , or [Tom XI]313-tom xi , or [Tom XIV]314-tom xiv by the grace of [God King]121-god , ”[131-clarence] would sound as well as it would when applied to the ordinary royal tomcat with tights on . “ And as a rule , ”[131-clarence] said [he]131-clarence , in [his]131-clarence neat modern English , “ the character of these cats would be considerably above the character of [the average king]6529-the average king , and this would be an immense moral advantage to [the nation]709-the nation , for the reason that [a nation]341-a nation always models [its]341-a nation morals after [[its]341-a nation monarch]6532-its monarch 's . The worship of [royalty]6533-royalty being founded in unreason , these graceful and harmless cats would easily become as sacred as any other royalties , and indeed more so , because it would presently be noticed that [they]4009-a royal family of cats hanged [nobody]476-nobody , beheaded [nobody]476-nobody , imprisoned [nobody]476-nobody , inflicted no cruelties or injustices of any sort , and so must be worthy of a deeper love and reverence than [the customary human king]6537-the customary human king , and would certainly get it . The eyes of [the whole harried world]6538-the whole harried world would soon be fixed upon this humane and gentle system , and [royal butchers]6539-royal butchers would presently begin to disappear ; [[their]6539-royal butchers subjects]6540-their subjects would fill the vacancies with catlings from [[our]6541-we own royal house]6542-our own royal house ; [we]6541-we should become [a factory]883-a factory ; [we]6541-we should supply the thrones of [the world]374-the world ; within forty years all [Europe]82-europe would be governed by cats , and [we]6541-we should furnish the cats . The reign of universal peace would begin then , to end no more forever .... This experiment was baseball . In order to give the thing vogue from the start , and place it out of the reach of criticism , [I]0-i chose [my]0-i nines by rank , not capacity . CHAPTER XLI THE INTERDICT However , [my]0-i attention was suddenly snatched from such matters ; [[our]4093-we child]4094-our child began to lose ground again , and [we]4093-we had to go to sitting up with [her]4094-our child , [her]4094-our child case became so serious . [She]4094-our child was [a flawless wife]4096-a flawless wife and [mother]6116-mother ; and yet [I]0-i had married [her]4094-our child for no other particular reasons , except that by the customs of chivalry [she]4094-our child was [[my]0-i property]4098-my property until [some knight]4099-some knight should win [her]4094-our child from [me]0-i in the field . [People]357-people talk about beautiful friendships between [two persons of the same sex]4105-two persons of the same sex . What is the best of that sort , as compared with the friendship of [man]4450-man and [wife]2084-wife , where the best impulses and highest ideals of both are the same ? There is no place for comparison between the two friendships ; the one is earthly , the other divine . [She]199-sandy never found out [her]199-sandy mistake . [I]0-i approached [England]1-england the next morning , with [the wide highway of salt water]4140-the wide highway of salt water all to [myself]0-i . [One of [[my]0-i servants]3859-my servants]4156-one of my servants gave [me]0-i a suit of clothes , and when [we]4158-we were safe beyond [the town]467-the town [I]0-i put them on , and from that time [I]0-i traveled alone ; [I]0-i could not risk the embarrassment of company . A miserable journey . A desolate silence everywhere . Even in [London]16-london itself . From being [the best electric - lighted town in [the kingdom]517-the kingdom]4167-the best electric - lighted town in the kingdom and [the most like a recumbent sun of anything [you]4170-you ever saw]4169-the most like a recumbent sun of anything you ever saw , [it]4171-it was become simply a blot -- a blot upon darkness -- that is to say , it was darker and solider than the rest of the darkness , and so [you]4170-you could see it a little better ; it made [me]0-i feel as if maybe it was symbolical -- a sort of sign that [the Church]900-the church was going to _ keep _ the upper hand now , and snuff out all [my]0-i beautiful civilization just like that . CHAPTER XLII WAR ! [I]0-i found [Clarence]131-clarence alone in [[his]131-clarence quarters]4177-his quarters , drowned in melancholy ; and in place of the electric light , [he]131-clarence had reinstituted the ancient rag - lamp , and sat there in a grisly twilight with all curtains drawn tight . [He]131-clarence sprang up and rushed for [me]0-i eagerly , saying : “ Oh , it 's worth a billion milrays to look upon [a live person]6552-a live person again ! ”[131-clarence] [He]131-clarence knew [me]0-i as easily as if [I]0-i had n't been disguised at all . [We]6699-we imagined [we]6699-we had educated it out of [them]544-the men ; [they]544-the men thought so , too ; the Interdict woke [them]544-the men up like a thunderclap ! It revealed [them]544-the men to [themselves]544-the men , and it revealed [them]544-the men to [me]131-clarence , too . With [boys]1338-boys it was different . Such as have been under [our]6699-we training from seven to ten years have had no acquaintance with [the Church]900-the church 's terrors , and it was among these that [I]131-clarence found [my]131-clarence fifty - two . As a next move , [I]131-clarence paid a private visit to [that old cave of [Merlin's]105-merlin's]6714-that old cave of merlin's -- not the small one -- the big one-- ”[131-clarence] “ Yes , the one where [we]6699-we secretly established [[our]6699-we first great electric plant]6715-our first great electric plant when [I]131-clarence was projecting a miracle . ”[131-clarence] “ Just so . And as that miracle had n't become necessary then , [I]131-clarence thought it might be a good idea to utilize [the plant]6716-the plant now . [I]131-clarence 've provisioned [the cave]6717-the cave for a siege-- ”[131-clarence] “ A good idea , a first - rate idea . ”[131-clarence] “ [I]131-clarence think so . [I]131-clarence placed four of [[my]131-clarence boys]5337-my boys there as [a guard]6719-a guard -- inside , and out of sight . [Nobody]476-nobody was to be hurt -- while outside ; but any attempt to enter -- well , [we]6699-we said just let [anybody]553-anybody try it ! Then [I]131-clarence went out into [the hills]4637-the hills and uncovered and cut the secret wires which connected [[your]6723-your bedroom]6724-your bedroom with the wires that go to the dynamite deposits under all [[our]6699-we vast factories]6725-our vast factories , [mills]6726-mills , [workshops]3951-workshops , magazines , etc . , and about midnight [I]131-clarence and [[my]131-clarence boys]5337-my boys turned out and connected that wire with [the cave]6717-the cave , and [nobody]476-nobody but [you]6723-your and [I]131-clarence suspects where the other end of it goes to . [We]6699-we laid it under ground , of course , and it was all finished in a couple of hours or so . [We]6699-we sha'n't have to leave [[our]6699-we fortress]6731-our fortress now when [we]6699-we want to blow up [our]6699-we civilization . ”[131-clarence] “ It was the right move -- and the natural one ; military necessity , in the changed condition of things . Well , what changes _ have _ come ! [We]6699-we expected to be besieged in [the palace]5896-the palace some time or other , but --however , go on . ”[131-clarence] “ Next , [we]6699-we built a wire fence . ”[131-clarence] “ Wire fence ? ”[131-clarence] “ Yes . [You]131-clarence dropped the hint of it [yourself]131-clarence , two or three years ago . ”[131-clarence] “ Oh , [I]131-clarence remember -- the time [the Church]18-the church tried [her]18-the church strength against [us]6699-we the first time , and presently thought it wise to wait for a hopefuler season . Well , how have [you]131-clarence arranged the fence ? ”[131-clarence] “ [I]131-clarence start twelve immensely strong wires -- naked , not insulated --from a big dynamo in [the cave]6717-the cave -- dynamo with no brushes except a positive and a negative one-- ”[131-clarence] “ Yes , that 's right . ”[131-clarence] “ The wires go out from [the cave]6717-the cave and fence in a circle of level ground a hundred yards in diameter ; they make twelve independent fences , ten feet apart -- that is to say , twelve circles within circles -- and their ends come into [the cave]6717-the cave again . ”[131-clarence] “ Right ; go on . ”[131-clarence] “ The fences are fastened to heavy oaken posts only three feet apart , and these posts are sunk five feet in the ground . ”[131-clarence] “ That is good and strong . ”[131-clarence] “ Yes . The wires have no ground - connection outside of [the cave]6717-the cave . [They]6737-they go out from the positive brush of the dynamo ; there is a ground - connection through the negative brush ; the other ends of the wire return to [the cave]6717-the cave , and each is grounded independently . ”[131-clarence] “ No , no , that wo n't do ! ”[131-clarence] “ Why ? ”[131-clarence] “ It 's too expensive -- uses up force for nothing . [You]131-clarence do n't want any ground - connection except the one through the negative brush . The other end of every wire must be brought back into [the cave]6717-the cave and fastened independently , and _ without _ any ground - connection . Now , then , observe the economy of it . A cavalry charge hurls itself against the fence ; [you]131-clarence are using no power , [you]131-clarence are spending no money , for there is only one ground - connection till those horses come against the wire ; the moment [they]6737-they touch it [they]6737-they form a connection with the negative brush _ through the ground _ , and drop dead . Do n't [you]131-clarence see?--you are using no energy until it is needed ; [your]131-clarence lightning is there , and ready , like the load in a gun ; but it is n't costing [you]131-clarence a cent till [you]131-clarence touch it off . Oh , yes , the single ground - connection-- ”[131-clarence] “ Of course ! [I]131-clarence do n't know how [I]131-clarence overlooked that . It 's not only cheaper , but it 's more effectual than the other way , for if wires break or get tangled , no harm is done . ”[131-clarence] “ No , especially if [we]6740-we have a tell - tale in [the cave]6717-the cave and disconnect the broken wire . Well , go on . The gatlings ? ”[131-clarence] “ Yes -- that 's arranged . In the center of the inner circle , on a spacious platform six feet high , [I]131-clarence 've grouped a battery of thirteen gatling guns , and provided plenty of ammunition . ”[131-clarence] “ That 's it . [They]6737-they command every approach , and when [the Church 's knights]6742-the church 's knights arrive , there 's going to be music . The brow of the precipice over the cave-- ”[131-clarence] “ [I]131-clarence 've got a wire fence there , and a gatling . [They]6737-they wo n't drop any rocks down on [us]6740-we . ”[131-clarence] “ Well , and the glass - cylinder dynamite torpedoes ? ”[131-clarence] “ That 's attended to . It 's [the prettiest garden that was ever planted]6743-the prettiest garden that was ever planted . [It]6743-the prettiest garden that was ever planted 's a belt forty feet wide , and goes around the outer fence -- distance between [it]6743-the prettiest garden that was ever planted and the fence one hundred yards -- kind of neutral ground that space is . There is n't [a single square yard of that whole belt]6744-a single square yard of that whole belt but is equipped with a torpedo . [We]6740-we laid them on the surface of the ground , and sprinkled a layer of sand over them . It 's [an innocent looking garden]6745-an innocent looking garden , but [you]131-clarence let [a man]518-a man start in to hoe it once , and [you]131-clarence 'll see . ”[131-clarence] “ [You]131-clarence tested the torpedoes ? ”[131-clarence] “ Well , [I]131-clarence was going to , but-- ”[131-clarence] “ But what ? Why , it 's an immense oversight not to apply a-- ”[131-clarence] “ Test ? Yes , [I]131-clarence know ; but [they]6737-they 're all right ; [I]131-clarence laid a few in [the public road]3279-the public road beyond [our]6740-we lines and [they]6737-they 've been tested . ”[131-clarence] “ Oh , that alters the case . Who did it ? ”[131-clarence] “ [A Church committee]6748-a church committee . ”[131-clarence] “ How kind ! ”[131-clarence] “ Yes . [You]131-clarence see [they]6748-a church committee did n't really come to test the torpedoes ; that was merely an incident . ”[131-clarence] “ Did [the committee]6749-the committee make a report ? ”[131-clarence] “ Yes , [they]6748-a church committee made one . [You]131-clarence could have heard it a mile . ”[131-clarence] “ Unanimous ? ”[131-clarence] “ That was the nature of it . After that [I]131-clarence put up some signs , for the protection of [future committees]6750-future committees , and [we]6740-we have had [no intruders]6751-no intruders since . ”[131-clarence] “ [Clarence]131-clarence , [you]131-clarence 've done a world of work , and done it perfectly . ”[131-clarence] “ [We]6740-we had plenty of time for it ; there was n't any occasion for hurry . ”[131-clarence] [We]4179-we sat silent awhile , thinking . Then [my]0-i mind was made up , and [I]0-i said : “ Yes , everything is ready ; everything is shipshape , no detail is wanting . [I]0-i know what to do now . ”[0-i] “ So do [I]131-clarence ; sit down and wait . ”[131-clarence] “ No , _ sir _ ! rise up and _ strike _ ! ”[131-clarence] “ Do [you]131-clarence mean it ? ”[131-clarence] “ Yes , indeed ! The _ de_fensive is n't in [my]131-clarence line , and the _ of_fensive is . That is , when [I]131-clarence hold a fair hand -- two - thirds as good a hand as [the enemy]3329-the enemy . Oh , yes , [we]6740-we 'll rise up and strike ; that 's [our]6740-we game . ”[131-clarence] “ A hundred to one [you]131-clarence are right . When does the performance begin ? ”[131-clarence] “ _ Now ! _ [We]6740-we 'll proclaim the Republic . ”[131-clarence] “ Well , that _ will _ precipitate things , sure enough ! ”[131-clarence] “ It will make [them]6753-them buzz , [I]131-clarence tell [you]131-clarence ! [England]1-england will be a hornets ' nest before noon to - morrow , if [the Church]900-the church 's hand has n't lost [its]1-england cunning -- and [we]6740-we know it has n't . Now [you]131-clarence write and [I]131-clarence 'll dictate thus : “[131-clarence] PROCLAMATION “ BE [IT]6755-it KNOWN UNTO ALL . Whereas [the king]4445-the king having died and left [no heir]6757-no heir , it becomes [my]0-i duty to continue the executive authority vested in [me]0-i , until a government shall have been created and set in motion . The monarchy has lapsed , it no longer exists . By consequence , all political power has reverted to its original source , [the people of [the nation]709-the nation]6758-the people of the nation . With the monarchy , [its several adjuncts]6760-its several adjuncts died also ; wherefore there is no longer [a nobility]6761-a nobility , no longer [a privileged class]5565-a privileged class , no longer [an Established Church]1510-an established church ; [all men]2102-all men are become exactly equal ; [they]2102-all men are upon one common level , and religion is free . _ [A Republic]5630-a republic is hereby proclaimed _ , as being [the natural estate of [a nation]341-a nation]6766-the natural estate of a nation when other authority has ceased . It is the duty of [the British people]6768-the british people to meet together immediately , and by [their]6768-the british people votes elect [representatives]6769-representatives and deliver into [their]6768-the british people hands [the government]864-the government . ”[0-i] [I]0-i signed it “ [The Boss]1014-the boss , ”[0-i] and dated it from [[Merlin]134-merlin 's Cave]4180-merlin 's cave . [Clarence]131-clarence said-- “ Why , that tells where [we]6772-we are , and invites [them]6773-them to call right away . ”[131-clarence] “ That is the idea . [We]6772-we _ strike_--by the Proclamation -- then it 's [their]6773-them innings . Now have the thing set up and printed and posted , right off ; that is , give the order ; then , if [you]6774-you 've got [a couple of bicycles]6775-a couple of bicycles handy at [the foot of [the hill]1334-the hill]6776-the foot of the hill , ho for [[Merlin]134-merlin 's Cave]4180-merlin 's cave ! ”[131-clarence] “ [I]131-clarence shall be ready in ten minutes . What a cyclone there is going to be to - morrow when this piece of paper gets to work ! ... [It]4180-merlin 's cave 's [a pleasant old palace]6779-a pleasant old palace , this is ; [I]131-clarence wonder if [we]4184-we shall ever again --but never mind about that . ”[131-clarence] CHAPTER XLIII [THE BATTLE OF THE SAND BELT]4181-the battle of the sand belt In [[Merlin]134-merlin 's Cave]106-merlin 's cave -- [Clarence]131-clarence and [I]0-i and [fifty - two fresh , bright , well - educated , clean - minded young British boys]4182-fifty - two fresh , bright , well - educated , clean - minded young british boys . At dawn [I]0-i sent an order to [the factories]4183-the factories and to all [our]4184-we great works to stop operations and remove all life to a safe distance , as everything was going to be blown up by secret mines , “ _ and no telling at what moment -- therefore , vacate at once _ . ”[551-these people] [These people]551-these people knew [me]0-i , and had confidence in [my]0-i word . [They]551-these people would clear out without waiting to part [their]551-these people hair , and [I]0-i could take [my]0-i own time about dating the explosion . [You]4186-you could n't hire one of [them]551-these people to go back during the century , if the explosion was still impending . [We]4184-we had a week of waiting . It was not dull for [me]0-i , because [I]0-i was writing all the time . During the first three days , [I]0-i finished turning [my]0-i old diary into this narrative form ; it only required a chapter or so to bring it down to date . The rest of the week [I]0-i took up in writing letters to [[my]0-i wife]4885-my wife . It was always [my]0-i habit to write to [Sandy]199-sandy every day , whenever [we]4184-we were separate , and now [I]0-i kept up the habit for love of it , and of [her]199-sandy , though [I]0-i could n't do anything with the letters , of course , after [I]0-i had written them . But it put in the time , [you]4186-you see , and was almost like talking ; it was almost as if [I]0-i was saying , “ [Sandy]199-sandy , if [you]199-sandy and [Hello - Central]212-central were here in [the cave]6717-the cave , instead of only [your]199-sandy photographs , what good times [we]6781-we could have ! ”[0-i] And then , [you]4186-you know , [I]0-i could imagine the baby goo - gooing something out in reply , with its fists in [its]4188-its mouth and itself stretched across [[its]4188-its mother]4981-its mother 's lap on [its]4188-its back , and [she]4981-its mother a - laughing and admiring and worshipping , and now and then tickling under [the baby]1891-the baby 's chin to set it cackling , and then maybe throwing in a word of answer to [me]0-i [herself]4981-its mother -- and so on and so on --well , do n't [you]4186-you know , [I]0-i could sit there in [the cave]6717-the cave with [my]0-i pen , and keep it up , that way , by the hour with [them]4192-them . Why , it was almost like having [us]4193-us all together again . [I]0-i had spies out every night , of course , to get news . Every report made things look more and more impressive . [The hosts]1771-the hosts were gathering , gathering ; down [all the roads and paths of [England]1-england]4195-all the roads and paths of england [the knights]1587-the knights were riding , and [priests]2086-priests rode with [them]1587-the knights , to hearten [these original Crusaders]4198-these original crusaders , this being the Church 's war . [All the nobilities]4199-all the nobilities , big and little , were on [their]4199-all the nobilities way , and [all the gentry]4200-all the gentry . This was all as was expected . [We]4193-us should thin out [this sort of folk]4201-this sort of folk to such a degree that [the people]753-the people would have nothing to do but just step to the front with [[their]753-the people republic]4203-their republic and-- Ah , what a donkey [I]0-i was ! Toward the end of the week [I]0-i began to get this large and disenchanting fact through [my]0-i head : that [the mass of [the nation]709-the nation]4204-the mass of the nation had swung [their]4204-the mass of the nation caps and shouted for [the republic]4206-the republic for about one day , and there an end ! [The Church]18-the church , [the nobles]949-the nobles , and [the gentry]4208-the gentry then turned one grand , all - disapproving frown upon [them]4204-the mass of the nation and shriveled [them]4204-the mass of the nation into sheep ! From that moment the sheep had begun to gather to the fold -- that is to say , [the camps]4209-the camps -- and offer [their]4204-the mass of the nation valueless lives and [their]4204-the mass of the nation valuable wool to the “ righteous cause . ”[4212-the “ righteous cause , ” and glorifying it] Why , even [the very men who had lately been [slaves]924-slaves]4210-the very men who had lately been slaves were in [the “ righteous cause , ”[4212-the “ righteous cause , ” and glorifying it] and glorifying it]4212-the “ righteous cause , ” and glorifying it , praying for it , sentimentally slabbering over it , just like [all the other commoners]4213-all the other commoners . Imagine such human muck as this ; conceive of this folly ! Yes , it was now “ Death to [the Republic]4206-the republic ! ”[4212-the “ righteous cause , ” and glorifying it] everywhere -- not a dissenting voice . All [England]1-england was marching against [us]4214-us ! Truly , this was more than [I]0-i had bargained for . [I]0-i watched [[my]0-i fifty - two boys]4215-my fifty - two boys narrowly ; watched [their]4215-my fifty - two boys faces , [their]4215-my fifty - two boys walk , [their]4215-my fifty - two boys unconscious attitudes : for all these are a language --a language given [us]4214-us purposely that it may betray [us]4214-us in times of emergency , when [we]4214-us have secrets which [we]4214-us want to keep . [I]0-i knew that that thought would keep saying itself over and over again in [their]4215-my fifty - two boys minds and hearts , _ [All England]4216-all england is marching against [us]4214-us ! _ and ever more strenuously imploring attention with each repetition , ever more sharply realizing itself to [their]4215-my fifty - two boys imaginations , until even in [their]4215-my fifty - two boys sleep [they]4215-my fifty - two boys would find no rest from it , but hear [the vague and flitting creatures of the dreams]4217-the vague and flitting creatures of the dreams say , _ All [England]1-england _ --ALL ENGLAND!--_is marching against [you]4218-you _ ! [I]0-i knew all this would happen ; [I]0-i knew that ultimately the pressure would become so great that it would compel utterance ; therefore , [I]0-i must be ready with an answer at that time -- an answer well chosen and tranquilizing . [I]0-i was right . The time came . [They]4215-my fifty - two boys HAD to speak . [Poor lads]6164-poor lads , it was pitiful to see , [they]6164-poor lads were so pale , so worn , so troubled . At first [[their]4215-my fifty - two boys spokesman]4220-their spokesman could hardly find voice or words ; but [he]4220-their spokesman presently got both . This is what [he]4220-their spokesman said -- and [he]4220-their spokesman put it in the neat modern English taught [him]4220-their spokesman in [[my]0-i schools]1194-my schools : “ [We]6783-we have tried to forget what [we]6783-we are -- [English boys]6784-english boys ! [We]6783-we have tried to put reason before sentiment , duty before love ; [our]6783-we minds approve , but [our]6783-we hearts reproach [us]6783-we . While apparently it was only [the nobility]1645-the nobility , only [the gentry]4208-the gentry , only [the twenty - five or thirty thousand knights left alive out of the late wars]6787-the twenty - five or thirty thousand knights left alive out of the late wars , [we]6783-we were of one mind , and undisturbed by any troubling doubt ; each and [every one of [these fifty - two lads who stand here before [you]6790-you]6789-these fifty - two lads who stand here before you]6788-every one of these fifty - two lads who stand here before you , said , ' [They]6789-these fifty - two lads who stand here before you have chosen -- it is [their]6789-these fifty - two lads who stand here before you affair . ' But think!--the matter is altered--_All [England]1-england is marching against [us]6783-we _ ! Oh , [sir]367-sir , consider ! --reflect!--these people are [[our]6783-we people]6792-our people , [they]6792-our people are bone of [our]6783-we bone , flesh of [our]6783-we flesh , [we]6783-we love [them]6792-our people -- do not ask [us]6783-we to destroy [[our]6783-we nation]6793-our nation ! ”[4220-their spokesman] Well , it shows the value of looking ahead , and being ready for a thing when it happens . If [I]0-i had n't foreseen this thing and been fixed , [that boy]4222-that boy would have had me!--I could n't have said a word . But [I]0-i was fixed . [I]0-i said : “ [[My]0-i boys]5337-my boys , [your]5337-my boys hearts are in the right place , [you]5337-my boys have thought the worthy thought , [you]5337-my boys have done the worthy thing . [You]5337-my boys are [English boys]6784-english boys , [you]5337-my boys will remain [English boys]6784-english boys , and [you]5337-my boys will keep that name unsmirched . Give [yourselves]5337-my boys no further concern , let [your]5337-my boys minds be at peace . Consider this : while all [England]1-england is marching against [us]6783-we , who is in [the van]3303-the van ? [Who , by the commonest rules of war]6798-who , by the commonest rules of war , will march in the front ? Answer [me]0-i . ”[0-i] “ [The mounted host of [mailed knights]6800-mailed knights]6799-the mounted host of mailed knights . ”[4222-that boy] “ True . [They]6799-the mounted host of mailed knights are [thirty thousand strong]6801-thirty thousand strong . [Acres deep]107-acres deep [they]6799-the mounted host of mailed knights will march . Now , observe : none but _ [they]6799-the mounted host of mailed knights _ will ever strike the sand - belt ! Then there will be an episode ! Immediately after , [the civilian multitude in the rear]6802-the civilian multitude in the rear will retire , to meet business engagements elsewhere . None but [nobles]953-nobles and [gentry]1437-gentry are [knights]412-knights , and _ [none but these _]6806-none but these _ will remain to dance to [our]6783-we music after that episode . It is absolutely true that [we]6783-we shall have to fight [nobody]476-nobody but [these thirty thousand knights]6808-these thirty thousand knights . Now speak , and it shall be as [you]6809-you decide . Shall [we]6783-we avoid the battle , retire from [the field]1674-the field ? ”[0-i] “ NO ! ! ! ”[0-i] The shout was unanimous and hearty . “ Are [you]1040-the boys -- are [you]1040-the boys -- well , afraid of [these thirty thousand knights]6808-these thirty thousand knights ? ”[0-i] That joke brought out a good laugh , [the boys]1040-the boys ' troubles vanished away , and [they]1040-the boys went gaily to [their]1040-the boys posts . Ah , [they]1040-the boys were [a darling fifty - two]4224-a darling fifty - two ! As pretty as [girls]475-girls , too . [I]0-i was ready for the enemy now . Let the approaching big day come along -- it would find [us]4226-we on [deck]5238-deck . The big day arrived on time . At dawn [the sentry on watch in the corral]4228-the sentry on watch in the corral came into [the cave]6717-the cave and reported a moving black mass under the horizon , and a faint sound which [he]4228-the sentry on watch in the corral thought to be military music . Breakfast was just ready ; [we]4226-we sat down and ate it . This over , [I]0-i made [the boys]1040-the boys a little speech , and then sent out a detail to man the battery , with [Clarence]131-clarence in command of it . The sun rose presently and sent its unobstructed splendors over [the land]4486-the land , and [we]4226-we saw a prodigious host moving slowly toward [us]4226-we , with the steady drift and aligned front of [a wave of [the sea]1047-the sea]4232-a wave of the sea . Nearer and nearer it came , and more and more sublimely imposing became its aspect ; yes , all [England]1-england was there , apparently . Soon [we]4226-we could see the innumerable banners fluttering , and then the sun struck the sea of armor and set it all aflash . Yes , it was a fine sight ; [I]0-i had n't ever seen anything to beat it . At last [we]4226-we could make out details . [All the front ranks]4234-all the front ranks , no telling how many acres deep , were [horsemen]4235-horsemen -- [plumed knights in armor]4236-plumed knights in armor . Suddenly [we]4226-we heard the blare of trumpets ; the slow walk burst into a gallop , and then -- well , it was wonderful to see ! Down swept that vast horse - shoe wave -- it approached [the sand - belt]4237-the sand - belt -- [my]0-i breath stood still ; nearer , nearer -- [the strip of green turf beyond the yellow belt]4238-the strip of green turf beyond the yellow belt grew narrow -- narrower still -- became a mere ribbon in front of the horses -- then disappeared under [their]4239-their hoofs . [Great Scott]196-great scott ! Why , the whole front of that host shot into the sky with a thunder - crash , and became a whirling tempest of rags and fragments ; and along the ground lay a thick wall of smoke that hid what was left of [the multitude]734-the multitude from [our]4226-we sight . Time for the second step in the plan of campaign ! [I]0-i touched a button , and shook the bones of [England]1-england loose from [her]1-england spine ! In that explosion all [our]4226-we noble civilization - [factories]4241-factories went up in the air and disappeared from [the earth]399-the earth . It was a pity , but it was necessary . [We]4226-we could not afford to let [the enemy]3329-the enemy turn [our]4226-we own weapons against [us]4226-we . Now ensued one of the dullest quarter - hours [I]0-i had ever endured . [We]4226-we waited in a silent solitude enclosed by [our]4226-we circles of wire , and by a circle of heavy smoke outside of these . [We]4226-we could n't see over the wall of smoke , and [we]4226-we could n't see through it . But at last it began to shred away lazily , and by the end of another quarter - hour [the land]4486-the land was clear and [our]4226-we curiosity was enabled to satisfy itself . [No living creature]4245-no living creature was in sight ! [We]4226-we now perceived that additions had been made to [our]4226-we defenses . The dynamite had dug a ditch more than a hundred feet wide , all around [us]4226-we , and cast up an embankment some twenty - five feet high on [both borders of [it]4247-it]4246-both borders of it . As to destruction of life , it was amazing . Moreover , it was beyond estimate . Of course , [we]4226-we could not _ count _ the dead , because [they]4248-they did not exist as [individuals]6525-individuals , but merely as homogeneous protoplasm , with alloys of iron and buttons . No life was in sight , but necessarily there must have been [some wounded in the rear ranks , who were carried off the field under cover of the wall of smoke]4250-some wounded in the rear ranks , who were carried off the field under cover of the wall of smoke ; there would be sickness among [the others]1524-the others -- there always is , after an episode like that . But there would be [no reinforcements]4252-no reinforcements ; this was the last stand of the chivalry of [England]1-england ; it was all that was left of [the order]4253-the order , after the recent annihilating wars . So [I]0-i felt quite safe in believing that the utmost force that could for the future be brought against [us]4226-we would be but small ; that is , of [knights]412-knights . [I]0-i therefore issued a congratulatory proclamation to [[my]0-i army]4255-my army in these words : [SOLDIERS]4256-soldiers , CHAMPIONS OF HUMAN LIBERTY AND EQUALITY : [[Your]4257-you General]4258-your general congratulates [you]4257-you ! In the pride of [his]4258-your general strength and the vanity of [his]4258-your general renown , [an arrogant enemy]4259-an arrogant enemy came against [you]4257-you . [You]4257-you were ready . The conflict was brief ; on [your]4257-you side , glorious . This mighty victory , having been achieved utterly without loss , stands without example in history . So long as [the planets]4260-the planets shall continue to move in [their]4260-the planets orbits , the _ Battle Of The Sand - Belt _ will not perish out of the memories of [men]508-men . [THE BOSS]1014-the boss . [I]0-i read it well , and the applause [I]0-i got was very gratifying to [me]0-i . [I]0-i then wound up with these remarks : “ The war with [the English nation]6812-the english nation , as [a nation]341-a nation , is at an end . [The nation]709-the nation has retired from [the field]1674-the field and the war . Before [it]709-the nation can be persuaded to return , war will have ceased . [This campaign]6816-this campaign is the only one that is going to be fought . It will be brief --the briefest in history . Also the most destructive to life , considered from the standpoint of proportion of casualties to [numbers engaged]6817-numbers engaged . [We]6818-we are done with [the nation]709-the nation ; henceforth [we]6818-we deal only with [the knights]1587-the knights . [English knights]6821-english knights can be killed , but [they]6821-english knights can not be conquered . [We]6818-we know what is before [us]6818-we . While [one of [these men]2820-these men]6822-one of these men remains alive , [our]6818-we task is not finished , the war is not ended . [We]6818-we will kill [them]2820-these men all . ”[0-i] [ Loud and long continued applause . ] [I]0-i picketed [the great embankments thrown up around [our]4264-our lines]4263-the great embankments thrown up around our lines by the dynamite explosion -- merely a lookout of [a couple of [boys]1338-boys]564-a couple of boys to announce [the enemy]3329-the enemy when [he]3329-the enemy should appear again . [The forty men]4272-the forty men were divided into [two shifts of twenty each]4273-two shifts of twenty each , and were to relieve [each other]1058-each other every two hours . In ten hours the work was accomplished . It was nightfall now , and [I]0-i withdrew [my]0-i pickets . [The one who had had [the northern outlook]4276-the northern outlook]4275-the one who had had the northern outlook reported a camp in sight , but visible with the glass only . [We]4283-we know [your]1587-the knights strength — if one may call it by that name . ( Signed ) [THE BOSS]231-the boss . [I]0-i read it to [Clarence]131-clarence , and said [I]0-i proposed to send it by a flag of truce . [He]131-clarence laughed the sarcastic laugh [he]131-clarence was born with , and said : “ Somehow it seems impossible for [you]0-i to ever fully realize what these nobilities are . And this was just fact , and nothing else . It was the thing that would have happened , there was no getting around that . [I]0-i tore up the paper and granted [my]0-i mistimed sentimentalities a permanent rest . Then , to business . [I]0-i tested the electric signals from the gatling platform to [the cave]6717-the cave , and made sure that they were all right ; [I]0-i tested and retested those which commanded the fences -- these were signals whereby [I]0-i could break and renew the electric current in each fence independently of the others at will . [I]0-i placed the brook - connection under the guard and authority of [three of [[my]0-i best boys]4296-my best boys , who would alternate in two - hour watches all night and promptly obey [my]0-i signal , if [I]0-i should have occasion to give it --three revolver - shots in quick succession]4295-three of my best boys , who would alternate in two - hour watches all night and promptly obey my signal , if i should have occasion to give it --three revolver - shots in quick succession . Sentry - duty was discarded for the night , and [the corral]4297-the corral left empty of life ; [I]0-i ordered that quiet be maintained in [the cave]6717-the cave , and the electric lights turned down to a glimmer . As soon as it was good and dark , [I]0-i shut off the current from all the fences , and then groped [my]0-i way out to the embankment bordering [[our]4299-our side of [the great dynamite ditch]4301-the great dynamite ditch]4300-our side of the great dynamite ditch . [I]0-i crept to the top of it and lay there on the slant of the muck to watch . But it was too dark to see anything . As for sounds , there were none . The stillness was deathlike . True , there were the usual night - sounds of [the country]420-the country -- the whir of night - birds , the buzzing of insects , the barking of distant dogs , the mellow lowing of far - off kine --but these did n't seem to break the stillness , they only intensified it , and added a grewsome melancholy to it into the bargain . [I]0-i presently gave up looking , the night shut down so black , but [I]0-i kept [my]0-i ears strained to catch the least suspicious sound , for [I]0-i judged [I]0-i had only to wait , and [I]0-i should n't be disappointed . However , [I]0-i had to wait a long time . At last [I]0-i caught what [you]4303-you may call indistinct glimpses of sound -- dulled metallic sound . [I]0-i pricked up [my]0-i ears , then , and held [my]0-i breath , for this was the sort of thing [I]0-i had been waiting for . This sound thickened , and approached -- from toward [the north]2993-the north . Presently , [I]0-i heard it at [my]0-i own level -- [the ridge - top of the opposite embankment]4305-the ridge - top of the opposite embankment , a hundred feet or more away . Then [I]0-i seemed to see a row of black dots appear along that ridge -- human heads ? [I]0-i could n't tell ; it might n't be anything at all ; [you]4303-you ca n't depend on [your]4303-you eyes when [your]4303-you imagination is out of focus . However , the question was soon settled . [I]0-i heard that metallic noise descending into [the great ditch]4306-the great ditch . It augmented fast , it spread all along , and it unmistakably furnished [me]0-i this fact : [an armed host]4307-an armed host was taking up its quarters in [the ditch]4308-the ditch . Yes , [these people]551-these people were arranging a little surprise party for [us]4310-we . [We]4310-we could expect entertainment about dawn , possibly earlier . [We]4310-we concluded to make a tour between the inner fences . Well , it was a curious trip . [Everywhere dead men]4340-everywhere dead men were lying outside the second fence -- not plainly visible , but still visible ; and [we]4310-we counted fifteen of [those pathetic statues]4341-those pathetic statues -- dead knights standing with [their]4342-their [hands on the upper wire]4343-hands on the upper wire .
