Pretty soon [we]4310-we detected a muffled and heavy sound , and next moment [we]4310-we guessed what it was . It was a surprise in force coming ! [I]0-i whispered [Clarence]131-clarence to go and wake [the army]5549-the army , and notify [it]5549-the army to wait in silence in [the cave]6717-the cave for further orders . [He]131-clarence was soon back , and [we]4310-we stood by the inner fence and watched the silent lightning do its awful work upon [that swarming host]4347-that swarming host . [One]434-one could make out but little of detail ; but [he]434-one could note that a black mass was piling itself up beyond the second fence . That swelling bulk was [dead men]6374-dead men ! [[Our]4310-we camp]4350-our camp was enclosed with a solid wall of the dead -- a bulwark , a breastwork , of corpses , [you]4351-you may say . One terrible thing about this thing was the absence of human voices ; there were no cheers , no war cries ; being intent upon a surprise , [these men]2820-these men moved as noiselessly as [they]2820-these men could ; and always when [the front rank]4353-the front rank was near enough to [their]2820-these men goal to make it proper for [them]2820-these men to begin to get a shout ready , of course [they]2820-these men struck the fatal line and went down without testifying . [I]0-i sent a current through the third fence now ; and almost immediately through the fourth and fifth , so quickly were the gaps filled up . [I]0-i believed the time was come now for [my]0-i climax ; [I]0-i believed that [that whole army]4354-that whole army was in [our]4310-we trap . Anyway , it was high time to find out . So [I]0-i touched a button and set fifty electric suns aflame on the top of [[our]4310-we precipice]4355-our precipice . [Land]14-land , what a sight ! [We]4310-we were enclosed in three walls of [dead men]6374-dead men ! All the other fences were pretty nearly filled with the living , who were stealthily working [their]4357-their way forward through the wires . The sudden glare paralyzed [this host]4358-this host , petrified [them]4358-this host , [you]4359-you may say , with astonishment ; there was just one instant for [me]0-i to utilize [their]4358-this host immobility in , and [I]0-i did n't lose the chance . [You]4359-you see , in another instant [they]4358-this host would have recovered [their]4358-this host faculties , then [they]4358-this host 'd have burst into a cheer and made a rush , and [my]0-i wires would have gone down before it ; but that lost instant lost [them]4358-this host [their]4358-this host opportunity forever ; while even that slight fragment of time was still unspent , [I]0-i shot the current through all the fences and struck [the whole host]4360-the whole host dead in [their]4360-the whole host tracks ! _ There _ was a groan [you]4359-you could _ hear _ ! It voiced the death - pang of [eleven thousand men]4361-eleven thousand men . It swelled out on the night with awful pathos . A glance showed that the rest of [the enemy -- perhaps ten thousand strong]4362-the enemy -- perhaps ten thousand strong -- were between [us]4363-we and [the encircling ditch]4364-the encircling ditch , and pressing forward to the assault . Consequently [we]4363-we had [them]4358-this host _ all ! _ and had [them]4358-this host past help . Time for the last act of the tragedy . [I]0-i fired the three appointed revolver shots -- which meant : “ Turn on the water ! ”[0-i] There was a sudden rush and roar , and in a minute [the mountain brook]4365-the mountain brook was raging through the big ditch and creating [a river]4366-a river a hundred feet wide and twenty - five deep . “ Stand to [your]4359-you guns , [men]508-men ! Open fire ! ”[4367-the thirteen gatlings] [The thirteen gatlings]4367-the thirteen gatlings began to vomit death into [the fated ten thousand]4368-the fated ten thousand . [They]4367-the thirteen gatlings halted , [they]4367-the thirteen gatlings stood [their]4367-the thirteen gatlings ground a moment against that withering deluge of fire , then [they]4367-the thirteen gatlings broke , faced about and swept toward [the ditch]4308-the ditch like chaff before a gale . A full fourth part of [their]4367-the thirteen gatlings force never reached the top of [the lofty embankment]4370-the lofty embankment ; [the three - fourths]4371-the three - fourths reached [it]4370-the lofty embankment and plunged over -- to death by drowning . Within ten short minutes after [we]4363-we had opened fire , [armed resistance]4372-armed resistance was totally annihilated , the campaign was ended , [we]4363-we fifty - four were [masters of [England]1-england]4373-masters of england . [Twenty - five thousand men]4374-twenty - five thousand men lay dead around [us]4363-we . But how treacherous is fortune ! In a little while -- say an hour --happened a thing , by [my]0-i own fault , which -- but [I]0-i have no heart to write that . Let the record end here . CHAPTER XLIV A POSTSCRIPT BY [CLARENCE]131-clarence [I]0-i , [Clarence]131-clarence , must write it for [him]131-clarence . [He]131-clarence proposed that [we]4363-we two go out and see if any help could be accorded [the wounded]4375-the wounded . [I]0-i was strenuous against the project . [I]0-i said that if there were many , [we]4363-we could do but little for [them]4375-the wounded ; and it would not be wise for [us]4363-we to trust [ourselves]4363-we among [them]4375-the wounded , anyway . But [he]131-clarence could seldom be turned from a purpose once formed ; so [we]4363-we shut off the electric current from the fences , took [an escort]4127-an escort along , climbed over the enclosing ramparts of [dead knights]4377-dead knights , and moved out upon [the field]1674-the field . [The first wounded man who appealed for help]4379-the first wounded man who appealed for help was sitting with [his]4379-the first wounded man who appealed for help back against [a dead comrade]4380-a dead comrade . When [The Boss]1014-the boss bent over [him]4379-the first wounded man who appealed for help and spoke to [him]4379-the first wounded man who appealed for help , [the man]536-the man recognized [him]4379-the first wounded man who appealed for help and stabbed [him]4379-the first wounded man who appealed for help . [That knight]394-that knight was [Sir Meliagraunce]336-sir meliagraunce , as [I]0-i found out by tearing off [his]394-that knight helmet . [He]394-that knight will not ask for help any more . [We]4363-we carried [The Boss]231-the boss to [the cave]6717-the cave and gave [his]231-the boss wound , which was not very serious , the best care [we]4363-we could . In this service [we]4363-we had the help of [Merlin]134-merlin , though [we]4363-we did not know it . [He]134-merlin was disguised as [a woman]6069-a woman , and appeared to be [a simple old peasant goodwife]4386-a simple old peasant goodwife . In this disguise , with brown - stained face and smooth shaven , [he]231-the boss had appeared a few days after [The Boss]231-the boss was hurt and offered to cook for [us]4363-we , saying [[her]6069-a woman people]1609-her people had gone off to join [certain new camps which [the enemy]3329-the enemy were forming]4388-certain new camps which the enemy were forming , and that [she]6069-a woman was starving . [The Boss]1014-the boss had been getting along very well , and had amused [himself]1014-the boss with finishing up [his]1014-the boss record . [We]4363-we were glad to have [this woman]1726-this woman , for [we]4363-we were short handed . [We]4363-we were in a trap , [you]4392-you see -- a trap of [our]4363-we own making . If [we]4363-we stayed where [we]4363-we were , [[our]4363-we dead]4393-our dead would kill [us]4363-we ; if [we]4363-we moved out of [our]4363-we defenses , [we]4363-we should no longer be invincible . [We]4363-we had conquered ; in turn [we]4363-we were conquered . [The Boss]231-the boss recognized this ; [we]4363-we all recognized it . If [we]4363-we could go to [one of [those new camps]4395-those new camps]4394-one of those new camps and patch up some kind of terms with [the enemy]3329-the enemy -- yes , but [The Boss]231-the boss could not go , and neither could [I]0-i , for [I]0-i was among [the first that were made sick by the poisonous air bred by those dead thousands]4397-the first that were made sick by the poisonous air bred by those dead thousands . [Others]1365-others were taken down , and still [others]1365-others . To - morrow-- _ To - morrow . _ It is here . And with it the end . About midnight [I]0-i awoke , and saw [that hag]4400-that hag making curious passes in the air about [The Boss]231-the boss 's head and face , and wondered what it meant . [Everybody but the dynamo - watch]4401-everybody but the dynamo - watch lay steeped in sleep ; there was no sound . [The woman]1872-the woman ceased from [her]1872-the woman mysterious foolery , and started tip - toeing toward the door . [I]0-i called out : “ Stop ! What have [you]1872-the woman been doing ? ”[0-i] [She]1872-the woman halted , and said with an accent of malicious satisfaction : “ [Ye]0-i were [conquerors]6834-conquerors ; [ye]0-i are conquered ! [These others]6835-these others are perishing --you also . [Ye]0-i shall all die in this place -- [every one]1361-every one -- except _ [him]231-the boss _ . [He]231-the boss sleepeth now -- and shall sleep thirteen centuries . [I]1872-the woman am [Merlin]134-merlin ! ”[1872-the woman] Then such a delirium of silly laughter overtook [him]231-the boss that [he]231-the boss reeled about like [a drunken man]4403-a drunken man , and presently fetched up against one of [our]4404-our wires . [His]231-the boss mouth is spread open yet ; apparently [he]231-the boss is still laughing . [I]0-i suppose the face will retain that petrified laugh until the corpse turns to dust . [The Boss]1014-the boss has never stirred -- sleeps like a stone . If [he]231-the boss does not wake to - day [we]4404-our shall understand what kind of a sleep it is , and [his]231-the boss body will then be borne to a place in one of the remote recesses of [the cave]6717-the cave where [none]557-none will ever find it to desecrate it . As for [the rest of [us]4404-our]6114-the rest of us -- well , it is agreed that if [any one of [us]4404-our]4409-any one of us ever escapes alive from [this place]4515-this place , [he]4409-any one of us will write the fact here , and loyally hide this Manuscript with [The Boss]1014-the boss , [[our]4404-our dear good chief]4412-our dear good chief , whose property it is , be [he]231-the boss alive or dead . [THE END]109-the end OF THE MANUSCRIPT FINAL P.S. BY M.T. The dawn was come when [I]0-i laid the Manuscript aside . The rain had almost ceased , [the world]374-the world was gray and sad , the exhausted storm was sighing and sobbing itself to rest . [I]0-i went to [[the stranger]416-the stranger 's room]4415-the stranger 's room , and listened at [his]416-the stranger door , which was slightly ajar . [I]0-i could hear [his]416-the stranger voice , and so [I]0-i knocked . There was no answer , but [I]0-i still heard the voice . [I]0-i peeped in . [The man]536-the man lay on [his]536-the man back in bed , talking brokenly but with spirit , and punctuating with [his]536-the man arms , which [he]536-the man thrashed about , restlessly , as [sick people]4417-sick people do in delirium . [I]0-i slipped in softly and bent over [him]536-the man . [His]536-the man mutterings and ejaculations went on . [I]0-i spoke -- merely a word , to call [his]536-the man attention . [His]536-the man glassy eyes and [his]536-the man ashy face were alight in an instant with pleasure , gratitude , gladness , welcome : “ Oh , [Sandy]199-sandy , [you]199-sandy are come at last -- how [I]4418-i have longed for [you]199-sandy ! Sit by [me]4418-i -- do not leave [me]4418-i -- never leave [me]4418-i again , [Sandy]199-sandy , never again . Where is [your]199-sandy hand?--give it [me]4418-i , [dear]664-dear , let [me]4418-i hold it -- there --now all is well , all is peace , and [I]4418-i am happy again--_we _ are happy again , is n't it so , [Sandy]199-sandy ? [You]199-sandy are so dim , so vague , [you]199-sandy are but a mist , a cloud , but [you]199-sandy are _ here _ , and that is blessedness sufficient ; and [I]4418-i have [your]199-sandy hand ; do n't take it away -- it is for only a little while , [I]4418-i shall not require it long .... Was that [the child]5150-the child ? ... Hello - [Central]83-central ! ... [she]5150-the child does n't answer . Asleep , perhaps ? Bring [her]5150-the child when [she]5150-the child wakes , and let [me]4418-i touch [her]5150-the child hands , [her]5150-the child face , [her]5150-the child hair , and tell [her]5150-the child good - bye .... [Sandy]199-sandy ! Yes , [you]199-sandy are there . [I]4418-i lost [myself]4418-i a moment , and [I]4418-i thought [you]199-sandy were gone .... Have [I]4418-i been sick long ? It must be so ; it seems months to [me]4418-i . And such dreams ! such strange and awful dreams , [Sandy]199-sandy ! Dreams that were as real as reality -- delirium , of course , but _ so _ real ! Why , [I]4418-i thought [the king]4445-the king was dead , [I]4418-i thought [you]199-sandy were in [Gaul]61-gaul and could n't get [home]619-home , [I]4418-i thought there was a revolution ; in the fantastic frenzy of these dreams , [I]4418-i thought that [Clarence]131-clarence and [I]4418-i and [a handful of [[my]4418-i cadets]6842-my cadets]6841-a handful of my cadets fought and exterminated the whole chivalry of [England]1-england ! But even that was not the strangest . [I]4418-i seemed to be [a creature out of a remote unborn age , centuries hence , and even _ that _]6843-a creature out of a remote unborn age , centuries hence , and even _ that _ was as real as the rest ! Yes , [I]4418-i seemed to have flown back out of that age into this of ours , and then forward to it again , and was set down , [a stranger]798-a stranger and forlorn in [that strange England]6845-that strange england , with an abyss of thirteen centuries yawning between [me]4418-i and [you]199-sandy ! between [me]4418-i and [[my]4418-i home]6846-my home and [[my]4418-i friends]4435-my friends ! between [me]4418-i and all that is dear to [me]4418-i , all that could make life worth the living ! It was awful --awfuler than [you]199-sandy can ever imagine , [Sandy]199-sandy . Ah , watch by [me]4418-i , [Sandy]199-sandy --stay by [me]4418-i every moment--_don't _ let [me]4418-i go out of [my]4418-i mind again ; death is nothing , let it come , but not with those dreams , not with the torture of those hideous dreams -- [I]4418-i can not endure _ that _ again .... [Sandy]199-sandy ? ... ”[4418-i] [He]4418-i lay muttering incoherently some little time ; then for a time [he]4418-i lay silent , and apparently sinking away toward death . Presently [his]4418-i fingers began to pick busily at the coverlet , and by that sign [I]0-i knew that [his]4418-i end was at hand . With the first suggestion of the death - rattle in [his]4418-i throat [he]4418-i started up slightly , and seemed to listen : then [he]4418-i said : “ A bugle ? ... It is [the king]4445-the king ! The drawbridge , there ! [Man the battlements!--turn]6849-man the battlements!--turn out the-- ”[4418-i] [He]4418-i was getting up [his]4418-i last “ effect ”[4418-i] ; but [he]4418-i never finished it . * * *
